P5f6TnGsOrl4OEoFNqxlrg.text: My husband and I spent our 10th wedding anniversary date with Hugo's Cellar last night. Beautiful, dimly-lit, old school romance. The staff is wonderfully considerate and trained. Our table-side salad prep was impressive, as was our waiter when he plated our filet and lobster for two table-side. This was the best surf and turf we have ever had. We were treated to a complimentary chocolate lava cake for our anniversary with well wishes from all of our table staff. Thank you Hugo's for an amazingly memorable evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet and Lobster plated table-side. A-ma-zing!

e9-KL6h69GlNNcO45kZ6fg.text: Me and a lady friend ate here on Christmas Eve a few years ago and it was the best meal I have ever had, I can still taste the creamy pepper salad dressing. The salad is served tableside. Everyone that worked there had a smile on their face and were very friendly. We love the place, but I don't eat in five star restaurants to often but this one remains my favorite. A man in Binions recommended it to us and so glad he did. They don't need to advertise because anyone who eats there will tell everyone they know how great the place is. I hope you can experience their food and their great service.

0ShYrYcEbTCjMu2WZwoMFQ.text: Hugo's Cellar was recommended to my by a neighbor of my family before I even moved here but was looking for a romantic spot to have dinner with my late Marine Corps Captain bf coming from San Diego. We thought the Four Queens looked a little seedy as we walked in, but the clubby dark decor that greets you as you enter the cellar tells you this is a special place. Lighting is romantic and dim. The hostess greets each lady with a long stemmed red rose which they place In a vase for you. Various breads, lavash and spreads adorn your table along with butter shaped as rosebuds.   Service is spectacular. John, the world's friendliest sommelier has been there for 20 plus years and always seems to remember me (I've been there 3 dozen times in 9 years. Sometimes a few times a week, sometimes with longer spans) he makes great wine selections and we happen to share a great love of Perrier Jouet Fleur du Champagne. Even when I don't order wine, he stops by to visit, a fine British chap. They are also famous for their delicious martinis which come with a mini decanter. Your water glasses remain filled and your waiter is assisted by the salad carte guru and at least one bus boy, and of course the fabulous Sommelier.   I dont order appetizers any longer but the hot stone app was fun. The salad carte which is old school table side has a dizzying array of ingredients and I always go with the parmesan pepper dressing. Usually, I pack half to go. Next an intermezzo of sorbet palate cleanser is served prior to entrees. I usually go for the sea bass en papillote prepared table side and steaming hot tender with a side of potatoes and vegetables. Other diners rave over the chateaubriand for two, prime rib, lobster virtually anything on the menu and enjoyed them thoroughly. Again I get half of my meal to go.   I love this place so much that when my best friend called to ask where to make reservations for our party of 8 next week when visiting from Hawaii to celebrate her hubby making Full Bird Col in AF, his birthday and reception of a Bronze Star; there was no hesitation in my selection. I will call ahead as I frequently do to to ensure John has a bottle of Perrier Jouet Fleur du Champagne on ice to greet us.   After dinner, a platter of dried fruits with white and dark chocolate and dipped strawberries with cream is presented. This is where all of my to go boxes come in: the bananas foster is DIVINE a show in and of itself with flames nearly scorching the ceiling as the perfectly caramelized bananas are served up over vanilla ice cream, the air perfumed with a hint of lingering cinnamon. Heavenly. Plus, I have great leftovers for lunch.   The service is professional, seasoned and on point without being obtrusive. When you leave, your rose is packed up for you along with wonderful memories of a fabulous meal. You could easily pay more at traditional a la carte steak houses but why? Hugo's is a veritable institution and you will walk away happy and sated. And wanting to return.

M7UDY0fjMs2PU7jZVnc2BQ.text: This was the highlight of my most recent trip to Vegas.  This was also the most expensive meal that I've ever paid for, so be prepared!  The atmosphere was very warm and cozy.  Dimly lit in a good way and no windows (you are actually in a basement/cellar).  The food was amazing - we were recommended to go here because we were looking for an excellent steakhouse and we were not disappointed.  Interestingly, the waiter brought a salad cart to our table and assembled our salads for us on the spot.  You can pick the dressing, vegetables, shrimp, cheese, croutons, etc.  In addition, we also got free sorbet to cleanse the pallet between courses.  Overall, the food, environment, and service were all top notch.  Well deserved of my 5 star rating.

1A_aL61fmkoNxtJXnNl6OQ.text: What a gem. Never would of thought it... good surprise and will definitely return with family and friends

L4FxSQNEEUs0Cdrbcj6WRw.text: Came here with girls on my most recent trip to Vegas. I had this place bookmarked for a while but was always so skeptical considering it's on Freemont(I'm so superficial. I know)   I can tell you, it's a must to try this place!!! It's got a great old Vegas "Mob scene" feel and the service was extraordinary. They were so welcoming and incredible attentive to us. They have us each a rose when we walked in. They has 4 or 5 people attending  to us and we felt so special!  I ordered the Filet with the horseradish crust and OMG!!! I'm salivating just thinking about it! They also brought us dessert that comes with all meals!   To too it all off, it was so incredibly reasonably priced! So much so I didn't mind losing it at the slots after :-/  I will definitely  return!

8kMDKTTP1SsQM7nzeSrjbA.text: Had a fabulous evening at Hugo Cellar celebration a little early our 3rd anniversary.  Mike had the Duck Flambe and I had the Raspberry chicken.  It couldn't have been better.  Jaime was our server and he and his team were fabulous.   The evening started with a Rose  and everything in between was to perfection.  Pomegranate Martinis and Lemon  Drop Martinis to die for.  Come and enjoy a fabulous experience.  Ohhh my a wonderful treat with chic dipped  strawberries, apricots and figs to end our dinner.

4R0x7QsvEZh8yLDow-RU9A.text: One of our best wedding anniversary dinners took place here at Hugo's Cellar.  I made sure to make a reservation over a month ahead of time because I really wanted to take my wife here for our special day.  They are located in downtown Las Vegas on Fremont Street inside the Four Queens Hotel.  The ambiance was almost perfect for a romantic dinner evening.  Felt like we had traveled back in time because of the decor and atmosphere.  They greeted my wife with a single long stem rose which made my wife very happy.  The food was very good.  Their table side salad was excellent.  Our steaks were delicious.  All evening, the service provided to us by the staff was top notch.  Very classy.  Thanks for a wonderful and memorable anniversary dinner.  Hugo's Cellar is a fine establishment to take your special someone for that special occasion.

-sS-dvcmPhbdR5cXF9qKcQ.text: Items Selected: Tom Collins Gin-Lemon-Seven Butter Rose, White Roll, Cheese Lavosh, Whole Grain Roll Escargot en Croute - Six plump escargots sauteed in shallots, garlic, burgundy wine, fine herbs with a puff pastry topping Tableside Salad - Romaine, Tomato, Hearts of Palm, Artichokes, Mushrooms, Blue Cheese, Croutons, Pine Nuts, Hardboiled Egg, Bay Shrimp with Creamy Pepper Dressing Raspberry Sorbet Stuffed Jumbo Shrimp - Jumbo shrimp stuffed with crab, parsley, savory and 'old bay' seasoned bread crumbs Duckling Anise Flambe - Duck roasted with licorice spices and herbs; flambeed table-side Beef Wellington - Filet of beef, topped with a duxelle of foie gras and mushrooms; baked in pastry and served with bordelaise sauce White and dark chocolate dipped strawberries, apricots and baby figs with whipped cream Bananas Foster Cherries Jubilee  Located in The Four Queens on Fremont and considered by many to be the best "Old Vegas" experience remaining in a city once rife with dens of a similar ilk Hugo's Cellar had always been on my proverbial 'to-do' list and despite the constant onslaught of new spots from celebrity chefs on the Strip a Sunday night visit found the venerable institution packed - the 'reservations recommended' sign proving justified as couples attempting to walk-in met a two hour wait.  Dimly lit with stone walls, wood beams, heavy linens, and art-glass chandeliers overhead it was to formal greetings and a rose for the ladies that we arrived in the Cellar and whisked away soon to a booth in one of several rooms the action soon commenced, each waiter presented by name as a trio of warm breads with a butter rose plus the famous tableside salad engaged the senses - the later a True crowd pleaser carefully customized for each and every guest.  Large in menu with a bar that promised to craft "anything you like" it was with a stiff pair of $7 cocktails that our proper order progressed and soon plucking tender snails under delicate pastry from their dish one really couldn't help but smile at a classic done so well, a theme continued with each of three superlative entrees following a raspberry palate cleanse - the tableside whole duckling a showstopper gathering looks from around the room while the Wellington rivaled that at Ramsay Steak beneath a pile of mushrooms and foie gras.  Truly a class act it was prior to desserts-proper that a trio of chocolate dipped fruits arrived to be dressed in hand-whipped cream and with more sweets offered on the house to celebrate a duo of birthdays it was tableside we turned again - the smolder and burn of booze, fresh fruit, and cinnamon ladled over rich ice cream a refined finish to a True 'experience.'

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Collins
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flowers for the ladies
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whole Grain Roll

V-UuDZLFia1A6R3V8Z21uQ.text: The most romantic, warm, rustic feeling restaurant I have ever been to. The food was absolutely amazing and not once was I disappointed. Crab cakes app, beef wellington and veal oscar entrees. The table salad was also very tastey and made the way you want it.  For our 2nd bottle of wine the Sommelier recommended one that ended up being our new favorite!  Was here for a "just because" night with my honey and it brought back all the amazing feelings I had the night he surprised me in Paris with dinner in The Eiffel Tower.  I was certainly swept off my feet by the delicious food and loving company.  Gentleman treat your ladies to a romantic evening here and you will have one grateful woman!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Oscar

iMVPTEIeOgWAZAABvh5Nzw.text: Visited Hugo's tonight and it was okay. Honestly for the price the food was just that. Okay. I don't mind paying decent money for good food but I don't think the food was worth what we paid tonight. I have been to Hugo's before and it seems as if time has caught up with this place.  As much as they are trying to keep it as a old Las Vegas vibe, the food is deteriorating in quality. 2 filet mignons was 148.00. Of course you get salad and a small desert plate. Again, it was just meh. The service was good. Don't know if I will return or not?

9Lu3J0Ljvr8vyj2SFU4MNg.text: Thank your lucky stars that this place is in downtown and not in the middle of the strip. If it were, then it might be pricier than Craft or Cut.  You get five star service for a the price of a four star place, and that makes a huge difference on your bill.  This means you can splurge a little and get wine or a cocktail, and maybe even a signature dessert.  There's a hired wine expert walking around and he answers any questions you may have, or he just pops out of nowhere and gives suggestions on what to drink. Pretty cool.  Like the wine guy, all the waiters are experienced, personable,and funny. They've all been working there for a looonnng time and probably have some great stories.  The food was magnificent and the best part is is that sides and salads come with the meal! The salad is made right in front of you, and it's a yes no process that feels like an interrogation. LOL.  The filet mignon was thick n juicy and cooked perfectly. The sides were white asparagus and mashies and tasted fine.  Because they bring chocolate dipped fruit after, I decided to try something different and got the kona experience. It looks like a science experiment when they bring it out, but it's basically coffee percolating  in front of you. Kona coffee is some of the best in the world in my opinion, and it tasted divine when it was finished. Pretty cool. If you want a real dessert, then I'd say get the banana foster that's made right in front of you.  The service alone is reason enough for me To go back and I love that it didn't break the bank either.  It's a gem in the city of sin for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary fruit platter
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The kona coffee experience
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon with asparagus and mashed potatoes.

mKEA8TbPAbzAVyGMZADHUw.text: Love this place in the cellar of the 4 Queens. Wait staff very friendly and not stuffy.  A long stem rose for the ladies, nice  touch. Salad comes with the entrees so side dishes are not all Ala carte like in so many steak houses. The meat quality is very good, which is why we eat at a steak house in the first place, right? If you are in downtown Las Vegas  and are Hungry for a steak,  you can't go wrong. Make reservations.

HAix9RYupVPGupyGH0D5Nw.text: What an amazing experience my wife and I had. From when we first walked in when the maitre d handed her a long stem red rose to the complimentary desserts everything was fantastic.  We were seated in a very romantic area and her rose was placed in a vase.  Then we were asked if we wanted wine we knew we wanted champagne so we ordered that after looking over this very extensive wine list and the Sommelier  came over to help us choose. He was great and so friendly. Our wait staff- yes staff- then asked if we wanted any appetizers.  We were ready to order.  My wife ordered the scallops and I ordered the Duck Anise flambe. In case you don't know every entree comes with salad, sorbet to cleanse your palate after the salad and complimentary chocolate covered fruits. David one of our wait staff wheeled over a cart and told he was about to play 20 questions, because you get to pick from 20 items to have on your salad-- from shrimp to hearts of Palm and artichokes to chopped eggs and anchovy. Yes the usual salad items are there but each person picks their own items   After salad raspberry sorbet in a mini ice cream cone was brought to us.  Then came the entrees.  My duck was flambed table side. It was wonderful.  My wife's scallops were out of this world.  Last but definitely not least were the chocolate covered strawberries, apricots and figs. We didn't order any other dessert because we were too full but we did order the Hugo's Cappuccino it's loaded with brandy and some other liqueurs. All the while during this experience our wait staff made sure our glasses were not empty and we had whatever we needed. The sommelier even filled our champagne glasses so we didn't have to.  If you think this was expensive--- well. How about 160 including tax and tip.   Why did we ever wait so long to go there

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorbet
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad

s8o80E0pU_tNk6OK7zfvYQ.text: Hugo's was recommended to us by my boyfriend's parents.  We called at about 8:30pm about getting a table for that night and they were happy to put in a reservation for us.  When we arrived I was given a long stem rose and we were escorted to our table where there was a vase for my rose.  We had about three different waiters helping us and each one was so nice and clearly put service first.  We had the crab cake appetizer which was amazing.  The salad that each meal comes with was one of the best parts.  They make the salad tableside individually for each guest.  There are many toppings to choose from or have them all.  My boyfriend doesn't like salad dressing so they offered to freshly squeeze lemons onto his salad, he loved it.    For the meal I got the filet mingon with bernaise sauce.  It was one of the best pieces of meat I've ever had.  The bf had the beef wellington which was also amazing.  Even the masked potatos and veggies that it comes with are great.  They brought a hot towel to wash your hands with before dessert.  Then dessert is a complementary chocolate dipped dried apricot, fig, and strawberry.  One of each for each guest.  And fresh whipped cream.  It was so good.  We will definitely be back here.  It is also perfect for a special occasion.

uefgDLbwClBp8olP9bSI6A.text: This is more than an excellent high quality restaurant--it was a fine dining performance! The wait staff made us feel like royalty! THE BEST!

RQttPRiYn9wmSfwCKJqo9g.text: Loved it all the way around. Service was quick and attentive. The food was cooked perfectly. The price was fair. Be warned though, the Hugos cut prime rib is a huge serving!! I only finished half of it. My wife had the sun dried tomato chicken, and loved it! We'll definitely make this a regular place to eat when in Vegas.

4MBjv1d9mzeQqD4w6d9-Aw.text: My bf and I went here for a nice sit down dinner on Sunday to cap off our weekend in Vegas! My bf ordered their prime rib, which he loved! I ordered the ribeye steak cooked medium well and it was the best steak I've ever had in my life! It was cooked perfectly and the meat was buttery and melt in your mouth delicious. I finished every last bite of that steak, it was beyond glorious! This place is very nice and they treat you like royalty, will definitely have to come back for the food and the service!

QpDAgZ-QNSQHMV233NjzOw.text: My husband and I dine out a lot, particularly at steakhouses. We did hours of research to decide where we would dine on our Vegas trip and although Hugo's was a bit of a trip from our hotel, my gut said it was worth it.   The entire experience from walking in and receiving my rose, to the great wine list (with even better price points), to the table side salad, palate cleansers, perfectly cooked steak, chocolate covered strawberries and possibly the best coffee (Cona) added up to quite possibly the best dining experience I've had!   Do not miss Hugo's cellar if you are in Vegas and guys if you find this place and take your lady, it's sure to pay off!

Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate covered strawberries
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old fashioned and 1/2 bottle

v5oF5tIZTBoEY2vq-rnE3A.text: Who knew there was an upscale restaurant in the 4 Queen's Casino?  As you walk in, it's dark (hey, it's a cellar) and the atmosphere is intimate and romantic.  I was given a rose when they seated us.  The food was high class.  The waiter prepared our salad at our table.  I ate the beef wellington which was very tender and cooked perfectly.  There was a delicious half of a tomato that was breaded, seasoned, and baked that I loved.  The asparagus was ok - I'm not an asparagus lover.    My husband had some kind of a breaded veal dish (I don't remember the name).  It came with a king crab leg on top that he said was very yummy.  He also had asparagus which he didn't care for (I guess he's also not an asparagus lover).    For dessert, they brought us a tray of dried fruit dipped in chocolate.

mitkGIM_vi6PxN5B5EcUWQ.text: Im a fan of Hugos Cellar.. it didn't blow me away, but the service was great and the food was good. Were it based on service it would be 4-4.5 stars easily.   The occasion was for a birthday dinner, and we had a few drinks, followed by more drinks.. so that helps here with this review :) In addition I am a fan of "Beef Wellington" and they had a serving of 'Individual Beef Wellington' on the menu. That was actually what solidified my choice to check it out for the big dinner.   It was myself and a couple of friends, which seemed about right.. but I have to say that it is a very intimate setting.. so it would be very well suited for a date or a couple having a date. Nonetheless, it's worth checking out if you are a group of friends that likes quality food.   The restaurant itself is in a lower level of the "Four Queens" Casino... The casino itself may be a bit long in the tooth and has some serious smoking areas still allowed, so be wary of that if you are sensitive to smoke.. because there is A LOT of it.   Down below where the restaurant is located, its dimly lit, old-school style and comfortable feeling. Above where the casino is, its a bit dank, old and crappy.. lol. A friend compared it to snorkeling - in that it looks beautiful when you are down below, and when you raise your head above water, its a little less than exciting.. in fact a dump.. haha.   Anyhow.. our waiter was awesome in relaying the specials. They create a custom salad for you table side then serve your items as ordered, and the meal is followed up by fruits dipped on white chocolate. It was nice, but I could have doe without dried apricots dipped in chalky white chocolate... I just didnt eat it.   I opted for a coffee desert drink as I was getting drunk and needed caffeine :]   So give it a try if you like something with a bit more style. be prepared to drop a few bucks, but make a night of it and head downtown after for some drinks and people watching.

RxoGJWCvQk5Qv-4jwcR26g.text: The service was a 5 star and the atmosphere was some what old school. Unfortunately the food was below par for the price. I was very disappointed for the price. I would say it was one step above Outback.

yLZ5mm3PSeOXLRm0PUkikQ.text: First off, there were people dining in here that were dressed in jeans and t-shirts. Our waiter explained to me that since Vegas is a tourist town they are pretty lenient, but it is up to the Maitre'D who he lets in. Just do yourself a favor and don't show up casual. Slacks and a button down shirt is fine for men. A dress is fine for women.  My husband and I were in Las Vegas for my birthday and we went to Hugo's Cellar. It was fantastic!  From the red rose at the door to the chocolate dipped strawberries, figs and apricots, everything was perfection.  I had the rack of lamb and it was so tender (Medium rare).   We were so full after dinner that ordering dessert seemed impossible, Nonetheless we ordered the Banana's Foster. It is made table side the old fashioned way. We only had room for a few bites, but worth it.   We ordered drinks, entrees, and dessert. Price with tip $300. Expensive? Yes The best meal you will ever eat in your life.

KT6VngV3_NJ9olENjcPbsg.text: So...I am local. I have been here many times & as much as I LOOOVE the salad, I'm leaving disappointed with the entrees lately. Lack luster in flavor or complexity. Always enjoy the service however!

uYHmWtLOG1Z4j878zQP1-w.text: Duckling Anise Flambe = perfection, even compared to GR Steak. Typical of such a place... Wine selection great! Atmosphere fits many moods! Staff is friendly, yet not overbearing. Roomy got steak... It was sushi tender - cooked perfect rare!

cGVQD6dmR44SZKxxnCiIJQ.text: If you look for bang for your buck this is the place. I love the atmosphere and the feel of the room. All ladies are greeted by the hostess with a fresh cut rose. The staff is first class and attend to your needs like your their only guest. The food is outstanding. Unlike other steakhouses where you have to pay for each side they provide a house salad made at your table, a sorbet to cleanse your pallet and chocolate covered strawberries on the house. It's hard for me to take my wife anywhere else when we celebrate a special occasion.

M_XLpY_7eXbuT2VzuYMEIg.text: Hugo's is my absolute favorite restaurant! It's classic, old-school, fine-dining at accessible prices. The whole restaurant is very dark and romantic, with ladies being given a rose upon entrance (they put the roses at your table, and then wrap them for you to take when you leave).  Larger parties have multiple teams of servers helping them, and a competant sommalier makes rounds, helping guests select the perfect wine pairings. Every entree comes with the signature Hugo's salad -- where they literally bring a salad bar to your table and make each salad to the specific diner's request. You can load up on pine nuts, artichokes, hearts of palm, shrimp, hard-boiled egg, parmesan cheese, anchovies, etc. -- it's all up to the diner.  After the salad course, delicious sorbet is served in mini cones as a delightful palate-cleanser.  Then the sumtious main course never disappoints - I'm a big fan of the Hugo Chicken - it's well-priced and yummy!  Every dinner is topped off with a selection of fruits dipped in chocolate and served with real whipped cream. In addition, you can select a tasty treat from the dessert tray, or pick on of their specialty flambe desserts. This time we opted for the flambe route - choosing the Bananas Foster. BEST. BANANAS. EVER!  The staff is so lovely - they really know the meaning of customer service. You leave Hugo's full, happy, satisfied, and with a lovely rose. You also get to take some amazing pictures in Downtown Las Vegas -- it's a seedy place, but those lights make for some killer photo ops. Also, if you're feeling seedy, you can stick around the Four Queens Hotel for some $5 blackjack on a Saturday night. I had lost $100 on the Strip, made it back and then some Downtown.   Honestly, I've gone to other high-end restaurants and didn't leave nearly as satisfied as I did leaving Hugo's -- which is why I've been back again and again. Don't be fooled by the big names - Hugo's is the place to be!

MUyQPnSL_dnxzdpDAbO2Sg.text: Hugo's Cellar is very old school. Even though it was late on a weeknight, they still seated us and were very friendly. It's downstairs in the Four Queens, and although the casino is bright and loud, the restaurant is quiet. They hand you a rose when you get there. After sitting down they suggested the raspberry lemon martini and it was EXCELLENT! Make sure you have some of the complimentary bottled water to go along with your alcohol because they don't skimp on drinks. While you're at it eat some of the cheese toasted lavosh or buttered rolls. There were some other families there celebrating birthdays and no one was really dressed up.   They make your salad table-side and with a huge array of toppings to choose from. I had tiny shrimp on mine and honey-walnut vinaigrette. They had to warn me against eating too much of it because we had a lot more food coming.   We got the crab cakes for an appetizer and I'm sure they were the best I ever had. Definitely try them with the aoli sauce. After that they gave us raspberry sorbet in tiny cones to cleanse the palate. My favorite part of the whole night was the server's accent. I felt like I had gone back in time to Old Vegas. For my entree I had the raspberry chicken, it came in a fantastic cream sauce with white and green asparagus and roasted garlic whipped potatoes. My date had duck with mandarin oranges and wild rice, also fantastic. Or course I took home the leftovers of both and ate them the next day for lunch.  We planned on getting the bananas foster for dessert but were too full. They also give you chocolate covered strawberries, apricots and figs with a whipped cream. The figs are awesome! I definitely recommend this place for a nice date or family celebration. Super service and excellent food.

4lITf49ax4A5NoDV-OxC1g.text: Great atmosphere, service, and food! A bit pricier than your "Outbacks" and what not, but well worth the money. Advanced reservations is definitely recommended.

r80poKGSPJ0AjSpNHjqMuQ.text: My wife and I were really looking forward to revisiting Hugo's Cellar.  It had been 12 years since our last visit. The atmosphere was just as I had remembered. We love this place. I was undecided on what to order so I let Vincent our waiter choose for me and the veal chop was excellent.  He provided excellent service but no one compares to John the sommelier. His personality and his wine selection complimented the meal perfectly. The only problem we experienced was when a couple came in with their teenage son and little girl. We are fine with children dining at adult restaurants however the little girl was watching a movie on an iPad WITHOUT headphones right next to our table. I really would have appreciated if the restaurant would have requested that the child either use headphones or shut off the movie.  Listening to a child's movie while trying to enjoy a romantic dinner was quite annoying.

wETpEmfqsMxLDw387kk56A.text: Loved this place! The atmosphere is so romantic and all of the staff does their best to make your time there incredible.   Your meal includes: a rose for the lady, bottled water, a salad made tableside, a dessert tray with mini treats and chocolate covered berries, and a sorbet.   Steak wasn't the best I've had, but I'm really picky. The steak was very good, but if this steak was served in a barn with crappy service I wouldn't be raving about this place. The overall experience is what makes this place!   Dinner for 2 was ~150 with tax and tip. Not bad for Vegas, and not bad considering all that was included. We left stuffed!

YoPFTbw4Px8ZicgKjqUV8Q.text: So we were celebrating a family reunion in Vegas. We made the reservation for 8 and then it became 10 when we called a few hours before the reservation. It was no problem at all. We waited at the bar for 5 or 10 minutes and had a great round of drinks. And coming from New York, they were reasonably priced.  The host then handed all the ladies a single red rose and we were escorted to our table. The table was in a private room and our roses were placed in vases in the center of the table. So pretty. The service was impeccable, and the prices were great BECAUSE it was NOT ala carte. So refreshing.  When you order your entree, you get salads and sides. The salad was wheeled over on a cart and the waiter puts whatever you like in it. Before you get the main course, there was an intermezzo palate cleansing lemon sorbet cone given out as well. Very nice touch. The main course was delicious. We all got filets. Some were wrapped Wellington style but all cooked perfectly. At the end of the meal they put trays of chocolate wrapped strawberries, figs and apricots on the table. We had a memorable, special evening. I would go back any time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottled soda is always better!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington

f4CH5_JhkU1YSSbfTMvTKQ.text: One of the best gems of Las Vegas. Good date spot or a big group in the private dinning room. Wine selections is great. You have to try the hot rock appetizer.

pbBoCAmYYuf5XzvLj0-_hw.text: Aaaah, Hugo's Cellar, I WANT to give you more stars, but I really just CAN'T.  I went here for my birthday last night.  I am not sure whether it is all the tourists in town for the holidays or what . . . but I was probably the most overdressed person in the restaurant - aside from the servers.    We had reservations for 6:30 and were seated immediately.  We ordered escargot for an appetizer, and it was really nice.  It boded well for the meal to come, that's for sure.  The tableside salad - lackluster at best.  The whole thing felt a little uninspired, and it definitely wasn't "the best" salad I've ever tasted.  Iceburg lettuce, mushrooms, pine nuts, tomatoes, artichokes, blue cheese ... eh, it was ok.    The sommelier seemed to really know his stuff.  We took his recommendation, and he wasn't wrong about that.  I ordered the beef wellington - medium rare.  It came out medium.  The sommelier advised us that it was, in fact, medium, but that it would take another 20 minutes to get another one .... so I ate half of my medium wellington.  We were never actually offered dessert.  Too bad, because my husband really wanted to try the bananas foster.  We were, however, able to order some cappuccinos, and those did not disappoint.  It took a long time to clear off the tables between courses.  I'm not sure if that was because the place was busy ... or not.  Also, my water went unfilled for a long time; I eventually had to ask the server for more water.  These small oversights do not a first class restaurant make.  All in all, I will go back again, just to see if my experience was an off night.

zGbZmRFzRe6FyEWFnxrhFw.text: I was nervous about finding a nice downtown restaurant.  Everything looked either very old or dirty.  I came across an advertisement in the Las Vegas tour guide for Hugo's Cellar.  It looked like the only decent place to eat, especially after leaving all the good restaurants on the Las Vegas Strip.  Hugo's is located in the basement (cellar) of the Four Queens Hotel.  Once you get through all the smoke and slot machines you are there.   At the bottom of the stairs the lady is given a red rose.  After receiving the rose you are walked to your seat and the rose is placed in a vase until after your meal.  Your seated in a cellar.  The cellar is surrounded by all red brick walls and pictures.  All employees are wearing suites or tuxedos.  You are immediately served a glass of bottled water, given a menu and list of the specials.  Before you receieve your appetizer and meal, there is a man pushing a salad cart.  He will prepare your salad anyway you like.  After you eat your salad you are given your appetizer and than a small scoop of sherbert.  You receive your meal.  After your meal you are given a desert tray with choclate strawberries and a couple of other delights.    Must warn you.  Eat slow.  They serve you a tremendous amount of food.  I ordered scallops, which were cooked perfect!  I have never been more happy with any restaurant.  Be prepared.  I never had a to ask for a single thing.      If you love wine, they have a huge selection.  Salad, Bottled Water and desert tray is complimentary.

6M85ZrBDE7oB8OQVkysPyQ.text: I dined at Hugo's almost 5 years ago for my first wedding anniversary and I have been wanting to go back ever since!  They treat you like royalty, handing you a long stemmed rose when you are seated.  The ambiance is great, and the servers are welcoming and attentive.  I had a bacon wrapped shrimp entree and my husband had a steak.  Both of us were very pleased with our meals and were blown away by the salad cart, which was fantastic with many choices.  The only set back was when I ordered an appetizer of lobster bisque and ended up not liking it at all, which could just be my palate.  The covered fruit tray at the end was perfect.  Definitely a re-visit kind of place!!!

7AwE3-VJL5S4exhHGxE4Qg.text: Great food.  The salad is as good as everyone says!  Steaks were perfect.  Bananas foster is quite a show tableside and tasted great.

3Y1_eUKqTmNObaFn6wXVWg.text: I love this place!  My boyfriend and I came here for our first date and now it's a tradition to come here every year.  I love the Stuffed Jumbo Shrimp.  The environment is amazing and the staff is great!

yiM33-WRNXUNHdjs3O99Zg.text: Very nice food. Nothing wrong with the fair. However, food is over priced. Waiter got our order wrong. Tipped him anyway. Take a healthy credit card or lots of cash.

wmk3CDk_fc-ZmcqcLU51vg.text: The ambiance and the romantic atmosphere was wonderful!! The food was exquisite and the service was impeccable. The people were friendly and it was classy yet comfortable. The only thing they forgot it was my birthday which is just fine. I would like to forget it too!!! Dessert was decadent!!

8J64vxmsWpMgbp9mVwrMyA.text: Worst meal we've had in years.  With three evenings to spend in LV we were happy to try a downtown venue that came recommended. Escargot had no taste, soup was lukewarm. The salad was watery and the dressing tasteless. When the entree of veal came we were both surprised. It looked as if it had been made and reheated. Not appetizing and tasted the same.  Also very expensive. Disappointment.

4e5qNKG_h80fbJ4nBjZ5nQ.text: Food: above average (filet mignon, prime rib, table side salad service) Drink: n/a Serv: excellent speed Music: average Price: average Other: lemon sorbet & warm towels much appreciated.  A veey likeable place

XVLeveHXFAD8jNB5F7M13Q.text: We will be returning to Hugo's.  Probably again and again.  Ambience is amazing.  You feel like you walked into old Vegas. And that's a good thing.  Lots of history.  The servers are wonderful.  Very attentive and personable.  Our table had the salad tableside service and I just loved this!  We ordered the shrimp cocktail and the prawns were Huge and delicious.  The steaks were spot on and seasoned perfectly.  We had a beef Wellington that was quite good but my first one ever so I personally just didn't like pastry on it.  2 things that kept me from a 5 Star; our bananas foster was over cooked (server on that was new.). And they have swamp cooling so if your there during Aug heat (it was 90 in the evening still) dress light.  But like I said, we will definitely be back!

I7dYfgR0srqaRvny9kqvdA.text: I had dinner at Hugos  with 4 coworkers. The atmosphere is very cool old school Vegas. The service was excellent. The personally built salad at the table was very good. I had the rack of lamb and split half and half with a coworker who had the prime rib. The prime rib was tough, not very flavorful and was served between room temperature and warm.  The rack of lamb was pretty good but not great as it was also tough, not very warm and not very flavorful. The dessert tray had chocolate covered strawberries that were pretty green and the blueberry tart was just ok. For the price and having entres that were said by the waiter, were two or their top three items,  I expected more.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yiMCUqKGUl2Fp093umFCxQ.text: We have been here before and loved every part of it! Not sure why things changed, but it did. In the past, we have arrived dressed very nice. This time we had on jeans and a nice top, still dressy. We were greeted, and seated right away, and our waiter introduced himself and stepped away to let us choose our lovely meal. In the meantime, 3 or 4 others were seated after us (who I noticed were dressed very nice) drinks served, meals ordered, and salad on their table before any action occurred at our table. We finally ordered our food and waited over 10 minutes for 2 cocktails. My husbands was watered down from sitting at the bar so long! The waiter only remembered after I said we were still waiting for them. The crab cakes were delicious, my prime rib was wonderful, but my husbands ribeye was thin, tasteless and full of fat. After we were finished, it took another 10 minutes to get the attention of someone to get a to go box, and another 10 to get the bill. I normally irritate my husband because I am a generous tipper, but not tonight. I felt the 15% I gave was very generous for the attention (or lack of) that we received. I felt like they already decided we were not going to be good tippers and treated us as such from the moment we walked in. It's questionable if we will go back.

H2xhQbc1LWVfeyLBVk2iGw.text: I can't even begin to tell you how on point this restaurant is. It would be endless amount of text to read, so let me try to shorten this review.  I've known of this restaurant for years, but never eaten here. tonight I finally remembered about it and off we went.  First, you wouldn't know this place existed unless you probably heard about it word of mouth. If you follow my reviews, have some extra bucks to spend, treat yourself to this luxury, superb meal. You will not be disappointed.  Second, decor. Once you make your way through the smoke filled casino and hundreds of gambling lunatics, you'll find yourself either tip toeing down a small flight if stairs or taking the elevator one short level down to this dim lit, classic feel entrance where you'll be instantly greeted by multiple service people. From there you just wait to be seated. Once you get taken in, you'll enjoy the classic, wooden, dark coat feel the place has, along with clean patrons and great smelling food. you'll walk by a walk in wine cellar that is fully stocked, amongst a sea of tables that aren't on top of each other, I would say perfectly spaced out, then you reach your destination.  I would suggest to instantly ask what the market price is for the king crab. it should average between $90-$105 for the 1lb dinner.   I had ordered the filet mignon, medium rare, wrapped with bacon. also ordered the spinach artichoke dip...let's get on to the food...  first up was wine list. I find myself now looking for some Opus One, which they had 2011 vintage @ $395. Great pairing with dinner, but I wanted 2013 so I passed on the wine. they have a wine handler though that handles any request you might have pertaining to the wine and champagne. pretty awesome.  The spinach dip came quickly. real fresh and delicious, pouring over the bowl it was in. the flavor of the dip was great. had a good taste of cheese with the mixture of the artichoke and spinach. very good.  next came our table side salad. you choose the ingredients you want on your salad, where it's then tossed in front of you with your choice of dressing. again a perfect salad. reminds me of a mix of Lawry's spinning bowl salad with no spin and table side guacamole you would order at a Mexican restaurant. salad was great. no issues there.  next, the waiter handed us lemon sorbet ice cream. this made me chuckle. he said it prepares the pallet for taste. how fancy is that!  so after the dip, salad and sorbet the filet arrived and I was very happy with it. it kind of looked like a baseball steak with how big it was, but it was all filet mignon, wrapped with a juicy slice of bacon..can't go wrong. when I cut into this meat I couldn't believe how perfect it was cooked. the outline of the cook compared to the red was flawless. Once I dove in, I just kept going at it non stop until I hit something...a bunch of crab meat! I completely forgot there was crab stuffed into the meat! was like getting a little bonus for eating this delicious steak.  after the dinner, your treated to more goodies. a chocolate dipped strawberry with some dipped fruit. then they offer you dessert, but it's not needed. you should be completely satisfied by meals end.  look, once I finished what I could, I was left fully satisfied, 10/10, no complaints at all...and I tried to keep this short with this review.  all of the staff is ultra friendly and courteous from the hostess to the servers to the runners. no issues at all with them.  check out the picture. I don't usually take photos but this dish deserved to be archived with the rest of the photos on here to show what this place has to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon stuffed with crab. cooked medium rare. perfect enough to photo and share!

koG7tuOMlqXQAOSi133C-w.text: I wanted to have a nice steak dinner while in Vegas and chose this place based off the reviews and menu. We were not disappointed. The service was great and I loved the salad. It's prepared table side with whatever you want on it. Very large portion for a dinner salad as well. Another yelper said the ranch was gross but I think it was good and I'm picky about dressing. I wouldn't say the steak was the best I've ever had but it was very good, cooked perfectly and on par with the price. I also like the little dessert platter. Everything tasted great and the portion was perfect. Definitely recommend and would return

7VmVJJAdo6KtNHDwm5ESCA.text: Had a wonderful anniversary dinner here. Every female gets a rose, even my niece and daughter. The service was excellent. The dirty martini my mom ordered came with an additional ice bucket and with a small glass filled with pretty much the equivalent of three martinis total. The lamb my husband ordered was awesome as well as the steak I ordered. The salads were so yummy. The kids loved the mini lemon sorbet cones and when we asked for more the waiter quickly go us more. The portions are big and the amount of food offered was too much for us but we gladly took left overs home! Loved the experience here. It is pricey, so we will save this place for special occasions.

mYrk4MR7lz7VPh1oKIlcBg.text: It was our 5th wedding anniversary and we had just renewed our vows at Vegas Weddings. The woman who officiated our wedding recommended that we go here for our anniversary dinner because it was one of her favorite date night restaurants with her own husband.   Upon arrival we were told that they generally are booked with reservations but they were still waiting on two people who had not shown up, we elected to hang out at the bar and have a drink to see if they did. While waiting the gentleman asked if we were celebrating anything special to which we replied it was our anniversary and we had just renewed our vows. He congratulated us and sat us a few minutes later.   When you are taken back to your seat they give every female a single long stemmed rose. The restaurant itself is very intriguing, it's like you're stepping back in time to the mobster days. Its very dark and mysterious. It was also very romantic. Our server and busser were very attentive. We never went without water or anything we needed.   They have a sommelier which is really neat; I typically don't patron restaurants with a sommelier so my husband decided that since it was a special occasional we would splurge and let him pick out some wine for us. It was a fun experience although pricey.  Included with your dinner is a salad that they made at your table. The server brings out a cart with what seems like endless options. Before you get your main course they bring you a small ice cream cone of raspberry sorbet to cleanse your palate. It was soooo good, so I ate the entire thing haha. Who doesn't love desert before dinner? I ordered the Filet Mignon and my husband had the Rib-eye. Both were cooked perfectly, were very tender and flavorful.   After dinner they brought us out a complimentary dessert, the Lava Cake, to celebrate our anniversary. It was very decadent and delicious!   Overall this was such an awesome experience. The food and service were excellent. The restaurant itself is very intriguing and romantic. It made the perfect place to celebrate our anniversary.

GJKOJCiGSiTOkCZf8DSL_w.text: Hands down the best meal I've ever had in my whole entire life. Had dinner with my wonderful wife and mother in law and heard so much great things about this place. Let me tell you, it's even better than you think and promises from others it will not disappoint at all in any way possible! This is more like the old school Vegas type of feel and service. The whole entire service was just so amazing the salad table side.. the filet melting in or mouths, and the lobster tale is no cheap tale now that's what you call lobster tale. Everything from beggining til end was just outrageously amazing! Will be back again no doubt!

BwkvYoDcl2KzlGJJpmy7oA.text: Excellent dining experience. Wife and I had escargot and bacon wrapped prawns then split ribeye. Those combined with made at your table salad was really too much. Staff is knowledgeable and professional. Old school Vegas that didn't disappoint.

qXJy0b0Zpce37EaqhgHCEQ.text: I LOVE Hugo's. I make a point to visit every time I am in Las Vegas. It is a total experience - from the rose at the front door, the salad made right up at the table, all the way to the delicious desserts. I had steak and shrimp and my fella had the duck flambe, both were AMAZING! The wait staff trerats you like royalty. The setting is wonderful and romantic. I will be coming back for many years to come. I cannot recommend Hugo's enough!

LFQhGFGd24Y_mCGNjhDp6g.text: Great old school Vegas dark romantic and great for anniversary or special event. Salad is the best in town

sfAVBWIW1Ykw1iY1f0huMA.text: Old school Las Vegas glamour really felt here! Long stemmed red roses are handed out to the ladies! Prepare to be pampered from the moment you make your way down a short flight of stairs and enter Hugo's Cellar. We had such a marvelous evening celebrating our 30th anniversary. Hugo's had the right amount of baby boomer nostalgia with waitstaff in tuxedos and elegant 70's deco. Diners today will love the experience of having tableside service of some of their dishes and desserts. Hugo's is one of the very few restaurants that still carries on this tradition since 1976. --Highlights -- -all entrees include steamed veggies, choice of potatoes, or wild rice, finished off with strawberries, figs and apricots dipped in chocolate. -Entree dishes: something for everyone. Various cuts of steak prepared, seafood, duck and chicken. hugoscellar.com/files/me... -basket of breads and cheese lavosh with a plate of butter carved out in shape of a rose is brought out as soon as you are seated. mini ice cream cone with Raspberry sorbet serves as a palate cleanser after salad/before main meal -Salad Made Tableside Server wheels their cart over to you and custom makes your salad. Of course I got the works with Bay Shrimp, artichokes, and about 8 other toppings with romaine lettuce. Beef Wellington is what I ate! Loved it! A VERY tender beef filet garnished with Foie Gras and duxelles wrapped up in a puff pastry, paired with a bordelaise sauce! -Dessert after main meal if you order Cherries Jubilee, it's made table side, with a little fire show even. Cherries, cherry liquor flambe'd served over vanilla ice cream. I would get this again! Get Hugo's Cappuccino with brandy and coffee liquor. It actually worked out perfect having it with the complimentary chocolate cake that Chef sent out for Happy Anniversary wishes! Thank you! When it comes to service. Impressive. It's well known that most of the original waitstaff since early '80s still works here. One of our servers Jaime, has been there the second longest time at 31 years, Michael, 14 years and the new kid on the block (I didn't catch his name) was 7 years! --More 411-- - dress code not enforced but stay classy and leave shorts, tanks, and sandals at home. - reservations a must! so call..Monday eve was packed - plan on spending 2 hours - dinner is slow paced - Your red rose is wrapped up in foil for you to take home - they'll validate your ticket for both valet or self parking - I thought spending a little over $200 for 2 meals, desserts and beverages was pretty reasonable. --Summary-- After having dining experiences at well known Michelin star and celebrity chef restaurants in Vegas, I'm so over it, doesn't impress me anymore. This time I wanted a place that had good food that we both would like, classy and unpretentious. You see hip, trendy restaurants come and go with a blink of an eye. Not Hugo's Cellar! It has withstood the test of time. Happy we celebrated here. Couldn't ask for a more perfect evening with my hot date.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherries Jubilee made and flambe&#39;d at your table. Got video too!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. dessert tray with chocolate covered strawberries figs and apricots
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hugo&#39;s Cappuccino with brandy and coffee liquor

vHbBjV_qh6MYxE5pYKMhEw.text: OLD SCHOOL FANTASTIC...!!!  Who knew?!?  A really great steakhouse inside the Four Queens Casino on Fremont Street...?!?  I've been to the Four Queens a dozen times or more - I believe, as do several friends, that they have the best odds in Vegas.    But until I saw all the glowing Yelp reviews, I've never ventured downstairs into the restaurant.  Folks, Hugo's Cellar is really good, old school fine dining.    Well dressed, very friendly waiters with real personalities.  A salad cart wheeled table side so you can choose all of your salad ingredients.  One of the best steaks I've had in a long time.  Bananas Foster or Cherries Jubilee prepared table side.  A great wine list and a sommelier who can really help you.  Not inexpensive, but all in all a wonderful meal.  We'll be back the next time we're in Vegas...

QSvNaY3ylqZddMeyjBwOWQ.text: We went in just for drinks. Dean was hands down the best bartender EVER!! His drinks were smooth and so good. I had the best Whiskey Sour ever. Even if you don't have the time to eat, go on in and hang out with Dean and Jon (wine expert) they will have you laughing til you pee your pants! Can't wait to come back!  PS. I've eaten here too and it's the best!!

jq0KHARPg53RsBTUfQ9tNw.text: The best service and food to go with it when you want to take that special someone to dinner in Las Vegas

F-kDxuPCpmnfxdE-_1oZkg.text: Exceptional service and dining experience! We absolutely enjoyed everything about this diamond in the rough! Attention to detail and attentiveness was impeccable. Each of our entrees were mouth watering. We had the Hot Rock Appetizer, and for our entrees we had Alaskan crab legs, Beef Wellington and the Double Lobster tails. And let's not forget the Bananas Foster. Ready to dine again. Highly Recommend.

m-326cN31zc56n1S_2Kq2w.text: Quick Takeaway: Enjoy a piece of 'Old Vegas' charm in the 'cellar' of the Four Queens. Expect a romantic atmosphere--- dimly lit cozy tables--old style service with personable waiters who have been there for years--complementary long stem rose for the lady- low music- great food. Relax, unwind, snuggle up and prepare for a feast! Make reservations and request a private table in the back and soak it all in.   Worth it?  Yes! Tableside salad; perfectly cooked steaks and sides; tableside cherries jubilee; Kona coffee brewed at your table--- this place it sure to sweep you off your feet. I felt like I was transported back to the 'Old Vegas' days. It's pricey. However, it was worth every penny and I'm confident you will be swept away in the whole dining experience and romantic atmosphere. This spot is a classic  treat-yo-self kinda' place! Loved it and I can't wait to treat out of town clients, family and friends to this spot!  Service:  Victor was our server and he was great! He was attentive but he never hovered. My husband and I were all smiles while he perfectly crafted our salads and kept good conversation. We never once had to ask for anything and he was on top of his game.    Overall: This was my first time experiencing an "Old Vegas" style dinner. My husband knows I'm a foodie and planned a special evening here for my birthday. We went all out and ordered steaks, cherries jubilee, Kona coffee and we had our feast and plenty of leftovers (photos and video included). I was 'wowed' and enjoyed my night out. All of this doesn't come cheap (expect 100 a person if you're going all out). It was worth every penny and is worth checking out for your own 'treat-yo-self' night on the town.

Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherries jubilee -Mmm Mmm
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary rose for the ladies :)

Zp19sPGiIFwA5dQK6mPyCQ.text: was happy we tried Hugo Cellars after getting the recommendation from our uber driver. Hugo's is located in the Four Roses casino. We just walked in and had no problem getting a table. They also give a long steamed red rose to every women. It's a very nice touch. Overall, Hugo's is very old school. Dim lights, great service, and an all male waitstaff. I thought they should have had some ladies. Only problem with Hugo's was the price. Because we just went there on a whim, we  look up the menu beforehand. That's our fault, but damn I wish we had looked. Entrees were at least $50 a pop. They were really good but we had been the another steakhouse on the strip earlier that weekend and prices were not that high. Hells kitchen is where we went before. I got the filet and it melted in my month. Portion was huge. My sister in law got the duck and they flambed it table side! Very fun to watch and it smelled amazing!  Overall I would go back. It's a unique old school Vegas experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hugr Filet Mignon

sXjmlrcalDczBOgpC7UlXQ.text: The service at Hugo's makes the experience. It is very romantic and 1950's glam. From the moment you arrive, you can tell it is a restaurant like no other. The women are greeted with a beautiful long stem red rose and you are treated like you are the only people in the restaurant. The food is great, but that is to be expected. The sommelier is knowledgeable and charming. The servers are quick, attentive and unobtrusive. I highly recommend the restaurant. The only criticism I could make is that it can get a little smoky from the casino above. Well worth every penny and will definitely do it again.

BcFEaZBOtnw-TFq67tir0Q.text: My fiance and I headed to Hugo's Cellar for our last night in Vegas. Our server was so kind and knowledgeable. The food was delicious but I would compare it to a nice steakhouse from where I live, I was not overly impressed, but I wasn't disappointed either. The salad that is made at your table is a nice touch. Also, if you like martinis, this is THE PLACE to go! They're $13 and you get about 3 drinks from that - totally worth it.

H6yMzCLjzAVlGwggBb074Q.text: My Valentine's Day date took me here for dinner.  First of all, we were late for our reservation because my date had a corporate gig run late, and they were extremely accommodating and friendly about it!  When we arrived, I got my fresh, beautiful, red rose (all ladies who come here receive one), and were seated immediately.  We had a few different servers attend to us - one for wines, one for our salad, and another for the rest of our needs.  I was blown away by the romantic setting, incredible service, and the impressive food!  As a vegetarian, your options are limited here, but never fear!  I had the vegetarian entree, which changes by the day.  When we went, it was mushroom ravioli, and oh wow.  It was SO good!  They were out of the raspberry cheesecake when we got to dessert, so we chose the berry tarte instead... I'm glad they were out of the cheesecake, because we wouldn't have gotten to try it otherwise!  (There are no words for how good it was.)  Everything about this experience was extremely positive.  It is on the tad pricey side, but if you want to really give a woman a romantic evening, this is the perfect place to go (unless you're vegan or a raw foodie, that is...).  Thank you Hugo's Cellar, for a lovely evening!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UC8T8SZva__glkup04lZfA.text: This is a delayed post, since I was here last month. Great old-school Vegas restaurant! A Gem, tucked inside of the Four Queens great food and great service. I had the ribeye, which was cooked to a perfect medium rare. My friend had the duck, which I intend to have the next time I go. Also had the Kona coffee after dinner, which was excellent. Make sure to stop by if you are downtown. They will treat you right.

1xr4WcoE1uPizpezoQzPvw.text: This place is a hidden gem! We were recommended this place by a friend and we were not disappointed. The portion sizes for what you pay were justified and the food was delicious. The whole experience from the drink presentation to creating your appetizer salad right at the table to the dessert was unforgettable! This place is a go to when in Las Vegas!

zpNx5pPdVWNC9W6uSf5xfg.text: I gave it 4 stars because the atmosphere was great for our party of 6. The service was very good and the place is cool. The table side salad was the highlight. Everyone in my party said their steaks or prime rib was top notch although the Beef Wellington was disappointing.

_6UmlygNkrbU9wFcHM4uSA.text: We have not been to Vegas for a long time but were looking forward to dinner at Hugo's. it was a favorite. This time it was a disappointment. I think that they were training new people because we had a minimum of four people hovering over our table at all times. The salad was good but the meat was mediocre. The lamb was flavorless, and i don't know how that was possible. The ribeyes were ordered medium rare and medium. They were both the same and had gristle that I've never seen in that cut. It was like Sizzler. For $400.00, I expect more.

cbORBqd9idag7I_k7bP9lw.text: So, I just wrote a not so great review on Morton steakhouse in Las Vegas .  I came to Hugo Cellars the night before and it was outstanding as it always is.  I tend to write reviews when I'm not happy, so here is a great review.    I like that the give women roses when they walk in.  I enjoy the great service by the tenured wait staff.  Salads made tableside.  Cocktails come in an ice bucket which is 3 times a normal pour.  It's old school and I love it.

uKljpECmQ9FgXzEKgWW-hg.text: Was looking for a nice place to take my girlfriend in the downtown area and stumbled upon this gem. It's located in four Queens hotel and honestly never knew this placed existed.  The service was phenomenal, from reservations, to being seated, and during our meal - whole 9 yards.  Rose on entering, great setting, very good food. Highly recommend.

dBMlZDfTZSJ9SfdLTxcnLA.text: The food was awesome.   Don't eat anything the day you're going.   You'll need the room.  Very classy.

_4BgIuCZliItjjdJTeY14A.text: A Romantic ending to a crazy day in Vegas. Food and service was amazing!! Will definitely be back.

OLZv9wWeR4kpkCJOKNEKjQ.text: Excellent restaurant. Very calm, clean and friendly environment. Great tucked away dining experience from the loud casino area. We had prompt service. Our steak was cooked perfect to our request. We would definitely recommend this place.

ZK95zYr45GuxcyJg-SGe4w.text: Awesome dinner!  My husband got the biggest prime rib and ate every bite.  I got the filet which was perfect.  We started with the yummy crab cakes.  My favorite part was the salad cart.  The honey walnut orange dressing they had that night was so good.  I've been to other nice steak restaurants in Vegas but I really loved this one.  Very romantic feel.
