unesinEiHAjOcUZYlStxjw.text: We had reservations a few years ago, but I forgot to post a review. Sadly we had a bad experience. With reservations, they told us we'd still have an hour wait???? Given it was on St. Patricks day, but I had told them we were celebrating our wedding anniversary when I made the reservations. We didn't wait, we ended up going somewhere else :(

eK8TJZJHETMLH8YgFzVJwQ.text: I love old school Vegas places, so I've obviously had Hugo's bookmarked for a while, and finally visited last night. First, the setting: downtown, in the 4 Queens, so you get the full 'vintage' feeling that I think is kinda lacking at Piero's or Golden Steer. Of course, the Four Queens has pretty much moved beyond 'vintage' to 'dated and smoky', so luckily the restaurant is located literally in the cellar, away from the nastiness of the casino. Second, the ambiance: all brick walls with old paintings everywhere. The furniture is newer, but definitely not modern. I think they could probably spruce things up a little without losing the feel of the place. For instance: 1970s glass lamp shades shaped like flowers.  Third, the service: perfect. Friendly, prompt, knowledgeable. All over it with our water refills and busing our dirty plates, but I never felt like they were hovering. I loved that the sommelier came around to chat with everybody, and he was great. Very approachable, explained things to us without being snooty, and definitely did not scoff at our price point. I love love love that the sommelier has been there almost 30 years, the busser 15 years, and the waiter 15 years.  Fourth, the FOOD: great. We started with the escargot, which were rich and buttery just like they should be. We each had an order of 6, but I wished we would have split because I was already getting full! Moved on to the salad, which many people have described. It might be nice if one of the offerings was just 'make me a caesar salad,' but I appreciated all the options. All the ingredients were fresh and plentiful. For entrees we had the sea bass New England style, and the beef wellington. Both were delicious, but I thought the wellington really stood out. Both the beef and the pastry were cooked perfectly and the sauce added the perfect flavor. Also, the meat was so tender, not a bit stringy like I expected. Finally, topped it off with the chocolate dipped fruits which were a nice tough. It was so much food (and we didn't even touch the bread basket), that we each brought home at least half of our entree. Finally, the damage: $250. Fine dining salads, appetizers, entrees, mini desserts, a bottle of wine, and tip. Totally worth it. I wouldn't mind stopping back by for a martini at the bar when I'm in the area sometime.

RCE2wFwxxTpVXwFf2rc3Kw.text: This just might be the fanciest place I ever ate at. I loved being greeted with a rose, and the service was amazing all throughout the night. I recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a quiet and romantic dinner. (The food was incredibly delicious!)

_1ZLg120SktGvjkpnNz4kQ.text: This place is great old school Las Vegas. The casino itself leaves a lot to be desired, but the restaurant is great. You go down the stairs descend into a totally different world from the casino above. The brick walls and dark intimate feel of the restaurant are in total contrast to what is going on above you. Once downstairs, you are greeted by the manager as soon as you arrive and shown to your table.  The waiters here all wear tuxedos and it gives the restaurant a real elegant feel. We had no less than 3 waiters during our dinner. All were very professional and delivered great service. We did not have any issues during our meal.  We did not order any appetizers because they already give you so much food included with your meal. For starters, they bring you a bread basket with assorted breads in it. All were very good and tasty. We very much enjoyed the table side salad. It was terrific. Presentation was nice and they have so many ingredients to choose from. All items were fresh and it made for a great salad.   They brought us out a little raspberry sorbet cone before our entree as a pallet cleanser. It was a nice touch and did what it was supposed to do. My entree tasted fantastic after eating this tart little treat.  For entree I had the 16oz prime rib. It was very good. Nice and juicy and full of flavor. Served with great horseradish sauce, vegetables and garlic whipped potatoes it was a very nice dish. My wife had the chicken champignon which was very good as well. Loaded with mushrooms and served with a tasty sauce it was good.  After your meal, you are brought a plate of chocolate covered strawberries, apricots and figs with a dip. This was a great touch to a wonderful meal. We were both full from our dishes but ate these little gems anyway. A lot of restaurants could learn something about customer service and service from Hugo's Cellar.  Our whole dining experience from start to finish was great. I will definitely be returning here next time in Vegas for another wonderful meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry Sorbet pallet cleanser

LDVKaOXwHoDLWBvRStxU7Q.text: We ended up at Hugos after a recommendation from a bartender. We we're going to go to one of the big chef named steak houses but after several locals told us about Hugos we decided to go.  Food was incredible. Service was some of the best I've had. My wife was greeted with a long stemmed rose. The entire team basically serves you and are all very attentive and professional. Having them make salads table side was nice.I had the prime rib, wife had the ribeye. Both came out searing hot and cooked to a perfect Med Rare. The Ribeye was amazing and my prime rib was probably the best prime rib ive ever had. Dessert was so so but we only had the complimentary fruit dipped in chocolate.  We will definitely be going back to Hugo's.

3Y99INj7Zizsb68ZHRNgzw.text: Diamond in the rough hidden underground at the Four Queens. Our group of 10 had a semi private room. Long stem roses for the ladies. Outstanding service from Greg Gene and Eddie. They were so fun. Martinis were recommended and enjoyed by all , from the raspberry lemon drop to the extra dirty, and those cute little ice buckets for your carafe!  Table side salads were amazing. Was sad when my plate was empty. Everyone had some sort of steak or the duck. Excellent meal. I enjoyed the cellar cut prime rib. Outstanding. Still thinking about it the next day. The cherry on top was the bananas foster prepared right at your table. Best I've ever had. Totally full but gotta finish this dessert!  Everything you'd ever want in a restaurant: great service, great food, great value. A memorable night for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gene firing up the Bananas Foster.

SHy1VKofo8l1R5U9YuicNw.text: Fantastic old school spot, business seems to have picked back up.  The last couple of years, I've always been able to get a reservation the day of...but couldn't a few weeks ago when I was in Vegas on a not particularly busy Vegas weekend.  Was actually glad to hear it and know business was good.  The table side salad is cooler than it sounds, and the service is top notch.  Request a room in the front area if you're like me a like a little more noise filling the room (though it's still not much), the back room is kind of boring in my opinion.

E9ASfYYpVaAnZGmwJ0KpvA.text: Went here on a Saturday night with a reservation. Thank goodness because the restaurant was packed and very loud. Was expecting an intimate quiet dinner based on reviews but almost had to shout to speak to my husband who was right next to me.   The service was very nice and prompt, even for a busy Saturday.   I ordered the jumbo stuffed prawns and my husband ordered the ribeye. Both were overcooked but still very flavorful. Salad was excellent. Chocolate covered fruit (figs, apricots, strawberries) were to die for and included with the price.   Good meal but probably wouldn't go back again.

xPnnqLL3-5k0fNbaMZnEtw.text: Most AMAZING service ever. As soon as you walk in every lady is greeted with a long stem rose and walked to your table with warmth and class. Food is even better then the service. And making my salad at my table is awesome.

FIP_Qt5DZ6C9uH74-M-qeQ.text: I chose this place because of the positive reviews. Either everyone else has really different standards, somethings has changed or some of these review are, well, maybe inflated?   Any way here is a list of the good, the bad and the ugly:  Good:  The ambiance* The martinis* The salad The server pouring water The seared prime rib  Bad: 1) The table-side manner. The waiter who greeted us (Jaime) was clearly in training as another waiter (Greg) was visibly agitated by whatever he believed Jaime wasn't doing correctly and it was awkward for everyone.   2) The timing. There were two of us, the place was calmly busy, and yet we were seated at a place with 4 settings and had one of the other waiters reaching across multiple times us as they removed each fork, knife, napkin, etc.   3) The training. Jaime showed how green he was when I told him I was considering the Ahi Tuna. He said it could be prepared the three ways the menu described. Hmmmm, I pretty sure you are not going to have your ahi tuna steak breaded or any of the other ways listed. More training needed before being on the floor.  4) The seating. I've waited tables for 7 years and you don't seat a new waiter with three tables back to back, especially at a labor intensive restaurant like this.   5) The host. One skill a host should have is being good with faces. We checked in a bit early and the waiter said to come back at our exact time. Since the bar was very tiny, we went back upstairs until the exact time. He had no idea who we were when we came back 15 minutes later.   7) The seafood. The second waiter (Greg - too agro, not the right personality for a waiter) came over and so I asked him if the Ahi was good. He said no. Points for being honest. He suggested the $54 Chilean Sea Bass instead. Given that the only other seafood item (I don't eat beef) of interest was the $85 King crab legs, and I usually love Chilean Sea Bass, I went for it. He said it came with a "shrimp sauce" on top. I asked for it on the side because why ruin a $54 fish entree with a sauce? This ended up being by FAR the WORST Chilean Sea Bass I've ever eaten. I see why they have you pour a very thick cream "shrimp sauce" on top of it. It didn't taste remotely like Sea Bass. It seemed like it had been boiled in water for an hour and then pan seared. It was total mush and completely flavorless. It was served with red potatoes which were also pretty flavorless. THIS was the #1 seafood recommendation?!?  8) The timing - when Greg had told me not to go with the Ahi, I asked for another minute to take a look at the menu. Then no one came back for about 20 minutes so we could finish ordering. We finally got our salads after being there an hour (we did not get apps) because Jaime was busy making salads for other tables ahead of us, which why I mentioned #4.   9) The bathrooms. There are no bathrooms in the restaurant, which is subdued and dim like a steak place should be. So you have to go up into the blaring loud casino and walk quite a ways to the bathroom.  10) Attention to detail. My martini was served in a glass with a big crack down the side and I had to request a new glass. I didn't realize olives could age, but these "green" olives were nearly colorless and seemed to have also lost their olive flavor. We were also not given wine menus and had to ask for them. The waiters also did not refill our drinks when they were empty.   11) The bread. There were 3 types of "bread" in the basket. One tasted like a giant, very stale, almost moist, saltine cracker. The other two were super cheap little rolls you would get at a Sizzler buffet.   12) Honesty. I already had an issue with this given the low-quality of food they are serving for the 5-star prices, but another thing that was directly misleading was that they say on the menu they serve bottled water. Yes, it comes out of a large glass container with a screw top that is I suppose technically a bottle, but it's clearly refilled tap water. And - there is no ice in the drinks so plan on warm water with your meal.   If we were not there to celebrate my husband's birthday, I would have addressed these items in person with a manager.   My takeaway is that this place is trying to get by with an "old school" steakhouse vibe and not even trying when it comes to a good wait staff, quality food or the kind of attention to detail that should be second nature for what they are charging.

mMDKQJkQ7WDVWPGohrYR6w.text: This place is delightfully old school, and should NEVER change up it's formula. You can't help but feel good about life in this place. My beef Wellington was absolutely amazing - I wish I had the budget to eat here once a week. Their sommelier is extremely knowledgable, and the servers are all friendly and outgoing. The rose at the door? Just the cherry on the sundae.

XmVnw5bxZW4G-5T0JNhgFg.text: I love the atmosphere and the ambience first of all. I love the fact that all of the ladies get a long stemmed red rose. It makes you feel so special, and just like a woman.  I think any woman would feel special if her significant other took her here for dinner. The food is spectacular.  Last night we had the spinach artichoke dip, which was so divine. Our salads were made fresh table side. We all got to choose our own toppings and our dressing. I had the peppercorn dressing and it was delicious. I chose queens lobster for my dinner. It was medallions of lobster and a delicious sauce with sun-dried tomatoes. I really enjoyed it. It came with vegetables, too. The portions are quite large. Between our courses, we were given sorbet on a tiny cone. It was a delightful touch to clean your palate. I also want to note that they serve chocolate covered strawberries, figs and apricots with fresh whipped cream for dessert. We also ordered creme brulee and chocolate mousse and everything was absolutely delicious. We truly enjoyed everything about this place and would give it 10 stars if we could!

gsl9o2GZk_0hLldRktPWIA.text: We went to Hugo's Cellar to celebrate my son's graduation from UNLV, this is the 3rd time my wife & I have dined there.  This time I was a bit disappointed, especially with the service.  We were seated in a nice booth in the back and although it was a Sat night, it was not a full house.  The waiter was nice enough, except he only showed up about every 15 minutes.  We waited several times for drink refills and clearing of dirty dishes.  About those drink refills; the sodas that were ordered came in 8 ounce small bottles, at $2 per refill.  It has been forever since I saw a soda bill that was more than the alcohol bill.  The appetizers and salads were good, my steak, however was luke warm.  Overall, I would say a fair experience at best for this visit.

UOwLSVc2CwkkSS2oCOHGBQ.text: Amazing experience overall. Staff and service was excellent. Ambience was superb. Food was simply amazing. My dad did say the rice was on the salty side. But aside from that the food was on point. The table side salad that comes with every entree is filling and excellent as well.

3rOkyST5aLhM2YGK8rk5_Q.text: We had a group of seven. The service and food was perfect!  Will definitely be back. Do wish they had a smaller steak however

j4N6vs-uInwmXBY3yLtcNg.text: This restaurant has the absolute rudest staff with an attitude problem. The food is terrible, the manager is mean and rude and acts like he's the president of the United states instead a glorified babysitter of restaurant staff. Overrated doesnt even come close to explaining this restaurant. That's what happens when reveiws from years past stay on the website, restaurants change and people still go there thinking they are getting a five star, and in reality get a one star restaurant.

a5TL4ouw8rwlFuLdh8dN7A.text: Our Luck was not as good as others... not to sure if i want to give them another shot... We received more service from the bus boy than our servers... and both the food and the service did not live up to our expectations or the hype.... Overall, im not going back, the experience was not something to remember... there was a missing touch from the service aspect....

zx0EIwsipgcsi_y4oBPGUQ.text: Best restaurant in Vegas!! The atmosphere is very classy and romantic. Each lady is presented with a red rose upon arrival. The service is impeccable! Have eaten there countless times and have never been disappointed with the food or service. The wine list is extensive and John the sommelier is very friendly and knowledgeable. The martinis are served in a little carafe and made to perfection by Dean. I have enjoyed every entree I have ever had....from beef wellington to prime rib to steak to salmon. The waiters make your salad tableside which is a nice touch. For dessert the bananas foster is incredible, especially when made by Victor. If we lived in Vegas would definitely make Hugo's a once a month event, but do make it there every trip to Vegas!

Ey2qz8k-N5CsQRYTNuutzg.text: AWFUL place.  after all the hype, clearly not worth it.  tableside salad is a joke -- think bad salad bar rolling around, lousy lettuce and canned vegetables.  service was atrocious.  our food came after others who were seated 30 minutes after us. after hearing about hugos and waiting for another trip to vegas to try, we were extremely disappointed and the prices were twice what they should be for the food quality and the service.  never coming back

eH5Is4ny1aD-kJnPWhYw6g.text: Growing up in the Santa Maria/AG area, I love a good steak. Hugo's Cellar is one of the best steak houses I have ever been to! It is in the basement of the old Four Queens casino in downtown Vegas, but do not underestimate the amazing food, service, ambiance, and overall experience you are in for at Hugo's Cellar!   The salad is something to behold. They actually bring a cart to your table with about 20 different items and make it fresh for you at the table. The steaks are huge and I recommend always getting the smallest cut. The restaurant is pricey. We go here only for special occasions when in Vegas or if we win big!   You can't go wrong with the Prime Rib or the Filet Mignon. I haven't ever tried a fish dish as the steaks are so delicious I can't being myself to try something new.  If you want the True old school Vegas experience I highly recommend Hugo's Cellar. Make sure to make reservations well in advance as this is a favorite restaurant with the locals.

Drme3pVKeIHisd7gijeOGA.text: Always as good as it gets. The restaurant is so intimate and cozy, it feels like your hundreds of miles away from Vegas but it actually one of the oldest steak houses around! The salad alone is to die for. I could seriously go and just have them make me the salad. I dream about that salad. And needless to say, service is always impeccable. Highly recommend that you try this old school Vegas gem.

Eb6EZK-Lm0S_1uHMKuVsPQ.text: Wow. One of the best restaurants I've been to.  I had a recommendation from a few people about this little known restaurant in old las vegas and they were right.  I forget our servers name but he was excellent. We both had mixed drinks. Nicely made. Loved the table side salad. My girl ordered the stuffed shrimp.  Excellent flavor.  I had the fillet wrapped in bacon w/ crab and Bearnaise sauce.  Wow... the meat was cooked perfectly, juicy, and super tender.   After every meal/restaurant my girlfriend and i review the eatery and both of us found nothing negative to say.  We give an A+

VTuTxNnmxcbnPsLh_j4JFQ.text: Hugo's Cellar deserves a "10" for both service and food (Hugo's chicken and sea bass).  We celebrated our 20th anniversary there, and everyone was very welcoming and professional.  We loved the vintage decor.  The sommelier was right on target, and did not attempt to oversell us in any way.  The garlic mashed potatoes were heavenly.  Can't wait to return for my birthday celebration, and I wouldn't even consider going anywhere else for a special occasion.

ROLYs72Ly3zzP9os9SMqIg.text: I should have trusted my instincts.  I love the romance of old Vegas and thought we should try dinner downtown one night.  Hugo's Cellar seemed to be the nicest, most highly reviewed place I could find.  Looked at the menu while I was home making plans and had my heart set on chateaubriand - just love a good filet with bearnaise no matter what chefs think of the cut - and looked forward to it.  Was given a red rose upon entering...not my thing...too cheesy for me but I took it (and left it on the table).  After ordering, the salad cart was wheeled over and our salads were created.  Old school salads, nothing frou-frou here and teeney-tiney shrimp.  I made the mistake of filling up on it too much since we were famished upon entering, so much so that I was full when my entree was served.   It was okay but nothing like I was hoping it would be.  Portions were large so come hungry.    This was too old-fashioned for me with mediocre food.  I realize I sound like an idiot saying I'm looking for classic Vegas and being picky when it's old-fashioned, but Hugo's Cellar didn't provide the scrumptious meal I was hoping to have.

AwBWZFcKXuaaYtrQX1zkzw.text: Wow. Hugo's is a diamond in the rough in the "old Vegas" section of the strip. FIrst of all, if you are going to Vegas, Fremont Street is a must-see. And while you are there, Hugo's Cellar is a must-taste. Our waiter told us that the Rat Pack used to be regulars. The place really feels like a cellar with a 60s or 70s vibe which I completely loved. I hope they never modify or revamp the interior because it is retro and priceless. Also, they give a rose to the women as they come in, and another when you leave! So classy! I had the Filet de Bouef Atlantis and it was seriously worth every calorie and fat gram it may have contained. It was probably the best steak I have ever had in my LIFE. Wrapped with bacon, in a sauce with crabmeat-it was so tasty that I could not believe my taste buds. I am not to one to "eat it and tweet it" since I find it rude and obnoxious when people can't put their phones down long enough to be courteous to others at the table, but I do wish I had taken a picture of my filet because it is one of my fondest memories of Vegas (and there are many; it was a great trip!). Our reservations were made in advance but I think you have to get them pretty early, so I would recommend making them WELL in advance if you want to go. Don't miss Hugo's!

9-oGpKzcIzrFjLbVrTVR1g.text: AH, tis a good life.  (pics will be posted soon)... Made my way down the stairs into the dark "cellar" flanked by three handsome gentlemen (my daddy, my bf, and his dad) and got my red rose....wore red shoes to match the rose! :) We were seated and got our complementary mountain spring water and bread....I got a glass of Riesling to accompany my meal. My favorite part of the meal was the individually tossed salads tableside...I think I can come back here just for that.  I had romaine with egg, mushroom, tomato, anchovy, bay shrimp, artichokes, hearts of palm, crouton, parmesan, maybe a few other things I can't remember, and honey-walnut vinaigrette.  soooo good!!! ~raspberry sorbet intermezzo was tasty~ I ordered tournedos Hugo.  2 5-oz filets topped with foie gras and artichoke in bernaise sauce, came with roasted garlic mashed potatoes, baby carrots, white and green asparagrus, and sauteed mushrooms.  The foie gras was not my favorite, too pasty and no crust or juiciness like at Rosemary's.  In fact, it was barely on the second steak.  The artichokes here, unlike in the salad, were tough to eat.   However, the filet was amazingly tender and the sauce delicious.  I gave my leftovers to my bf (aka disposal), as did my dad (he ordered the 16 oz ribeye).   Dessert: chocolate dipped figs, strawberries and apricots with cream dip were soooo yummy!!!! In conclusion, great service and probably a place you go once or twice in a lifetime!  So in Hugo's honor, I made an interesting salad for lunch today. My rose is in a water-bottle-vase that I made, but the fun was walking around all dressed up in the Four Queens holding it and I looked stunning (with the red shoes of course) and watching my dad win at craps.

ChhlxnhbgAKBrLld7Pat-w.text: After a day of gambling, I had some extra money, thanks vegas, and I really wanted a good steak.  We were not dressed up, but I check with the hostess and they were totally cool t-shirts.  The service was amazing.  No one judged us because we weren't dress up.  The steaks were the highest quality and perfectly cooked. All the severs were so cool.  Totally worth the money!

YaMS6wZEOFAXNLVJgckWPg.text: We were forgotten. We checked in at 730 with a reservation and didnt leave until almost 915. Initial drinks came fast but after that we were left hanging. When the meal did come out, we got the "careful plate is hot" warning which did not include a "food is cold" warning along with it. One star for the salad guy who was awesome and one star for the guy that kept my water glass full.

F1kZSSKe3BaPueqsJnevFA.text: Nice placee to satisfy the craving for steak. We walked in with no reservations but from the looks of it, reservations are highly recommended. The host said we got lucky as some guests hadn't shown  up for their reservation. I was given a rose by the host before we were seated on our table, it was a nice touch. The place itself is nice, it has a very old timey feel to it, very dimly lit. I love places like that. Every entree comes with a salad, served table side, and dessert.   I ordered the filet mignon, medium rare and it was cooked to perfection. It came with a side of bernaise sauce and mashed potatoes with asparagus and carrots, so yummy.   Dessert consisted of a chocolate covered strawberry, figs dipped in white chocolate and dried apricots with a side of fresh whipped cream, soo yummy!  We weren't dressed the part, but there is a slight dress code that is enforced. No shorts, flip flops, or tank tops.

v8NKc39a5bk4H_KD9fxwxQ.text: The rose at the door of Hugo's Cellar and the look of the old school is not just good....... They are incredible!!  The food is wonderful. If you go down the stairs you feel that you are in a strange oasis in the far west. The service is always impeccable.   Recommended for all types of appointments with friends or family, but if you are looking for a romantic place to be comfortable with your partner. Hugo's Cellar is not.

IhZmyj5BGQS023kX2ywy7Q.text: Great atmosphere and service! Reminds me of a classy 1960's restaurant.  Very romantic.  The tableside salad was amazing and great martinis.  Steak quality was great but needed a little more seasoning.  It comes with sauce on the side, however, I prefer no sauce.  Butter, garlic and salt is all that I need on a steak.  We will definitely come back.

_c1J8yCOoNEoooovkKGK-Q.text: A little hidden treasure went there last night for our 10 yr anniversary  , it was so beautiful and romantic the lobsters bisque was delicious and the salad the best part they give you a made me feel special thank you for the experience !

Kl7iGO6zKn9VZ2tL3dreWg.text: It's like a step back in time but I was disappointed first with the salad was very bland I was really hoping the Prime Rib would make up for that but once again I was disappointed That's to bad If anything positive the rose was a nice touch

j38pIwZvohalr8qEAjDJ2A.text: Awesome dinner as always. Such a great spot to go. The salad cart is always great and the steaks were cooked to perfection. Love this place and the drinks were on spot.

KkoU-y5rwMZIxX72H7XXlA.text: Good experience. I had lamb chops which was cooked beautifully. Husband had rib eye. Service is beautiful. Cesar salad was wonderful. This is a great Las Vegas institution that you have to check out.

lXj7Vga_eUWkc5zs7QysIQ.text: "Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life." - Steve Jobs   This was my third visit to Hugo's Cellar. I first came to Hugo's back in 1994 for my Junior Prom in high school. I came back a few years later around the turn of the millennium. This final visit was with my love and a couple of our best friends, as we needed a place to eat before seeing the Las Vegas Philharmonic at the Smith Center and felt like the charm of Hugo's might go nice with the evening. "Old School" comes up in 92 other reviews...for good reason...this most recent experience matched my old memories of Hugo's pretty well. In fact, as we spoke to Gene the salad guy and John the sommelier, I realized that some of the staff had been there for all three of my visits.  You come to Hugo's for a different feel. This is a traditional steakhouse, void of modern nuances, but with character and flair of a different era. Hugo's is a traditional place, especially for those of us born from the late 60s to the early 80's, because it has held fast to elements of charm and service that are unique. At Hugo's you will find a sommelier with wit and charisma in John, table-side salad from the refined skills of Gene, and service that continues to impress in yesteryear kind of way...such as raspberry sorbet from a miniature cone and table-side Cherries Jubilee for dessert.   You can easily enjoy better food in Vegas at this price point, but it won't come with the same feel. Hugo's has a classier feel than old-school counterpart Golden Steer, and is significantly better than the other old Vegas classic that is Pamplemousse Le Restaurant.

XNJN3JAwoQyZhuBmvAsu7w.text: This is definitely one of my favorite old school Vegas places to come for dinner.  It's located inside the 4 Queens casino in Downtown Las Vegas.  Very cool vibe here.  They give the ladies a rose when you enter, then they seat you and proceed to order immediately.    They prepare your salads right at your table, get your drinks and have amazing appetizers and dinner options.  The menu, service and ambiance can't be beat, especially for downtown Las Vegas.

13BNfQu-VqGm2dhDiPYmag.text: Old Vegas Feel...I got it here, WITH great service!  My love made a reservation here before our Smiths Center engagement...convenient location, with 4 1/2 stars on Yelp Reviews...sign me up please!  I was greeted with a red rose and accompanied by three handsome gentleman...how can a girl not be over the moon already?  Two of our friends had arrived just ahead of us and were already sipping on old fashioneds...I am not an expert on cocktails by any means but these old fashioneds were not the best I have tried.    All the staff at Hugo's Cellar, from waiter to the sommelier, John, were friendly and professional with a welcoming manner. John was wearing a small metal bowl to taste all the wine he opens for the night...what a lucky guy with such a pleasant manner. We were already in an incredible mood when Gene, the Salad-mixologist, topped it up with this engaging preparations...he's been working at Hugo's Cellar over 3 decades...patiently and kindly aqurairing our preferences for the table-side salad making. He offered three different house made salad dressings, as wells as anchovies, hardboiled egg, lettus, shrimp, onion, mushroom, tomato, croutons, blue cheese, parmesan cheese, hearts of palms, pine nuts...Gene literally brings out a cart full of ingredients and asks for your likes and dislikes. Then, he prepares and mixes it right in front of you...very freshly special.    Before our entree, we received a Raspberry Sorbet cone to cleanse our palettes. For the entrees, my love and I shared the Trio of Seafood, and a Filet mignon.  The seafood came with sweet potato, white and green asparagus, stuffed tomato, Crab cake, Shrimp, and Sea bass...the taste was all alright, but the presentation was lacking in some parts. Our Filet was cooked perfect for our request, and came with mashed potato, asparagus and a duo of mushrooms...it all tasted average. We also received a complementary dessert tray with chocolate covered strawberries, dark chocolate covered apricots, and figs with white chocolate...there were all good but not so stimulating as to promise our return visit...but we loved Hugo Cellar's wine selections and services from the beginning to end...   I am grateful to Hugo's Cellar for keeping the old Vegas setting...adoring the ladies with a red rose, and the authentic service...but not so much for the food and presentation.  - 2017 Review #7 -

msHFHS21RAoNzUmCqugJ8w.text: This is the best restaurant we have eevrr eaten at.  We haven't had a restaurant like this in 30 years.  The service was exemplary from our waiter. The sommelier was the best we have ever seen. Fully knowledgeable and just made a joy out of ordering the wine and drinks.   The food & everything else was just specular. I've eaten there 40 years ago when I lived in Las Vegas in it was great & this is even better than my recollection of a back then.   It was 5 stars then and it's actually...  don't have enough stars this is a 10 star restaurant for food and service just spectacular. Thank you Hugo's for be in there.  U made our night and will for quite a while till we get back there again.  Thank you!   From my husband John

JJTFrb9HshYQe7vwBiU34Q.text: Boyfriend raves about this place and how he HAD to take me. One word amazing. The food was great. Service great. Atmosphere romantic in the middle of downtown. It's like you're stepping into another world for an hour or so. Haha. I love it. Recommend it all the time. Will go again forsure.

VM-a6Zc3rGN7Psjp2bba1A.text: I was Truely pleased with this restaurant. Old romantic feel with the atmosphere of what the essence of real fine dining. Tucked away in the basement of one of the oldest casinos the four queens. The experience from start to finish was all top notch.   Greeted and seated with a rose in a quaint booth we were welcomed with water and a warm hello. Offered a predinner drink and warm bread.   We started with escargot which was served hot and fresh. The table side salad was a real shocker. The salad is an entree in itself. With numerous toppings available the experience of the way its served is memorable.   We enjoyed the table side flambed duck and filet mignon with shrimp skewer. They were both very delicious.   The experience in itself made this an extremely memorable dining experience. I would definitely  recommend this restaurant.

EPQkOaQtz4qdAJ6y5VZN1g.text: We just enjoyed an amazing dinner @ Hugo's! The food was not only delicious but we were fortunate enough to have Rashard as our server tonight! He was so helpful, polite and friendly! He made the dinner worthwhile!

7uxBOLbeo9qiXXGhkv7EwA.text: This place serves the best restaurant experience. When our party walked in, they gave the ladies of the party roses and told us a little about the history of their restaurant. We were seated fairly quickly and were introduced to our two servers. The food was plentiful and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate covered strawberry
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon covered filet stuffed with crab. This was so tender and flavorful. The mashed potatoes were nice and garlicky.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert platter that comes with dinner. Chocolate covered strawberries that were big and sweet. Chocolate covered figs and dried apricots.

Bh8oqY6-O_u5ykLl3dR5Cg.text: Food was really good. Service was pretty good. I'm sensitive to cigarette smoke and the place smelled like stale smoke since it's in a casino. Seafood trio was cooked to perfection and the filet was delicious! Great place for a romantic dinner!

pnk8sSrbVg3vdtvHIpolJg.text: I came here with two out of town friends.  We were seated promptly, brought menus and drinks, and were ready to order after a short time.  During the time we looked at the menu, a server arrived with a bread basket.  Two of us decided to split the escargots en croute and I ordered the 10 ounce NY Strip steak done blue.  When the server came with the escargots, he cautioned us that the cast iron was very hot and we should let the escargots cool a bit so as not to burn ourselves.  As he was saying that, one of the escargots decided to "blow off steam" and it exploded out of the pan onto my sweater along with some garlic butter.  I took the snail and put it on my plate.  Our server removed the plate and brought me a clean one.  We all had a good laugh.  He was correct, they were very, very hot.  They're really not en croute--rather, they're topped with a piece of puff pastry.  My recommendation would be to put the pastry aside on your plate, eat the escargots, and then use the pastry to soak up the garlic butter remaining in the small wells.  When our server cleared these dishes, he told us he mentioned to the chef what happened and there would be something extra at the end of the meal.  Then he brought the salad cart and one by one made the salad according to each person's desired items and dressing.  I was a bit disappointed that bleu cheese was not an option so I opted for the ranch and he put extra bleu cheese crumbles on top.  The salad was good and it certainly is an old school way of doing salad.  In between the salad and the main course, we were brought lemon sorbet in a miniature cone as a palate cleanser.  Nice touch.  The it was on to the main course.  Garlic mashed potatoes or rice were the two choices (there was a third I didn't understand what he said) and I chose the garlic mashed.  There was a small baked tomato and some white and green asparagus.  My steak was cooked properly and was tender.  The vegetables were were good but I couldn't help but think how nice it would be if they had a baked potato cart like the salad one.  What a way to get baked potatoes.  For dessert, we were brought a chocolate mousse cake to make up for the flying snail and the standard tray of chocolate covered strawberries, and some apricots, and figs dipped in white and regular chocolate. Two of us had coffee and we were brought a dish of chocolate sticks, cinnamon sticks, whipped cream, and sugar to go with the coffee.  Service was very good during the meal.  The rose for the lady in our party certainly is a nice touch.  Now that I finally did Hugo's Cellar, I can say it was A-OK but I'm not sure that I would come back again.

thQ0aX9bUuoUwp3wZ5_oTQ.text: Had dinner there last weekend. Feb 24th. with a party of 12 and they seated us in the back room. We were having an amazing meal when an other family member popped in and we brought an extra chair over for him. Anyway long story short. The manager literally screamed at us. Let me repeat screamed at the top of his lungs that he would call security and get the fire marshal if our extra guest continued to sit there. Maybe he forgot to take his medication but he came in like lunatic out of nowhere. I didn't get this managers name because he disappeared after the confrontation but he has only been there for maybe 6-7 years unlike the rest of the staff that have been there for decades. Anyway this guy is a total jackass and shouldn't be in any type of management position. He's lucky he left or they would have needed security. I'm 49 and I've been going there with parents since I was a kid and always had an amazing experience. I should note our waiter and sommelier we're fantastic as always but I will never ever step foot in that restaurant again after the way we we're disrespected. That also includes every member of my family. Vegas has many great stake houses in a lot nicer hotels.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Oux2vJNBZzkHaRt1i9PbAw.text: This place would be great at $30-40 a person...but at $75-95 a person it is not worth it. Saw a lot of reviews about how good the service was...this was not our experience. Service was slow from the beginning of the meal till the end. Had to flag down a waiter to refill my ice tea only to be told they were out of glasses...really? Place was only 2/3rds full. What do they do on a busy night? Had to get someone for my wife's refill a few minutes later. Table side salad was a nice touch but it wasnt that great a salad...her pepper ranch was so bland it added no flavor to salad. My vinaigrette was so strong it over powered my salad. The steaks were good...not great. She asked for her filet medium rare and it came out very rare. I ordered my ribeye rare and it was cooked fine but it was just ok. No seared crust, or any real stand out flavor. After our meal was done it took 30 minutes to get the check. Made several attempts to get waiters attention before finally getting it. Again for $180.00 I want to leave happy and we didn't.

4aSbI6E7mctJ1wECgW5jrw.text: My husband and I really enjoyed Hugo's. The food was delicious and the service was top notch.  The raspberry martini was so good and you get a lot for the money. The rose was a nice touch!

xOi1EUeLHugF-XVwaQCmcw.text: Went to Hugo's last night for our 15 th wedding anniversary. Service was absolutely amazing as was the food. I wasn't disappointed at all. The lobster bisque was creamy and full lobster pieces. The lamb chops melted in my mouth like butter. Absolutely delicious. Will definitely go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yuEVmvqNI5HopYn__2WQzg.text: Celebrated my Mom's b-day here on a Thursday night. This was on her list of places to try in Vegas so we figured we'd head to "old town" for an "old skool" dinner. It was busy.... And almost every table was sat.  The Ambiance: Dark colors, Low ceilings, Low lighting Mostly tables, I think they do this to maximize occupancy Would have been better (IMO) if they had big cushy booths along the walls to give it more of an intimate, private type feeling The tables are so close together we might as well be having dinner with the people next to us since we ended up having a conversation with them about entrees and desserts Several times I was bumped by guests passing or by the salad cart... Seriously... if you're going to have salad and dessert carts... make sure there's adequate room in between ALL the tables and chairs so as not to disturb your patrons.   Loud.... Don't try to have a quiet conversation because you won't hear the person next to you.    The Food: Overall.... Very Good, but there's lots of places in Vegas to go for Very Good and Excellent meals, so food alone is not a good reason to go back here. Now if you are staying on / near Fremont street... Yes, this is a very good steakhouse.  The Bread to start... ok...nothing super extraordinary.  The butter served with it was in a flower shape which was nice but it was rock hard.  The Salad...included with your entree order ... made to order, table side.... It's fun to get to pick what goes in your salad and watch it get made right at your table...  You can choose your dressing and if you pick Caesar you can have an anchovy in your salad diced up.  I opted for the orange walnut vinaigrette which was tasty but other than that... it was just a salad.    The Palate Cleanser... included with your entree order..... ours was a lemon sorbet served in a mini ice cream cone.  Very refreshing and fun.  Personally... I like mine served in a long stemmed glass of sparkling wine ... it's classier than an ice cream cone but then I'm a princess and I know it.  The Steaks... prepared perfectly to order and juicy.  The Sides ... included with your entree order.... meh.  Mine came with red potatoes and mixed veggies.... The red potatoes were dry and crumbly...  The mixed veggies were something that looked like and tasted like it was from frozen Green Giant mixed veggies.  My mom opted for the mashed potatoes and they were gummy.  The Bananas Foster... AMAZING!  This is the reason to come here.  In fact, if this restaurant were closer to Henderson, we'd go here just for this as often as we could.  It is sinfully rich and decadent.  (Of course, you have to like bananas and rum.) This dessert is HUGE.  Big enough for 4 people to share.  The preparer (Victor?) was a showman and talkative so he was fun... be prepared for lots of flame and lots of fun when you order this.  The B-day cake.... They provided a chocolate b-day cake for Mom, and it was rich dark chocolate...  tasty and a very nicely presented.  The Dessert... included in the meal... YES, included not extra.... chocolate covered strawberries and white chocolate dipped figs and a side of whip cream to dip.  So.. you don't really need to order dessert.  The Service: Very Polite The Red Rose for each female is a sweet gesture. They have a lot of people seeing to "your" needs. There's so much activity in the room with the salad and dessert carts and bread and water attendant and the other patrons coming and going ... that again... it's not a quiet dinner but it is entertaining.  The Price: Pricey but not ridiculous particularly for the amount of food we ordered... and we all took home "doggy bags". For 4 people where 2 of us split a half bottle of wine and 2 opted for non-alcoholic beverages... the total with tax and gratuity was about $85/pp.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Dessert Plate
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Foster table side

CZ-vg7xSVEntinMdAP1srQ.text: Picture yourself transported to 1969 Vegas... the hosts and servers wear 3-piece suits with roses in their buttonholes, the somellier has a silver tasting spoon around his neck. Women are greeted with a long-stemmed rose. You're completely transported, until you look around and see the patrons are wearing short sleeved button ups with cargo shorts, the women swearing loudly about how far they can spit.   The service was very friendly, if a little slow. Gives you plenty of time to sit and relax to enjoy your meal, this is definitely a meal you don't want to rush.   The escargot was buttery, fluffy, and so deliciously rich. Be careful, they're hot!  The beef wellington was good, but a little dry. We ordered it medium rare, came out completely medium. In the future I would probably go with one of the signature cuts of steak instead.  Duckling flambe - it's always fun to order things that are flambeed table-side! Was very moist and delicious, would definitely recommend this dish.   Lemon sorbet served in tiny sugar cones as palate cleansers between apps & mains.  Complementary chocolate-dipped strawberries / dried apricots / figs to close out the meal.  Was not expecting much, was pleasantly surprised, and would definitely come back!

M7oIBXlxG0VDRh-HFMtkLw.text: OMG This place is awesome. From the moment you walk in the door you're treated like royalty. The atmosphere is great the food is to die for. This establishment proves the old saying that you get what you pay for. Although it was a little pricey it was worth every penny. If there was six stars I would give it six stars. Great job to the employees and management team of Hugo's Cellar

tBgT3H8uyNVQPYdiFmum4A.text: Hugo's was recommended to me by a friend and the menu looked good so I made our reservation.   This restaurant is located in the 4 Queens hotel/casino in the downtown section of Las Vegas on Fremont Street. You have to walk through the casino to get to the restaurant. Apparently the ventilation system at 4 Queens is awful because by the time I got downstairs to the restaurant I reeked of cigarette smoke.  Upon entering each woman is given a rose(very nice). The atmosphere is nice, brick walls and an "underground" feel. We were seated and our waiter came by for a drink order. They made a customized salad at the table which was very good. For dinner I ordered a NY Strip Steak - medium rare. What I got was practically raw and was very fatty. I would have sent it back but our waiter was no where to be seen. After we'd finished, a different waiter came by to ask us if we needed anything...then someone else bought our chocolate dessert . For the price ($55.00 for steak) Hugo's was not worth it. I get it that handing out the roses is a thing but maybe it's better to do away with the roses and focus on service and food prep.  There are many great steakhouses in LV...I won't return to Hugo's.

nEyBqYDGoOhBsJmcrnAHOw.text: Hugo's Cellar is still the premier downtown classic dining den where continental cuisine is served, and table-side service is the norm rather than the exception.  Ladies still receive a long-stemmed rose, a palate cleanser is offered just before entrees are served, and complimentary chocolate-covered fruits are bestowed in abundance at meal's end.  All I missed was French Onion Soup Gratinee.  Alas, it is not served here.  To begin at the beginning, my party of four enjoyed Cheese-Toasted Lavosh and Sourdough Rolls with rosettes of butter, before some of us shared a very good Shrimp Cocktail.  But only 3 shrimps were presented for $16, along with a nice traditional Cocktail Sauce and a Thousand Island type dressing.  These were followed by an excellent complex salad prepared with a choice of Caesar, Peppercorn, or Honey Raspberry Orange Walnut Vinaigrette Dressing.  I recommend the latter, which was light, flavorful, and interesting with its different fruity notes.  A diner has 20 ingredients from which to pick, including Romaine lettuce, pine nuts, hearts of palm, tomatoes, Parmesan Cheese, shrimp, mushrooms, croutons, anchovies, bell pepper, red onions, and egg.     An Intermezzo of Lemon Sorbet was a refreshing change of pace before we launched into our entrees.  I had an excellent, perfectly cooked medium-rare Fillet Atlantis, which is similar to Filet Oscar, but here the Filet Mignon is surrounded by Crab Claws.  Except the claws were ice cold on arrival.  An offer to flash heat my entree was accepted, and it yielded beneficial results.  On return the crab meat was hot, and the smooth Bearnaise Sauce tasted great.  Mixed vegetables on the plate, including cooked tomatoes, were good, and Boiled Parsley Red Potatoes and mushrooms were very good.  But, based on the little crab provided, I didn't feel it was really worth the additional cost.  While it is not necessary to purchase a dessert, a pyramid of Caramel Chocolate Mousse with sweet Whipped Cream was really luscious.  But it resulted in a few Chocolate-Covered Figs and Strawberries being left behind on their plate.  It is fairly dark inside (It is a cellar, after all!), and the ambiance is romantic.  Service was formal, attentive, and professional.  Food is pricey, but the cost of entrees is discounted 20% for each diner who is age 55 or over and presents a Four Queens Club 55 player's card.  Thus, a Fillet Atlantis that is normally sold for $60.00 is reduced to $48.00 for young seniors.  4-1/2 stars overall, and still very much downtown Vegas's diamond in the rough!

bZZfOunzr8uWhlRUDKnNDg.text: Very old school feel. Romantic and dark. It's hidden inside of the Four Queens Casino. Once I walked in I felt like a queen receiving a red rose. They have a full bar which is nice. The food is very well the price. Loved the honey walnut dressing for the salad, which you customize. I had the Queens lobster. Such a luscious meal. Potatoes were to die for! Gave my momma a run for her money. Sean one of our waiters was so hilarious and made it an even Moore memorable experience. I'm still full almost 5 hours later. Would definitely come back again!

xbn3kYWBgEw6WLEWu1xj5A.text: I split a meal with my girlfriend because we going to attend the Cher concert later and didn't want carry around leftovers. We had the stuffed shrimp. It was so good. It made me want to try more of their food. Got a surprise birthday lava cake and it was amazing.

GNNqNZ_Uys_NkrwElN7qVQ.text: We had such a great meal, we had tried the following steaks: filet and ribeye.  Someone in our party got the combo grilled for their entree which was excellent. We also tried the crab cakes and mushrooms for an appetizer.  The table side salad was good as well.   We will definitely be back and recommend if you are looking for an old school steakhouse style.

daICx6MyJ7dCpSt0l3lH0A.text: We decided to listen to the other reviews and head downtown for our 15th anniversary dinner. We were not disappointed. What a wonderful hidden gem that defines the classic steakhouse. An intimate setting with impeccable service. The red rose given to every woman is a nice touch as well. My husbands steak was cooked perfectly and the table side salad made to order was delicious. Definitely try the house dressing. So many personal touches I can't begin to list them all. Just go!

aitc1m_q9Vi_RmZnzQ6pnw.text: I have to give this amazing steakhouse 5 stars. I decided to take my boyfriend out for dinner to celebrate his birthday & we chose this place which has been in Vegas for 37 years (!) located in the Four Queens casino downtown.   Upon being seated, the host gives every female a single, long-stem perfect red rose which you can place in an individual case on your table.   We ordered the Hugo's Hot Rock Specialty for Two ($36) as an appetizer in which the server brings out a 500 degree sizzling slab of granite. He then cooks chicken, filet, ahi, and shrimp on it & leaves it on your table. It was delicious.   For the main courses, we ordered the Filet de Boeuf- Atlantis ($65) and the rack of lamb ($56).   The Atlantis is a gigantic, thick filet wrapped in bacon & served over lump crab meat with bearnaise sauce. It comes with sauteed mushrooms, mashed potatoes, green & white asparagus (there's white asparagus??) and two crab claws.   The rack of lamb is marinated in olive oil, garlic & Rosemary & served with an Indonesian style sauce.   The filet was tender & delicious. I ordered mine with a bleu cheese crust ($3) which I try to get whenever I eat steak. The lamb was also very good.   All entrees come with bread, table-side salads (try the honey-orange-walnut vinaigrette!) which is the best salad I've ever had, and a sorbet to cleanse your palette before the main course. You also get chocolate dipped strawberries with house-made whipped cream, white chocolate dipped baby figs, and chocolate dipped dried apricots.   Service was good, and for the price, you get a lot of food. We'll definitely be coming back here.

kX5taT1qokQnBstd9CfhIQ.text: Hugo's is an Excellent place to take your wife, significant other or even a business partner to dinner. They prepare your salad for you in front of you and give Roses to the women upon entry! It was viewed as a 4.5 but I give it a 5 for everyone's service and kindness. Food was excellent in my opinion! I had the Cellar cut prime rib and it was huge. Could not finish it.

d-od1hxEIkAnBgrwB6Xo4A.text: My wife and I enjoyed another well spent night at Hugo's. It's an old school fine dining experience that used to be much more prominent in Las Vegas. Unfortunately you have to walk through all the drunken riff raff just to enjoy the restaurant.  Service is some of the most professional, courteous, and attentive group you will find. We never had a need or wait at any point, but weren't hovered over. The house sommelier picked a perfect wine for us and didn't try to sell us on the high side.  In terms of the food, everything was cooked to perfection and timed just right. We never felt rushed or waiting too long for the next course.  For the price, it's on par or a little bit less than other fine steak houses around town.  My only negative is the dress code. Even though my wife and I focused on ourselves it's hard to miss abundance of cargo shorts and t-shirts. Please enforce a dress code!!!

Ho3GJ0at9VyT-yGop3Bc8g.text: I brought the boyfriend here for his birthday last night. I am so happy I did! Upon entering, a lady will receive a rose - so old school, I loved it. I gave it to the man friend since it was his bday tho haha the ambiance is nice and really romantic, still can't believe this is located inside the four queens!  I was kind of sick, and the waiter kept bringing out hot water for me for my tea, very thoughtful. My boyfriend had ordered a McCallan 12 year on the rocks and when they brought out the glass, it was FULL! Like when you order a water or soda type of full loll   We ordered the seafood platter for two as an appetizer. It came with Alaskan king crab, poached lobster medallions, and jumbo shrimp. They bring out two sauces and the yellow one was more delish imho. After this, they brought over a table side salad bar and the waiter makes it for you right then and there. We had a guy named Victor and he was very entertaining. After all this, we were brought raspberry sorbets to help cleanse our pallets. I had gotten the 16 ounce ribeye and the boyfriend got the 16 ounce new York strip. They both melt in your mouth. They also bring out complementary dessert- chocolate covered strawberries, figs, and apricots. All good! They had also made a little chocolate cake with birthday balloons written in chocolate for my boo. There was a candle and everything haha  I would definitely come back here again no doubt about it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter rose!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rose
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Then seafood platter for two

X5zb-SpxuDElJJrIwUG1SA.text: Hugo's Cellar is located in old Vegas in a Hotel named Four Queens. Once you enter the hotel casino you walk towards the back right and walk down a set of stairs to an old tavern feel restaurant. If you are with a lady, she will receive a rose. An excellent wine list with a table side salad selection. High-end prices with a slightly above average meals.

KBvjnymKMqgCWky_BvDgOQ.text: I liked the nostalgic, old timey feel of this place. Rat Packers ate there. The service was perfect. They give you lots of food. They make excellent martinis and negronis...old time boozy drinks. The steak was cooked very nicely, the lobster maybe a little less so. You get tons of sauces to put on your steak...bernaise, hollandaise, bordelaise. I had flambe'd cherries jubilee for dessert...haven't had that in decades. Their other dessert is bananas foster which we didn't try. You get tableside salad. One price includes a lot of food. It's a nostalgic steakhouse to try on Fremont Street...book ahead, it gets full.

YqiWpaiJJQjkT1zY2dZ4mQ.text: We wanted steak and since we were going to be in Fremont St we looked for a convenient spot in the area. I would highly recommend making a reservation as it is not a huge place and it is pretty popular. The setting is exactly as the name implies-a cellar. So it was very dark but the ambiance was cool. As for dress code, it says business casual but we were in jeans and there were a lot of people dressed casually; that being said, some guests looked pretty snazzy. Women are given long stemmed roses upon arrival; super nice touch. Was the meal the best I've ever had? I would say "no". But it was pretty good. What makes this place great is the service. All of the people we interacted with were super nice; jovial but professional. No stuffiness whatsoever. Timing was impeccable which to me is pretty important. The table side salad was pretty delicious I must say.  Toppings include: hard boiled eggs, tomatoes, red onion, artichoke/hearts of palm blend, baby shrimp, anchovies, pine nuts, Parmesan, blue cheese and croutons. Steaks are served with a mushroom ragout and a grilled tomato. I had the garlic mash (I'm not a mashed potato fan and would have preferred baked) and the veggies were a squash medley (delish). For dessert I wanted the Bananas Foster which is prepared for two. I was the only one who wanted it and it was my birthday so they only charged us half. I truly appreciated that gesture. Drinks were strong! No drink menu but they have a full bar so they can make just about anything. With tax and tip we paid about $90/person which included drinks. I would come back for sure.

9nvUVY20hlOcKE6M8RIlHg.text: When I asked my craps dealer where he takes HIS wife for an anniversary dinner in Las Vegas, he didn't hesitate to suggest Hugo's Cellar!  After our dinner experience last night, I can see why!      Incredible service; from the salad prepared at table-side to the help with the wine list by our sommelier made the evening special.      The seafood was extraordinary!  The seafood sampler appetizer we shared had large beautiful shrimp, plump lobster medallions and king crab leg meat that was very fresh and tasty.  My wife had the sea bass entree and loved it!  But the best was my prime rib steak.  Hands down, the BEST prime rib I've ever had - perfectly cooked, tasty and almost fork-tender! Outstanding!      The after dinner sweet of chocolate-dipped strawberries, apricots and figs served with homemade whipped cream for dipping was the perfect way to end a perfect meal!        Next time we are in Las Vegas, we will make time to come here again for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The made to order salad prepared at table-side was a highlight of the evening!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After dinner, they brought us this chocolate-dipped fruit with fresh whipped cream to the table...wonderful!

5PIBGYJ8bPXEG7ffzQjq9A.text: Really great service and the food is always lovely. Quite a gem. I've gone for several work dinners and everyone always has a great time.

MJ9JM2dF3futzd-pGc8Egg.text: This place is very over rated. I can't believe how in the Hell this is 5 Star establishment. For starters they allow patrons w jeans which is no big deal but I've seen people there for dinner tank tops and t shirts and shorts and of course flip flops. Ok great not the biggest of deals. But when I order a $60 NY steak medium rare plus and it comes out rarer than rare well  not too happy . To make matters worse the waiter was non chill ant about it. " ok will get the chef to put it back on the grill for you " no apologies and no big deal from the waiter. Well there u go HUGO's here's ur one STAR review. No big deal .

yyoQsNwZTnTOVKaJqg29sw.text: A touch of old Vegas. Tuxedo dressed staff, a rose for every woman, table side salad and an awesome martini, what more could you want? It is a bit pricy but for downtown or the strip it's priced accordingly. Just wish other patrons would dress accordingly.

nT4Mggk_AdZhQYPhETwbLQ.text: We had a party of 4 it was my mother in laws 60th birthday. Honestly this was the best dining experience I've ever had! No words! Come here for sure

SJNa2E8bgPHOwAy7dp_3ww.text: I've been to Hugo's Cellar many times. It's a fantastic place to take friends and family for a special night. That is why I was so surprised at the experience I had on my last visit.  It all started with making my reservation. I had called and a woman named Claire answered. I had asked for an 8:15 reservation and was told they only had reservations for 8 or 8:30. I quickly asked the person going with me what time they would prefer and on the other end of the phone heard Claire say "come on!" in an irritated, impatient voice under her breath. I thought it was inappropriate and poor customer service on her part. Instead of saying anything I quickly took the 8:30 reservation and hung up. I was extremely disappointed and let down by what had happened because Hugo's is a place I love to go and I have suggested it to others many times. In spite of all of that we went to our 8:30 reservation as planned.  Once we got there and we're seated not long after an alarm started going off and continued to go off thru the entire meal. I understand that there is nothing they could do about it but not one manager stopped by the table to explain what was going on. Not even our server offered any information. At the end of our dinner he came out with a free dessert but still said nothing about the alarms. It was as if there were no alarms!   Hugo's Cellar is a fine dining restaurant and is not cheap.  For three of us our bill was almost $200 and if I recall correctly there was only one alcoholic beverage on the bill.  I don't  mind paying a premium price but I do expect quality customer service in return and I was very upset about the customer service my guests and I received that night. I will give them another shot because I really do love the atmosphere, the food is great and I understand that things happen and people make mistakes. I just hope they don't drop the ball and my faith is restored in Hugo's Cellar on my next visit.

rF7cfky5oB-cqKvi3bbFmQ.text: We go to Hugo's every time we go to Vegas! This is a must go place! The food is always amazing, as is the service. You will not be sorry if you go to Hugo's, you will be planning your next trip so you can go again. Go to Hugo's!! I am telling you to GO TO HUGOS! :)

qvT63VwZvzo5DXVvbeYxjQ.text: (sigh) hugo, will you be my valentine?  hugo, will you be my boyfriend? hugo, will you marry me? if i had a man like hugo, without a doubt, i will marry him and live happily ever after.   hugo is just lovely and just perfect for me. lovely atmosphere 5-star, attentive, prompt service resonable price-not too cheap not too crazily fancy  large portion  humongous wine menu   hugo's table-side salad--just the way i like it... a lot of red onions,  some tomatoes, some mushrooms, some toasted pine nuts, some bay shrimps and some anchovies with mix of creamy peper and hone-walnut vinaigrette hugo's hot rock specialty-this rocked my world. chilean sea bass with sauce nantua (flaky crab meat with shrimp sauce)-WOW...flaky flavorful taste  i have so many great things to tell you about my hugo, but you'll just have to go and meet hugo for yourself. i hate sharing but sharing is caring...enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chocolate volcano cake
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. steak
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. halibut

4G4kTv340C5EsfADQ9yQWQ.text: This classic Vegas restaurant in the cellar of Four Queens is one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  The table side salad, steaks and wine service/selection are unbeatable.  Also, although it is expensive, it's a great value when compared to some of the newer more flashy/trendy restaurants.  You definitely don't want to miss the table side salad which is the best salad ever.  I don't think you'll find better steaks anywhere.  I usually get the 10 oz. fillet, but last night I got it wrapped in bacon served on top of crap meat...spectacular.  The table and wine service are definitely 5 stars and so is the food.  If your staying on the strip, it is worth the trip downtown to eat at Hugo's Cellar.

9GYbItSRah2Z1fravr5nqA.text: Dine at Hugo's Cellar only if you are looking for the QUINTESSENTIAL Las Vegas experience!

QlM1o7rJdKiwVWd_ijuqCA.text: I' m sorry to say that I was very disappointed in the food, atmosphere and service. This was recommended by multiple people for where my husband and I to go for our anniversary. First thing is that the host was very nice n the rose was beautiful. But this point on in the evening was not so beautiful. We sat at our table for 10min before anyone came over to us. Most places ask if we have ever eaten there n introduce or give suggestions - none was done. Both of our servers had no personality at all. When we ordered I know you get to choose your sides and server just walked away before I could say. My husband n I both ordered filet n shrimp. We ordered our filets medium. I know meat shrinks but this came out half the size of a card deck and the 3 shrimp were very small. The whole plate was covered in this sauce/ gravy. We had the crab cakes that were decent. Bananas foster for dessert- it was so so;( I know the restaurant is old in a casino but if you don't like the constant smell of cigarette smoke like me, you will not enjoy smelling it while you eat . Our main meals was not worth $58 each...We had one app to share n dessert . No wine or alcohol... Our bill was $200. If the food was great or service was great I wouldn't mind the price but Neither was good that we would ever come back or suggest this place to anyone!

q_groNTv2OmgJ2yS_vBAQQ.text: The name of this place makes no apologies: Hugo's Cellar in a word (or 2) is a complete representation of '70s fern bar mentality. This is old school Vegas, baby, and don't forget it. Hugo's is situated within the bowels of the Four Queens casino, located smack dab in the middle of the Fremont Street "Experience." The Four Queens is a retro-New Orleans style place. No need for pirate ships, mock Parisian towers and the like - gambling is the focus here with good food (at Hugo's) an added benefit.   Once you make your way past the slots, check-in area, and cashier, you walk down a set of stairs to Hugo's. It is a throwback to another time - red brick walls, large hair on the hostesses, and lots of flambe-food prepared tableside. I arrived an HOUR early (my fault - I'd driven in from Utah and didn't set my watch back an hour) and had to wait at the small bar area. The bartender brought me a portion of pate which was nice. I finally sat down for dinner which was very good - but not great.   Good things about Hugo's Cellar: - Retro Vegas subterranean fern bar decor; - Good wine cellar with selection of half bottles; - Delicious Filet and Shrimp aux Poivre; - Hugo's Tableside Salad - you get to pick the stuff! - Cheese Lavosh! (kosher?)  Bad things about Hugo's Cellar: - Need a guide with GPS to find the place in the hotel; - Elderly hostesses seem a bit 'uncaring;' - Side dishes bland; - Service efficient but impersonal; - Valet parking pretty slow.  I'd go back to Hugo's Cellar if I wanted a 'break' from the mega-restaurants on the Strip that are named after famous chefs (who rarely, if ever, cook in their kitchens). I'm glad I found Hugo's on Chowhound - I think it is normally 'locals only'. Worth checking out. Major yang decor with low fu design. Wear a tux with ruffled baby blue shirt to feel 'connected' to ghosts past in this place. Check it out. 4 stars.

LZEj9zDZ-094pDNDHt9PgA.text: It is a nice place to take a date, the ambiance is good and they give females a rose.   Simply put, I didn't like my steak.  My date had the filet.  She said it  was good.  i had the ribeye and thought it sucked.  If I liked my steak I woulda given it 4+ stars...

OvsseorhqvaMnZKE4DdQ-Q.text: This was our 10th time visiting Hugo's. As every time before, both the service and the food were top notch.

BGxJPK80E2EweDr2f7sDug.text: A friend recommended Hugo's Cellar and since I was staying at the Four Queens Hotel anyway, decided to try it.  Well worth the experience. It's miles apart from the noisy, packed casino floor.  It's more like the old school top notch Vegas restaurant, not a chain, outstanding steaks, service and ambiance.  I was not dressed in a suit, but was not treated any differently because of it.  The salad table-side was wonderful, and my steak and shrimp combination outstanding. The whole experience was one I recommend. Too many of the Vegas restaurants are chains, over priced and cater to well-heeled tourists. I would imagine that this hidden gem has been here for years and will be here for years to come.  Don't let the low budget tourists on Fremont Street deter you.

XNBX1HxUeUPTc1Hv-Sqrnw.text: Came here last night with a few of my coworkers. Was suggested to go here by a Vegas local. He said it was one of his favorite restaurants in the Freemont St area.   I don't see it. I ordered the duck which was good, but nothing spectacular. I wonder if I was supposed to order the steak here?? No clue. The tableside salad thing was kind of cool, I like how they mix it right in front of you. Extra stuff always gets me excited. :)  The free dessert is always a plus as well.   As for the service... WAY grouchy! Everyone that worked there just looked absolutely miserable. Maybe I should have given them my free rose. Cause they needed a bit of cheering up! :) :)

oqjsx9MENU1kQBFEwZu69g.text: We have been going to Hugo's almost every year for the past 15 years.  The food is always good and the service is beyond words!  Victor is a SUPERSTAR and Oscar and Jaimie are exceptional.  This place has that old Vegas feel which nothing on the strip can top.  Could you find more innovative food in town?  Perhaps, but nothing will compare to the overall service and atmosphere of Hugo's.  I am just lucky that I live here now and can go more than once a year.

U4CU_Cuecctvobz96GxOfA.text: I had my first visit to Hugo's Cellar this past weekend and throughly enjoyed it. My bf and I went with another couple who had previously dined here before on several occasions. As we entered, both Karen and I received a long stemmed red rose which I found hilarious for some reason.  My dirty martini was pretty damn good and so was the bacon wrapped filet mignon served on crab legs along with garlic mashed potatoes. Oh yes, I almost forgot, the table side salad. Our salad maker, I think was named Kenny? made a great salad and I had every damn topping short of onions that he offered.   The only thing we missed out on was dessert but time was an issue. I'd definitely recommend going here for the "old-school" steak experience, especially with good friends who can appreciate the vibe...

e2HpfHnBzJlWVwhLGJKeYw.text: Best meal in Vegas I've ever had! Huge delicious portions (I thoroughly enjoyed my filet). Salad made at the table. Free rose to all the ladies (bonus!). And some delicious desserts, to boot! Also, there is a great wine selection, nay, AWESOME wine selection.  Having to go through the decidedly lower-rent Four Queens to get there is interesting, but Hugo's Cellar really is a slice of heaven in Downtown Vegas.   Come for a romantic and delicious dinner, stay for a yard of margaritas and the light show outside afterward.

uBG_dT4KzEuVgHfkGoHI4w.text: Fantastic food, awesome service, and they treated us like royalty!  From the rose for my wife to lovely chocolate-covered fruits for dessert everything was decadent!  I'm so glad we had our anniversary dinner here instead of one of the glitzier places on the Strip.  It was great to see a piece of "Old Vegas" during our stay.

fWp72y6afnZC0Lc6MPcSow.text: Good quality steak dinner with excellent waiter "theatre" service. Not sure about the sommelier from Yorkshire, England. Had a strange attitude towards the diners.   We had our salad prepared at the table, you get to choose the ingredients. Try the Filet with prawns if you struggle with 16oz steaks. Good night out for a group. Look forward to going back one day.

owJItvGYt9eVIX-bdTB3Gg.text: I love this place! My husband and I have been eating here for years. We often take company here for a very entertaining and enjoyable evening. The ambiance is amazing...think old school Vegas with dimly lit tables in a cozy nook. The sommelier is a comedian in his own right and gives the best wine suggestions! The food is amazing! The tableside salad is amazing. I've had their rack of lamb, the halibut, the steak au poivre and the lobster tails and have never been disappointed! The bananas foster is a real treat for dessert too! If you like a nice romantic dining experience, this is your place!

7o_kcBfNuGBvHRqFBAfhuQ.text: We dined at Hugo's Cellar to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday.  We had a great meal...the absolute highlight of which was the salad service.  I believe the waiter's name was Victor (?) and he MADE the evening.  Asking each person what salad ingredients they wanted in a fun, group participation way made the meal so much fun.  The atmosphere was great, the all inclusive meal was good...but it was that waiter serving our party of 9 that made this memorable and the reason we will go back.

s6c-mw_wVhZBbEXrppbqoQ.text: This was an outstanding dinner and I am happy to write this review.  The place was packed and we didn't have a reservation.  The wonderful host slipped us in anyway.  What a romantic, elegant old-school dinner house.  For starters every lady guest is given a rose when they seat  your party.   We ordered crab cakes that were excellent.  For entrees we  ordered fillet Mignon, and stuffed chicken.   The dinner salads are made for you at the table.  You can choose from, artichokes,pine nuts, tomatoes, mushrooms, shrimp,cheese, croutons, etc.... just wonderful.  I must mention their orange honey walnut vinaigrette.  This was the best dressing for a salad that I have ever tasted.  Wonderful.  Now back to the entrees.   My husband had the best melt in your mouth fillet he has ever ate.  He was blown away by how perfect his steak was.  Our chicken was delicious as well.  Nice and tender with an awesome sauce.  We were so stuffed from our meals that we didn't order any extra dessert.  They bring a complimentary dessert to your table.  Chocolate covered strawberries and apricots and I believe dates.  This was a wonderful ending to an unforgettable meal. We all agreed that this was the best attentive service that we have had in ages. We did not want or wait for a thing.  If you are in downtown Vegas and near the Four Queens hotel and casino and want a delicious meal I would highly recommend Hugos.  I wish I could give more stars.

ZOXL6n3t1cCw5L00rpZD9w.text: Following a tip from the bartender at Social House, we decided to get our steakhouse fix in here at the restaurant at the Four Queens.  An aside:  downtown Las Vegas is a lot more fun than I remembered it being.  The people are friendlier, the games less expensive and it's a great way to balance out the chaos of being on the Strip.  The service at the Cellar:  fantastic.  They check up on you frequently if you look confused or just looking for a waiter.  The sommelier led us to a tasty selection.  The atmosphere:  cozy and friendly.  Matt mentioned that it was like being at a great wedding reception.  There's enough privacy between each table, but everyone was close enough to see each other as well.  The food:  great.  The main courses start off with a salad made right at the table.  You get to choose all the ingredients you want as it's made.  I never enjoyed a salad as much as this one.  The steaks were tasty and come with a variety of sauces and topping.  The value:  like most if not all things in downtown Las Vegas, the value is excellent.  We expected to pay much more for this dining experience.

qpZGOUkik-BCvTdLvSK0nw.text: If you're ever in Vegas, and looking for a great meal, excellent customer service and isn't afraid to spend good money for it, this is the place to be!  We celebrated a friend's 25th birthday over the weekend with a party of 11.  From the beginning to the end, the experience was wonderful.  Each female who walked by hostess was handed a long stem rose (very nice gesture).  We were then seated right away and menu was introduced.  Each meal came with a salad which they make fresh at the table.  A cute mini sorbet cone was given to everyone to clean our pallets.  Next came our main course, and boy was it a lot of food!  My friend and I shared the scallops and the 16 ounce prime rib and could not finish our plates!  The scallops were seared to perfection and the prime rib was cooked as ordered.  By the time the chocolate covered figs and strawberries came in time for dessert, I was so full but I tried one anyways because they looked so good!    You must try this place it least ONCE in your lifetime.
