bkkhmHZeeM4mUl8gv8sqvQ.text: The only reason that I gave them 2 stars is because of the service. If this review was based on the food quality it would be a single star. I have been going to Hugo's for 30 years and by far this was the worst food I ever had there. This food was way over priced for the quality. 2nd Street Grill at the Fremont across the street has a better quality steak dinner for 50% less. I was so dissatisfied with this visit. I know the new owners also own some bars in town: if they are trying to bring "bar quality" food to Hugo's, it's a big mistake. Sorry to say I will never go back to Hugo's.

m0aWPHHsSkP581LSDwiG4A.text: Ahhh Hugo's. While I hadn't been here in at least 5 years......not a thing has changed. And thankfully so. Old school charm and service. Great food, great service, great drinks. Nice.

zb0ybvrh9mrjoPf8lTYUOg.text: After searching and searching for the perfect restaurant for a group of 11 to celebrate my birthday, I hoped that I had finally found it when I read the reviews for Hugo's Cellar on Yelp.  If you have ever planned a a group dinner, then you probably know what I'm talking about.  The restaurant couldn't be too expensive, it had to serve a variety of food, it couldn't be too far, it couldn't be the same ol' thing, etc etc.  Hugo's was everything that I had hoped it would be.  It was PERFECT.  All the other reviewers were right on the mark when they said that Hugo's is the epitome of old school Vegas.  It was definitely a nice break from the strip.  When we arrived our table wasn't ready yet, but we had no problem passing the time by taking advantage of the low minimums on the roulette tables near by.  Within a matter of minutes, the hostess let us know that they were ready to seat us.  The long stemmed roses given to all the lady's was definitely a nice touch. (To be honest, this is one of the big reasons Hugo's topped my list of where I wanted to eat for my birthday. After all, I am a hopeless romantic at heart and I love it when I receive roses, whether its from a boyfriend or a friend or even a restaurant).   Our waiters (I believe we had 3), were all fantastic.  Our main waiter was hilarious, he had us cracking up the entire night and at the same time, he was extremely attentive, helpful and knowledgeable.  He also noticed that my friend was a little sick and so he had the bartender whip up a special drink that gets rid of that scratchy feeling in your throat. And miracles of miracles, it worked! Now, that's what I call service!  As previous reviews have indicated, a salad, a lemon sorbet to cleanse your palette, and some chocolate covered fruit are all included in your entree price. In my opinion, you really don't need to order an appetizer as the portions are all extremely generous so its already a good amount of food.     The salad in the beginning was great.  A waiter comes around with a salad cart and you tell him what you would like in your salad. It was wonderful to be able to customize your own salad without feeling picky for not wanting this or that.    For the entrees, Hugo's has a ton of variety so that there's pretty much something for everyone on the menu, there's chicken, duck, fish, crab, lobster, etc etc.  For the entree, I took a chance on the chilean sea bass ($36) even though I knew that Hugo's is mainly known for their meat.  The sea bass was FANTASTIC.  Every bite was cooked to perfection and it was extremely moist and flavorful. Just thinking about it makes my mouth water.  My boyfriend got the 16 oz. prime rib ($38) and that was melt in your mouth AMAZING.  Our friend got the 24 oz. prime rib ($49) and that slab of meat was gigantic, It was a treat just watching him trying to finish that thing.  Because we had 11 people and mostly everyone ordered different things, we got a pretty good taste of the entrees that Hugo's offers.  While everything tasted great, the standouts of the night were definitely the prime rib and the sea bass.    By this point, we were so full after the entree that we almost groaned when they brought out the chocolate covered fruits.  They served us two platters of chocolate covered strawberries, figs, and apricots.  All of these were delish.       The prices aren't what you would define as cheap, but you're in Vegas so that has to be expected.  Plus, for the quantity of the food, quality of the food, the service, the atmosphere, it was definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Customized Salad
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Covered Fruit Platter
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Christmas decorations by the bar area

tojVnMfEM7WFDIbRxL115w.text: IMHO, this is about as good as it gets for steak in Vegas.  The only thing Hugo's Cellar is missing is a view of the Vegas Strip, but let's face it, that''s not why I'm here.  It is for the calm atmosphere, the elite service, and the food!    I've dined here twice in three years.  The first time impressed me and made me want to come back.  The second time (last week) made me list Hugo's as my favorite restaurant for a great salad and meat entree.  Both my wife and I agree that the made-to-order-at-your-table salad was absolutely  the best salad we've ever had!  I liked how they brought my cocktail (a gibson) in a small carafe - and it must have been a double - because the extra is stored in a dish of crushed ice on the table  so it doesn't get warm or watered down.  Now that's something very few places do for you.  A classy touch that's worth bonus points.  Other Yelpers have validated that the food - from the bread basket to the chocolate-dipped fruit - is expertly prepared, presented, and tasty, so I won't go into that.  But I would like to compliment the staff.  We had a team of three servers waiting on us, and they were smooth, efficient, attentive, professional and warm.  Combined with the quiet atmosphere, subdued lighting, and luxurious cellar ambience, this is a place that will not disappoint if you're weary of the hustle and noise of the Strip.  To add frosting to the cake, you get a discount on one entree at Hugo's if you have a player's club card from the Four Queens Casino upstairs.  Free validated parking at Four Queens as well!  What more could you ask for on a great dining experience?

yYrZYYMEq7FuzrTszOpIGA.text: This is my favorite steak house in Vegas. Food is amazing! The filet mignon is so tender and flavorful. The service is great, especially the ladies getting a rose at the front when you come in. Very classy place.

av9lykHVVQjDP4TS5bhmoA.text: I went back and forth on a couple of places to have my birthday dinner at, but I am so glad that we decided on Hugo's Cellar. Hugo's is located in the Four Queens down in Old Vegas. As mentioned before, all women receive a long-stemmed red rose, they even have a vase at the table for you to put it in while you are dining. The maitre d' looked alot like the actor Michael Caine, perhaps a distant cousin??. He was very sweet and welcoming though.   I ordered a steak and the other half ordered duck, that ended up being flambeed tableside. I loved the salads that were made tableside too. I was beginning to feel bad for the guy that went around making each tables salads. He probably felt like a robot. Tomatoes?, anchovies?, shrimp?, blue cheese,? choice of dressing? Our server was wonderful. All of the food was absolutely delicious and cooked to perfection. All meals come with chocolate dipped fruit and whipped cream, as well. The whipped cream was superb and decadently homemade. They even offer a regular dessert menu, but we didn't get to that because we were simply stuffed.   The only regret I had was that I was not able to bring my rose home on the airplane with me, for fear it wouldn't survive the journey/get crushed. I took pictures of it though.

4X28RLWDjLXQALLO6i5dXg.text: By far, the best downtown spot in Vegas!! I will drive 30 minutes to make it to the four queens any day of the week to eat here. A couple of hints to make your Hugo's Celler experience the best... 1. Go a bit early and have a drink at the bar, its old school and you can really get a sense of the place by watching the room and the waiters and the cocktails being made. Martini's are huge and served a fun way. 2. Order the salad cart, it is the most fabulous way to start a meal there. 3. If you drink Iced tea, get it. Its AMAZING I know, iced tea but trust me 4. Wonder around the hotel after and play a little craps or the slots, you will feel like its 1975 if you let it....

Yo9uXvF4D2-xsdvalndOtg.text: I have been to Hugo's four times. This is one of the best secrets in Las Vegas just wish it was on the main strip. If you ever wanted 5 star service this is the place. I have only had a couple issues with food but for the most part they are aces in my book. I love the table side salad preparation but be sure to stay away from the pine nuts. Love the roses and chocolates. Be sure to make a reservation and always come here on a winning night.

Ou025pw2Tz6FyNZ1Q5TlSg.text: This a very nice restaurant in downtown. I had dinner the day after dinning at Eiffel restaurant. It does not have a view but has everything else you may look in a nice restaurant. It feels very intimate and dinner was delicious. The cocktails are probably the best I had in Vegas and Dean the bartender is awesome. We met a couple at the bar that has been coming to this place for the past 6 years or so. That tells you a lot about a place. Do yourself a big favor and visit this restaurant, may be your best dinner in Las Vegas.

R9lcq0cU_2XvE2oj4WwhnA.text: This was one of my best all-time eating experiences ever!  Flashback 24-hours earlier where my hubby and I spent way too much $$$ at a snooty Strip restaurant (Table 10?) that charged you for every side, had three waiters constantly hard-selling you and served very mediocre food. Screw those guys.  Flash forward to our next night's meal at Hugo's: a classy (70s Vegas classy), pampered evening where we ate the best food of our lives.  Ladies get a rose at the door, the youngest waitstaff have been there for 10 years (some of the guys have been there for 20). You get warmed hand towels, sorbet to cleanse your palette, salads are served up at your table...and the meat--oh the meat--is some of the best I've ever had in my life. I've heard they have an amazing wine selection as well, but we chose to go with some of their martinis which were to die for and plentiful. Sure it's $14 a martini, but they give you a carafe with the extra from the shaker so really you're getting 3 drinks for that price.  Located in the cellar of the Four Queens Hotel on Fremont Street this place screams Old-school Vegas. I was channeling Sharon Stone in Casino the whole time.   No nickle-and-dime---you pay heartily, but you get a lot. It's worth every penny for the ambiance alone. Love it!

jdAXbLocy0STDDxEpDT3LA.text: We were a party of seven people 4 females and 3 males and when we entered Hugo's right away we were greeted by Dean (the best bartender in Vegas). We all enjoyed not only the great drinks but the comedic stylings of Dean....hilarious!!!! Once we were seated, which did not take much time at all, we were greeted by a team, yes, a team of servers that were there for our entire evening. From the warm delicious bread to start, I knew we were in for a culinary treat. Next were the salads, hand prepared by one of the servers, and made to your own specific order, the salads were wonderful. Then we were treated to a raspberry sorbet to cleanse our palates before our main courses were brought to out table. All I can say is the main courses which included Filet Mignon and Crab was over the top AMAZING!!!! Then the final treat was two platters filled with chocolate dipped strawberries, figs, and sliced apricots. WHAT AN EXPERIENCE !!!!!! Great place to dine!!!!

xm-IbHznGbRrx6cr5Bunhw.text: This place is amazing. Excellent food, incredible service, and a great atmosphere.   I was actually worried when we walked into the cheesy hotel that this restaurant is located in, but all fears were tossed out the window when a red rose was given to every woman in our group. They bring the salad cart over to the table so that they can make it right in front of you. Raspberry sorbet is served between dishes to cleanse the palate.   This restaurant is in a class of it's own.

LoN-SouXP2Ko3WOh5nKrCg.text: This is our anniversary/special occasion restaurant.  It is always a great meal with great service.  Their steaks are delish and the salad that comes with the meal is something I would put on my list of things to eat if I was going to the electric chair.  The meals include salad and sweets (choc dipped fruits and some delish and I'm quite sure the most fattening whipped cream ever) so save some cashola and don't order any apps.  You will be quite full the time the dessert tray comes out.  Our dinners usually range from $120 (no wine) - 200 (with wine) for the 2 of us.  It's fantastic every time....well almost....  This visit was not as good as our other visits because of a bunch of goobers in the back room (we were seated right next to it) being very loud and obnoxious - since when do birthdays excuse you from having manners? The food and service were great despite the mannerless cretins.      If you go, request a booth in the front part of the restaurant.  It  is almost a completely different experience - much more quiet and romantic.    There isn't a dress code per se but there is a sign that says no tank tops, shorts or flip flops.  Well, obvs they don't enforce it cuz the BF and I both had flip flops on and I had a tank on.  There were folks in there in shorts and crap that they just pulled out of the hamper so it doesn't look like they enforce the rules.  PS: The gals get a rose upon entry which you can give to one of the many hobos or unsupervised little kids outside on the FSE.

oMHSMm9tjV5wl5llblpPXw.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas... Superb service, food, amazing drinks and vino selection.. Oh, then there is the rose... Always a special treat. Classic old school Vegas.. Perfect.

QoD4LJUU8szdGG8DaxS2jA.text: Our dinner here was THE HIGHLIGHT OF OUR TRIP to Vegas.  You won't be treated with this kind of sincere, genuine kindness and class anywhere else!  Don't let the old casino's cheesy facade and dated interior fool you, this place is top notch.  The ambiance is completely different once you go down the stairs to Hugo's.  They even give ladies a perfect, long-stemmed red rose upon entering the restaurant.  I felt like a queen when I dined here.  Everyone was so nice and friendly and welcoming - the employees, the other customers, EVERYONE.  It was like something straight out of a movie.  Excellent.  Classic.  Amazing service.  Old-school charm.  Some of the best food I have ever had anywhere in the US or abroad.  I had the filet and shrimp aux poivre: the steak was tender, the sauce delightful, the shrimp and steak both perfectly cooked.  The table side salad service was a show in itself - the guy who does it (can't remember his name) was born and raised in Las Vegas and has a wealth of knowledge about its history and funny personal anecdotes to tell if you are the kind of customers who want to hear that stuff (we were!).  It is worth going just to chat with him about old Vegas, Elvis, and the Rat Pack.  The meal and the experience were well worth the price - unlike other places in Vegas the price of your meal includes sides, bread, salad, and dessert (a plate of chocolate dipped strawberries, apricots, and a few other goodies).  You can order a dessert off of the menu, they looked delicious, but we were so full and so satisfied by the complimentary fruit that there was no need.  Drinks were very reasonably priced for a restaurant of this caliber.  The take away: If you have only one splurge dinner in your budget while you are in Vegas, skip the strip and come here.  Seriously, you won't be disappointed.  They've been in business this long for a good reason.

BNL-uYWlEv4R2C3oKG_cLw.text: We love the atmosphere at Hugo's. 5 stars for atmosphere but based on the last 2 times here the food does not rate as high. Table side salad is great, lobster bisque excellent. But the steak my wife had was not great.  I had a seafood trio consisting of shrimp, sea bass and crab cake. Just ok. If I can convince my wife Richella I will try again sometime. Love the place for the atmosphere and service!

1ejcGpWBw37OWD-eIZI_-Q.text: Love love love this place! I never come to Las Vegas without coming here! It's old a school vegas steakhouse with top notch service! Atmosphere is amazing and very old school Vegas vibe.  The food is fantastic and the steaks are some of the best I've ever had! 5 stars all around!

F49Xbw5UmZbQQuitJXUXqw.text: What can I say other than still one of the most authentic old school white glove service restaurants still around in this modern sometimes over the top city. Service and hospitality is by far a solid 10+ and the food is without question the best quality I've had in a long time. Small and intimate dining and just as fantastic as I remembered when I went over 20 years ago.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Seafood Trio

jtigqibMTIKF2DtFBJmZHg.text: Great food and excellent friendly service!!! We all 4 enjoyed our meals from start to finish.

cBkSQyfyrpCAFT4qOsj9kA.text: I was very disappointed in Hugo's Cellar. I was excited to come here as I'd heard great things and I love old Vegas restaurants. We had a bad experience with our food however. I ordered the filet mignon medium rare with a lobster tail and the filet was well done and the lobster tail was cooked to the point that it was rubbery. We were seeing a show so we didn't have time to send it back. We also ordered coffee after dinner and told them we were in a rush but despite telling us it would only take ten minutes or took over twenty and we ended up having to rush to our show. The appetizers were nothing that impressed me either; we did the hot rock, the table-side salad, and a seafood starter. Finished with a dessert and the Kona coffee. I was not impressed with my experience at all!

54kp43L7g80oWXyKAKS8RA.text: We had been to this restaurant before and loved it. This second time was just as good until a couple of hours later when my girl friend suffered a serious case of food poisoning, Let me just add that she was so sick that she could not move.  The following day, as a courtesy, she called the restaurant to advise them of what occurred and what she had eaten so that they could check out the food she ate. She did not ask for anything nor did she want anything. A manager, named john answered the phone and NEVER said that they were sorry, but only said they he would refer it to "risk management."  Two weeks later a man named John Navitidad, called my girl friend. It is not necessary to go into a long dissertation on his attitude but the man can only be described as an old complete jerk, since he stated that he has been doing this for forty years. He as much as accused my girl friend of making up the story. She tried to explain to this hostile man that she wanted nothing but to inform the restaurant so that they could check out what she ate but he kept referring to "her claim."  So I would say to future diners, be aware. Obviously they have a defensive attitude about these things that may suggest there are many more complaints.   Visited July 2016

nQ1Xs2UbJ0wL_Do89Lx_1w.text: Hugo's  cellar totally screams old school vegas with lots of class. You can picture yourself in the company of the rat pack here. It's downstairs inside the 4 queens casino. The waiting area of the restaurant is very personal and looks like a living room.   Upon sitting down you are surrounded  by brick walls and nice art. If you are with a lady she will receive  a rose which will be put on a vase during your meal. All the waitors  are older gentlemen in suits/tux's and most of them had accents that scream old school.   We started off with salads which they make in front of you. It's a real winner. The spinach artichoke  dip was very creamy and delicious. We had the filet and ribeye steaks cooked to our liking and included garlic mashed potatoes. All were amazing! They sometimes throw in free ice cream which is a nice plus.  If you want to try a high end place without the vegas flash (more vegas class) then this is the place for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of the nice and intimate restaurant  atmosphere
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad bar brought to your table
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad made to my liking

3eaWLx42AtTQfDx41VSTrg.text: Great steakhouse with better service.  If you are looking for a one of a kind experience in Las Vegas, this is the place.  Big steaks, big drinks and experienced waiters in tuxedos.

huPU1WMeUHe1kgLo6tTY6A.text: We really enjoyed this restaurant.  There are so many overpriced and over-rated restaurants in Vegas now, it's refreshing to find an old school quality steakhouse.  But be prepared, this means everything about the restaurant has not been changed in a long time.  If you are into trendy decor and hip atmosphere (I'd recommend STK @ Cosmopolitan) this is definitely not the restaurant for you.  For me, I loved how everything is done the traditional way.   Food was great, service was great, price was great.  Love love love.  Can't wait to go back.

agGDamoxr5MnPDIQov7cng.text: How can i give 100 stars? This restaurant was a dream! The staff is awesome and very friendly. I was treated like royality here. First the reservation was extremely easy online. When we showed up we were seated immediately and i was presented with a long stemmed red rose. The waiter was kind and very punctual. The salad that is made individually and table side was awesome. I have a lettuce intolerance so he was happy to give me toppings of my choice. I had the beef wellington and it is exceptional!! I love this place!! I just wish i lived closer. I highly recommend a quiet dinner here!!

76LqV2CRQNBavxeSXUrkUA.text: Worth the $200+ for my husband and I. We aren't big in splurging for dinner (the most we do is AYCE sushi) but since this was a special occasion - our 3 year wedding anniversary we thought why not. Service was great, I loved the long stem Rose it's small gestures like that that make me want to come back. I also liked the old vegas feel it had when you walked in the room and of course the food was finger licking good! Definitely will be back for more anniversaries to come!

StCmRI3BskbYeuKLWAG_Wg.text: My first trip here. 2/22/17. This place is great.  David our waiter is amongst the best in Vegas.  The whole staff was great.  I don't drink much wine but the wine sommelier's knowledge and presentation was so well done I had to try his recommendation and loved it.      The salad preparation on the cart next to the table was a nice nice touch and all ingredients tasted very fresh.       I highly recommend the "Hot Rock" for the appetizer.  It does say "for two" on there but we actually shared it 5 ways but we knew we were going to eat a large meal.  It is quite a bit of food for an appetizer.       The main course was amazing.  I had the 24oz Prime Rib.  I have had a lot of prime around the world and this ranks in the top 5. My only thing I prefer is fresh horseradish verses the creamy styled on my prime but that was not a choice I was told by one of the staff so I did not even use the creamy style given to me.  Not a complaint but a preference.  I think a place like this would offer both.     We did not opt for the deserts presented as we were so full but the presentation and the servers description makes me want to not eat as much and try one next time.  Then they bring a complementary assortment of chocolate covered fruits.  As full as we were we could not resist.  The white chocolate covered dates were amazing.    A rose for the ladies was a nice touch as well.      Our table of 5 did not have a reservation till 9:00 pm.  I was a little concerned as sometimes places tend to be a little lax or rushing to closing time in later night service.  This place had the most top not service I have ever seen.  I have been in the service industry for 29 years and kinda watch/pay attention an be a bit critical of staff.  I would not find anything whatsoever that this outstanding staff did.  I wish I remembered everyones name to compliment every individual one.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My 24oz Prime Rib.  excellent

tVjq0-nOLMpa3ZvaTZinPA.text: The service & ambiance was impeccable.  The steaks - not so much.  For a $50 steak I expect pretty close to perfection.  Unfortunately, my steak was pretty tough.  I wouldn't go back.

d41nUpOGVXlMvD8Fl5765g.text: My wife and I dined at Hugo's Cellar on a Saturday night. I made my reservation the Friday morning before through the Open Table phone app.   We came down the stairway entry to Hugo's to see a dimly lit and beautifully set up lounge area. We approached the host to let him know we had reservations at 9pm, it was only 7pm, but we were hungry and figured what would it hurt to ask.   The host let us know that he would get a table for us right away, it would just be about 15 and we could sit at the bar and have a drink while we waited, so we did.   Just as we finished our Jameson and Ginger Ales, the host came over to let us know our table was ready whenever we'd like to sit down. We followed him over to the host area, were he handed my wife a month stemmed red rose (that all ladies are offered).   (In an effort to avoid tl;dr, I'll cut small details.)  Our waiter, Dave, explained in detail everything that we would receive with our meal then gave us a minute to decide. Some fresh bread arrived, Dave returned and we chose. I went with the 16oz slow roasted prime rib and my wife chose the filet and shrimp prawns.   Our table side salad service arrived, I went with their signature vinaigrette and my wife, the Caesar. The vinaigrette was absolutely wonderful, wasn't expecting to enjoy it as much as I did. An orange sweet twist that went very well with the fixings I chose for the salad (which was pretty much everything). My wife's Caesar was good, but not great. Nothing to complain about, have just had much better is all.   Our sorbets came next in order to clean our pallet before dinner. We got another round of drinks, finished our sorbets and relaxed while waiting for our entrees.   When our meals arrived they looked beautiful, prime rib was a perfect reddish pink for my medium rare and my wife's filet and shrimp was much larger then we expected.   One tip, get the garlic mashed potatoes as my red potatoes were nothing special and I need to salt them.   Hugo's was amazing, beautiful, intimate restaurant with a wonderful buzz. Service was incredible and on its game. Food was also wonderful.   I would have given Hugo's Cellar 5 stars but here's why I didn't; my wife and I both had to season our meats. I expected the prime to be so amazing I wouldn't need to reach for the salt, unfortunately I did. Prime rib was definitely not seasoned properly as it came out without much flavor. After some salt and pepper it was incredible.   Overall Hugo's Cellar is an excellent steakhouse experience without the added price of ala-carte. With definitely return and recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 ounce Prime Rib.

ELszj7_kWNyGU9efYbUpUg.text: I was recently at Hugo's to celebrate my birthday. It was my third visit to the restaurant and each time I leave full, satisfied and impressed. I explain this restaurant to friends as "a proper restaurant experience." The staff are professional, knowledgeable, attentive and the food is amazing. This is one of the few places where I can order a Sidecar without being asked what it is - and its perfect each and every time! Hugo's Cellar is my favorite restaurant and I cant wait to return!!!

Kzg8tjw4p-HYWbKOfPJNeA.text: I am going to try and make this as short as I can  because I have a lot to say on this restaurant I come to Las Vegas every year for my birthday and I visit the Fremont experienceas  well because the Strip is so pricey.The one downfall is wine! I love Chardonnay so I t sneak down there and get a glass and sit in their little bar but I noticed how darn busy they are and I always would forget to plan to reserve a table.So this year I remembered and we got a early 5:30 time.We walk in you are immediately greeted by the host.You are sat at your table and given a  rose(very nice touch) They hand you menus and you are greeted with water and a waiter.He introduces himself but I notice the busser is a tiny bit nervous.I notice these things because I own a small cafe in Pismo Beach.He gets a drink order and our friends order a cappuccino martini which was surprisingly good.I was a bit surprised they did not have nightly specials.Order is put in and one of the highlights of our night was their salad presentation.Its a presentation I have never seen in my lifetime.A guys comes personally with his cart and his salad bar filled with every topping anyone could ever ask for and takes our order for each salad.We sit there in complete awe.You could of only served that at this point and we would of been happy.So as I said previously that busser who looks nervous misses out on the fact I am dehydrated and I have finished  my water.The waiter comes over and fills it quickly but there is a exchange of looks to him( the nervous busser) that says " This is you job!" He does not have to say a word.I feel for this young man but being new is tough in this situation because you have to learn and this waiter is teaching him.I wish I could  have more space to share my whole story but its already going long.They know their stuff.They have a very loyal following.Our meals were tops notch,the dessert was delicious! One last note.I stack my plates and this waiter goes to the busser yet again and says "When they are stacking their plates that is your cue to remove them.I run a cafe a small one and you have to train your crew the way you want your place run.You can not take shortcuts and I as well demand a lot.This place is a gem.Its is worth every cent and you are genuinely spoiled.I wish our busser luck.Hang in there! All my Best,Penny(Penny's All American cafe)

bkp7WKVQHJAySq_HN_MOqg.text: The  BEST Servers you will ever have and a Gorgeous "Old Vegas" Atmosphere - BUT the steaks were AWFUL!  No flavor at all.  They tasted like they had been microwaved instead of grilled.  Hard to even cut they were so bad.  None of us could eat them.  Beautiful presentations and the salad before dinner is custom made for each person.  A nice touch.  We have enjoyed Hugo's Cellar for 40 years but we won't be returning because the food was so bad.

rl8_A6TW3c2Nn3poaH5ahg.text: Absolutely amazing food! The atmosphere was cozy and warm. Enjoyed the 5 course meal and the steak was perfect!

IgbdE7Kl7cryR50Jbv6U0Q.text: I've been to this restaurant twice now and would come back every time I visit Vegas if I could. I love the romantics you dime setting with low hanging ceilings and old Italian feel. Makes me think I'm back in times of speakeasies and mobsters.   All women get roses upon entering. All restaurant should do this. All of them.   I'll admit that this place is somewhat pricey considering it's located in a somewhat ghetto casino on Fremont St., but none the less, it makes a memorable impression.   Every meal comes with a salad that is created for you from an Ingredient cart allowing you to make the salad you want. With ingredients you want to eat. I will say that they have a $25 sharing fee. Slightly obnoxious, but I have a feel people do it more than one would think.   All in all, the food is amazing. The atmosphere is unmatched in Vegas and the service is very attentive. Check this one out if you can!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EKLQMTaQQz96NibjBULxOA.text: We loved Hugo's the first time we went nearly 10 years ago. Everything is still good, it's just that we can find better places for less money now.  March 14, 2016 = Party of 5. I order what I always get, Filet de Boeuf - Atlantis, which is a bacon-wrapped filet served with lump crab and bearnaise sauce. Steak was cooked perfectly & bacon was tasty. I was a little disappointed with the sauce. I got crab meat but not much sauce so everything was dry because of that.  One thing I can't say anything bad about is their salad. It's made to order & you get tons of choices. I absolutely love it every time.   If you've never been, I feel like it should be on a list to do. But we've gone multiple times now so the luster has rubbed off.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King Crab Legs
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry sorbet palate cleanser
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet de Bouef - Atlantis...bacon wrapped filet with crab meat and bearnaise sauce.

Hc8xe2hyg25cd_YKicyAeQ.text: This was my fifth and final visit to Hugo's Cellar.  ...Not sure what's happened, but there were more negatives than positives this time.   Our table of four ordered: two rib-eyes, veal Marsala, tournedos (filets)  I'll start with the good: - The filet was great. - The wines selected with the help of the sommelier were fantastic. - The salad cart was good, as usual, though I think I'm over it.  The bad: - The ribeyes were unremarkable, bordering on unappealing. - The veal marsala was a little chewy, with unremarkable taste. - We waited a L O N G time for the check.  Two of the things that kept me, and my friends, coming back here trip after trip (tasty food and  great service,) just didn't happen this time. The great location and old-school Vegas ambience aren't enough to carry this joint.  Every other visit over the past 10+ years was at least four stars. I wonder if this experience was a fluke, or if it was indicative of something more permanent.

lvccMWItZEriMzOwUrbLfg.text: Been wanting to try Hugo's Cellar for years after hearing good things about this place. I'm not a fan of Downtown, so it's very rare that I'll even be in the area. But, we decided to come here for a special occasion - my birthday. The restaurant has a cool, old school Vegas atmosphere and women are greeted with a red rose. It was pretty crowded on a Friday night. From what I could see, most of the tables were full and it was really loud. Service was good, but not excellent. For the most part, the servers were friendly and attentive with removing plates from the table. But they were slow with refilling our waters.  We started with the bread basket, which was nothing exciting. The bread didn't taste too good and although the heart shaped crackers were cute, they were just plain old crackers. Ordered the Spinach Artichoke Dip appetizer and it was sooooo good!! Creamy, full of flavor and delicious! The bread that it came with was warm and had the right amount of softness. I was afraid that I wouldn't like it because of the shallots, which is a type of onion from my understanding. But they either didn't bother me or melted away. This was the best Spinach Artichoke Dip that I have had and the best part of the meal! The table-side salad was good, but they went a little too heavy with the dressing. I appreciate that we got to choose our toppings instead of them just mixing everything together.   Ordered the Filet Mignon for the main course. Yep, I always get the same cut but sometimes you just stick with what you like. For the price, I expected the steak to be much better. It was cooked to my liking and juicy, but not very tasty. Also not a fan of using any steak sauce. My husband felt the same about his Prime Rib. The complimentary chocolate dipped fruit after the meal was nice since I do like chocolate covered strawberries. Wish there were more strawberries or apricots in place of the figs though. They also brought a Chocolate Lava cake for my birthday. Can't remember much about it, but we did eat it all. We also wanted to see their dessert selection and probably would have ordered something, but our server didn't even bother to ask. I guess he assumed that we were fine with the complimentary cake. Oh well, their loss.  It was a good experience and I'm glad that I finally got to try this restaurant, but it's not somewhere that I would dine at again. The hotel is run down and the elevator in the parking garage is scary. Awesome Spinach Artichoke Dip though!!

HfG8W5NlIyDZBYUcfeqYQg.text: Very disappointed. Went there with my mom and sister. Wasn't busy. Our waiter used a fake accent, we also had two other waiters who reassured our food was coming. We didn't order any drinks and it took 2 hours just to get our meal once we ordered.  We were there a total of 3 hours and when our food came we got to go boxes right away. They gave us a complimentary desert... or so we thought. Bill was high, they charged us for cocktails that we never ordered and it took them about 20 min to figure out how to take them off the bill. Exhausting experience.

Y37sj-Wj8oGdNIfTSkYg8g.text: Absolutely incredible experience I just wish it wasn't so far away. A great place for a romantic dinner. The staff was amazing for the almost two hours we spent there. The table side salad was great and a great wine selection to start. My wife had the filet stuffed with crab and I had beef wellington both were cooked perfect and melted in your mouth. The complementary deserts were a nice touch. I researched many of the steak houses in Vegas and I'm glad we picked this one.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberrys, apricots, and dates.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complementary anniversary desert
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet stuffed with crab

0peVsUzCcOzrt659kaymwg.text: I have grown up with Hugo's Cellars. My first time here was with my high school boyfriend for the prom. I was all impressed when I walked in and they gave me a red rose. Next time was with my parents and then my husband took me while we were dating. This would be my fourth visit.  I was craving a return visit for some reason, maybe because my Dad used to enjoy this place so much and now he has passed on. Anyway, it had been many years since I had been so off we went.   Upon arrival, I was glad to see that they still had the tradition of giving all the women in the party roses. So classy! We were then sat in the main dining room at a small, intimate table for four. If you have never been, the restaurant is dimly light for romance and ambiance. The ceiling is low and I adore the brick on the walls. Our server Oscar had all our roses placed in a vase so we had our own floral centerpiece. The sommelier approached the table and provided his wine recommendation. We then placed our orders. I had ordered a bowl of Lobster Bisque which was really creamy and featured some nice chunks of lobster. I absolutely devoured this bisque. Eric approached our table shortly after this and was ready to personalize our choice of salad from the salad cart. He asked each one of us what ingredients we wanted in our salads. There were many choices such as anchovies, mushrooms, tomatoes, hardboiled eggs, pine nuts, toasted croutons and a choice of dressings. I was disappointed with this cart.  When I think of a salad, I envision, carrots, cucumbers, radishes, garbanzo beans in other words veggies!   Once the salads were finished, we were all brought a small cone of raspberry sorbet to cleanse our palates. This is special touch where I feel Hugo's stands out. Along with the outstanding service that is truly hard to beat.   Onto our entree's. I had ordered the filet and shrimp. My steak was cooked just as I had asked, but was really just ok. I felt the green peppercorn sauce was a little overbearing and took away from the taste of my dinner. My husband had ordered the prime rib and found it tasty but really heavy. My daughter being a non red meat eater,  had the vegetarian plate which was a spinach ravioli and garlic mashed potatoes (odd combo) with a pesto sauce. I saw her take a couple bites but never finished it.   Oscar was kind enough to bring us the dessert tray with chocolate strawberries, apricots and creampuffs. Other than that, no one ordered dessert.  I am not sure why this dinner was just A OK but it was. Maybe it's because we don't eat very much red meat anymore, or maybe we are just over old school steakhouses living in Las Vegas so long and there are so many dining choices. Or maybe Hugo's was just having an off night.  If you have never experienced this kind of dining, than you should try it at least once. For the downtown area, this is a long time favorite and although pricey this place will have you stepping back in time to when steakhouses were where it's at!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert with creme puffs, chocolate dipped apricots and strawberries
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet/Shrimp, veggies, garlic mash potatoes

m9xMrV-HR2rSOokn-WqCtg.text: I'm giving Hugo's five stars because it feels like you just have to give it five stars.  But I'm doing it reluctantly.  Dine here and you are sure to think, at least once or twice, "Wow, that's a nice touch."  The signature "nice touches" include a lovely red rose presented to female guests at the door, the salad prepared table-side followed by a sorbet palate cleanser, and the mini dessert tray with chocolate covered strawberries - all included with your meal.  The room is high end, and the staff is impeccably attentive.  So what's not to like?  Well, I'm glad you asked.  I'll tell you what's not to like, but this is just me - I prefer a restaurant where I can choose my own courses.  Sure, Hugo's has appetizers on the menu and a dessert tray, but the fact that every entree already comes with salad and dessert doesn't leave much room for anything else, unless you are a competitive eater.  For a first course, I usually prefer a soup or hot appetizer rather than a salad.  And frankly, the salad wasn't all that great.  (Yeah, the table-side preparation is a bit of a show, but really - it's not Cirque or anything.)  In an effort to mix it up a bit I did order the cheese plate to follow the entree, and the cheese plate wasn't all that great either.    So, let's talk entrees.  I ordered the Petite Surf & Turn (filet and shrimp).  My wife ordered the sea bass.  Both dishes were perfectly acceptable high end restaurant fare, but neither left us craving a return trip to Hugo's.  Entrees come with potatoes, and we both asked for the au gratin potatoes (extra charge).  Alas, our waiter returned to inform us that they didn't have the au gratin potatoes.  (What does that mean, anyway?  They ran out?  Is there a potato shortage in Vegas?)  So we had the mashed potatoes and, again, emphatically, not all that great.  Not even very good.  At all.  Hugo's is pricey, but because you really don't need more than just the entree the overall tab is not that bad.  Drinks are generous and not overpriced.  I guess they also validate parking, but I forgot to ask.  So the bottom line is that if you like Hugo's all-inclusive approach to dining, you will like Hugo's.  If (like me) you prefer to go your own way with an a la carte menu, you might not put Hugo's at the top of your list.

Gx1R60bcLMawYcDK1BsRcQ.text: Been coming here for years and have always loved it. The highlight of the meal is the table side  salad cart which is individually made for you with the ingredients of your choice.   The ambiance is super romantic which is perfect for special occasions as they are a bit pricey but worth every penny.   A must try for any foodie!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dLJ4SN-xwcZZ4oK1FWlU4g.text: After hearing so much about this place we decided to return with friends who go every year! This year they agreed and apologized for talking it up so much. It was terrible! I also found it interesting before I posted my review how many bad reviews they have had over the last month or two. Something has had to have changed. Our friends raved about this and it was so disgusting and disappointing for a 400.00 Tab! We didn't even have alcohol so goes to show how pricey their meals are and for the meals to be so bad that's not right.

zjXvJDS6YFDu1hwx2QoWIw.text: Quiet, dark, romantic. No sleeveless shirts (glad I brought a sweater), and the ladies get a long stemmed rose upon entering. Very nice and professional service, an the food was fantastic. We went there specifically because we wanted to celebrate our anniversary in a place I'd never been to. It would have been movie-perfect, dripping with gaggy romance ....HOWEVER... the waiter decided to have a long chat (returning 3 more times for several minutes each time) on the awesomeness of very particular cars. Such as Acuras and other fast and (from the boastful sounds of it) expensive cars. I don't care. I just wanted quiet romance. This waiter stood less than 3 feet from us, stood and spoke on a booming voice THE WHOLE TIME. I couldn't wait to leave.

L3q9PqUDFdURFfpsoVXa5A.text: My girlfriend and I went here as it got great reviews. I will tell y'all this... there are a lot better restaurants for the price in the greater Las Vegas area. The food was sub par. Atmosphere was cool, but trust me, if your looking for a great steak with all the fixings, there are a plethora of other selections.

z8Xa2And9Xs0PszQJ2Ya0Q.text: "You're taking me on a romantic date, and the only planning I'm doing is buying a cute new dress." It was my birthday weekend and I wanted a great meal at a nice place next to my favorite person.         He immediately made reservations at Hugo's cellar. And I'm so glad he did. It's intimate and old vegas. The service is UNMATCHED. David and Michael were our servers and they were phenomenal. That place operates like a well oiled machine. The food was delicious, you practically had to roll me out of there. We had the duck, and a New York strip, table side salad, and shrimp cocktail. Everything was thought out, even to the cloth wrapped lemons to keep the seeds from getting in your food. Their drinks are perfect and the atmosphere is perfect for a date.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The perfect ending to a wonderful birthday weekend.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They even make sure all the ladies get a rose.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved the atmosphere. Can&#39;t wait to do it again.

WCuwy-8JCc_5fuh-TRC8vQ.text: Hands down the BEST dining experience I have ever had. I've lived in Las Vegas for 17 years and just now made my way to Hugo's. It was a surprise dinner and it didn't disappoint. Warm welcome with a rose for the ladies. Every table is s great spot. The menu is simple and not overwhelming with too many options. The seafood appetizer for amazing and could be a great main. Next course is the famous salad with 10 options for toppings and 3 dresses. Mini lemon sorbet cones to cleanse your pallet. I had the classic prime rib with asparagus. My date devoured his filet mignon. The included dessert tray of chocolate covered strawberries, dates and apricots. This is just a sampler but you have the option for an additional option of desserts. But I was too full. And in addition to the food the service was IMPECCABLE! We never went without anything, always had full drinks, and timing was perfect every step of the way. Save this for a special occasion or just a surprise night out for a classic Vegas experience. You won't be disappointed.

qQR8GCq5H3UXqRi17Qf5vw.text: I really wanted to love this place. From the first moment you walk in you feel as though you have been transported in time. It gives you that old school feel that so many of us look for when finding a new interesting restaurant. The host was super nice and welcoming and I was handed a rose before being escorted to my table, such a nice touch. Our server was nice enough not exactly super friendly but not rude either just kind of there. All of this would be fine except for the food.   Each entree comes with a salad, option for potatoes or rice, and chocolate covered fruits and the end. I was definitely a fan of the table side salad. Being somewhat particular I loved that you are able to pick exactly what you want included in your salad, such a great idea! I opted for the pepper ranch dressing and it was quite tasty. Once the entree came out was when the meal took a turn for the worst. My prime rib came out rare just like I ordered it which was a plus but it was quite bland and two bites in it got extremely cold. And I definitely didn't doddle eating it because I hadn't eaten all day! How did it turn so cold so quickly? I chose to get the side of red boiled potatoes and they gave me two cold potatoes with zero seasoning on them. And the side of veggies that they described so beautifully and that I was so excited for came out tasting like they had been cooked in a plastic bag, I could taste some sort of weird chemicals on them. In the end we also tried the tiramisu for dessert which was a big mistake because it came out  extremely dry and lacked flavor. One plus was that the chocolate covered desserts came out with a bowl of homemade whipped cream which is my favorite, soooo good.  But overall for the price, the food needs to be delicious and that just wasn't the case here. I would probably recommend visiting the bar for a drink so that you can experience the ambiance of the restaurant without having to ruin one of your meals in vegas.

4c90l7b880aNv2r0htdyiQ.text: Been coming here for 34 years and it never seems to Disappoint. It's my favorite place to come as a couple. The food was exceptionally good last night we had filet mignon it's delicious. The vegetables though we're not   great, soggy and the mashed potatoes could really use some help. My husband and I like to go there so that we can just sit back and talk and relax but last night it seem like it was very loud and crazy. Although we will be back again I hope they take a look at this and upgrade some of the sides

UNBP2t4_FowIRHTYCUWhaQ.text: We ate here on Tuesday evening. My recommendation is don't bother. It was the worst meal I've had in a full year.  I love upscale steak houses like 3 Forks in Austin Tx. This isn't one. It was over priced and poorly executed. My 10oz fillet def wasn't 10oz, was crispy charred on the outside, medium Well instead of Medium and tough as shoe leather. Seriously. It came with a highly hyped tableside salad that was ridiculously heavy on red onion (requested a "few" got 3/4 cup vying in volume with the sad chopped romaine), a half dozen grape tomato halves and a tablespoon of hearts of palm. Blue cheese was offered along with anchovies and fresh mushrooms. No option for dressing on the side. This salad comes with the steak but is $21 on the menu as a stand alone item with no other salad options.  Also included were 2 sauces, that were lukewarm, for the steak, 5 small fingerling potatoes, and a melange of zucchini and onions. A tiny Lemon sorbet amuse the bouchee was also provided. A Chocolate covered strawberry was the dessert for $65 filet entree. No baked potato offering only mashed or fingerlings.  Fellow diners sampled the crab cakes declaring they were all filler with very little crab at 1/$21. The NY strip was also sub par, tough, indicating a lower quality grade of meat. Good steak doesn't rely on sauces or "enhancements". The Vegetarian options was also disappointing and extremely overpriced, considering you can get house made pasta at Eataly in the $20 range. The shells could have been frozen. Be aware there is a $26 charge for splitting any plate and a $25 per person charge for cancellations of reservations. I honestly don't understand the high ratings, obviously reviewers have ever had steak in Omaha or Austin where diners know great beef. Had the quality been there, these prices would be expected. The setting is a cellar and it's dark, but not excessively. White tablecloths imply upscale service that was sadly lacking. They didn't sweep crumbs between courses and no description of the items was provided. The server reached over plates and was unable to offer suggestions when asked. Each female was presented a promotional red rose, sweet, but frankly we were there on business and had no way of enjoying it beyond dinner. We left them. One of our party asked the kitchen be informed of a shellfish allergy and was informed "you didn't order seafood". Yes but even cooking items in a pan where shellfish was cooked can trigger a reaction.  My advice is ignore the yelp reviews and ask a local where to go for a great meal. We had high hopes that getting off the strip would improve our dining experience but Hugo's didn't deliver.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $21 Hugo &#39;s Table - side Salad. Pitiful

LJXJRFZBaotNnYxfVyShsQ.text: The excitement and high expectations of Hugo's Cellar was immediately crushed upon descending the stairs into the front lobby / Host Stand. Directly in front of us on our Anniversary as we were well dressed our eyes are fixated upon the grungy shorts and flip flop wearing trio descending the stairs as well. This is supposed to be Fine Dining.  The trio even stated to the host that they had a reservation. They must have known that this is upscale.  I guess upscale is just a notch above swimming trunks.  Anyway, while we walk to the host stand ourselves I feast my eyes upon the fake electric fireplace in the lobby.  Hmmm. Old School Vegas????   You got to be kidding me????  Our host greets us and wishes us a happy anniversary.  We get seated and are met immediately for a glass of water.  I'll get to the chase here.  We were seated in the very back.  Nothing romantic or inviting about this area.  The middle part of the restaurant was a bit more romantic with some nice lighting with string lights.   Our food?   I had the 16oz. Prime Rib.  My wife the Stuffed Shrimp.  The Prime Rib was good. The meat was Prime Quality but not much actual seasoning.  The aju sauce was flavorful as well as the creamy horseradish.  My wife's shrimp was slight over cooked as the meat would not separate from the shell when the tail was squeezed.  Plus the stuffing was a bit dry.  It needed some type of sauce or even a melted garlic butter.  We were treated with an anniversary dessert plate.  That touch was nice.  Our reservation was at 6:30.  We did not leave the restaurant until 8:25. Why so long?  Our actual table service was very slow.  My glass of tea was refilled once.  Im struggling on this one.  I want to give more stars. But honestly, service was literally no better than a mediocre steakhouse.  Clothing of clientele was as if we were at Chili's. Very disappointing.  We attend many fine dining restaurants.  This one I thought we were gonna be impressed.  Disappointment is what we got mostly out of this experience.

Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U9WNik2yYzbmugjVtNI3-w.text: Some colleagues and I were in town for World of Concrete and decided to have a nice meal on our last night in town 1/24/19. Shortly after we were seated, one of the people in our party watched another patron having some sort of an emergency. The restaurant appeared to to have everything under control after about 30 minutes.   We ordered our food along with Shrimp Cocktail and a couple of other appetizers. The appetizers arrived and everyone sampled what was on the table, except me and one of my coworkers who split the Shrimp Cocktail. Dinner took a little over 3 hours and we left the restaurant around 10:00 pm. By the time I arrived back at the hotel (11:00), my stomach was queasy and by 11:30 I was sitting on the toilet.   When I arrived at our booth Friday morning, feeling like death warmed over, I learned that my coworker was ill also. I talked to all of the people in our party and learned that he and I were the only ones that ate the shrimp.   The last thing I expected out of a $94.00 meal was food poisoning.

oylLciqQdsTJEHEDRhJgPA.text: I am really not sure why there are so many high marks for this place. Service was awkward and overbearing. So many oversights for our special night out celebrating out friends' wedding. We did get a great private table that was really wonderful for our group, but things wnet downhill from the roses.  They give every lady a red rose when coming in, which may be a nice thing for some, but our friends who were getting married are men and they did not get a rose or any congratulations even though we alerted the host they were getting married. Then, the waiters served all the ladies first, again, slighting our special guests. I'm sure they just thought they were being polite with the "ladies first" thing, but it really didn't work here.  The waiter forgot to give us menus and asked what we wanted to order. We got menus and ordered and then came that ridiculous made to order salad that just doesn't work for a table for 12. Hearing the list of ingredients 12 times was super annoying and it was very time consuming. Then, the salad wasn't even good and the ranch dressing was near gross. The meal (Hugo's Chicken) was just OK, nothing special, but ok. The chocolate covered fruit at the end was the nicest part.   The cherry on top was having to walk up the stairs and onto the casino floor for the restroom, and going for the second time, having that inept host point it out and tell me it was good that it was far off because I'd need to work off my dessert.   Never again and I don't recommend this place to anyone.

AuWsLP6ChBHD2mrtQupHwg.text: I was excited to eat at this place and ordered the 24 oz prime rib to share. We barely ate it because it was so bland and on top of that without asking they charged us a $27 share charge basically without mentioning or asking about it. Won't go again and next time I got to a steak house I will get a real steak (prime rib as a roast was a poor choice on my part. Way overpriced and wish I went to another location I had in mind instead of listening to the local Lyft driver.

JCy8PJxJDHkPWZN-74SsZg.text: Best steakhouse in Vegas with an old school Vegas vibe! The Alaskan King Crab is the best around!

3Mge1SOTYBmWBhIZkHZMNA.text: Old school classy dining.  I was amazed by the staff, service and food.  This is now our favorite place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zi_C_OGR-WxggtqVbjJUTw.text: food was good and service was great.  I guess my only beef with it is that Hugo's is very "Old Vegas".  I am only 21, I am more interested in hip and trendy restaurants.  Not a sit down, 5 star time capsule.  I will come back but give me a few more years to mature like a fine wine

u2ygroUfdhVjfE2_6qzqNA.text: The service was exceptional, the food was really good, and although the prices were high the dishes came with salad, sorbet, small sides, and petit fours.  I'm off beer at the moment but they had hinted at a fairly interesting beer list.  I am a big fan, and ever-so-shocked to find this kind of quality in a downtown casino restaurant.  The rose for my lady was a nice touch!  The ceiling was low and the atmosphere felt cozy, but I didn't find the place felt too crowded or cramped.  It was packed, but not too loud.  We got lucky with the reservations on a weeknight, but I recommend making a reservation in advance for weekends.  So glad I looked on Yelp to find dinner last night! :)

7LhJnLz4NLLX-ToQpmUW8A.text: We were just in Las Vegas to celebrate our anniversary.  We google searched 5 star restaurants on the strip.  We looked at their menu's but could not find anything that we fell in love with.  We then decided to go to a restaurant that we have gone to many times in the past 25 years and never had a bad meal.  That restaurant is Hugo's Cellar at the Four Queens in downtown.  Not a downtown Las Vegas fan but the restaurant is so good we overlook were it is located.  Surprisingly nothing has changed since the first time we have been there.  We talked to the manager about this and he said the owner's philosophy is why change something if it is not broken.  The service was nothing less than outstanding and the food was delicious.  The price is very reasonable and includes a rolling salad cart to create your own salad, a small sorbet cone to cleanse your pallet, included starch, and lets not forget the chocolate covered strawberries and dried fruit.  We have to say that Hugo's is by far the best restaurant in Las Vegas.  We give Hugo's 5 stars.

k2-OjMxPHdWBx4Au6fog7A.text: We spent Valentines Day here. It was very nice. A little bit of a rough start but a strong finish.   We arrived and it took a few minutes to be seated. Understandable at it was a big night. Small line to get in.   Each meal comes with a salad, breads. and starches. For an upscale Vegas restaurant, this was a nice touch.  Some highlights (all included).  Table side salad preparation Small cone of sorbet to cleanse your pallet. Chocolate covered fruit for dessert  Our meals were good. Rib Eye and Beef Wellington. Crab cake also good especially the sauce.   I also enjoyed the white chocolate mouse cake.   Drinks were very reasonable. Sodas were $2 and mixed drinks were $7.  We commented that we thought the servers forgot about us as after we sat down no one came over for about eight minutes to greet us at table. Once they did service was fantastic.   Annoying that there was no cell service which is ok on a romantic night.  I would go back.

IZA67pEf1cTT_VBRH2JVZA.text: Now this is a Hidden Gem! Found in the 4 Queens Hotel & Casino, Downtown Vegas. Take steps down to the Underground Dungeon of a True Throw Back in Time Vegas Mob Style Dining Area.  Every Lady that steps foot in here, receives a long stem red rose.. Brownie points already! We didn't have a reservation but we were given a table in literally a minute and the place was filled. The host was a jokester, had a great sense of humor that definitely set a positive vibe and loosened things up.  2 Servers(1 Server & 1 Assistant Server, Not Busser) immediately pulled out our chairs, and greeted us with much enthusiasm! Without wasting time, they poured their own in-house bottled water into our glasses. Within seconds, our bread basket (basic dinner rolls and  lavash) was dropped off with butter that had been intricately sculpted into a rose bud!   Menu offered a wide variety and every other entree I grazed at was so appealing. But I was sold on their 21 Day Dry Aged Top Shelf Rib Eye that is char-broiled and served with mushroom ragout and bordelaise sauce.  My girl orders Hugo's Chicken - breast of chicken stuffed with a sun dried tomato pesto and roasted garlic sauce. Both dishes included sides of veggies and mashed potatoes. Not only that, the order also came with their Custom Made Salad and Dessert!!!!!   Shortly after, a gentleman with this hunky salad cart rolled over and started to toss the  salad and asked what additions I cared for, about 15 different options! I added, creamy pepper dressing, onions, tomato, egg, artichoke hearts, hearts of palm, parmesan cheese and croutons (they had anchovies and nuts too..). The lettuce, onions, extremely juicy tomato was farm picked fresh, artichoke hearts and hearts of palms added that lucious subtle flavor, egg, parmesan cheese and croutons just complemented each other wonderfully!! This disappeared in minutes..   Then one of the servers handed us over a tiny ice cream cone with a scoop of raspberry sorbet! Nice!  About 10 minutes later, the servers came over with our piping hot plates of steak and chicken. The Steak was a chunky piece of meat that had Flawless grill marks checkered throughout. Fork tender and their mushroom/bordelaise aujus makes this Steak Unrivaled by Most Other Rib Eye's I've Ever Had!  The chicken had an aroma that filled the air with garlic and sundried tomatoes. As good as it smelled, it tasted even better! The stuffing/sauce flavors were expertly balanced with the chicken. Undeniably recommended!  The included sides were small but were a satisfying amount of vegetables, mash potato and pamesan crusted tomato that were all very good.  When we were done, the servers boxed our leftovers and bagged them for carry-out.  Next came the dessert tray, with an assortment of divine looking Treats.. We passed since we had our Chocoloate Covered/Dipped Strawberries, figs and apricot with their homemade whipped cream to come to the rescue! It came swiftly on this propped up cake stand, exactly what we needed to end the night right! Semi-sweet chocolate, flavorful fruits and fluffy whipped cream equals dessert Greatness!  What an Experience! This place has Romance written all over it! Candle-lit dim dining room, Accomodating A+ Service, and Most Importantly this place doesn't Break the Bank! Just be cautious not to crack open too many bottles of Wine!!

tHgpzX36UwLprqrhyMhIvw.text: Wow. Wow. Wow. Amazing food, amazing service!!  I live in a huge foodie city and have never seen salad bar they bring to your table and make it for you. Love it! Price was on par for most good steak houses. Might be the best restaurant in Downtown.

yThGzfx2igHuzGE9dNk-zA.text: Truly a wonderful dining experience!  I come to Las Vegas two or three times a year and ALWAYA plan a super at Hugo's Cellar. The steak selection has never disappointed me either because they have always been very tender and exactly how I've ordered them. Great service and tasty food merit five stars.

dRKdXL08AvhX7NDrMfVV4Q.text: This is one of the last places downtown that I really can say is great for fine dining. Atmosphere is kind of interesting has that cave felling of old Vegas. Steak was well prepared and decently priced. Love the old style salad live prep bar.

zxpi_zoZqTvBPeHV0Ixd_A.text: I lived in Las Vegas for 11 years and have been back twice a year since I moved away five years ago but I never made it to what is purported to be Las Vegas' 'Most Romantic Restaurant.'  It is a charming and cozy restaurant that offers all ladies a single red rose, romantic lighting, tuxedoed waiters and impeccable service.  Unfortunately for us, there were several families with small children dining at the same time and the shrieks and cries were distracting and obtrusive.  Despite this fact, we did our best to enjoy ourselves.    We both agreed that the table-side salad was one of the most delicious we'd ever had.  It's a weird thing to say about a salad but it's True!  After the salad we were offered a delightful sorbet on a tiny cone to cleanse the palate.  We both enjoyed a beef entree: for me the filet mignon wrapped in bacon and served over a lump crab cake and for him a huge slab of prime rib.    The prices are very reasonable considering that salad, entree, sides and a dessert tray are included.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and look forward to returning to Hugo's again during our next trip to Las Vegas!

0E1Q_bdi0qdWZPlj9JjmDw.text: Don't want to give too much away as it is a great experience.  Let's just say this . . . .my wife and I LOVE this place.  The food is excellent as is the service.  We can't wait to go back!

WGc51Jf3yyQgq1-cqRug_w.text: I usually LOVE LOVE LOVE my meals at Hugo's Cellar...but this time my experience was dulled.  They were out of beef wellington, the item I MOST order and the rack of lamb, the item I was GOING to order in place of the Wellington.  The waiter (Eric) seemed embarrassed about the Wellington, and I would have appreciated if he had notified us of the outage upon our being seated, but what was most disconcerting was his lack of attention to us after our main dishes were served (I ordered the 10 oz. Filet, which was a bit on the rare side, but was corrected). After our dishes were served, the waiter seemed to 'disappear' and we were then attended to by the salad master, and the beverage support.  We will return, but will ask for an earlier seating...gotta have that Wellington !

iVM-1eUEqi_bUKU0s726nw.text: Forget all the hype in Vegas this is the best food for your money. A+ service and A+ food. Steaks , seafood, chicken, etc you won't be disappointed.

sOx7DwFQXFzdE_t4F0NjJQ.text: UNFORGETTABLE experience! Highly recommend. Loved this place - came all the way from Miami and impressed the heck out of my guests. No view at all but great food!

udKajVRmq1Nem60vzgI9RQ.text: DO take your dates here and DO make reservations on those special nights.  Your partner would never expect anything like this.  I'm only saying that because when i think about downtown i think about old town:  beat up and just worn down crappy area.  You'll have to walk through the casino and all, but once you hit those stairs that leads you downstairs it'll take you to a whole another level.  The ambiance is something else like you're part of the mob or crime family.  Got to love how this joint has so much character.  You get sooo much more than just the great food here.  Little things like a rose for each lady before seating, table side salad tossing, sorbet between course to cleanse the palate.  Defiantly one of the most memorable dining experience i ever partaken by far.  Wanted: A date, preferably a sugar mama.  Must have all original healthy teeth and no pointy elbows. *cha-ching!*

vB0Z3H_M1Lr6B47Y9dAhCw.text: Outstanding.  Had the New York strip and shrimp cocktail.   The dinner includes salad and dessert.   Great ambience if u like old Las Vegas. Excellent service and great half bottles of wine.

lYdoXotF8RzFDO8k-CajQg.text: man i love this joint.   the food is amazing and the ambiance very romantic. or in my case BRO-mantic as i come here annually with my high school bud. we had a blast with 6 dudes at the table. we were very loud, but it's spacious enough that it won't matter. plus it's vegas baby. don't get me wrong this is a classy joint, very upscale, but i love how we can come in here decked out in our now infamous vegas costumes complete with leisure suits and bandanas and no one blinks an eye.  do get: the BEEF WELLINGTON. my favorite thing on the menu. careful tho... if you get it too "rare" the pastry crust doesn't cook all the way through.  salad: this place makes your salad for you at your table and it's divine. my personal preference is to NOT mix in every salad ingredient as it will turn your salad into a funk salad. IXNAY on the hearts of palm (it overpowers all the other flavors). keep it simple, less is more. LOVE the  baby shrimp on the salad - goes well with cream dressing, egg and bacon.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my favorite thing on the menu: beef wellington

B0SLyODlSUWmqOOVapSvGg.text: Delicious! Blast from the past...loved the table side salad bar...sommelier was very friendly ...food was amazing ...the filet melted in my mouth...definitely not what I was expecting from the 4 queens

nVokqC42Pvu1FbwPrhwsiA.text: Ate here before with food and service being very good. But...the last time (party of 5) was served an order of escargot that wreaked of ammonia and was obviously rotten/spoiled. I told the waiter and all I was given was an apology by him. Not the manager , the Hostess (who has been there forever). Not looking for a free meal but sheesh...someone could have gotten really ill! Will never eat here again and unfortunately can't get myself to eat escargot again.

YvZcN4lDbcwLFxwb1edZhA.text: Okay, great steaks abound in Vegas. Hugos is a dining experience, not just dinner. Waiters in Tux's, salad made tableside to your order, and incredible steak and service. My Beef Wellington was so tender I could cut it with a fork. Oh and a la carte is how other places serve it up...you get all your sides with your steak at Hugos. Drinks were great while we waited for table and the house red went great with my steak. Did I say the service was exceptional? When in Vegas, go to Hugos Cellar. I know I will be back.

3nOeYg1ikYPieUEJqxukRw.text: I used to love this place, the food is good...pricy but comes with a side table salad prepped to your liking. If you're a lady a rose is given to you before you get seated. My older friend whom I love like a grandfather took me for my birthday. This was my third time there and the waiter an African American treated him with respect but treated me rude. I understand this is Vegas and whatever he assumed I can't blame him, however, he needs to set aside his opinions and lack of professionalism when on the job. I asked if they offered a side of sauteed spinach and he replied in a rude manner that they didn't. ..so I asked well what do you have? To which he said only a medley of veggies. I wanted to ask what they were and decided to just go with those. Aside from the terrible waiter who looked at me like I was an escort I love this place. Cozy old school, an underground hidden gem! Everyone with the exception of the one waiter have always been polite especially their sommelier.

TJwpEHSGGr99qUSUQgv8xw.text: You go here for the old Vegas experience. You get advice from real experienced sommelier, and included in your meal is a table side salad, and small dessert that includes two chocolate covered strawberries, figs, and apricots. Also, they come often to fill your water and check on you. As you come in women are handed a rose, it's really sweet. 5 stars for service and 4 stars for food. Article interviewing Hugo's sommelier. m.reviewjournal.com/busi...

Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet gesture by the restraurant
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert included with your meal

DwglBEGnjDX_uAe_9R56Dw.text: AMAZING!!!!    Husband and I can't remember if we have been here in recent years.  This was the first place that I brought him 14 years ago when he came to visit me in my hometown for Christmas break.  So, last night for our 12th wedding anniversary, we decided to take a walk down memory lane and kick Vegas old school.    First of all, the service is incredible.  You are consistently (in a good way) being checked on by the various servers.  You never have a moment of wanting.  The food was O M G!  We shared the lobster bisque.  I took the first bite, turned to husband, and said, "THIS is what lobster bisque is supposed to taste like."  Great flavor and chunks of lobster.  The wine sommelier recommended a nice half bottle of pinot grigio for me to accompany my salmon.  I had it sauce nantua, which had a nice sauce with bay shrimp and crab meat.  I liked the accompanying veggies.  Husband had the Beef Wellington.  While we both enjoy our meals, husband does prefer his meat well, which is not possible with the Wellington.  Ended the beautiful meal with a house cappuccino.  ;-)   Complimentary salad is outstanding, as is the chocolate covered fruit.  This is a classy, old school Vegas place that is worth the trip to the Four Queens.  Husband's favorite part is that he does not leave hungry, unlike some of the other "upscale" places in town.

AS-DzBE0dFNt5L4z0yNOuQ.text: Amazing experience, fantastic dinner.  Great spot for people watching. One of my most favorite restaurants in all of Vegas.

S4YqaF9ygrcKuzQ22v8EyQ.text: I was treated to Hugo's by my husband.. It was an amazing experience and I highly recommend the food! I had the duck and he had the lamb. Wonderful, romantic atmosphere! We will be back!

nkS3sQqfHVE6dsyrefnDPw.text: Hugo's never disappoints! Amazing food, atmosphere, and service. You won't be disappointed! The fish and steak are always delicious. You won't find a better meal in Vegas.

icA3QyW14NIl6Omf1iCTFQ.text: The service here was PHENOMENAL. Our waiters were incredible, and I *loved* all the little touches like the table side salad (AMAZING!), the sorbet, the flambee table-side, the chocolate covered strawberries...  The ambience was wonderful, everyone there was so friendly...  I LOVED EVERYTHING ABOUT THAT!  The food was just "OK" though. My boyfriend got rib eye and garlic mashed potatoes. The rib eye was decent and the mashed potatoes got cold very quick. I got the duck and boiled potatoes. The duck was a bit dry and the potatoes were bland.  With the desserts, the chocolates were already super-hard, so it wasn't fresh-dipped. Even the whipped cream was kind of hard.  I loved the salad, especially the pine nuts.  For best FOOD on Fremont, I'm a huge Vic and Anthony's fan. It's amazing. But the experience here was outstanding!!! We'll definitely go again. :)

Iva9wXcgP0R03XfM9AWrrQ.text: Amazing food!!  Located at the Four Queens Hotel in Downtown Las Vegas.  Our friends took my husband and I to this wonderful place and we were not disappointed.  It has an old Las Vegas feel, you think that you are back in the 1950's.  You will have a waiter, a server, and a wine sommelier.  Awesome.   Come and enjoy this delicious meal.
