Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The salmon over crab meat with shrimp sauce.  Delicious!!!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1QfiVVC1EkIraaMOdgjb8w.text: So when it comes to fancy dinners and fancy restaurants and all that jazz, I'm a newb. I have very little experience eating at fancy steakhouses and fancy restaurants, though 2011 seems to be changing all of that. Sometimes...perhaps in an optimistic perspective, change IS a good thing! =) So when I went to Vegas to meet up with my bf and his family, along with the soon to be bride & groom, our celebration dinner was held here, an old school steak house located in downtown Las Vegas in the Four Queen's Hotel & Casino. It's downstairs from the casino, and it's "like" you're in a cellar. Cool points, yes. When you step inside you already feel the old school lady & gentlemen-like vibe. The ladies are greeted by the hostess with red long stem roses, WOW! Takin' it back to the old school when chivalry was common and ladies wore dresses everyday. Very cool. Our large party was comfortably seated in the back in a room with a large table, a bit secluded from the rest of the customers but not too much where we felt completely alone. You can tell that this restaurant pays attention to all the little details. yelp.com/biz_photos/VG0n... Gorgeous butter, looks like real roses. I had to snap a picture before the guys dug into their bread and lavosh! The menu here is pretty too, hugoscellar.com/files/me... , what I liked about this steakhouse was that they included the prices for each meal. AND, if you read carefully, the meals COME with sides. Unlike other fancy restaurants where you have to order your starch and your veggies, it's all included on your plate and in the price. Even the side table service salad, which was incredibly delicious, is included. My boyfriend and I tried the orange walnut dressing, which is more of a vinaigrette, and it was AMAZING! Toppings were extensive to, he goes around asking what you want. And I give props to him, there were 13 of us I think!! Our servers were great, consistent in their service, and were patient while they took our orders. We munched on the bread & lavosh and a bunch of us shared this lovely appetizer : yelp.com/biz_photos/VG0n... I've never had it baked or made like this, and I enjoyed it very much. Now this is when I got confused--- my lack of experience in fancy restaurants will do this to me --- they brought out these: yelp.com/biz_photos/VG0n... "Why are they giving us dessert before our meal? " Confused look but hey that looks yummy... Come to find out, they're palette cleansers--- Wow spiffy! It tasted like raspberry sherbert and it did its job pleasantly. Cuz my main meal was scrumptious.http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VG0nWxGsPixYLsyi49gyxQ?select=6GeGY9m4Z4N4Idq5KqtREQ most of the guys ordered prime ribs: yelp.com/biz_photos/VG0n... all around the table everyone enjoyed their meals. The meat was good and the sides were just enough to complement the hunk of meat we all had. Now, there are choices of great desserts here, they're even on a cart for every one to see when you walk in. But, the meal also comes with this: yelp.com/biz_photos/VG0n... which to me, was just enough to satisfy my sweet tooth that starts aching for some form of dessert after a good meal. I absolutely loved this steakhouse and I'm glad the whole fam was able to celebrate the soon to be bride & groom here. Great atmosphere, attentive staff, quality food, and attention to detail. 5 stars in my book!! Now all of you, go try it when you're in downtown vegas! Yelp 365 challenge: 59/ 365

08T574i8AbXTTAVZ09pouw.text: Hugo's Cellar is awesome.   Reservations were made in advanced using Open Table.  Our evening started with each lady being presented with a long stem red rose.    I ordered a Negroni which was the best value In Vegas.  (Basically two large cocktails).   The shrimp scampi appetizer was cooked to perfection.     Each entree is served with a salad that is made table side.  There were 7 folks at our table and we all loved the salads.   The restaurant lived up to all the hype and we all will be returning on our next visit to Vegas.  Bananas  Foster was made at the table and the Kona coffee brewed in front of you topped off the experience.

OlB1rLKeDAORy78I5_USdg.text: I met with of 3 of my friends here for dinner on Friday 1/20/17..6:30pm reservation .  2 of my friends are well known to most of the staff. We barely ordered drinks when the "maitre di" came over to our table, said "there have been complaints about language at our table". We were shocked, as I know we were not loud. Needless to say, management should have moved the complaining party, as we were at our booth first, expecting to have an adult evening. We paid our bill and left. To add insult to injury, they put our expensive wine in a plastic cup. We will NEVER go there again.

Ith8T32DPU9JnikiV3qV1Q.text: Been here several times in the past with good food and service but this time was surely different.  Seated promptly and friendly, beautiful rose for the lady and a nice booth.  We made our selections and when the entrees came out we noticed both my filet and her lamb chop were under cooked. I could deal with my filet but her lamb was still blue. I notified one of our waiters and our main server came over and took part of the lamb back for further cooking. It came out a few minutes later burnt on the outside and still extremely rare on the inside. She couldn't even eat any of her $60 lamb chop. The server never once came back to check on her, no one addressed our obvious discomfort and then we just got presented with the bill.  For what "was" my favorite romantic restaurant to take my lady I was extremely disappointed.  I don't see myself returning.

kRzw8UBfenUaXhVUVg7keQ.text: 5/5 Stars, would recommend. Came here on a weekday night to celebrate an anniversary and was seated almost immediately with a reservation. Every lady gets a rose when you come in which is a nice touch. Never had to ask for a thing as our server was constantly filling our glasses and asking if we needed anything. Sorbet was given to cleanse the palette which again was kind of cool.  We ordered the filet/shrimp combo & a chicken dish (can't remember the name). Night ended with our Server comping us a free dessert and wrapping our rose to go. Has an old school Vegas vibe to it which was unique but definitely worked.

539dXj_WKwkzJmQpoDpGTg.text: Excellent steakhouse! Food,service and ambiance is what you expect in Vegas. My wife and I travel to Vegas 3-4 times a year (retired) and always try different steakhouse restaurants. Hugos table service is professional and prompt. Food is prepared as requested and there is no hovering over the table. Although  a little pricey, I believe you get what you pay for. Oh, btw....menu selection has something for every tastebud!!

jX4z0R0jGrifOMJ9SwgpXw.text: This place was so good!!! The staff was amazing. All the women get a red rose upon entry.  From the minute we walked in to the minute we walked out, the service was great! We went for our wedding anniversary and order the crab cakes for our appetizer. I don't care for crab cake but it was delicious. Table side salad, I had the orange vinaigrette... yum!!! My filet mignon was cooked the way I asked. The lobster tail was thick and juicy. They give you sorbet between salad and dinner to clear your palette. Then at the end, you get 2 chocolate dipped strawberries, figs and apricot. I only ate the strawberries. The room was dimmed and had a great atmosphere. But our waiter, Marco was amazing!!! He was very nice, great personality and te tentative. Highly recommended!

kMVsyeRAbcw5Tc_-3VcZsg.text: From the moment you walk down the stairs in the Four Queens Casino, you feel like you jumped back in time. The whole restaurant is dimly lit and has the original decor from the late 70's. Every woman is presented a long stem rose. The prices for each dish include everything which is bottled water, a full size salad complete with shrimp, eggs, and nearly anything else you can think of, sorbet for palette cleanser, entree with vegetable and potatoes or rice, and fruit dipped in different chocolates. We also ordered escargot, a bottle of wine, and pecan cheesecake. Left completely stuffed and thinking every penny we spent was well worth it.  Our staff included 3 waiters and a sommelier who were charismatic and extremely friendly. Our next trip to Vegas will include Hugo's!

lOJIj22pXlrQiqMt5z4How.text: HUGO'S WILL SPOIL YOU.  Nice reception. The hostess was very kind.  The waiter was quick to my table, friendly and explained the menu very well.  How about some whipped butter with an assortment of fresh bread? YUP.  For those who enjoy wine, Hugo's has a sommelier...wine stewart. If wine knowledge isn't your thing, it's ok...there won't be a quiz.  Sommeliers won't make you feel stupid. They're available to help with pairings and a deeper understanding of wine IF you want.  Who doesn't love a table-side salad cart? Many fresh and chilled salad fixin's to choose from.  You may be surprised with the raspberry sorbet pallet cleanser. This is not common.  You might think...WHAT, dessert comes first? No, this is how rich people eat.  LOL.  Let me circle back to the waiter and service. I like a waiter who will not only make suggestions, but damn near insist you eat a particular menu item.  Of course, we the customer have final say, but it shows the waiter will go beyond normal service.  You can order sides, but Hugo's isn't cheap.  They will provide veggies and starch with your main course. Also, they have sauce options for meat items.  The dinner concluded with an assortment of complimentary goodies, including chocolate covered strawberries and FRESH whipped cream. I was caught off guard. I thought I was suppose to choose one of many treats on the dessert tray. Nope, they were all for me! I understand Hugo's offers a pretty amazing Banana's Foster table side show.  I don't how people do it. The other courses are not small.  Following dinner, both the waiter and hostess insist I come back...as if I was a celebrity or high roller. I was given a business card with the hostess' name and phone number...the restaurant phone number.  I will DEFINITELY give them a call.  NOW, DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND LOOK THROUGH ALL THE PHOTO'S.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hugo&#39;s compared to Vic &amp; Anthony&#39;s at The Golden Nugget. Also a great steakhouse.

zhIuDEUdME8xqLfl3RwwJQ.text: We spent our anniversary dinner here and we're very impressed! Everything about this place was classy and romantic. The staff was great and made sure throughout the night that everything was perfect. Our food was what we will definitely be coming back for. We had the filet mignon and the ribeye with garlic mashed potatoes (the best I've ever had) and house veggies. It was a great mixture of flavors throughout the whole night. I highly recommend this place for any occasion.

XgU2sHPsLMV8CCOCPKXT3Q.text: Hugo's is hands down one of the best restaurants in Vegas! This place is truly an Old Vegas staple. We would come here every trip but we love to only reserve it for our yearly anniversaries, it is that special! I would really refrain from ordering an appetizer because unless you are ready to eat an insane amount you will be full by the time your main course comes. The price is great because you get a huge salad, sorbet, entree, and dessert all included (hence don't order and appetizer). If you are super hungry though the lobster bisque appetizer is amazing. For dessert I highly recommend the bananas foster which is flambeed in front of you. The Sommelier is also the best around, he is so nice and knowledgeable.

0Dd3Uf3iXxkPh3GxTpBumA.text: Second time at Hugo's. I didn't feel it was worth the $$$ this time. Bottom of Wellington pastry was black. Ribeye was not tender. For the price you pay it should melt in your mouth. Instead if downtown check out Therapy. Love that place

9VQguJu2_70o1DHjnda07w.text: No gimmicks here, just great food and service! Wonderful tableside salad, awesome steaks and an old-school Vegas steakhouse ambiance. Skip the cappuccino...it was the only part of the entire meal that fell short of excellence.

o9mcIokO6SKOiRLzNasxkg.text: Last night was my first trip to Hugo's Cellar in probably 10 years or so. I have been telling my wife about it since before we were married and we are coming up on 7 years.   Hugo's is what old Vegas used to be. Fine dining with personalized service. Something you don't get too much of these days. Our reservation was at 8:30, but we showed up early to have a drink. The bar area at Hugo's is VERY SMALL. The bar has 5 seats and there are 3 tables available. There is no table service in the bar so you have to order yourself. The drinks are a good value. You are handed your glass and then a carafe in an ice bucket. You get 3 drinks out of it. Not kidding. Of course, I am only speaks mg for those if us who drink martinis or Manhattans.   Them menu is very old school. It has things like Beef Wellington, escargot en crut, and Chateubreaun. I ordered the escargot, of course, and it is probably the best I have had. My wife said it was the best she has had. My wife and I both had the Beef Wellington. I had never had it before and I wanted to see what Gordon Ramsey is always yelling about on Hell's Kitchen. Lol It was served with garlic mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables. For my first Wellington, it was incredible. So tender.   The funniest part of the Hugo's experience is the salad cart. Your waiter will wheel this cart over with all kinds of things. He will then read off a list of things and all you say is yes or no. I suggest being last so you don't hold up the train and if you don't have the ingredients memorized after the 9 people that ordered salad before you, then I don't know what to tell you. Lol  Hugo's decor hasn't changed at all from what I can tell. I am sure the booths have been redone at some point. The clientele is a good mix of young and old. I think there were a few working girls in the room also. Lol  So if you want that old school Vegas experience, go to Hugo's and ask for Sinatra's booth.   There is valet parking available at the Four Queens and there is self parking as well. However, if you are coming from elsewhere, I recommend taking Uber or Lyft.

vV2MElPTQCwuQ-Fa12ETlQ.text: My husband made reservations here for our date night. This restaurant is phenomenal. Amazing atmosphere. Amazing welcome. They made the most delicious salad  in front of us. I ordered the Seafood Trio and my husband had the Salmon. Each course was just superb. We highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uEoj_VWMaQun12s1D6ZK1w.text: No, we didn't come her for Valentine's Day dinner (mind you I think Vday is lame and fake); we came for our Anniversary dinner.   Didn't necessarily want something romantic but, I did want something different and super old school. And after recommendations from my boss, this sounds like it could be as Super OG as can be!  And after looking at other restos I wanted to try, I think this place had the most bang for the buck AND THEY HAVE RACK OF LAMB (my fave!)   Right in the cellar of Four Queens, lies this little gem of a restaurant!   After getting our romantic drink of Hennessy on the rocks, we ordered the shrimp scampi, lamb, and rib eye. Initially, we wanted to order the appetizer of hot rock but, our waiter (Glenn) said he didn't recommend it as it was a lot of food that we were ordering already -- hence the shrimp scampi switch up!  And our waiter was on the dot about that.   The table side salad that came with our meal was delicious. I love salad so I could've had him come around once more :)   My lamb was fantastic. Not too many places have lamb so this was exciting to me. Other steak houses make their lamb toooo salty for me so, this was perfect. Not salty at all and was amazing with the tasty mash potatoes and veggies.  The Indonesian sauce it came with was tasty, but I liked my lamb just the way it was.  The BF, actually, took my sauce for his rib eye which he found delish!   After entrees, we got a complimentary cake and ice cream and their standard fruits dipped in chocolate. It was very nice!   Ended the night with their Kona coffee brewed tableside. That was definitely the high light for the BF as he's a HUGE coffee drinker.  The more it boiled and brewed the more amazing our area smelled. Coffee accouterments of cinnamon sticks and mint chocolate was unexpected and yummy!   Service was awesome! Ambiance was vintage and really OG. Like this is where Frank Sinatra used to go. That's craaaazzzyyyyyy!   I'd love to come back with a bigger party so, I can enjoy this place again :) Downtown Favorite for sure!

g3nXFIlj79tXrLp5_kBm5A.text: This is my favorite go to steakhouse when in Vegas. We specifically left the strip to head over to the crazy nakedness of Fremont Street to have the always excellent service and food at Hugo's Cellar.   it's such a random little spot at the Four Queens and easily missed if you're not looking. I lov that all us ladies get treated with a rose. Each of the steak entrees come with the tableside salad where they make to order a large salad with as many or as little of the fixins as you want.   I love the little touches of lemon sorbet to clean the palate between salad and meal as well as the chocolate dipped fruit at the end.   I have had the beef wellington many times and am amazed that every time they are able to bake this nice fluffy puff pastry with a perfectly made medium cooked filet inside.  The potatoes are garlicky and smooth and a wonderful side to the steak.   The tableside desserts of bananas foster is always a "treat" to watch as well as eat!

yZtp-wrnIAQaQlLbAhUqfA.text: Great service in a cool old vegas setting. Salad made table side is awesome. Beef Wellington was very good. My wife's lobster was excellent. Dessert was good also. Overall great meal and upscale place. Gave 4 stars instead of 5 just based on the good not being quite as flavorful as some of the other nice restaurants we've been to with the same price tag.  Coffee maker was really cool and unique.

ahjCGk4hyhbYPbzQdphq9w.text: Had the most amazing dinner experience. Ordered the Hugo's cut of prime rib, every single bite was the best steak I ever had. Staff was incredibly friendly, our waiter was very knowledgeable of menu and pleasant. Seriously, every time I come back to Vegas this will be my spot. Thank you Hugo's for being as great as you are.

72F57CcuBLGHdJFgPP0XEA.text: Had a wonderful dinner at Hugo's Cellar. I highly recommend it to anyone staying downtown or on the Vegas Strip. ($15 Uber drive). It's an old school restaurant that's been around for a long time. The decor is old but food is great!  Such a nice touch, that all ladies receive a long stem rose when being seated. We started with martinis and they were awesome!  All meals include a house salad made at the table side.   Highly recommend the Hugo Scampi. Delicious large shrimp in a excellent sauce.  We enjoyed the fruit sorbet that cleansed our palate!  I had the 10 ounce  filet and it was served with bearnaise sauce, mashed potatoes and veggies.  IT WAS GREAT!! My husband had the rib eyed and loved it.  They even include chocolate covered fruit for light dessert.  Overall, it's not some fancy Strip restaurant but I highly recommend visiting this classes old joint. We had a lovey experience.  All the servers are dressed so classy! Wine menu/selection was great.  Worth a visit even just for drinks and apps.

2Mn_Dhf0knkjAIthqdw_rQ.text: Oh my god.  What an amazing experience.  When you are seated every women is given a beautiful red rose. The staff is amazing and the food was spectacular.  We will definitely be visiting again  Hey and hat off to Gene on the waiter staff. Good gosh he makes an amazing salad.   Woo hoo

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husbands birthday !!   Our waiter Gene surprised him with this amazing and beautiful desert
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Marsala was amazing!!!!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs were so fresh and cooked perfect

8wkRDZfOpzvesTIad30cVg.text: Women are greeted with a long stem rose. For a Monday night this place was very busy. Our reservations were for 8pm and we tried to move it earlier but they were completely booked.   Service was extremely horrible! They never came to check on us. My husband waited for a drink refill forever. I actually had to find our server and ask if we could get another drink.  Food was definitely not worth the money at all! It was like eating a steak from a buffet. If it wasn't for the little extras that they do, the rose, the raspberry sorbet ice cream mini cone that they bring out before your meal to cleanse your palette, the chocolate covered strawberry after your meal...actually no not even the extras made it worth it! I was upset at how pricey it was for how horrible the place is. Mind you it's inside the Four Queens downtown so not in a nice hotel, it's in a dark restaurant which makes sense to go with their theme but for the price, service and food, it was horrible! I definitely would not recommend it.   Oh also just one last thing, when one table ordered some table side app they cooked it and smoke was everywhere...no ventilation for that type of cooking.

DPxtrQzZqTKHmR-1X1vkRw.text: Honestly if you are a person of color I don't think this is the place for you! I hate the race card however I'm black and my husband is Mexican and we felt VERY out of place. We watched everyone get served around us, when our waiter finally did come he was blah at best. It took 45mins just to get our food. 25 mins before we even got approached for a drink order. They weren't exceptionally busy because we only waited 10mins for a table (even Denny's can do better) I mean when your paying $50 minimum for an entree you can AT LEAST get decent service. The food was boring and tasted pretty bland, we left most of it and just ran out because we were so uncomfortable. Spend your money somewhere else!

vKt0OFCTpUxvzuby2w4ebQ.text: Hugo's was delicious. We went for a birthday dinner and had a wonderful meal. We both ordered steak and the meat was tender and flavorful. When you come be ready to eat! The prices are fair considering everything you get and the staff is wonderful. Hugo's is definitely a place we will be returning to. And the rose is a nice touch!

YhG7TM_ICv6erCG9y456QQ.text: On 12/31, my wife's birthday, we visited Hugo's for the second time. After less than a five minute wait we were seated in what we believe were the best seats in the restaurant. Against the back wall, where we could sit side by side and hold hands. After 46 years of marriage, that is pretty cool.   Cocktails:  Grey Goose martinis served up wit a twist. Great drink but the presentation is incredible. Served with a martini glass chilled with ice around the edges, each martini was in a carafe which was inside a crystal ice bucket.  What a cool presentation.  Salad: simply incredible. Made table side, with what you want.   Entree:  steak-perfect,  couldn't be better. Scallops-incredible. Wine: perfectly delivered after fun discussion with John. Desert: wonderful.  Special birthday desert:  unexpected and out of this world!  If you want a special, old school place to go that delivers, this is the place to go.

uwrQGH7W_pghO24e56VdPg.text: I have been a customer at Hugo's for "Special Ocassions" for about 10 years. It was a wonderful dining experience and I recommended it to friends and business associates freely. That was....This past Monday May 28 my wife and I and a a couple of friends went for my wife's Special Birthday Dinner. From the getgo it wasn't THE Hugo's we know.We were greeted by this indifferent old blonde who claimed she was a manager and ushered to a table as you enter the room despite having made a reservation a week earlier! Then we sat for 15 minutes for water and waiter to appear. The manageress remained indifferent to it all.But the worst was the food. Gone was the panache that came with the rolling salad Barn Now is that a crappy mini cart. The veal chop, our fave was no longer on the menu due to problems with the purveyor we were told. (Gimme a break). The salad presentation was mediocre. And then the entrees, all 4 arrived and looked like places that I would not dine at. My rack of lamb we no longer a rack, but double chops laying on a plate, My wife's veal scalloping arrived in a tepid state as were the mashed potatoes, and sent back to be nuked no doubt. There are no vegetable choices here for this 64.00 plate. here. Our friends were equally underwhelmed by their food, the presentation and the attitude of this manager. Never again will I descend into what has truly become a cellar in it's most negative way. Folks, if you want to blow almost 400 dollars on dinner, you can sure do better in This town.

MWiX2G8VJQ_XXBM92lwQAQ.text: I was referred here by a friend and could not happier.   Grown people that come to Vegas go to places like Hugo's. Don't buy into the pretty hotel hype.   I had the prime rib my wife had the salmon we were both floored. Absolutely killer. This was after the table side AWESOME prepared salad.   Please try this place out.   You can thank me later.

J4_C8Jf0gi8Bftw7oJ3NKA.text: What a vegas gem!! Second visit and it was even better than the first time. The service was amazing and our waiter Vincent was very welcoming and took very good care of us . The food was seasoned well and arrived hot and delicious. A must dining experience when in Vegas

HSviRn74tm6KDOCWyl4izg.text: Great old school style steak house with superb customer service! Worth the money! Great food. Love the salad they make at your table.

4kZxKdnxatNqnQNXIVW75Q.text: This was my 3rd year in a row eating here and its just as amazing every time.   Greg and Ahmad were our servers this time, both of them, the food and atmosphere did not disappoint! We had a few people not show up so we had a nice 3 some and it made it an intimate gathering in a famous place.   With great food and my favorite bullett rye whiskey it was the best time.  I cant wait til next years SEMA show for the forth annual Jim & Gil dining experience

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aZz3KdKsux012NClTmhYmA.text: Old school class act Need we say anything more Classic menu and excellent staff Bartender on the strip recommended and it did not disappoint  Get there early as the locals tend to book this classic restaurant  Table side classic Cesar was excellent touch and always a red rose for the ladies when seated

T9HrgvUthDo7OuhF_sO-zA.text: Took me 50 minutes to get my steak dinner, party of one. It was good but I hastily ate it to try to make it to a magic show I was 20 minutes late to. Didn't go into the show because I didn't want to be embarrassed once I saw how small the venue was. I was essentially ignored by the waiter that took my order, and was checked on more by the water server and the person that prepared my salad. The salad options were great and the bread was good.  Nice atmosphere. If you've got loads of time or are in a big party, you'll probably have a better time. Dress is business casual but I went in with a t shirt and hoodie, and saw retirees in Hawaiian shirts and some sports jerseys.  For a $52 steak, I expected better service. It came with mashed potatoes and veggies, and a strawberry desert. Still cheaper than Gordon Ramsey's steakhouse.

FMZVg-KyDyV8gK4UkMMwZA.text: Always good !! Perfect place for a romantic dinner and drinks, excellent service great atmosphere! We had lamb and filet mignon omg so delicious and of course our dessert was delicious! Will be back soon!! Thank you for my beautiful rose!

k9SGawefdJQHftAv0eaYoA.text: It's the first average meal that I have had a Hugo's... the Ribeye was just not very good this time.  My buddy got the filet and it was great.  Not giving up, just an average piece of cow this time.  I'll be back.

WTGC21Gs2JfVk72N_z5wLg.text: Four ladies had dinner here on February 28. I was embarrassed I had suggested Hugo's. The food was OK. The server basically ignored us. He was quite friendly with all the tables with men around us. I was never offered a 2nd glass of wine, we were never offered coffee. Our birthday girl was not offered a dessert though we saw several others coming out with candles...for that matter, none of us was offered dessert.  Our server's assistant came with the bill. We asked if the 20% had been deducted for our players' club cards and he assured it had. On review, it hadn't.  He was a big aggravated to have to take it to be redone.  The whole experience made us wish we had gone elsewhere.  I've more recently been to Ruth's Chris and T-Bones (with the same group) and had very pleasant experiences.

RgMfd8TY-izux3vGMAED9A.text: We celebrated our anniversary at Hugo's Cellar last night and the experience was as good as it gets.  We got there 30 minutes early to have a glass of wine (the house wine is Franciscan) and enjoy the complimentary pate and nuts at the bar.  The table-side salad is the best - I'm probably the only girl on earth who loves anchovies - and they have toppings like bay shrimp, blue cheese crumbles, and hearts of palm.  The honey walnut dressing complements the salad.  My hubby and I split one of the chicken dishes, wasn't in the mood for steak, and were pretty full so we took the rest to go.    The best part of the dinner are the complimentary chocolate covered strawberries and dried fruit they give you - the staff was kind enough to make it to go for us.   Overall - definitely worth the $$

xEfOy5MF9ozsSzpIiHu5Zw.text: This venerable institution of fine dining never ceases to impress. As a local I've been a frequent guest on many of occasions and each meal has left me filled not only in appetite but with an incredible dinning experience. From the onset with the woman receiving a rose to the table side salad made to order, well aged steaks to the delectable desserts Hugo's never fails to impress.

HC0X_aFqJZuzrRg2FVRY4g.text: We always try to go out for at least one nice dinner while we are in Vegas.  This time we did not plan ahead and we asked a local while we were cruising downtown- he suggested Hugo's Cellar.   Let me first say I was very surprised to find a romantic and quiet restaurant just below the casino floor of the 4 Queens. There is a stairway down right next to the buffet, so I was a little nervous going in.  We had a party of six all dressed downtown casual, but they did not bat an eyelash and were able to seat us immediately. They even handed each of the ladies a long-stemmed red rose.   The food was great. Especially the table-side salad. (One of the best restaurant salads I've had.) The service was even better. Despite our casual attire, we were treated very well and had excellent service by our server and enjoyed a great conversation with an outstanding sommelier.   Thank you Hugo's for delivering an outstanding meal without the usual snobbery of this type of high class establishment.

ZO1UkbjLMq6l1NYySseKDg.text: The ambience is great. All the staff are courteous and professional. The food is AMAZING!! Yes, you are looking to spend $40-50 per person, but unlike most fine steakhouses that are ala carte, this price includes bread, salad, and chocolate dipped fruit dessert. I definitely did not expect to find such fine dining in a casino in downtown Las Vegas.

5tHCufnqp4Dw7AfqP35OWg.text: Vegas's Romantic hidden gem! I'm a local (dont let downtown/old hotel fool you) because this is one of the most romantic places we've been to. A must go to for a special day! My husband totally blew me away!

boisk4j0LOri6_fGvzwZzw.text: This place has never done me wrong.  Form the moment you walk in it's magic.  I know a few other reviewers have mentioned it and yes it really is a romantic place.    From the flowers for the ladies, to the flintstone size prime rib, and the chocolate covered fruits this place was made to help you get laid.

UCUmBjvfvyiyoXKQtWaatg.text: On an impromptu vacay to sin city in February life on the Vegas Strip got routine very quickly. I asked the locals where do they go to have fun and almost everyone responded "Freemont St". It definately lived up to the hype in the fact that it was just a huge block party style atmosphere, but what took the cake was Hugo's Cellar. This restaurant has a very balanced menu from the soup to nuts. The build your own salad to the braised lamb had me in heaven with every bite. The expertise of the sommelier was very helpful in proper wine selection. The ambiance is very intimate and perfect for a date night. Be prepared to drop a few dollars but it is a nice alternative to the hustle and bustle of the strip. I definitely will go back.

vAKov6F24QPDPjTrr64svw.text: Excellent!  We had the filet and it was cooked perfectly.  This by far was our favorite dinning experience in Las Vegas.  It's tucked away from all the hustle and bustle of Vegas, in Four Queens on Fremont.  Our servers were fantastic!  The extra touches (each woman who comes in gets a rose, salad customized and made at your table, complimentary chocolate dipped strawberries, figs, and apricots) all really made the dining experience superb.  I finished with a brandy cappuccino, another slam dunk.  We didn't have reservations, but someone else didn't show up so they took us no problem.  Fantastic place!

CkgI3xNof-UVcw35PWErqQ.text: Classic steakhouse.  Old school Vegas atmosphere with great service, wonderful food, and one of the best martinis I have ever had.

Gh1bEJ6bxNIt9Lmi9h3RjQ.text: Never had anything but and exceptional time here. Service A+, food A+, old school atmosphere is fantastic.

M9YKVng7LYhtzNGt-431PQ.text: The girlfriend and I were checking out Fremont Street on a Wednesday evening.  It was dinnertime and we were hungry.  After some cursory research, we decided to give Hugo's Cellar a try.  Tucked away downstairs off of the casino floor at Four Queens, Hugo's Cellar is an unassuming looking place, which, from its decor, looks like time stood still stopping somewhere in the late-60s/early-70s.  That said, this only adds to the dining experience as Hugo's Cellar exudes old school charm and harkens back to the day when going out to dinner at a nice restaurant was truly considered a special occasion.  We didn't have reservations, not that we probably needed them on this particular mid-week evening.  Upon stepping up to the host stand, the maitre-d handed a red rose to my girlfriend (and all women who dine at the restaurant) before leading us to our table.  At its heart, HC is a steak place, but the menu has a good selection of seafood choices as well as lamb, veal, chicken, and duck.  We opted for the Chateaubriand and Lobster for Two which consisted of a roasted center-cut tenderloin filet and broiled lobster tails with a side of green and white asparagus.  Soon after our order was placed, a cart wheeled up to prepare custom, made to order salads at our tableside.  The salad was made with fresh romaine lettuce and topped with pretty much anything you could think to throw on a salad.  Think salad bar at Fogo de Chao, not Ponderosa.  After our salads were cleared away, David our lead server delivered two small cones of raspberry sorbet to cleanse our palate.  Next, our main course was served up.  The chateaubriand was cooked to a perfect medium rare doneness, as requested, and the good-sized lobster tails were also flawlessly prepared, moist, tender and flavorful.  The GF remarked it was the best lobster tail she'd ever had.  A meal like this required a good, hearty red wine.  HC has an extensive and surprisingly affordable wine list.  Vince, the extremely knowledgeable and personable sommelier, guided us through the list, but we knew exactly what we wanted when we spied a bottle of the 2008 Frank Family Cabernet Sauvignon ($68).  Frankly (no pun intended), this wine at the price was a steal especially given the fact that a bottle retails in the $40-50 range online!  The 2007 Frank Family Cab was the best wine I had the pleasure of tasting this year and the 2008 shared virtually all of the same, pleasurable characteristics of the 2007.  At this point, I didn't need anything else to eat.  Yet, a plate of chocolate-dipped strawberries, dried apricots, and figs showed up at the table to close out our thoroughly enjoyable meal.        Compared to the Strip, Downtown Vegas and Fremont Street lacks the wide array of fine dining choices.  However, Hugo's Cellar easily dispels the notion that there isn't any fine dining to be found and that you need the culinary draw of a big name, celeb-chef to be successful.  Hugo's Cellar isn't a cheap night out, but it delivers quality, quantity, and among the highest levels of service I've ever experienced at a restaurant.  Old school, indeed!

lQ45Xhs7ZSjAzJXHHyTGIA.text: Jimuay spent 300 on dinner sitting next to a group of people with juicy sweats.  Meal was nice crowd was thrift mall

v3Lug50YGv4KOQ9TLIWTNQ.text: We have been coming to Hugo's for special occasions for the 26 years we have lived in Las Vegas. We love the atmosphere, the food, and the service! Along with the rose, fabulous table side salad, the sorbet to cleanse the palate, and the complimentary chocolate dipped fruit for dessert. We have never been disappointed.

Pn5xY6GBv_wQI9keDaZW7w.text: Heard great thing about this place, so we decided to book this place for a birthday dinner. When everything were done, we wished that we shouldn't gave gone to it in the first place. Even though the service and atmosphere were great, the food was so disappointing, especially at about 50 bucks each for the main entree.  The rack of lamb was under seared, under cooked, and under seasoned. The result was a very gaming smell dish which I couldn't even finish. Well, the upside was the mash potato that came with the lamb was good ... LOL  My friend's fish entree was average and nothing special, which I wouldn't have b***** about it if it didn't cost 49 bucks for it.  Maybe it was a bad night for them, but these kinda of food quality probably won't get my second visit.

mUtreMxle4IPBAEARoWYkg.text: This is why you come to Vegas - Food! The level of service was spectacular.  Our waiter and the team made some great recommendations and pairings for us to enjoy.  The table side salad serving was delicious and gave us lots to share and compare.  Best Banana Foster was spectacular but, we also shared the cheesecake.  Again really interactive staff made it a really fun night with a great group of friends.  We wore suits but, could have been business casual.  The rose for the ladies was a nice touch.  This was my second visit and I will definitely be back for more.

ofzvma0WBPBUMKhPb2BpWg.text: The food was excellent.  When you see the price of an entree it appears to be costly, then you find out that you get a huge salad made at your table, a little sherbet served between the salad and main course, then to top everything off chocolate dipped strawberries, dried figs and apricots. The waiters keep your water glass filled and anything else you need.  The long stem rose for the ladies is a nice touch. I had the prime rib served just as ordered and my wife the filet mignon which was perfect. This restaurant gives you both good food and tastefully extras.

tymJSuwKwUOLyL-zwjYxTQ.text: this place is a real treasure! never in a million years would i have guessed such a swanky steak & seafood joint lies beneath the Four Queens! my in-laws discovered it on their last trip to Vegas and insisted we come back for their 40th wedding anniversary. they handed all the ladies in my party a single long-stemmed rose before they escorted us to our dimly-lit, circular booth and placed the roses in a vase for us. it felt like i was on the set of Mad Men or an old school New York-style steakhouse.   the menu is expensive, but i felt it was worth every penny. most of us ordered entrees because we wanted the full service. first comes the table-side salad service, and they let you choose every item - mine had hearts of palm and anchovies and a lovely vinaigrette. then a 'palate cleansing' mini-cone of raspberry sorbet - darling! and then the entrees...  i had the salmon en papillote, which came with a dramatic table-side preparation of salmon steamed in a puffed-up little parchment bag, then deflated and cut away, and served with julienne vegetables on top. absolutely fantastic. i pretty much never do dessert - too heavy, cakey, creamy, etc. but i was terribly pleased with dessert at Hugo's - chocolate covered fruits! strawberries, apricots, and figs, all my favorite things!   it was just wonderful. attentive and expert service, very cozy space, with light classic Rat Pack lounge tunes piped into the background. very highly recommend this place. i would love to return for another special occasion.

JmmC7RW2fSGRHgbVgSw9mA.text: came highly recommended by a local of Las Vegas  place has very cheap drinks and great cheap food  menu is large drink menu is large  this place is packed with people long waits  decors nice this place is very very very clean

WktQ2MbdejdTlsqJZEB9bA.text: I cant say that I loved the Freemont Street area (really really not my thing) but we had an incredible meal at Hugo's Cellar which made the trek downtown all worth it. We didnt know it at the time, but Hugo's Cellar turned out to be the best dinner we had on our trip. The ambiance was incredible, the service was wonderful, and the food was amazing. It has a special "old world" charm to it and, in my opinion, is a must visit for any foodie traveling to Las Vegas.  Just a note: dont let the casino (Four Queens) or the downtown area in general deter you from dining at Hugo's Cellar. Its a quiet, charming, and classy restaurant in the midst of a less-than classy area.   Food musts: the escargot & the table-side salad.  Never in my life did I think I would rave about a salad like I have about the one at Hugo's Cellar. Its what all salads should strive to be like.

nTbC_Y0eeTWl8pPXGyylZQ.text: Our first time here, group of 7 and first impression was excellent.  Great ambiance, ladies greeted with roses, attentive service, table side salad custom built, sorbet before main course and delicious chocolate covered fruits at the end.  All martinis and wine and cocktails were spot on delicious  What was very nice was that it was all salad and sides were included with your dinner, no ala cart which is hard to find anymore.  Most everyone had steak and enjoyed them.  I however I went with scallops and they were not great.  Overcooked with a sauce that overpowered everything on the plate.  Now to be fair, we were all pretty happy with everything but the reason for the 3 stars was a meltdown at the end when the bill was paid.  Cards were ran and we were all getting up to leave fat and happy when are waiter came sprinting out telling us the bill was processed wrong, mind you it was correct and all of our charges were correctly ran, over $800 worth. This turned into a fiasco that never should have been noticed by us, it was a POS issue with their system (wrong table number on the bill ) and our experience should never had been bothered by this.  Bottom line, I still have 2 large transactions on my card and have to dispute one with the bank now 3 days later.  Hate to bog down a review with something like this but that's not how you manage a fine dining establishment.

b4VS10vHfGmOfdiZcf5Lbw.text: Excellent dining experience as usual. The sommelier is knowledge and has a good sense of humor.  Food was delectable!!! Will go here every time I'm in Vegas!

OepZ68fFecjp58uNhFbEQw.text: We have been going there at least 2-4 times a year for 36 years every time we are in LV.  We feel they may be in the top two restaurants we ever ate at.  We love it.   The food was great again last nite. The beef Wellington was fantastic   My only gripe is I have a favorite dish that I get there and have every time I have eaten there in the last 36 years: veal dijonnaise.   It is no longer on the menu but they have been kind enough to make it for me every time I come except the last time.  They said they did not have the sauce ingredients.   OK that happens.  But we requested it when we made the reservation 1 month age and reminded them when we confirmed the reservation 2 days before.    It is as if they ignored it.  That is not good customer service and for that reason alone I can not give 5 stars.

LH0L2UJnhbCkpqLL3ee8vg.text: Hugo's Cellar was a amazing dinning exsperiance  Great service, Great wine list, Good cocktails, and amazing food! Table side service was awesome - the table side Hugo's House salad was awesome and the table side Bananas Fosters was great to watch being made but even better to eat. I highly recommand you take your best gal or guy to Hugo's Cellar - you will have a great time and a awesome meal  Oh all the ladies get a beautiful long stem rose :-) You will not go wrong with this restaurant!

JxsCKYKATt85tY3g0qOMHQ.text: What can you say about a place that has been here for almost 30 years other than to survive in downtown Las Vegas for all these years being higher than all the other places price wise something has to be done correctly.  With reservations secured we are seated in a private room in the back called the party room. Actually very nice 10 Top in secluded gated off area.  Waiters are on us along with John the long time sommellier.  Reconmending a very nice Cabernet we are on to the main event. All entrees come with the Table side Salad made to order with your options of at least 8-10 accutrements. Salad for each of us was cold, fresh,  and dressings and overall presentation and taste was top notch. Delicious.   Entrees go for the beef folks and if you do go for the beef go for the PRIME RIB!...  Couple of NY Strips were on a scale of 1-10 about a 7... Good top shelf quality but not the blow me away one.  A bone in Filet was also 7 out of 10 as was the rib eye.  The balance of the group ordered the Giant Cut of prime rib and folks this sucker could tip over Fred Flintstone's car.   Big rich in color, flavor & Texture and served with  Nice Auju.  All entrees also included choice of potatoe and grilled vegetables.  Too much food for one man to finish.  Some after dinner drinks, and coffees were enjoyed without desert.   Service and atmosphere in downtown vegas was fantastic and it was truly and enjoyable experience across the board.  1 star off as Steaks were just miss on greatness but price points exceptional, wine list reasonable and prime rib KILLER.

LoCFP4qILoXgf5oXbAXAdQ.text: I visited Las Vegas with the hopes of eating at a good steakhouse. Hugo's Cellar was recommended and raved about by a local. Looking at the prices I thought they definitely should have miraculous steak!! I ordered the Filet Mignon and I have to say I was not pleased. Although the presentation was good, the steak was not seasoned, dry, and not worth the price tag!!! I would not return here ever again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon

gH6viJS3E0J1fjgdSt92OA.text: Hidden gem on the old strip.  This place is pricy, I mean damned pricy, so be prepared for that.  Either hit the tables at the 4 Queens hard and often to get a meal comp'd or pony up for this great experience.  This is the quintessential 'old vegas' experience.  When you walk in, you can soak in the sight, sounds and smell and instantly wonder what it must have been like 60-70 years ago in that very spot.    You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  However, why not go after the real mccoy?  Get a bourbon on the rocks and one of their primo Filets.  They even give fresh roses to the lady in your life.  Surely, they will dig it as well.    Also worth noting - The Salad Cart.  Sounds odd...but do it.  You build your own creation table side and enjoy while the meal is being prepared.    Unlike the restaurants namesake...my review couldn't be any higher.  Visit Hugo's Cellar.

gqdcG34m3JYEzB9L_DEIDw.text: The environment the food the way everything played together made this one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. I had the beef Wellington was very very good. The wine guy was very intelligent and very helpful. I ended the meal with A glass of incredible port

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French

Dhe49_WjTafkD5hXKRgAaA.text: Service at Hugo's is EXCELLENT...from the friendly Host who greets you and gives red roses to the ladies, to the server, assistant server, and bus boy they are all very pleasant and very attentive. This place is a must visit when in Las Vegas...it's not advertised but is very busy due to word of mouth. You can tell you are in a five star restaurant with the amount of care you are given here.  The food here is first-rate. Each entree comes with assorted warm breads and special cheese-toasted lavosh, bottled water, and Intermezzo-Fruit sorbet. It also includes their table-side salad, from which you can choose crisp romaine lettuce, peeled tomato wedges, marinated artichokes and hearts of palm, sliced mushrooms, blue cheese crumbles, toasted croutons, roasted pine nuts, chopped eggs, red onions and bay shrimp and a selection of dressings: Caesar, creamy pepper or honey-orange-walnut vinaigrette. The entree also comes with fresh vegetable du jour and choice of roasted garlic whipped potatoes, red potatoes with parsley or wild rice. They also serve white and dark chocolate dipped strawberries, apricots and baby figs after the meal. With all the accompaniments we did not bother with ordering appetizers.   The table-side salad was delish! Love that everything is made to order thus making the experience more special. The cheese toasted lavosh bread is so yummy I ate way too much of it.  I loved the rose butter it was such a lovely touch. The sorbet was a great touch specially if you had anchovies on your salad. My dad and I both ordered the Filet and Shrimp Aux Poivre (5 oz filet and about 6 pcs of shrimps), my mom got the rib eye and my husband the 10 oz filet. My meal was superb...the filet was a perfect medium and the shrimp was not chewy or rubbery. The peppercorn sauce an awesome flavor to the shrimp. The garlic mash potato was delicious...you can taste the garlic flavor but it was not over-powering. The fresh vegetable was cooked to perfection. The chocolate dipped fruits were also delightful. You can tell that they use high quality chocolate. I ordered creme brulee for dessert...that too was lovely but not as great as everything else.  I love the ambiance at Hugo's...it's cozy and relaxing even though it is somewhat formal. The price for the food is somewhat high but is well worth for the quality of food and service that you get.

XjQdf-YFaiy0GPeb9v5awA.text: One of Vegas's oldest steak houses and still in my top 3! Its a little hole in the wall downtown in the 4 queens and a dinning experience you wont forget. 5 star service 5 star food. We live in town and have been here a couple of times. We always get the same thing, my husband gets the prime rib that is cooked to perfection, juicy and tender. I get the chilean sea bass that melts in my mouth, I haven't had a better one yet at any other place. Its a DONT MISS whether you live in town or are just visiting!

FLyR3KOunwsGsQ6DsfvPBQ.text: Classy old school Vegas Steakhouse downtown in the otherwise unexceptional Four Queens Hotel.   Ladies get a rose when they sit down,  get the table side salad,  and don't miss the free chocolates at the end of your meal.   Swanky and not outrageously priced like on the strip,  still not cheap though.  Dress nice.

dFfUtsfkAKNXaGMLUwAKhw.text: I went here last night for my boyfriends birthday. We heard great things and wanted a special place to go to. If I was to rate it on service and atmosphere alone 5/5 all the way, the staff are amazing and it was a nice cozy place. Unfortunately the food wasn't, I did like the table side salads, it was a pleasant surprise as well as the complimentary sorbet and strawberries and dried fruit. I order the beef Wellington, the best meal I have had in vegas was at Gordon Ramsey's steak. Hugo's did not even come close to the Wellington I had at Steak. The meat was completely rare and the pastry was still gooey and undercooked. The garlic mash was good but the veg had no seasoning. I expected something a lot better considering the price and reviews. Maybe the chef just had an off night, but it was not worth the money.

L5WT0XuU_UXfMtTQg0ACbQ.text: Party of 5 at 6PM on a Monday; it was good for old school steak on Fremont. The lobster bisque gets high points for being served hot. It was delicious and its a very generous serving. Salad is cold and large, but overly dressed and the choices of dressings are too limited (with the cesear not really an option for most people since it reeks of anchovies). Don't spend your money on the king crab legs - unimpressive and not worth it. Stick to the steak; filet is excellent as was the beef wellington. Solid player in a classic Fremont casino. Its nice that it is still around and its charm hasn't faded too much. Whether they can stand up to a Ruth's Chris or modern steakhouse.. no. But its all about the tradition here. Service was good - although a bit distracted for being so early in the evening.

S1QFdD-PWFQcyJCuGcrYwg.text: One of my favorite places to have a fantastic meal while in Vegas.  Unfortunately it will only get 4 stars....when you get a long stemmed red rose, a Sommelier to help you with your wine pairing, 10 star outstanding service and food, one should not have to dine with people who wear cargo shorts and sandals to dinner, and look like they are eating at a trough.  Keep it classy and elegant.  Keep it a memorable moment because of the excellent food and service, and not because of the group of people that looked like they just got off the tour bus to the Hoover dam.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hugo&#39;s Cellar cut prime rib
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilled butter rose with cheese sprinkled lavosh
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_AVCjFJC-fAJRNSLLr-Dsg.text: Hugo's = Vegas Legend? Yes!  Hugo's = The REAL old school Vegas Experience? Yes!   Hugo's cellar is definitely one of the best restaurants I have EVER eaten in Las Vegas. We journey to Vegas multiple times a year and have tried many of the so called "best" in vegas spots via YELP/Tripadvisor.    Honestly, They dont compare to Hugos in price, service, ambiance, and quality of dishes. Hugos is a classic and I hope never changes. What folks need to realize, is that places like Hugos dont hardly exist anymore. So you better help keep these places alive.  A classic top notch service gourmet room in 2013? Nearly impossible to find. Hugos is one of the best in Vegas for their traditional menu (Old School but in a good way) offering Steak, Seafood,Prime Ribs, Beef Wellington, Chateaubriand and they succeed flawlessly in delivering excellent food and and service. Hugos You found customers for life.  Service: We were greeted in a warm and friendly manner. The waiters were professional and top notch.  Food was spaced and paced adequately and they had the mandatory 3 person wait staff present for all tables. They also prepared custom table-side salad for ALL orders. Do I want shrimp in that salad? Heck yes. Fresh cracked pepper? A must! I get to choose my toppings? My my my.   Food: Wife and I had the Prime Rib, which were excellent in terms of quality and price. The Prime Rib was cooked well and came with all the accoutrements. Solid piece not to mention the custom salad cart.   Bread: Warm and soft. They had really yummy bread. Probably shouldn't have filled up on it.   Atmosphere: Nothing fancy, but clean and orderly. It was probably the nicest spot in the 4 Queens Casino. Its downstairs by the poker tables if your lost.

UsdPCbDFkbgYzhhDBwj0YA.text: Need to find a place in downtown that is romantic? Then you have found the right place.  Located in The Four Queens on Fremont St, you walk down some stairs and walk into a lobby with a few tables and a fireplace with a fire going. Everything is dim and all by candlelight which I love immediately. I came here with a party of 6 for my Birthday dinner and there were 3 ladies (including me) in our group and we each got a rose! How sweet. We had a reservation for 630pm and we were promptly seated.  Our server was great and walking into this restaurant, you definitely get that old school vibe like how it was back in the 50's or 60's and that's how the server's were too. They wore tuxes and they were just a notch above. I ordered the Filet Mignon and it was cooked perfectly with a great juicy flavor. Oh yeah, and it was huge so definitely didn't finish it. LOL. When you order an entree, you get the pleasure of having a salad made at your table. It was a different guy that does this and he was hilarious! The salad was made just to how I like and it was great. After we were done with the salad, we were served sorbet to "cleanse our palates" and that was super tasty too! After our entree, we were served a selection of dessert items (chocolate covered strawberries, figs and apricots). And since it was my birthday, I got a slice of pecan cheesecake which was ridiculous! And I got sung too which made it even better!! Oh yeah and no cell service down here since it's in the "cellar". Kind of nice!  This restaurant is the epitome of old school Vegas style and the romantic feel of it is top notch. The food fits right in and the service was impeccable. I can not wait to come back with just the Hubs for a romantic date night!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8JSuJzEAR3PgBomw3kLXFg.text: My favorite place to eat. The place is beautiful and the staff is extremely friendly. You HAVE to try the Salmon.

Uwdno-Vip8RF68fwVTCXOA.text: Since it was the hubbys 50th birthday we decided to try something new on this visit to Vegas.  Reviews for Hugo's cellar were really good and the Chateaubriand and lobster for two sounded like just the ticket for our celebration. The setting is lovely, dark and romantic. The meal started off nicely with a wonderful salad served table side but unfortunately the experience went down from there.  We were quite excited when we saw the nice sized lobster tail and were fully ready to enjoy.  The steak was ordered mid rare and served medium and the poor shellfish was overcooked to the point that no amount of butter to dip it in was going to help.  The staff was semi solicitous and asked if we wanted replacements but we opted to just take our desert to go and make an end to the disappointing meal.

RqGSAvRp-otYcAVGJeI_Og.text: This could not have been a better experience. Service was impeccable. We were celebrating my niece's 21st birthday and this place was perfect. Kind of an "old school" classic steak house...my sister was ecstatic to find beef Wellington on the menu. We also loved the table side salad service and the chocolate dipped fruits that were included.  Just wish we had room for the banana foster! Or flambe...steaks and prime rib were perfect. The only thing I didn't love was the asparagus...I like mine with some crisp too it and it was a tad on the mushy overcooked side. We will definitely be back next time we are in vegas. My brother in law talked about it for DAYS.

ZyJXFCEj8Ib2GqBLKIVmjQ.text: OG "gourmet" room in Downtown Las Vegas. Favorite of residents and old-school gamblers. The only part of 4Q worth visiting. Gamble at the Golden Nugget or a Boyd property if you have to go downtown.

qgeLLomAAOBj_5Q_fxfwhQ.text: Truly one of the grand old dames of the Las Vegas scene.  It is certainly a throwback, but in the way.  Food/Drink: In the end, this is the most important right? Everyone at my table enjoyed their meal. I had the fish of the day, which was done perfectly, but can't comment too much on everyone elses.  The others in my parties got a Ribeye and some other cut of steak and both gave two monster thumbs up. The sides were perhaps a bit too rich, but nothing to really cause a downgrade.  Service: Service stuck out the most to me and really is what earned this the five star.  From the beginning they are extremely attentive.  The rose for the ladies was welcomed by all.  Additionally, we had a classically trained sommelier who was excellent and chose a wine that really actually complemented the meal, that was not even close to the most expensive on the menu.     Ambience: Classy place, dark (not too dark) and romantic.  I thought it had excellent acousitcs insofar as you knew others were in the restaurant but you could still talk at a nice level.    Price: $300 for four of us with a good amount of wine seemed extremely fair for the enjoyment we got from the night.  So it is pricey, but less so than most of the fancier steakhouses in town.  I definitely recommend for a special night out.

ibdl-0feTzlPY2rtmMmL6g.text: Great mix on the menu.  Never really thought of the salad being a big part of the meal, but will always look forward to the salad at Hugo's.

gouFL6rC11doZKkVH0fYOw.text: We returned to Hugo's Cellar for my boyfriend's daughter's birthday and were VERY disappointed in their service!  This is the first time I have ever had bad service.  We sat for almost 25 minutes before we got offered anything to drink and then we had to flag down Greg, the gentleman who serves the salad, and ask him where our waiter was and if he could just take our order.    Our waiter did not even bother to stop by until our food was brought out and even then he did not apologize about not helping us and just tried to drop the food off and run away.  Two of the steaks were cooked wrong, and of course one was the birthday girl's!  This is one of the only steakhouses in town that cooks steak the way my boyfriend and his daughter like it and she had never been to a nice steakhouse before and we really wanted her to experience what Hugo's usually offers.  They did offer to have the steaks fixed, but at this point we were all starving and wanted to eat together so they just kept them as they were.    Then all the waiters sang happy birthday to a big group at the front.  Mind you, when I made the reservation I told the hostess that we were coming to celebrate a young girl's birthday and asked if there was anything they could do and I was told she would get dessert.  Her birthday was not even acknowledged at all through out the whole dinner, not even when we were offered dessert!  When this happened after we had watched another table get the full birthday treatment and his daughter felt kind of left out or not very special he got up and walked away from the table to so he did not get upset with the waiter.  When the waiter asked if there was a problem I told him we are here for her birthday and wanted her to experience what we usually experience when we dine here and it has been anything but pleasant.  He didn't even say sorry and just walked away!!!    In the meantime, three other tables that were in our waiter's area were being totally ignored and one of them had been seated before us and got their food long after us.  I don't know if this waiter was new or what his deal was.  But his rude manners and lack of concern for his customers has made my boyfriend not ever want to return again, which makes me very sad as this is my favorite steakhouse!  I'm very disappointed in the service and how we were treated.  The food is still wonderful as ever, but for the price I can go anywhere else in town, even Olive Garden, and get better service than we got.

NTEL-2n608K5n0dcGBifug.text: Read what "Foodman" has to say in his Yelp review.  I usually go into detail, but he says it all.  If you love "Old World" recipes, values, approaches to refined dining (about as far removed from our cave ancestors as anything can possibly get and still remain carnivorous) or are just curious to see what it was like "back in the day"--then DO make a res. and enjoy an evening as relaxing as a day at a high-end Spa, as exciting as an evening at a Cirque performance of "O", as romantic as your first anniversary date, as satisfying and stimulating to the senses as your first whiff of "love sheets", but now I'm getting carried away...  Yes, it's expensive, but at least this time you'll feel you really got your money's worth.

7qDsOYyHp1E8jMLnAC37ew.text: I have dined at hugos since they opened many years ago but the last 5 years it has been doo doo as far as quality of food and service...except for John, the sommelier .   But, we have to keep taking our out of town friends there as they have memories there too.  Last time we dined there, there was glass in our salads....the waiter could care less and the manager came in 45 minutes because he also works acrossed the street.  he said he would take the cost of one salad of the check...anyway, if anyone had good service please tell me...I have to go there again on Friday and I want it to be special.

_39M1qA8qORl_jjNCD424w.text: Wonderful, elegant dining location.  We have been to Hugo's Cellar several times during our Las Vegas trips.  It is always a treat to dine there!!! The food is excellent, the staff are very professional. They treat everyone with the utmost respectfulness.  Their menu has a wonderful selection of tastes to satisfy most anyone's palate.  They grace each woman with a red rose upon arrival.  Great date place!

VuQLek1lSrOMYe0L84zaoA.text: Good thing its so hidden, not many tourists know about this place. It is the best romantic fancy restaurant i have been in so far. The whole place looks like a stone cellar from the old world, very romantic. ALl the ladies recieve a rose from the host and the service is just the best you can get.  The price is high.. BUT the food and the atmosphere is well worth it.  Make reservations, take your girlfriend or wife here!!

1pGVVpil57F7kPh6ezNrjw.text: This is a old world style romantic restaurant with great food and even better service. My husband took me here for Christmas dinner.  Ladies receive a rose after entering. Each entree comes with a big salad that you customize when they bring a rolling salad cart to the table. The food was great- lots of steak, lamb and veal choices. I am not a huge meat lover and I had a chicken dish that was surprisingly delicious. After dinner, we walked out of the casino and walked Fremont street. I like the Fremont street atmosphere much better than the main strip for walking around. Highly recommend for a romantic night out in Vegas.

D46S_vXScawtodav4qSVTw.text: My wife and I were trying to decide what we wanted for dinner so we took a drive to downtown. As we were walking around we remember a friend recommended this place. We did not have reservation, so we went to see if they had any open tables. We got there at 6:30pm and the host said he needed to wait until 6:45 to see if any reservations did not show up. So we decided to wait. At 6:40 the host said he had a cancel.   I like to rate my food items on a 5 star scale. The number of * is my ratings  What we ordered/items came with entrees: Caesar salad*, NY Sirloin*, Tomato/ pesto stuffed chicken*, dessert plate (we did not eat any of it)  Positives: Lemon sorbet that is served between the salads and entrees. No ordering of sides separately (also listed on negatives). Build your own salad tableside. Service for bread and water  Negatives: Atmosphere: Very dark, old feeling, and very small place. They have too many tables for the table side service for the salads and desserts. We sat at a table and when the gentleman was preparing the salads for the booths behind us he kept bumping into us.  Service: The waiter had broken English so it was hard to understand him. He did not make any recommendations. Right after we ordered the guy came to make our salads. The gentleman did not recommend any salad or describe any of the dressings. We heard him describing everything to the tables behind us after we ordered.   Food:  Salads- Terrible dressing was very very fishy (anchovies). Entrees- First, my steak. The steak seemed like it was from a cafe that serves the $1.99 steak and eggs. This was not a steak from an expensive steakhouse. My wife's chicken was something that you could also get at a cheap cafe.  Sides- This was very disappointing that the sides came with the entree instead of us being able to order what we want. The entree sides were a stuff tomato, veggies, and mashed potatoes.  This was the most disappointing places we have EVER been to. We have been to many expensive steakhouses and this by far is the WORST. We are locals there are many other great places to eat.

DCUkVr9YrTli4_RweoDNTQ.text: After looking for the "most romantic restaurant in Vegas" I came across a few on the strip, and then I saw Hugo's Cellar.  I was intrigued by the old-school charm it seemed to have, and the yelp and travel advisor reviews were all positive so I thought I'd give it a try.  The best part about this place is the location, the ambiance and the wait staff.  We were greeted sincerely, my wife was given a rose as we were seated.  The staff are all knowledgeable adults, not college kids looking to make a buck and move on.  My wife loved the dark, cellar like decor, and it was a great quiet place for a romantic dinner.  The food was really good, although I've had a better filet elsewhere, it was still delicious, and the portions were healthy.  After the bread, table side salad and sorbet palate cleanser, we were almost too full to even eat our entrees. But we managed.  Overall, I will definitely recommend this place, and probably be back for another special night out with my lady.

m_5Gr0C8CzHazGniL_lwcA.text: One of my favorite steakhouses in Las Vegas! Hugo's has been here for such a long time. Ladies get a red rose. The butter is in a shape of a rose. The steaks and appetizers are very good. I was very happy and come back as often as I can.

qx2Bv4CT4Yb68UQGESRlQA.text: Old school vegas. Booths sommeliers duck flambe filet mignon surf n turf all that. Great place where you expect to be treated well. Do yourself a favor and get reservations for your first dinner in Vegas here. This is how I always want to start my Vegas out. It's not in my choice of place on town but that's even part of the draw. You don't know till you try it, this is vegas at its heart. I'll be sad when it goes, much of the soul of old vegas is alive in this cellar.  Protip: if you like martini this is the place, it comes in a carafe on ice. Awesome.

xO5tSIk5D-aJeCCHqcJ3xA.text: I had such a wonderful time at Hugo's. My boyfriend selected this place for my birthday dinner and he hit it out of the park!  I received a lovely long-stemmed rose when we walked in. Table side salad preparation was superb. The sorbet palate cleanser is a nice touch. Entrees were delicious. I also really loved the fact that chocolate-dipped fruit was included, for dessert.  The other desserts presented to us looked delicious as well, but we were just too full to eat more.  We left Hugo's full and happy. Great food, impeccable service, and a very intimate feel/setting. We'll definitely be back soon.

xug71V-7tWE-Q_Jrvn_Qug.text: We tried Hugo's for the first time on Saturday.  The ambiance is great.  Low ceilings and very friendly and attentive staff.  It was what we expected from a place that is often described as "old Vegas."  We got the crab cakes and lobster bisque to start.  Loved the cakes, the bisque was not as big of a hit.  The famous salad cart came next.  The ingredients were good, but not great.  I will say the bleu cheese is of excellent quality.  A good, solid salad.  I ordered the ribeye and my wife got the filet with a bleu cheese topping.  I was surprised by the quality of the ribeye.  Not much marbling and just not a great cut.  My wife's filet on the other hand was fantastic.  The crust was excellent as well.  This steak was superb.  The garlic mashed on the side were also excellent.  The wine list is reasonable but not extensive.    Overall, it was the experience we hoped for.  You can get better food at a lot of places in town, but it was a wonderful night.

AZsnfa62bJOhDzVMBpfMFA.text: From beginning to end, this was a fantastic meal that was only outdone by the fantastic service. From the second we walked down the stairs, we were catered to as if we were royalty. My wife was given a rose at the front desk. We were seated immediately, and within moments, our server was taking our drink order. I chose a Manhattan and I am barely joking when I tell you that the pour was seven fingers with the portion that couldn't fit in the martini glass nicely stored in a bucket of ice for me. We then moved on to the appetizers of crab cakes and Gorgonzola stuffed portobello mushrooms. Both were delicious. Up next was the salad service, which was a True treat. Your server comes to the table and puts together your salad with whatever fixings you so desire. At this point we got to our main course of prime rib. The prime rib was so tender and so well cooked that a person with no teeth could have enjoyed it. The velvety touch of the cut was something you find so rarely these days. After our main course, they brought out a tray of chocolate dipped strawberries and figs which even a person like myself who was tragically born without a sweet tooth enjoyed. We ended the night with a cappuccino, which just was the final embellishment on a wonderful meal. I would have loved to try the bananas foster or cherries jubilee dessert, but one more ounce of food down my gullet and I might have died. I recommend reservations as this restaurant is very popular and after the service and quality of food I received, I can understand why they are so popular.

Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hugo&#39;s Cut Prime Rib

DgC_yvupPz23ykMFkEwjYg.text: this is an old school gem in downtown.  reminds me of the Mob days of vegas because you would never think this place that's downstairs in old downtown would cater to you like a 5 star strip restaurant.  Hugo's cellar was absolutely delicious ... starting off with the house salad is fantastic and then the entrees... I ha lobster stuffed with crab.  so good!  I love how they roll around with after dinner liqueurs as well

r8yVf1_rZYvbo1aSa5MTXQ.text: It was fine, the prime rib was good, and it was open late enough for me to get a meal.

AtvjRvrJXWDDXT4ZKDQPhw.text: Yes, the food is THAT good. Yes, the special touches such as free dessert and a rose are lovely. The tableside salad is spectacular. But the part that amazes me is the quality of service. It is flawless.

LpG5VRSOQ3JHbdddlS6VpA.text: The food, ambiance and service at Hugo's Celler is good, but not good enough to justify a $250 bill for a dinner for two, including one glass of wine each. I could easily have had a similar dinner at any one of a number of nicer properties in Las Vegas for $100 less than I paid at Hugo's. This restaurant, while nice, is simply overpriced for the venue (Four Queens on Fremont Street where street performers, zip lines and homeless people are just steps away outside the casino). I would expect to pay $250 for a nice meal at the Wynn or Encore or Bellagio, but not at the Four Queens. If I'm looking for a nice dinner out in Las Vegas in the future, I doubt I'll make reservations at Hugo's.

Q6g3CHBWFkhqkvQX01XxNw.text: We live in 'Vegas and I took my wife here for a romantic dinner. Good Choice. What exceptional Service. The atmosphere, just dark enough. Cocktails mixed with old school care. Food tasted delicious. Did I mention the Service? So very attentive. Made us feel special. Oh this was an expensive night for sure.... but no regrets. - 1 star because the Dress Code was not enforced. Extremely casually dressed Fremont Street tourists in shorts and tee-shirts with ball caps. We are not snobs, but the atmosphere bubble was burst. Still we will return.

Au0NpjMF-V47zGk5tvVpjA.text: Another local recommendation. When you walk in you are given a long stem rose. That rose then is placed in a vase at your table. One of the oldest steak houses in Vegas. Michael was our server and eloquently explained the menu. Hubs got the filet mignon and I ordered salmon. Both come with table side salad. Honestly this could have been my entire meal. About 11 items can be added to your salad. Everything from shrimp, onions, pine nuts, etc. Tremendous salad. Then lemon sorbet as an palate cleanser. Then our entree. My hubs also ordered a negroni. It was served in a carafe in a small bucket of ice. He absolutely loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xcujfpTA1hKVv915wJCoXw.text: Omg! Seriously! This place is brilliant.... service was impeccable, food amazing, martinis are served old school and generous!  I mean we got a 2.5 serving from one drink! My prime rib was HuGE and my husbands New York was sublime. Loved Greg, David and Teddie!!!  Love love love!!!  I think we had at least 4 amazing servers st all times!!!  Will come back soon!!!

h8JzBOYsiyGi0w6wO_0tig.text: If you are looking for a classic steakhouse experience with amazing food, colorful staff, and posh vibe this is the place.  While there are so many food choices in Vegas, we always include Hugo's in our plans.  The sommelier is great and love his stories.  The bartenders make a mean martini and who doesn't love a table side salad.  You get to choose whatever you want in your salad! Don't change a thing, we will be back!

Mg5aaDFNsq6bVRayi3HUyw.text: One of the best steakhouses in Las Vegas. I have not been here lately but last time I was here they gave all the women roses and the butter on the table was even shaped in roses. It was very delicious and had something on the menu for everyone. :)

6tU3vqUGZ5oJEZEjZIMixQ.text: Richard, Ivan, and David, along with the chef, and everyone else that helped was amazing.   I called Hugo's Cellar on June 17th preparing for my trip to Vegas for my mom's birthday. I requested a reservation on the 21st at 5pm. I then asked if they had any vegan options on the menu. I was told about 3 options, which after asking what kind of plant based cheese was used on two of the options, I was told it was dairy cheese. Not vegan.   Then I was told the chef sometimes can come up with something the day of. Well, the day came and my mom and I were running late. I called to let them know we would be about 30 minutes late, they were very nice and told us to take our time. When we arrived the host I spoke to on the phone knew exactly who we were and referenced a vegan meal the chef had prepared for me. I felt so special, not only because they give every woman a rose as they enter the restaurant, but because the chef went out of his way to prepare an entire meal that isn't on the menu for anyone else.  The meal consisted of zucchini alfredo made with nuts, ratatouille, and a side of asparagus and carrots.
