I wasn't sure if the bread was vegan, and I don't think there was a clearly obvious vegan salad dressing choice, so I skipped out on both if those.  The wait staff was incredibly attentive until it started to get busy. It started taking a while to get someone's attention. We unfortunately didn't have time to get my moms birthday dessert. :[   All in all, I give this restaurant 5 stars. My mom used to come here with my dad, for years. He passed away 15 years ago and I'm so glad I got to experience their favorite place in Vegas with my mom.   Thank you Hugo's for being so kind and accommodating!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roses given at the door
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh yeah
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan meal

Fco2C3aC076S-fsfCrWTTQ.text: First, let me highly encourage you get reservations... secondly, don't be a knucklehead like me and book for the wrong night. I felt like such a failure when my wife and I got all dolled up and prepared, and when checking in, realized I booked the wrong night. Hugo's didn't miss a beat, they moved some things around and got us in... That alone proved they were a great group.  If you're looking for old school fine dining and really want to feel like you're in an episode of Sopranos, hit up Hugo's. The environment is surprising, considering you are literally in the cellar underneath the loud, smoky world of table games and slots. The gentlemen at the door immediately greeted my wife with a rose, which was placed at the table when we were sat. I loved the entire experience, I loved how they built salads at the table, utilized a team of waitstaff to provide specialized care and truly a first class meal. Food was excellent and likely my favorite fine dining experience my wife and I have ever enjoyed.   I plan to come back next time the wife and I are in Vegas and she wants to get fancy, before I blow all my money at the tables.

o-1J3viu6o_ZYbDSrWYCkg.text: This is an Old School Vegas Classy Romantic restaurant.  When I wanted to take my wife on a romantic dinner I asked several local natives where to go.  I have lived here for a little over a year.  They said go to Hugo's.  I did.  It did not disappoint.  Excellent food.  Amazing service.  Everything was perfect.  I had a ribeye, my wife the filet.  They were so good. I like the side table salad prep they do here.  It's amazing.    The casio Hugo's is located in is kind of dumpy, but don't let that fool you.  When you walk down stairs into Hugo's, you enter a whole different experience.  If you do have the pleasure to take a date here, consider going to Mike Hammer's show after you eat.  I saw him last night and really had a good time.

9NimyCo7P5Mxk2S2-RwMLA.text: I love to try new places. But when it comes to a special occasion, I only trust the staff at Hugo's Cellar. Jamie is the best server. Always great with suggestions. But the winner is always their Chilean Sea Bass. There is some magic in their kitchen because it comes out PERFECT every single time.  The table side salad is a nice touch. You know these guys are saying the same thing to every table all night long but you never feel like its robotic. They are still engaged and courteous.  I always recommend this place to friends celebrating a milestone in life!

uXkpF_SvTkj_1k6G0UIYtQ.text: The service is always great. The quality of the food has been declining. We came in January and again in July. There were four of us who didn't complete our dinners. The ribeye steak was tough, the rack of lamb had a weird tasting sauce, the Chilean sea bass wasn't anything special or good, and the veal was dry. The wine sommelier never checked on how we liked the wine. Very disappointing dinner. The waiter apologized but we still paid the $400 bill.  Don't think we'll return after patronizing for 20 years.

Ls969K1ab2rDZh3LYL42Dw.text: If they had more stars I would give them more impeccable service, generous drinks,recommend the hot rock appetizer, we had scallops that were perfect,Veal was tender and juicy,the serve staff was on point,pricey but worth it

Qf4e8EApCwuR7mnY1LrBkA.text: I had the surf and turf for dinner and it was very good. Dinner comes with a salad and a starch. I recommend the garlic mashed potatoes. The escargot was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot

eeaxazkKc9V2rgytU8Pj5A.text: Service and Atmosphere was amazing and romantic. Our server Fredrick was the best thing about the night. Unfortunately they do not have many options if you are on a dairy free, low carb, no meat diet.

zspntLdOjVQ_Gnq14qTHxg.text: This is traditional. Rags steakhouse done right. Pretty sure most of the wait staff served the Rat Pack. Not over interested in witty repartee but committed to serving you as rarely seen these days. They are tuxed' up and take their occupation serous whether your in a suit or cut-offs and flip flops. Traditional salad made at table by wait staff. Meat cart to select your cut after explaining. You want something special or different (like wife wanting blu cheese melted and torched on her steak) they accommodate. It's in the basement and you feel like your getting away with something and Joe Pesci May walk in at any moment. Steak was awesome (ribeye) spot on temp and well marbled. We got there a little early to purposely hang at the old school Bar and have high-ball. If you want the whole experience of Vegas - Hugo's baby. If you don't agree I will fight you.

0kk-GHSrvrP-uw7_hy0fTg.text: We had planned on visiting Hugo Cellar with a group of co-workers that had gone to Vegas for the weekend. We decided to splurge [we can all splurge every once in a while] and enjoy this fine dinner. Splurge is the the best word to describe this place and not just because of the prices. The treatment is superior to your standard night out.   First the girls were presented with a rose. The host was very cordial and gives you some of the long history that Hugo Cellars has enjoyed. You can imagine Sinatra, Dean Martin and many of those personalities sitting in the same seat you may have sat tonight.   To start a Sommelier came to see about our wine list. Pretty simple so the girls got a bottle of white while I preferred a glass of red with my dinner. Rest of the boys had drinks.   We ordered our dinner as baskets of bread and butter were put on our table. Our waiter explained that the meals here are NOT al carte. It includes salad, the meal and dessert. As soon as we had ordered our meals the second waiter [we had two] came over and prepared our salads for us right at the table. Each of us got to pick our items which I was glad because some of the members of our group hardly put anything while I put in almost everything, including some anchovies. As soon as our salads were done, they came out with some small cones of lemon sorbet to cleanse the palate.   Dinner came out and it was prepared excellently. My beef wellington was super tender and delicious. I think we all had the garlic mashed potatoes which was a great choice. My wife and daughter ordered the rib-eye and both looked at the their dinners at the end of the meal and realized that they should have shared. Neither got to half their steak. Some guy on Fremont Street asked for some change and got about $80 in food. Its Vegas Baby!   After the meal, some desserts were brought out at no charge, they included some chocolate covered straweberries, some dried apricots dipped on a bed of chocolate and baby figs with some whip cream. But they also brought some upscale desserts that looked great but we were all stuffed.  They added 18% gratuity because we had a group of 7 which makes it easier anyways but if there was one complaint was that I handed the waiter $200 and put the rest of the groups meal on my credit card. There were some incorrect charges on my card as part of the cash was used to increase the tip. Don't know where the mistake happen so when I saw my bank statement I was preparing for a fight but the GM Richard said he would call me back the next day and he did just as he had promised. He was polite and resolved the issue quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect inside: pink but not bloody.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time having the Beef Wellington
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They made my salad at the table; you put what you want on it.

Hw-uAFVvrt3_YUUQ3alvKg.text: Can we be a little nicer, less arrogant?  One of my favorite places in all of Vegas for over 30 years. I love that it's one of the last remnants of the old Downtown with a quaint underground feel, and lord, some of the best steaks and salad offerings in town. I've probably come 50 times and now I bring new friends and clients from time to time.  Except that I always run the risk of a super arrogant, dismissive host saying something offensive when we step to the entry. It's even worse on the phone IF there is no reservation available. Just incredibly snippy and arrogant. Over and over and over.  I think there are two different older gentlemen who take turns being particularly dismissive. When you call in and there is no reservation it's almost as if you're a fool for not booking sooner. Sometimes they act like they ARE Hugo.  Love, love, love this place and I'm not giving up any time soon. But I had a group of eight friends in town and I chose to go to Del Friscos just because I didn't want to risk being embarrassed or pissed off.  I like my steak medium rare. Can I get the host at medium arrogant?

RaAlMNUPzJSy3i-c2Ys4Hw.text: Great classic ambiance, when you go downstairs it's like you're stepping back a little to a quieter time - no other way to describe it.  The rose for the lady was a very nice touch...  Menu isn't overwhelming and everything is delicious.  Don't pass up the prawns wrapped with prosciutto- crunchy and delicious with the prawns staying light and moist. Making salads tableside was a fun spin and everything is nice and fresh.  The duck dinner entree is one of the best preparations of the dish I have ever had.  This place is a little off the beaten path from the current "modern" Vegas but worth the ride.

EFDZnuIlSHt5Etaw7AKhEA.text: Let me start with, I hate Las Vegas.  I refer to it as "have" to be here for work. I have a favorite, off strip burger place I wanted to go to but my wife wanted to try Hugo Cellar so we compromised and did what she wanted.   This place is such an experience.  The rose at the door, old school look, the servers are not just good, they are personable, not robo-service that is fake.    The salad was fun, my Manhattan was kept chilled because the drink was huge I had it as an after dinner drink.    Then the steak.  Not dry aged so I can't compare it to dry aged steaks but one of the better I have had out.  And they cooked it perfect, black and Blue or Pittsburgh.  The only other place I have been that cooked it this perfect was actually called "black and blue."  We tried the cherries jubilee and it was interesting. Not really my style dessert but part of the entire experience.   So wonderful meal, full belly, you walk out up the stairs and remember you were in this weird oasis in the middle of some crappy, old school casino with people smoking and weird smells.  And realize what they have to do to keep Hugo's Cellar so cool.   The only negative is they need Luxardo cherries for that Manhattan.

aWXMcO-L3LhUCpCdJwIBxg.text: I come here for one reason: Dean the Bartender. One of the nicest, funniest, and most experienced bartenders I've had the pleasure of meeting. I never know what to get so he asks me what I'm craving. I'll give him an answer like fruity, chocolate, etc, and he'll make me one of the best cocktails (or specialty martinis) I've ever had. Do yourself a favor and head down to the bar and enjoy some great drinks and friendly conversation.

PZ2lBUMefYzWX-D8no6TbQ.text: Wow cutest little hidden gem ever.  So much character.  Food was so delicious. Cute salad cart. Fabulous wine list. Amazing meal.  Will come back!

RkoHmXwFe3QTH23Bams9GA.text: We (2 30 something couples) decided to go here after all the reviews. As people have mentioned, the ambience and service are incredible. Everyone is so professional and hospitable. They definitely know what they are doing and give great tips on what to order if you are perplexed. The salad was probably my favorite part of the meal- I could eat that ranch dressing at every meal. We got the escargot, which was great and very rich. The reason I'm not giving 4 stars is that I ordered the double filet with foie gras, as did my boyfriend, and his was rare but I couldn't tell the difference with my medium order. We were crunched for time so I didn't ask for them to fix it though, and I'm sure they would have. I am definitely coming back here, especially when we can take longer time.

kcCHgqVvHsqO3uMin10rYw.text: I love Hugo's, the salad cart is my favorite part! I had the sea bass and it was delicious. I took off one star because the wait staff needs to be better informed about gluten allergies; when I ordered the sea bass and told him I was gluten sensitive, he said I couldn't eat the garlic mashed potatoes. I asked him what they put in the potatoes that was gluten and he responded "Oh, we put butter on almost everything...."  But the food is delicious, the staff is so friendly and you get a rose when you go. What more could you ask for? :)

SXMVdLnY_ZKwlqz33bWITQ.text: Hands down amazing place! Great food and the service was even better. Went there last night to witness one of our friends propose to his GF. Very classy place, we'll definitely go back again and be regular diners from this hidden gem  of Las Vegas.

sMVzrchc9yIxe9u8cRxXFQ.text: A lovely underground jewel in a not so popular casino.  We had reservations however were seated next to the door to the bar.  In and out in and out door opening and closing.  And...the ice bucket for all of the tables near us was next to our table.  Crunch crunch crunch - so much for ambience.   The food?  Lovely!  We had a filet mignon that was perfectly cooked.  Bearnaise sauce - could I get a bathtub full and soak in it?  Yum.    My husband and I shared the meal - no extra charge for 2 salads and an extra side.    Our martinis were served with an extra carafe - making an equivalent of 2 drinks.   The meal ended with complimentary dessert.    The waitstaff was very attentive.  And...all ladies get a rose!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert!

LjsCEz0ercgDVPqNAmF4OA.text: Best steak dinner in Vegas! The atmosphere is old school and the staff is so attentive and knowledgeable. We've been coming to Hugo's for years and we have never been disappointed. Don't be afraid to let the sommelier guide your wine choice, both on staff are amazing and know the wines like the back of their own hands.  Only thing I'd change is the rose to each lady....while sweet, you find them littered throughout the casino and carrying a rose around is a bit annoying :)

mdmqKpV_23Mw6p23OduEFw.text: My wife and I dined here to celebrate our two year wedding anniversary. If you want to step back in time and experience Las Vegas dining before the uber expensive restaurants on the strip started becoming the norm, come here. The restaurant is inside the Four Queens, a few steps down below from the bustling casino floor.   Once you get to the bottom of the stairs, you are presented with a dim, old school, romantic restaurant. We arrived 30 minutes early, but were seated right away. But before we started walking back to our table, my wife was presented with a very gorgeous long stemmed red rose, quite a nice touch for starting a romantic dinner.  We started with Hugo's Scampi to share and chose the Chateaubriand and lobster for two for our main course. For some reason, the appetizer took quite some time to come out. A number of servers did apologize a number of times for the wait. We were served our salad a short time later, still waiting on the appetizer. The appetizer showed up right when we finished our salads. The scampi was good, just a little confusing how four shrimp took so long to be served.  Our main course was served a few minutes after our appetizer was delivered. The Chateaubriand and lobster were presented on a large platter table side. The meat is sliced and the lobster removed from its shell. We ordered the chateau medium rare, but it was more towards medium/medium well, almost like it sat under a heat lamp for a little too long? Regardless, it was still tasty, just didn't make quite as big an impression as a chateau usually does.  We were presented with chocolate covered strawberries after our main course, but were given a small chocolate mousse cake by the chef for our anniversary. A very nice touch and the cake was absolutely delicious. We tried to finish the cake because it was so good, but at that point, we were ready to pass out from the meal. Thank you to the staff who paid attention to my reservation notes.

aTxNFW1otEALGjmBDrt61Q.text: Had a great meal here. You can tell this place has had it nailed for a while! I had the lamb and had no complaints. Most others had the NY strip and liked it. Had a few bites of the cheesecake and OMFG it was good! Great service and reasonably priced. We had a few great bottles of red wine and the total bill for 7 people was about $500. Highly recommend!

aYBaZd1fnh6vn4tug6UHOQ.text: We always make this restaurant one of our stops whenever we come to Las Vegas. The experience stars with a rose for the ladies. The salad experience at your table is second to none. There are 15+ choices of additions to make your salad a one of a kind. You can't go wrong with ordering any of their main courses as everything is 5 star here. Don't bother ordering dessert as they give you a delicious complimentary fruit platter at the end of your meal. Be sure to make reservations or you will be disappointed. Very popular restaurant.

sT_TukY-U4L_HwgaZ0T19w.text: I searched to the ends before my dining here to make sure I got a top rated restaurant to eat dinner at, and I found Hugo's.  It's located right by their other restaurant and you go down a few stairs.  The ambience is romantic with dim lights and leather booths.  The waiters are dressed nicely and the presentation of the food was very nice.  However, I just did not like my dinner, nor did my mother.  I felt as though my food was not very fresh, and I thought m hopes would be renewed for dessert with the strawberry plate but that wasn't fresh either.  In all my years, I won't be back because I am just afraid of spending top dollar again and having the same experience and I can not afford that.  Again, my review is subject only to my experience, someone else could have ordered something completely different and had a much better dinner.

2ccSbSSTsB70g7i9i38S3Q.text: Four of us had Valentine's Day dinner, this place just rocks it! We had stuffed mushrooms with Gorgonzola cheese and balsamic vinegar plus a cold seafood platter with Lobster, Scallops and Prawns both were fantastic. They made our salads at table side and server was fantastic at making it as well as making it sound appetizing and entertaining. For the main course two of us had Prime Rib and two had steaks that were aged and cooked to perfection not a single complaint all night. When the bill came the bartender had put two cocktails for another table on our bill and were apologetic and quick to remove them, it appears to be an honest mistake. The girls each received a long stem rose when we arrived that they took with them as well as a platter of chocolate covered strawberries and apricots. Top quality! We'll be back on our next visit.

VFv8Q51LE_X1qaRa6hfF0w.text: I would not recommend Hugo's Cellar - there are so many better choices in the area. Some people claim a "Godfather" ambience, but I just felt a dated, dreary, basement. The prices are high and the food was mediocre at best. The service was just meh - maybe because I came in a group of 12 so they knew they were getting their guaranteed gratuity. I got the Beef Wellington, it came out overdone and was definitely nothing to write home about. The worst part, though, was the table-side salad service. For a party of 12 it is just ridiculous to hear the same set of toppings-related questions twelve times! The salads ended up looking like something you'd find in a school cafeteria anyway. I left feeling thoroughly unimpressed.

43wlM8W4efq699gPCkXwZg.text: Excellent, wonderful, and tasty! Absolutely fell in love with Hugo's Cellar yesterday! We came here for an intimate dinner before seeing a show at the Smith Center and were wowed every single minute of our meal.  The food starting with the artichoke and spinach dip (+crab meat) was outstanding! The crab was tender and they didn't jip us on the crab meat! Just enough without taking away from the taste of the dip. The salad is great! I had the creamy pepper dressing (similar to ranch) and it was delicious. Made to your liking... awesome! By the time our actual entree came we were ready! I had the Veal Oscar which is perfection. If you like veal or want to try it, get this dish! Also, your meal comes with chocolate dipped fruit, and IT IS GOOD. But if you are too much like me and my boyfriend you'll get a cheesecake to send you over the edge! Absolutely delicious and creamy.  Our drinks were great, they even serve you a whole drink and pour it in the rocks for you so you're actually getting enough alcohol. Hard to find in Las Vegas.  The presentation of everything is divine. A rose for every Lady to put on your table. The servers and wait staff are extremely pleasant. Oscar and Carlos were wonderful they really are a great representation of this restaurant.  Would absolutely recommend this place over and over again. Loved every minute of it. A great meal and beautiful ambiance, the Old Las Vegas feel is all over this great underground nook.  Great for date night or even a girl's night! Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Oscar served to perfection!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My delicious salad with Bay shrimp, egg, tomato, cheese, and creamy pepper dressing.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach and Artichoke dip with crab meat, excellent!

xRmMXPjfCMHdXw3ULKWZtg.text: We have been here twice now and really enjoyed both times. I recommend starting off with a raspberry lemon drop martini, its like 3 cocktails for the price of one. The salad they make table side is delicious and could be a meal in itself. I loved the filet and shrimp with peppercorn sauce and highly recommend it.  Our waiter was Oscar and he helped make our experience really special.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Booth at Hugo&#39;s Cellar.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert that comes with each meal
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet and shrimp with peppercorn sauce

Hx7RIqUwrmHWjD4dvkaTZA.text: Was there with my Vegas friends and had a great time. The table side side salad is the best!!!! enjoyed the service a lot and pricing is very good for the quality of their product, same goes to their wine list, good and priced right! Personally, I like duck and that is what I ordered....very good!  My only suggestions to management at Hugo's is the fact they do not split tickets at the table, they take two credit cards but they do not split bills, that is not very consumer friendly EVERY restaurant does it but they don't....making VERY complicated for a group to figure out who is what! Every POS has the facility, I think they are just difficult!  Will be back just because of the quality of the food and service!!!!

UmLUjj5OKbJHlejMDEnRwQ.text: It was recommended by so many guests and has earned 4.7 stars so we choose Hugo's cellar ( or rather musty basement) for a special night. It was supposed to be a touch of class, upscale, romantic, elegant restaurant, but it is not even close to that. First it's located underground of 4 Queens old casino, and with old (fake) brick wall, musty smell of a carpet and decor and stuffed with the cigarette smoke coming from the casino, the whole place is more kitschy and tacky that anything else (even more with roses for ladies at the entrance). Secondly, food is far too overpriced. $62 for seafood trio consisting of 2 shrimps, 2 scallops, 1 crab cake. The crab cake tasted so weird, (couldn't identified spices in it) and a lobster bisque was too salty. To make long story short, this was our first, last and never again time.

a6fMNB0AVxwEAxykhTR84w.text: We really were not impressed with this restaurant.  Our friends suggested this place for a great dinner (they were with us and very embarrassed at the quality of the food).  First off the dress code is not upheld so that was the first disappointment as we had dressed up and were expecting a very nice dinner experience.  Some people were dressed in just a printed tee shirt and jeans. That would be okay if you were going to a low end restaurant but was not expecting that. The ladies are given a nice red rose that was a nice touch. We had waited a very long time before our waiter actually took our order.  They didn't have any fresh off the menu special.  We had the shrimp cocktail and it was very good would have it again.  The table side prepared dinner salad was actually the best part of the dinner.  As for the food when it arrived that is where the biggest disappointment was, we had ordered two of the ribeye and they were not good!  It looked like something you would get from Denny's and only pay $12-$15 and not $58 the others had a New York steak and the Duck and it was not bad.  They do provide a nice deserts platter after the dinner and that was very nice and fresh.  I am sure many years ago this place was top notch but it has definitely had better days.

4FyQQFTLdRj7y8ChSmwIGg.text: Hugos Celler is definitely the atmosphere of old Las Vegas!! The food there is excellent I have been there many many many of times and have never had bad service or bad food I recommend the rock appetizer because it is spectacular!!! If you're in old downtown Las Vegas Hugos Celler is the restaurant to be at.

K1JO_WJzF5TRWh5wqKJiuA.text: Very memorable meal! The food and service were impeccable. Will be going every time we visit Las Vegas.

vsX1r81inYqBQ1J3zxMpkA.text: I brought my wife here for her 40th birthday. We were seated promptly in a rear booth with sagging cushions and a view of the salad cart. After our waiter ignored us for a while someone finally came around to take our order. The shrimp cocktail was good. We had to ask repeatedly for our salad, which was mediocre at best. Limp lettuce and canned artichokes, etc. The steak (filet mignon and powerhouse) were average at best...something you'd get at a family style restaurant in the suburbs someplace. We then had to practically beg for the check to get out of there. I would not return.

wEZwaeYP2nnA7HMVK59CmQ.text: I'd like to pretend I was savvy enough on my own to figure out that Hugo's would be a good spot to visit during our visit to Vegas, but a friend recommended we check it out.  We were a bit leery of what the "business casual" attire meant for us (friends of ours were not seated at a different restaurant on the strip the day before), but our basic assumptions for what it meant held up:  don't wear flip flops or clothes with holes.  Hugo's might be less of a sleeper than it used to be, but it's still pretty surprising that you can find a $5 craps table under the same roof as this amazing place.  A visit to this restaurant was not just a meal, but a True experience.  John the sommelier's charm and fun storytelling was one of the highlights, along with the rest of the great service and impeccable dishes.  This place is a pleasant relic of days past, legitimized by the longstanding tenure of the staff (several of them have been there for decades, they had said).  Some of the other unique features included custom tableside salads and the fact that the meals here are actual full meals (salad/sorbet palate cleanser/choc covered fruit for dessert), not just the "a la carte" one might expect at a higher end restaurant.  Also, there are no meat portions smaller than 10 oz, so don't expect dainty plates.  Steaks and seafood stuck out on the menu, and our server's suggestion to add a half order of the "Queen's Lobster" was a great one, as I paired this with the 10 oz NY strip.  The steak was great, the lobster was even better, and there was even a special dessert dish brought out to us since we got married the day before.  This was the one stop we had on our list on Fremont Street, and it was well worth the trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chocolate lava cake - perk of being newlyweds.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10 oz NY strip and half order of Queen&#39;s Lobster!

22bDSZvvkBw4EdMxDqUHzA.text: I like this place for nestalgic reasons.  The food is ok.  The service is good.  The ambiance is fun.  It's a little dated but that's ok.  Don't expect nuevo cusine.  Steaks, seafood, a salad cart and waiters in black tuxes.  The sorbet in a mini cone cracks me up everytime.

G7R_Xdbb-h0TO5S3HEpYKQ.text: Every lady deserves a rose.   And that's what Hugo's gives you.   Additionally, a candle lit dinner in a romantic setting, many men to wait upon you, and exceptional food. What more could a girl ask for?

rrIrV_aFruPcfIQoJZlyEQ.text: One of the better kept secrets of Las Vegas, you'd probably never know about this place unless a friend told you about it (like me!).  Tucked underneath the Four Queens Hotel in downtown Las Vegas, this place is the ultimate old school "wine and dine" your woman joint (complete with a complimentary rose for the lady).  One of the things I like most about this place is that you actually have a snowflakes chance in hell of bringing your own wine to enjoy here (as long as you're cool to the sommelier and don't make a scene about it).  No chance of doing this on the Strip.  Did I mention "old school"?  They bring the salad cart to the table and prepare it a la Lawry's style right in front of you.  Beware of eating too much of this as it's definitely a meal in itself.  The steaks here are aged just right and don't disappoint.  The lamb is excellent as well.  I tried a bite of the sea bass once and it was pretty damn good.  The service is impressive and don't be surprised if you get someone who's practically lived and worked there his entire life.  It's really cozy (get a booth), schedule plenty of time here to relax and enjoy your meal, and get to know your server as they have all sorts of stories to share w/ you if you wish.  Definitely an older crowd plus a lot of regulars so if you want glam, stick to the Strip....but if you want a unique old school Vegas experience, this is definitely it.  Pricing is what you'd expect for LV but maybe a little cheaper.  Make a reservation in advance for sure, especially if you're coming from the Strip.  Nothing sucks worse than paying taxi fare only to find you're paying another taxi the same on the way back hungry.

9BRJA6YpmFsJYli0QJYJgA.text: More like a 3.5...We decided to hit downtown because we'd never seen the old Vegas.  We went, we saw, we ate, and we left.  I am not sure the scene is for me but the saving grace is definitely Hugo's Cellar.  This place was packed with a variety of folks and the atmosphere was classic and romantic.  It definitely looked like it had not been updated in 20 years with the blue tableclothes and blue tapestry on the chairs.  I took my rose as I walked in the door and we were seated on time for our reservation.    All in all, the food was good...not mind blowing but good.  It is honestly more about the atmosphere than the food and that is what we wanted on the first night of our trip.  I loved, loved the tableside salad.  It was purely delicious with creamy peppercorn dressing and all of my favorite toppings.  I had to stop myself from eating the whole thing so that I could enjoy my entree.  My husband had the Filet Atlantis and I had the Seabass prepared with crab and shrimp sauce.  Mine was alright but I would probably go for the meat if you dine here.  My husband's steak was cooked perfectly medium rare and had a nice flavor.  Being from Texas, we get good meat all the time and while his steak was good, it was not the best cut I have had.    We finished our meal with the complimentary chocolate dipped strawberries that were divine!  Oh, and another great thing is that the wine list is priced extremely well.  The value far exceeds most restaurants in Vegas.  We ordered an $85 bottle of Jordan Cabernet, which is a steal in a restaurant.  And, the Sommilier was quite charming with his British accent and all.  If you are looking for something different from the strip, Hugo's is a good call.

vnqLyw3amBKLlYUo5L26vw.text: This palce is very interesting. My boyfriend brought me here as a surprise, and well... walking there I was definitely a bit shocked. The hotel is kind of old and dinky and as I walked by the Subway and TCBY signs I was definitely wondering, "Where the HECK are we going?"   But once there I was so pleasantly surprised! The ambience is great. The welcome rose was a hit for sure! The food was definitely a bit pricey, but you get sooo much for it (and compared to the rest of Vegas a steal).  My bf and I aren't huge eaters so we just shared an appetizer and one entree. The bread and cheese toasted lavash was really good and of course they refill it as soon as you are done. Also, they must have some job description as "water-filler" because I don't think my glass of water was ever more than 1" from the rim! They just kept refilling it, after a while I had to stop drinking water or else I wouldn't have had room for the food.  The hot marble slab appetizer (with 2 pieces of filet, 2 pieces of swordfish, 2 pieces of chicken, and 4 shrimps) was SO amazingly good. I don't know how they get everything to cook so soft and tender when they do it right in front of you. The selection just must be very quality.  The salad that comes with the meal = awesome! I loved the idea of making food in front of you and they do it was such bravado. Our entree was the shrimp scampi and well it was so yummy, but I was trying to save room for the dessert! Complimentary raspberry sorbet and chocolate dipped apricot, figs, and strawberries with fresh cream.  Overall I have to say it was such a great and fun experience that made me forget I was in flash Las Vegas.  Thanks yelp! My bf said he chose it from here :D and I am so glad I got to go.

tjuCml6s22f9IEhnhTyOag.text: Go there!!! Order the Blue cheese crusted Rib eye. Get a table-side salad (customized to your liking) and take advantage of their two sommeliers on staff. Most of the employees have worked there for over 20 years and they know their sh*t. They're super witty, classy, and hilarious.  I went with my girlfriend, and another couple. In total (the four of us) we ordered two steaks, two lovely bottles of wine, two apps (crab cakes and shrimp cocktail) and two table side salads (then split). I think we dropped $320 all together. The experience was wonderful and we'll definitely return.   Enjoy.

SFMRCHjcW5fjsA0Erky3PA.text: Great experience.  NY strip steak well prepared and tasty, sides great, and the salad excellent.  Great service including an extra complimentary dessert to celebrate our occasional. Price was consistent with the level of quality and service.  Don't overdress -- we wore coat and tie and dress and probably the only ones in the place.  Business casual would have been fine or a sport jacket.  I'd go back, great steak!

dpDPeI2II2V7vctGt74YeQ.text: This is definitely a solid 4, the food was very good, and the service just the right amount without being overbearing.    My only concern is the table salad service.  Yes it is nice to have a salad made at your table with your choice of fixings and dressings, but unfortunately that also limits your selection.  For example, they only have three types of dressing, I would prefer that  a nice generic salad be made in the kitchen where they could have serveral type of dressing available.

boUvifCbFwfU2QR0aa-Iqg.text: Hands down one of our favorite places in Vegas. From the time you walk in the door till you walk out, you are showered with hospitality. Victor the gentleman who prepared our salads table side was by far the most amazing person we have met in Vegas. The food is amazing and cooked exactly as asked. We definitely will make this a regular stop while visiting Vegas!  We stepped back into time while enjoying great people and great food!

MemRJ7L9jS3BOngZnWeYlQ.text: I absolutely love Hugo's Cellar! I had dinner here during my bachelor party, and let me tell you, some of us guys can't stop talking about the meal we had here. Okay, it was mainly the amazing salad (mixed at your table, to your specifications) that grabbed our attention. But, the rest of the meal and spirits were great as well.  Well, from what I can remember (in between shots of Patron), I had a great salad and steak. The salad (did I mention it was amazing?!) was fabulous. Okay, maybe it was just the alcohol was talking at this point, but we all thought the salad was wonderful! Besides being made in individual portions and with whatever we liked, it was tossed thoroughly and not overwhelming in the dressing department at all. My steak was cooked well, seasoned just right, and helped combat the alcohol demons coursing through my veins at the time. Just remember that saying, "Beer before liquor..."  Like many of the other reviews state, this place is kitschy and 'old school' in terms of the decor. Set in the basement of the Four Queens Hotel in downtown Las Vegas, this place is something straight out of a 50s, 60s, or 70s movie. It's rather dark inside, but that only serves to heighten the mood: cool and chill. I felt like a high-roller in this place. It's classy and sophisticated...even though you're in the heart of Sin City itself! Service was top-notch and overall, we had a spectacular meal.  I highly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys good food and doesn't mind having to travel 'off the strip' in order to get it.

NiFqmvFbSDsT_cGqIsSp7Q.text: Wonderful steak house located in the Four Queens, downtown. My date and I shared the Chateaubriand for two which came with lobster tails. An impressive hunk o' cow was carved at our table, the lobster tails were de-shelled and the veggies were plated in front of us from a silver platter. My only minor whine is the food should have been a little hotter and the beef was slightly undercooked, but everything tasted great.    Love the rose they give the ladies, the tableside salad service is fun and the serving is very generous, and the dessert plate at the end with chocolate covered strawberries, figs and apricots was a classy and unique finish.  We prefer slightly sweet wines and the sommelier recommended a wonderful Reisling that we thoroughly enjoyed.  A very retro 70's atmosphere with brick walls and romantic lighting and oil paintings on the walls. The service from our wait staff was quite good as well.  A much better value than most steak shops located on the Strip (with the exception of The Steak House at Circus Circus, which is still the best in town IMHO).

3dVOFbJ5p6aYQk52P_04XA.text: Another 5-star experience at Hugo's Cellar. The meal was perfect, as was the service.  This is a #1 dining spot for me and my wife.

tWqkUpqn-SBfokIEnJHKYw.text: Yes, it's expensive.  But, for the meal, everything is included, and it's just such a lovely experience.  The wine somalier is not too snooty, and everyone we encountered was very nice, accommodating and pleasant.  From the second you walk in and are handed a rose, to the moment you finish that last chocolate covered strawberry or fig, you are treated to an experience!!  Tables are cleared promptly, including crumbs so that you don't have to worry about dropping a piece of lettuce and it sitting there the entire time lol.  Thanks Hugos! Another lovely time.

cAaouogPyc1_XRpu-3BYGQ.text: Great place to spend a few hours at, so more of a dining experience. Kind of out of place downtown, but still a great atmosphere away from the downtown chaos.  Dinners range from 40 to 60 bucks but that is misleading because you get a Huge table side salad where you pick the toppings + bread + 2 sides + sorbet to cleanse your palate + dessert sampler = Great bang for your buck.  Recommend hitting the mob museum for a few hours then dinner here for another few hours and you have a whole night of entertainment!

KbINq9GOQjJCjRWy_zwpJw.text: This is old school Vegas at its finest. Romantic ambiance. Roses for the ladies & great food. The custom salad chef was terrific.  It's quite a bit of food - especially given the price! This is a must-do for Vegas.

ISIHENi-gizkOfqhNhHaxA.text: My bf took me here for our anniversary, and we loved it! I'll organize my thoughts so it's easy to follow...  ATMOSPHERE: Romantic but a bit "old." Most people there are in their 40's - 60's, but don't let that stop you from going. Try to get a booth if you're there with your significant other to make the meal more romantic :)  FOOD: Wonderful! I ordered the sea bass which was slightly seared and served on top of crab meat and shrip. My bf ordered the duck with wild rice and he absolutely loved it! The great thing is, included in your meal is a salad (made in front of you), a palate cleanser (lemon sorbet) and dessert (chocolate covered strawberries, apricots, and figs). They actually make part of the meat and some of the dessert table side, which is fun.  SERVICE: Great! Service usually makes or breaks my dining experience, and the service here was top notch.   OVERALL: Great atmosphere, food, and service. Not much more you can ask for!

ljX-9fSARPKTmHea0CFw9g.text: You have to eat here at least once in your life if you frequent Vegas.  It's under the Four Queens Hotel like a bomb shelter.  It's very dark and romantic.  Every woman who enters gets a rose from the host.  The table side salad is to die for and I'm not a salad guy.  They basically roll this cart over and you choose the toppings........  Tons of baby shrimp please.....  The food is wonderful and if you take a date there you'll impress him/her.  You'll also get the old mafioso feeling in the clubby environment.

cAuuwoxilBXJVJn4fmE_xw.text: This restaurant came highly recommended, but I honestly don't know what all the fuss is about! Our party of five wanted a nice dinner after a long week of work in Vegas. We went to the Four Queens Casino in old Vegas and followed the stairs down to Hugo's Cellar. We were greeted by the hostess and the ladies were given red roses. Nice touch, except now red roses remind me of death, after V for Vendetta. Anyway, we were promptly seated. The restaurant was busy but there was no line. The waiter seemed annoyed that only two of the five of us ordered drinks. I might have ordered a glass of wine but I just can't justify spending nearly $20 on A drink. We told the waiter we were all going to share some appetizers (to start). The salads are made fresh at the table and are $19 each. (No, the croutons were not golden.) I said we would share a few. He was totally put off... OH NO, you can't share the salads... we would have to charge you. Heck, I thought that's what the $19 was?? Anyway, the salads were tasty (I snuck a bite of my dad's when the waiter wasn't looking) but small. The crab cakes were average, the shrimp was DELICIOUS and the blue cheese stuffed mushrooms were tasty but strong. We were still really hungry but not enjoying the ambiance enough to warrant spending $50+ a plate, so we decided to get our check. All in all, we were in and out in 30 minutes, and spent over $100 (pre tax/tip) on 2 side salads, 3 appetizers, and 2 domestic beers, so Hugo's should not have been annoyed at the quick table turn, yet they seemed almost hostile that we left after appetizers.

tP_w0sWHl7wxBzG54z6ipQ.text: The food deserves 5 stars but the service was so horrible I can't do it.   We were a party of 5 and one of our steaks was over cooked.  After asking the waiter how to order the steak for it to be pink we were told medium. The medium ribeye came with no pink.  We sent it back and the waiter rudely asked if anyone else had a problem with their food. He said he took it off the bill as we didn't want to order something else at that point.  The bill came with a $19 charge for the salad that came with the meal.  When the manager was called over he told us it was because she ate the salad. Really?   Salad that comes included with the meal is $19 when your steak is over cooked???  And the manager argued with us when we said we didn't feel we should pay $19 for the salad.  Eventually he agreed to take the salad off the bill but as he walked away he said "really"?   I have never been treated so poorly in such a beautiful restaurant.   What a shame.

o3BatH7FltHhL62iOVoBgA.text: We went down to Fremont Street because we were doing a Classic Vegas weekend. After realising our party was under-dressed for the steakhouse at the top of Binion's (turns out they frown on guys in shorts, even with good shoes and decent button-up shirts - Sorry about dressing for 100+ degree heat!), we wondered around just trying to find anything (turns out one in our group turned out to be kinda picky). I had "a feeling" for the 4 Queens, so we went in there and found Hugo's Cellar.   Sheer Perfection.   Great Style (You enter by going down a staircase. The brightly-lit hussle-bussle of the casino disappears as you descend into nice subdued lighting, beautiful brick and wooden pillars),    Old World Hospitality (the ladies all received long stemmed red roses and were seated by the staff),   Good sized Portions ( the drinks, from the bar that seat 5, come in 1/2litre carafes in little ice buckets, so you're getting about 2+ drinks for the price of 1).  Our service was over the top outstanding. Eddie, our congenial bartender fixed superb drinks, from uber-standards, The Manhattan and The Cosmopolitan, to the faddish Raspberry Chocolate Martini. Sue was at the podium as Matre'D. She optimized great service with her balance of candor and professionalism.  I've had lots of good food and I thought the food here was very good. The table side salads were all done in the same bowl; so you're right, it's not going to be pure flavor of your particular choices. Eh, we all thoroughly enjoyed our salads anyway.  Two of us are Veg; you might be surprised by the great meals made from just veggie sides at your typical high end steakhouse. Hugo's didn't disappoint and they fixed up quite decent plates for us. Others in our group had the swordfish and a porterhouse. Everyone was pleased with their meal.  At the end of the meal they brought us chocolate covered strawberries; each one was about the size of your fist. Interestingly, we had had fist-size chocolate-dipped strawberries the night before at a wedding reception and had been impressed then.  And yet, the ones at Hugo's were bigger and sweeter.  Crazy...  Hugo's has become a permanent stop every time we come to Vegas.

uDeGVCiyzCtAnA7aQ0HtIg.text: I visited this restaurant 5 years ago for the first time and it was the best salad, best ribeye, best creme brulee, and best service I'd ever had.  I've been back once a year since and my high expectations are met or exceeded on every visit.  It would be hard to convince me there is a restaurant that could impress me more.  The perfect place for a date or special occasion.  Prepare to be impressed.

0uPcP02MnibbYNLOwkcNSA.text: 4.5 Stars... Really, really good, but not *quite* "as good as it gets" because of a few small flaws which may have been flukes.  (Plus if I leave an empty star spot, my boyfriend whose favorite place in the world this is may take me back again to try it again in hopes of me being able to up my review, teehee!)  We came on a date here on our first trip to Vegas together, and it was an amazing experience all around.    We had reservations so when we arrived we were promptly seated after my being greeted with a long stem red rose (which they do for all their women guests).  It's located beneath the  Four Queens Casino, and it's fun and a bit impressing to walk down the steps out of the noisy casino into the relative calm of the restaurant.   The atmosphere is dark, elegant, romantic, and classic feeling.   The service was top-notch:  friendly, personable, just the right amount of refined to make you feel like you're eating somewhere fancy but not so much that you feel they're talking down to you, and on top of their game from start to finish.   The sommelier  was the same one that boyfriend remembers seeing when he came with his parents in his youth.   He was very nice and knowledgeable so I really hate to say this, but he ultimately ended up steering us into an off-menu wine that we *liked* but didn't *love* and that was significantly more expensive than the wines we had been looking at.   That's part of the missing half-star.  It was my first table-side custom salad experience and I am now sold on it and think every restaurant should have one.  I ended up with a bed of greens topped with shrimp, hearts of palm, artichoke hearts, tomatoes, pickled red onion, blue cheese, pine nuts, caesar dressing, and parmesan.   There were lots of other toppings that I passed on, but I don't remember what they were - sorry.  I just remember these because it surprisingly ended up being one of the best salads I've eaten and I've duplicated it at home several times now.  We ordered the Escargot as a starter, and it was melt in your mouth delicious. I love that they served it in an escargot dish surrounded by the perfect amount of sauce with the puffed pastry on top.  It made for a much cleaner presentation and easier to eat, rather than having to fish around in a sea of butter to fish out what may be a mushroom or an escargot.  Easier for those who are slightly squeamish about the idea of eating snails too:  less interaction and more enjoying the flavors.  This dish was beautifully balanced, light, savory, and just perfection.  For our entrees we ordered the New York Strip, and the Rack of Lamb (and we split them).  The portions were generous and they both came with large sides of beautifully cooked vegetables and creamy mashed potatoes.  The rack of lamb was cooked to perfection and was such a treat.  I loved the Indonesian style sauce that came with it, but the boyfriend preferred it without - which was fine because the sauce was on the side.  I would definitely order this dish again and highly recommend it.    The New York steak was good - very good, but this is where it fell a bit flat for me.  I have to admit here that I've had better steaks that I've made at home - mind you, I've made some VERY NICE prime steaks at home so I'm a pretty hard sell.  Don't get me wrong, It was very good but not quite as good as it gets, so this is the other fraction of a missing star.  I did enjoy every bite of it (eventually, bc there were tons of leftovers lol).  NEXT TIME I plan on ordering the duck - apparently that's all they served when it first opened and everything else has been added over the years, so I'm betting they've got that down to perfection by now.  (And the boyfriend is going to order the lamb again and I'm going to make him share it with me.)  After the meal they brought out a plate of complementary chocolate dipped fruits which was a very pleasant surprise and also the perfect 'little bit of something sweet but not too heavy because I just pigged-da'hell-out' end to the meal.  All in all it was one of the favorite meals I've ever eaten. If I was reviewing a less expensive restaurant it would definitely be five stars - but given its price level my expectations are extremely high.  Even so, it only fell the teeniest bit short of absolute perfection and I can't wait to come back and have a 5th star wooed out of me.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot en Croute (minus a couple)
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was a charming and elegant evening.

oXRtheMce6BQy7iaECDm9w.text: This is usually one of our go to's when we're in Vegas.  The food is probably the best meal you'll get in downtown.  You definitely can't miss the salad cart, and if you want a steak, they make a good one.  I've more recently experienced some of their chicken dishes which I actually prefer over their steaks.  For dessert, we've had the Cherries Jubilee and Bananas Foster, both are great but I'd lean towards the Bananas Foster.  The only real issue with Hugo's is in the last 10 years the service has gone downhill.  It's not terrible but just not as attentive as it used to be.  There are better restaurants in Vegas at this price point but if you're going on a date and want some old school Vegas feel, this is a great restaurant.  We're likely to go back every time we're in Vegas and hopefully it will pick back up to the level it used to be.

Hb-enIYo_GnErXfg2MtGKw.text: Beautiful Mahi, garlic mashed potatoes were fabulous, tableside salad wonderful, bartender is matched by none.  This is a gem in downtown with a classy, old world vibe to celebrate with Friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1tf1SN40zGaPFqySZzYXRA.text: This is one of the finest, most romantic places to go with your significant other. To say that the service is attentive is a gross understatement. The food is always delicious, and I love the martinis served in an iced-down beaker. They also have an extensive wine list, and a knowledgable sommelier.  Every lady gets a rose, which is a nice touch.

nbjLvd0lfdAvol1d9g59PA.text: What a nice place to dine!  The food, the server is so good!  My husband and I are celebrating our anniversary there, both of us enjoy a lot! The duck is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and rose-shaped butter
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert on the house
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot

gMHpoXCGWcCW_T2Qo3qiaA.text: Wow, never a bad meal, but you pay for it.   The food was wonderful last night from the custom salad, to the chocolate dipped figs. The service was amazing, you do not have to ask for anything, the servers are 5+++ as they are the most attentive I have ever seen, and they are smiling to boot.  The food is really good, and everything is clearly fresh and not rubbery or ready made tasting. We had a very nice unrushed dinner, but as I mentioned before they are in the $40 and up price range for your meals. Not too bad for the quality of food and service. It is just a bit high when you think of Vegas.  I come everytime I come to Vegas, as everyone deserves a nice dinner from time to time and I consider Hugo's to be a treat. Just don't forget to get your parking validated when you settle your check.

dir1DPvLhpt6dKoAfayKmg.text: The good:  great atmosphere, romantic setting.  The food and service was good. The not so good:  The food was just okay...not great.  My steak was underseasoned.  Salad was good, but not worth $18.  Complimentary dessert was okay, but nothing special.  Overall, I think this place is just overpriced.  All the food was tasty,  but didn't impress the way an expensive meal should.  I had an incredible steak at The Flame at El Cortez, and would recommend going there for better food and better value.

tayRIyFUjUpNI1nX06nZ1Q.text: My friends and I traveled to Vegas for an annual guys' trip and decided to check out Hugo's Cellar, hearing so many great things about it.  We certainly got a night that we will never forget... we arrived roughly 20 minutes before our reservation and asked to be seated early and they said it would be a few short minutes.     It turned out to be about 20 minutes, which we normally would not have cared about, but in the restaurant waiting area, we weren't alone.   We were with... the smell.   A cheap potpourri fragrance that my 89 year old grandmother would find offensive and just a hint of smoke became the topic of conversation all evening.  We tried to talk about sports and anything to distract us, but we couldn't ignore this scent.  It had effects on all of us.     Our friend Adam, who is usually a very nice man, completely snapped and yelled at his friends and stormed out, with the smell affecting his mood and well-being.  It even gave our friend Brooks diarrhea, which was another unfortunate incident for him, but welcomed for us.    We then were finally able to sit down at a very lovely table in the old-school, classy restaurant.  We were treated to a lovely and generous assortment of breads which we ate with aggression and stuffed in our nose to try to wash our nose hairs of the clinging scent.  Amongst the breads was a toasted lavish that was inseminated with cheese that was just delightful.    Also in the breads was... ahhhhh... I'm sorry I just can't stop thinking about that smell and how pungent and poisonous it was.    We then ordered our drinks and we were very pleased by portions and quality of the dirty martinis.  There were at least 2 helpings per serving and it helped dull our senses and killed some of the brain cells that held our memories of the smell, but not all of them of course, it was just too overpowering.    Our friend Kevin ordered a Gin and Tonic and it was such a special cocktail that they spent 45 minutes preparing it until he was eventually served it right before he polished off his steak.  He couldn't enjoy as much bread as us because he was afraid of choking on it due to the lack of fluids in his mouth to help digest the carbohydrates.  But he said it was worth the wait.  ... I can't get that smell out of my head.  Then it was time for the salad cart.   This was a very cool idea and felt classy to build our own salad to our liking.  I opted for the traditional oil and vinegar with all the trimmings and I enjoyed it immensely.  Many of our friends went with the fishy dressing, at least that is what I believe it was called.   I believe it was a sort of trout/salmon/seaweed mixture that tasted like the ocean at low tide, if you enjoy that sort of thing.  It's only redeeming quality is the fact that the fishy taste infiltrated our nasal passages as well, to help put the smell out of our minds, at least for the time being.     Then we had our main course and many of us opted for steak.   I'm sure it was good, but honestly, I can't remember.   The smell did so much more than penetrate my large Italian nose, it also cause a rift between me and my friend/partner Adam.  Adam, if you are reading this right now, I'm sorry.   I hated that smell, but if you ever want to go back, I'd go with you.  I choose you.  Always. Forever.  Can we please go somewhere else.  Ok fine you win, let's go to Hugo's.  But we are not showing up early.

Z7tr2StwZ1dLIaBEHJFPTQ.text: Fantastic dining experience that is well worth the price. Great service with delicious items and nice atmosphere. One of my favorites in Sin City!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet with shrimp in a green peppercorn sauce, garlic mashed potatoes, asparagus and a lovely Lobster tail.

D_tOUErFvcO8BGXF8xiD4w.text: Outstanding traditional steakhouse.  + Dark, but not so much one cannot read the menu  + Good service - polite, informative and not overbearing  + Not everything is a la carte. Salad is included with the meal and it's made tableside. Same with the dinner carbs - choice of rice, potatoes, etc. is included with the meal. This makes my decisions less complicated.  + The desert that is again part of the meal was really a nice touch - especially the figs!  It on the old Vegas Strip - downstairs away from the hustle just a few feet away. I'd definitely go back.

lRRu4y9UCEHkovGO-DL8sA.text: Husband took me here for my birthday - Ladies get a long stem rose as they walk in :) If you are a fan of Rack of Lamb - THIS IS THE PLACE TO GET IT ! :) I can't believe the price here, it's old school dining experience where everything is included - you get a salad (prepared at your table-where you get to choose your dressing and toppings), a sorbet in between to cleanse the palette, the entree and then a hot towel to clean your hands before a dish of dipped fruits are served ! We also tried their Kona Coffee (prepared via a vacuum coffee maker at table side) and Cherry Jubilee - so good but we must admit we were way over stuffed by the time we walked out ! Our servers Michael/Anthony were GREAT ! It was a great dining experience :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Famous rack of Lamb - prepared medium.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kona coffee for two -  vacuum coffee maker :-)

zoFY2Yb3Ilnq77k7OCdZoQ.text: OMG!  This place is an EXPERIENCE!  Pricey and worth every penny.  The service from start to finish is over-the-top excellent.  we have gone here once a year, every year for the past 15 years.  We have the same sommelier every year and he has never steered us wrong on wines.  The starter salad alone is amazing and delicious. I love that the price of each meal includes the salad, starch and veggies (it's not all a la carte -- which bugs me).   the portions are so huge that you can easily split a meal and leave more than satisfied.  This place is great all around.  Cannot recommend highly enough.

_NR3o9SdIyURhG4eg3Fmtg.text: This is my fourth time going here and I have never yet been disappointed, this is our "go to place" now for special occasions!  Went again last night for my 56th birthday with a party at four, we were seated immediately, and had our drinks within five or so minutes of sitting down at the table. Gene & Victor we're our waiter and they were great!!! Victor was marvelous helping us with our drink orders and Gene was a great waiter as well.  I will continue coming back again and again love this place And the meals are all inclusive!! Which is rare to find at a good steak house that doesn't charge you $10 or more for a potato! The table side made to Salads here are amazing you get exactly what you want & don't have to pick out the stuff you don't like (I'm a picky eater!), sherbet (sorbet) cones come in between courses  and I've never been disappointed with a main course yet!  Then there's the platter of chocolate dipped fruit with creme fresh for dessert IF you don't order one of the other amazing desserts I always go with the banana foster cooked table side. HIGHLY RECOMMEND for any special occasions or just to enjoy s great meal!! It's "Old style Vegas at its best!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dgVWqWBzXLGa5HiXJ6JqVw.text: Complimentary salad and dessert were meh. The service was good. The ambience is lovely. The beef wellington was delicious. The scallops were bomb.

uZ9tqRrVQponRmzmygM2rA.text: Hugo's Cellar is a tribute to what steak restaurants used to be.  They have a incredible menu with great appetizers.  I'd recommend the escargot, lobster bisque, hot rocks and seafood platter.  You can even just order appetizers and get full.  The salad cart is a special touch, no one does that anymore.  Food is cooked to perfection, unfortunately I'm always full by the end, so I haven't tried dessert yet.  There is also a sommelier who will pair a nice wine with your dinner as well.  Hats off...

hH79IiOJzujUZtTHO6GuVQ.text: Heard a lot about this place; how great the food and service was. Everything far exceeded our expectations. My wife and I are celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary and the meal here provided a very memorable evening.

UBLqobM2yQCMGwuEkGXUQQ.text: This is a must stop in Vegas. It's an old school Steak House/Vegas Super club with amazing food and excellent staff. Loves our waiter Rashand. He connected with us in a personal level and was completely unpretentious and just an overall nice 'kid.'  My sister had the filet & shrimp and I had the Beef Wellington. All amazing. Make sure you go hungry and make reservations. Excellent raspberry lemon drop martini too. Great date place too

SN_ENtt0FeLVccavtTxDeQ.text: If Yelp considered short statements as "reviews" then all I'd have to say is..  "Hugo's Cellar is AWESOME!"  Instead, let me explain a little.  This is a review that could really go on and on so I'm gonna try to cut myself short.  There is nothing that I don't like about Hugo's Cellar.  The service is superb, the food is fantastic, and it reminds me of other "old school" Vegas gourmet rooms that are no longer around.  The table-side salad service is fantastic and whatever you order on the menu is gonna be delicious.  Remember to save room for Bananas Foster (prepared table-side) after dinner and a cup of great coffee.   You might be surprised, but you won't be disappointed!

Hxcdmu1PY2za92bfXCtHOA.text: Some friends told us to come to Hugo's!  Service was fantastic.  Food was prob some of the best we have ever eaten while in Las Vegas!!!!  Highly recommend and will be coming back!

AOgjykwW2AufhxoN5J76pw.text: Always a must when I'm in town. Food is fantastic and the sevice is excellent. Very romantic. Don't let the location fool you.

a6AqqtnC3jC9KI2fQoCBig.text: Went to Hugo's last night for a special anniversary with my wife. We had not been there in 8-9 years. We were seated quickly and we ordered a nice bottle of wine from the sommelier. That was the highlight of the dinner. I ordered the Sea Bass ($59) and my wife ordered the Seafood Trio ($62). My Sea Bass had a frozen taste to it and it was like eating a sponge No taste whatsoever,  My wife's entree was similar. I sent mine back and ordered a filet instead,  as I was not willing to try their seafood again. The filet was good... not great. We came to Hugo's because of the great tradition of excellence in service and food. Neither is present anymore as the service was just ok. When I spend $200 on dinner for two people, I really expect a much better food experience. No more Hugo's for us.

7YxPu4pHNK18He2n35QE8w.text: I came here with my boyfriend for our very first time for Valentine's Dinner (the day before because it was booked on the 14th). From the moment we entered the service was phenomenal. There were warm smiles everywhere. We arrived exactly on time for our reservation and were seated immediately after being handed a rose. Once seated, we had several gentleman serve us. There were 4 to be exact, although I can only remember 3 names: Rashard, Oscar and Dave. All four were kind and humored us quiet a bit.  First, Rashard came and asked us what we would like to drink. (TIP: it's an open bar charge of $10... We didn't know this or we would have taken advantage lol). I got wine and my boyfriend got whiskey. Both delicious. The server who brought the wine was very knowledgable and funny (can't remember name). The salad done by Rashard was delicious! I asked for the honey dressing that they had and, my goodness, it was delectable, my boyfriend got the same dressing and also loved it.  Oscar came by next to give us raspberry sorbets in cute little cones to help cleanse. He too cracked a few jokes and was very friendly (our favorite 2 servers were Rashard and Oscar for their humor). Next the entrees served by Dave. I ordered the filet mignon and my boyfriend had the queen lobster. Both were seasoned perfectly and cooked just right. We didn't have room for dessert although they do bring complementary desserts which are a few fruits covered in chocolate. Overall, it was a great experience and I definitely recommend it to everyone! Just be ready to drop anywhere from $175-$275 for 2 people. It's worth it though!

825scdg_4h1FHt3WnQ52FA.text: Wish I could give these guys a better rating. The place sounded like a cool idea, a little old school Vegas in an old school Vegas hotel/casino. Down in the "Cellar" as they say. The ambiance of the restaurant and decor was nice. Unfortunately some of the staff was really loud. They do a cool made to order salad at your table and the waiter doing it really seemed to enjoy his job. But he was so super loud and obnoxious. The salad was cool, but just not very tasty. The dinner was about $100 per person, I tried the Filet & the Lobster Tail. Portions were very good, but honestly I've had better steak at Sizzler and the Lobster tail was worth $12.99 not $80 for two. Probably won't go back, but it wasn't a horrible experience, just not worth what I paid.

TsaL70Re1K5lCFbE_9stfA.text: One of the best steak steakhouses in downtown las vegas, it's definitely smart to split a plate, steaks are a real good size :)  Would recommend this place if you're in downtown las vegas for a special occasion or celebratory dinner :)

asqJ1MV4T1xSWmgHGvbb0w.text: Have been here twice. Wonderful dining experience.  Had dinner here with my husband last week for the second time. Will be back for sure. Old school Vegas done right.  Looking at the menu online - I thought it was very pricey - but it turned out to be fairly priced - because everything was included - full meal -  from fancy breads, to custom made tableside salads, entree with sides, sorbet and chocolate covered strawberries for desert all included for the price of an entree. Plus the portions were large.  Food was really delicious.  The first time I had the scallops which were excellent, and this past time I had grilled Ahi - which was such an enormous portion - I took it back from Vegas in my cooler and had it the next night with dinner - it was amazing! Awesome wine list too. Generous cocktails with overpour!  Service was very good. Ambiance was very dark and comfy. It seemed that several of the diners around us were locals - not visitors - so that you  know is a good sign!

mShZ1UHapw6S9KWggEfwJw.text: Ooo-Weee, this place is FANCY.  Make you wanna wear a really pretty dress and get all dolled up fancy.  Who knew a place like this existed in Downtown Las Vegas.  Well, apparently this chick knows now.  I came for a friend of my cousin's birthday.  At first glimpse, this place seems a bit cramped.  True to it's name (cellar), you go down stairs to get to this little place.  The lobby area is a bit small, so if it gets crowded, it may only  be standing room only.  Once we were seated, each girl was brought to the table and given a long stemmed red rose.  I know, cheesy ... but it was cute nonetheless.  They have a great selection of seafood and meat.  First course was salad.  Their salad was delicious, and I probably could have just made the salad my whole meal.  Not a side salad.  This baby takes up your whole plate, and comes with all the fixings.  Of course, you get to pick which fixings you want on it.  I also had some of their bread.  I especially enjoyed the lavosh.  It was crispy and flaky, and something different from the ordinary bread given at restaurants, although that was served as well.  After much deliberation, I chose the filet mignon. Very tender, juicy, and well cooked (medium rare, just the way I like it).  I was pleased with my choice.  I also got to try the Escargot en Croute.  It was my first time tasting escargot, so I really don't have anything to compare it to.  However, I know I liked it, and will be willing to have it again.  If you're in the mood to be fancy, hit this place up.  However, it is definitely on the pricey side.  For me, great to try once on my dime, but I hope next time it'll be on someone else's.

FyAjnLAzgVs8ErBQ7Y-2zg.text: The ambiance and charm of Hugo's Cellar is what makes it a new favorite of mine. My husband and I were celebrating the day we met 7 years ago, and wanted to go somewhere different and special. Hugo's Cellar was my choice.   I loved every bit of the decor and style of the restaurant. It felt like it had been there forever, and that there was good reason for it. Vegas is so quick to demolish the old and put a new spin on everything, so I just love the coziness Hugo's exudes.   We were greeted with sincerity, and I was given a rose as we were walked back to our table. I already knew what I wanted from studying all the Yelp photos and reading the reviews prior to arrival.  I ordered a Greygoose Orange Cosmopolitan, my husband had the Franciscan Cabernet. We started with shrimp cocktail (pass on this!), had the table side salads that were included with our entrees (my husband exclaiming it was the best salad he's had in his whole life- LOL!), I ordered the small prime rib med rare (yum) with a 1/2 lb. of king crab legs (omg yum), and my husband had the beef Wellington med rare. We were happy with everything we ordered. I found the food to not have much salt on it; which is a good thing if you're more health conscious, or prefer to add it yourself. My crab legs were pre split and fat with meat. Yum. - I love crab legs! I couldn't finish all my prime rib, so it was boxed to go.   We saw a neighboring table order the bananas foster for dessert, and while it looked and smelled wonderful, we didn't have enough room. We shared a berry custard torte which was really good. After dinner it was fun to walk off our big meal and take in all the lights of the downtown area.   Overall, we really enjoyed our meal at Hugo's Cellar. There are a lot of fantastic restaurants to choose from in Las Vegas, but if you're looking for something special with your someone special, look no further.  This is it.

DtZx28p3L2uUlA1wsX-yvA.text: Wow. Last time we came in May, we were waited on hand and foot. Tonight, got there at 5, out by 6:15. So rushed. Food was mediocre. so disappointed. They rushed us the entire time. Won't be back....

YFpFmKDM5O89jSA_q-KUQQ.text: My wife and I recently spent our 20th anniversary in Las Vegas and decided to try Hugo's on the recommendation of a buddy who comes to Vegas a lot.  We ordered single malt scotch and wine to drink respectively and were impressed how generous they were with the drinks.  The house Cab was just average, but they brought me a HIGHBALL full of Macallan for the single shot price, which was nice.  We both ordered the salad cart, which was awesome.  The dressings were not too heavy and the selection of veggies to compose your salad from was outstanding.  For dinner, I ordered the 16 ounce NY Strip med rare with the blue cheese creme topping.  The wife got Hugos chicken and we both got special vegetables.  A few cool things about Hugos - First the setting is great, quaint little brick basement with low ceilings and a 70s feel - they bring you sorbet between courses to cleanse the palate.  When we told them it was our anniversary, they brought us a little Luxor-shaped mousse with a candle.  Very cool.  Also, as has been mentioned many times, every lady gets a single rose.  My wife was so tickled by it she brought it home to Denver on the plane.  So, in summary,  good food and fun ambiance.  Go do it once if you want good food on Fremont.

izm9nHZjF5teT6uJo96NUg.text: We had dinner here, I had the Filet Mignon and my wife had the stuffed Shrimp, both were EXCELLENT, they gave my wife a RED ROSE, when we arrived. The over all experience was FABULOUS..!

Bvd9dducjIfockPw-jpRhw.text: Love this place, always has and probably always will! The service is impeccable and the food is great. Its one of the old school steak house left in Las Vegas, where you can order a Steak and still get the veggies, Salad, bread, sorbet, and desert all for one price! I would recommend for anyone wanting a fabulous tasking dinner with great atmosphere and prices! Love it there!

nNRmPSNF1tcwTKqNWZuQGQ.text: The restaurant had a nice, romantic vibe. The service was exceptional. We started with the mushrooms, which were delicious. The custom salad course was amazing. The steak was cooked perfectly. And the chocolate covered fruit was a nice addition. The raspberry lemon Martini was a delight. We finished with the chocolate mousse dessert. Yum!

FihCAOEmSi_5EDmyfQAXNg.text: Absolutely incredible gem hidden in the  Four Queens casino. This is an old school restaurant, the kind you can imagine Robert Deniro and Joe Pesci dining at. Every woman is given a red rose at the door. They have dishes you don't often see anymore such as Veal Oscar and Beef Wellington. The service is impeccable, the food is heavenly and I love the little touches, such as sorbet to cleanse the palate, chocolate covered fruit after dinner and hot washcloths. I just can't rave enough about this place! Going back already next Sunday!!!

trPDiywoua8q1KCYfgBMDw.text: Took my wife there for a romantic dinner following a week long trade show. Her only request was "somewhere nice with Beef Wellington". After an extended wait for entrees, with empty wine glass in hand and watching tables that were seated after us receive their meals, we were finally presented with our steaks. Upon cutting into her's the wife realized the pastry portion of the Wellinton was still doughy and the steak very very rare. My prime rib was one of the fattiest cuts that I have ever encountered. I realize that Prime rib is a marbled cut but this was mostly fat! Entrees were accompanied by overcooked veggies and lackluster mashed potatoes. We seemed to have no less than 3 people waiting on us at one time or another, at least until the steaks were served, yet none bothered to ask how was our meal and thus couldn't complain. My wife peeled off the dough and ate the outer, more done portion of the steak.  I would have had another glass of wine but never got the chance to order one. Had to basically tackel "a" server for the 2nd glass prior to the entrees.  Never saw the servers again until we disgustedly asked for the check. The only high points were the salad prepared tableside and the shrimp cocktail. Hence the 2-Star score for Food.  Sub-par Service and Food. Very disappointed considering the choices we had in Vegas.

kd7L2R9XAt4TWJxIPLlSIQ.text: This place reminds me of a bad 70's movie.  You'll pay as much here for a mediocre meal as you would at the Wynn for a great meal.   The restaurant has cheesy fake floral arrangements covered in dust greeting you at every table.    The waiters were a bit slow, but earned points for trying really hard to impress you with their knowledge.  The salad cart that so many people mention is about as gimmicky as unlimited salad and breadsticks at the Olive garden.   My sister and I almost walked out, but like the ending of a bad movie, wanted to see what might possibly come next.  I seriously question the credibility of all the 5 star reviewers on this list.

0e2sHdZUwTF4yq-E5TGXmA.text: My boyfriend surprised me on a Valentine's Day dinner here. The food was amazing the service was perfect . Loved the friendly hostess and waiter very accommodating being that I had just had back surgery two weeks ago and needed to sit in a comfortable chair.
