They make the salad according to your taste, right in front of you! Love love this part. This place is highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moscow Mule in tin cup the best!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basket of bread! Yummy! This weight watchers girl threw the points system out the window.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the rose shaped butter.

MEcJTIZFujaVNhN-fVjayA.text: This is a great steak place on Fremont. The brick wall atmosphere is cozy and quiet down in the 4 Queens Casino. We paid about $60 for a steak each (ribeye and filet mignon) it comes with rolls, awesome table side salad bar, sides (get the garlic mashed potatoes), and even a chocolate covered strawberry, fig and apricot. Definitely a great deal for Vegas! Got a martini for $13 that had its own refill container (so you actually get 4 martinis for the price of one). Service was highly attentive and enjoyable. They gave all the women a complimentary red rose as well! We are definitely coming back on our next trip.  Highlights: Table side salad bar, well-cooked steaks, and 4 for 1 martini.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Well-cooked steak and garlic mashed potatoes!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great made to order table side salad bar!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table side salad bar

elbfL7_ptH3CtDXsmDWDUA.text: Ladies, make sure you tell your man to bring you to this little old school steak house.  Fellas, you want to bring your ladies here, all the staff with take care of the rest.  They will definitely take care of you.  As you walk down stairs into the steak house.  The host will greet you and hand all the women long steam red roses.  Everyone here was so friendly and enjoyable.    I came with a group of three ladies celebrating a birthday on a Friday night.  We all order the ten ounce filet.  This came with the following: salad, sorbet, meat with all the sides, and dessert.    The handsome salad man, who tosses salad all night long, will come over to the table and make you the perfect salad with whatever you want on your personal salad.  First chose you dressing and then you can add whatever you want.    After the salad you will be served sorbet which will cleanse your pallet for your main course.  When our filet came out, it looked so delicious.  The filet was served with garlic whipped mashed potatoes, green and white asparagus, and bearnaise sauce.  The steak was succulent and devine. It was cooked just how I like it.  I will definitely be coming back.    This is great place for anniversaries, Valentine 's Day, or any date or event.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate covered fruits served with cemè. Strawberries, figs, and apricot.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday dessert deliciousness.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pallet cleansing sorbet to re-set those taste buds served by this handsome gentleman.

XWXCncs7Da3BxEkC7QrmYQ.text: Hands down the best meal I have ever had. My husband and I have traveled the world and this is the best kept secret. The food is prepared with care and an attention to detail. My personalized salad was delicious. My martini had a side car that was kept In a small ice bucket. My Chilean seabass was cooked to perfection as was my husband's steak.  We recommend that anyone visiting Vegas check out this hidden gem!  Worth every penny!!

4mGrgd1BdGpto7FhrTK18g.text: I have to be honest ...with all the hype I was expecting more. Our reservation was at 830 and we were seated the greeter and man who gave the roses was super awesome. Our assistant who did our salad was great ! The rest of the servers /service acted like it was an annoyance to be there. I understand it was a later reservation at 830 but still I don't think we should have been made to feel like we were annoying them or a burden. They forgot to bring a few things to our table , they gave my father in law my medium rare and gave me his medium, and the food wasn't even that hot , like it had been under a food lamp.   For the price I think I will go somewhere else . I really was so excited to have my bday dinner here too.  The desserts were great I will say that!  You know it really wasn't the food so much as that was enjoyable ...it really boiled down to the service. I would have given the service one star , but the doorman/Rose giver was a delight and so was our assistant server.

N5XP3WsxdPeMObnDp2j0dQ.text: Last night, my Sister and my Niece and both of their gentlemen friends, as well as myself, dined at Hugo's Cellar at the Four Queen's. It was an Unforgettable meal! From the Maitre D'Hotel to the Sommelier, to the Waiter, each person we met, added to our experience. The table side salad was excellent-  and the anchovies on my Caesar salad were delicious! The Barman brought my Martini with three olives, and poured it into my glass twice! The Sommelier, Vincent, brought us a lovely Reisling to go with our Scallops, and I cannot remember a more perfect meal! Even our Waiter, Marc Oscar, was very entertaining! A five star dining experience was had by all of us! Everyone made me feel like a Queen!  It truly was the BEST of Las Vegas!

3zHXr593of8cwtmVkIs6-A.text: The best sea bass I have ever had. The serves was amazing. A hidden gem in Vegas! Make sure you dress well.

4voBBQqxgkPFL5Vy7rlCvA.text: So today's adventure found us headed to Vegas and looking for a good spot for dinner. Leave it to our VP Jeff who lived in Vegas for many years suggesting a very nostalgic spot known as Hugos Cellar in the Four Queens.  He was looking for a place that still maintained a Rat Pack feel to it and we definitely found that at Hugo's this evening.  The restaurant truly is located in the cellar of the Four Queens and the second you descend the stairs into Hugo's reception area, it feels like you're walking into a set of a very dark and broody dinner scene of a Coppola movie.  They do give the ladies in your party roses and I'm not quite sure if that makes it romantic or just a little creepy, which isn't so bad either--if you're into creepy. :)  We had reservations for 9pm, arrived a few minutes early and were seated without waiting at all.  Host and servers were very friendly and seemed to be on their games--especially Michael, our salad and dessert chef.  Unfortunately, although coming across as very professional, our waiter on the other hand, was very slow and not very attentive.  Drinks took forever and it was another HOUR before we were even asked for the next round.  Appetizers were delicious but so slow to get to the table.  We even had to ask to put our orders in because we were never prompted to in that first hour.  Our entrees didn't arrive until almost 1 hour and 25 minutes later 5 minutes before they closed.  We had an upset table to say the least.  Once our dinners arrived, the mood began to lighten because of the quality and presentation of every dish.  My NY steak was done PERFECTLY medium and was incredibly tender and perfectly seasoned.  I ordered it with the au poivre sauce that needed just a smidgen of salt but after that was pure heaven.   I went with the red potatoes and steamed vegetables as my sides and they came out still retaining their crispness and wonderfully moist.    After that meal you have no idea how much it pains me to give it three stars but the waiting was handled so miserably that I just have to deduct two stars for it.    Hugo, please read this and make these errors right in the future.  I would love to give you another try, but unless there's some assurance it's been addressed, I'm back to the strip to my regular steak places.....

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vx9OA3aATxiQmzkWVBtmCw.text: An intimate romantic restaurant with excellent high quality dining! This is one of the best restaurants to dine at here in Las Vegas. Tucked away inside of the Four Queens casino, you go down the stairs into a lowly lit beautiful dining experience. It starts with a staff member handing the women in your party a fresh rose. You are greeted by multiple staff, it is a very warm and friendly environment. Plan on spending some time when you come here, your dinner is served in stages and it is well worth the wait. They have an excellent menu of fine dining, from steaks to fish. I love the experience of the table side salad preparation. You can choose from a large array of additions from anchovies, pinenuts, boiled eggs and artichoke hearts. If you would like to have wine, the sommelier will come and discuss it with you, and give you recommendations. Also know that they do have half bottles of wine if you just want a glass or two. I had the fillet wrapped in bacon topped with crabmeat.  The steak was very tender, even though I ordered it well done! They offer a complimentary dessert tray, with fresh fruit dipped in chocolate. This restaurant is an excellent choice for a fine dining experience and a great date night!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HlzSrskBpt5dnOLQZNMS8Q.text: This restaurant is good they open here for 40 yrs nice service and nice coffee so delicious And food was ok.    Salad very very good   Food price ok it was not worth it than what i expected

BzCnSXNBV5ry_vHzA2n2Rg.text: What in the blue hell are you thinking my fellow food critics ?!!!! If Hugo's is a 4.5 star steakhouse than you may as well throw me in the kennel and lock up the key because this has got to be the most overrated and overpriced restaurant in las Vegas. I spent weeks deciding on where to eat to celebrate my cousin's engagement. after much deliberation I settled on Hugo's because everyone recommended the place from our hotel concierge  to the Yelp community. Well I should have known when the restaurant  asked me for my credit card number upon making a reservation that this was going to totally suck. Should have listened to my instincts....  We started with the mixed meat grill which consisted of a bunch of undercooked meats that they bring out on a sizzling platter. Nothing was seasoned at all so the meat itself tasted bland and dull. Plus the chicken was undercooked when they brought it out so we had to kind of guess when it was ready to eat. The various dipping sauces that came out with the platter were just entirely overpowering and the dish itself was just a pointless and lazy way to serve meats at a high end restaurant like Hugo's. Since we were a party of 7 people it was at this point that I began to worry that the rest of the meal would go downhill. Once again I was right...   The table side salad was a complete f^*%%ing joke. I'm angry just typing this out. It's like the salad bar they used to have at sizzlers except a waiter is actually mixing ingredients into your custom salad. The ingredients were cheap and pathetic. My shrimp were smaller than toe nail clippings. The lettuce was wilted and The salad itself wasn't even tossed well AT ALL. I basically had a glob of dressing that never made its way onto any of the lettuce.  Everyone hated their salad. Nuff said...  Next We proceed to the entrees and nothing improves. I ordered the tenderloin and shrimp both of which were drowning in a cream sauce. The shrimp themselves were actually cooked well. They were also deveined. My steak was small and bland once again. Albeit there was no fat which I will say was nice. The veggies on the plate were a complete afterthought and the mashed potatoes tasted like Ora Ida box mix. I was too embarrassed to ask how everyone else's meal was but judging by the half eaten plates i don't think a single person enjoyed their meal here. The assorted chocolate covered fruits at the end were a nice gesture but unfortunately they did not make up for the lackluster meal our party was served that evening.   I love old school steakhouses but only if it's done right. This was not done right. The fact that we were the last table in there on a Saturday night at 10pm was probably a bad sign. Oh and the fire alarm went off twice during our meal. The staff never came over to apologize so we basically sat at our table and listened to that loud noise for a good 15 minutes. It was probably a sign from God that i made a fatal mistake by eating here.   Never again.

JlVQAcLdmcU3rkXY5eFeQQ.text: We were in Vegas to celebrate two birthdays and were sad to hear that our usual birthday stop was not open for the season.  So the steak lover in our group made reservations for Hugo's.  My daughter, who is such a romantic though she doesn't realize it, fell in love with Hugo's the minute they presented all the women in our group with a rose.  Then, she was in heaven when on the menu was the caesar salad (her favorite salad) prepared "table-side", somewhat of a dying art where we live, as far as I know.    This is an old-fashioned (in a good sense) steakhouse that is so elegant, yet not stuffy thanks to the friendly staff and a knowledgeable sommelier with a great sense of humor.  They have your standard steak selections that you expect from great steakhouses, in addition to delicious fish, chicken, duck, and lamb choices.  Their rack of lamb is served with an Indonesian sauce . . . . But not to worry, they also can serve it with mint jelly!  Phew!  Their beef wellington is delicious (tasted my husband's).  To top off the dining experience, we were presented with a splendid platter of chocolate dipped fruit.   Now we have two favorite steakhouses that we need to visit when we are in Vegas!    The only thing that I missed was that crust that some places have on their steaks. Oh, and for "old eyes" you may need to use your phone's light to read the menu because it is a little dark--can't give up the ambience just to accommodate us old people.

VvyGw_1IDhpChE6X_9ZOjw.text: First of all, being a local, I frequent this restaurant often and it has been our MOST recommended restaurant in Vegas for our out-of-town friends for many years.  We have always recommended it for many reasons: every woman receives a rose upon entering the establishment; classic Vegas ambiance; its great bang-for-your-buck menu where entrees include bottled water, table-side salad service, and chocolate-dipped fruits for dessert.    The sommelier, Jon, is one of my favorite things about Hugo's.  Jon is quite witty and makes excellent recommendations for wine.    The sea bass and prime rib are both excellent choices for entrees.  The bananas foster is a must-have dessert served flaming table-side.  My primary reason for the 3-star review is for the following reason:  We received our bill at the end of a fabulous dinner for six (we took two couples who had never been).  The bill only listed a total price and two lines for tips (one for the waiter and one for sommelier).  We asked for an itemized bill so we knew what we spent in wine to determine the tips for each.  When they brought the itemized bill, we realized it had ALREADY INCLUDED an 18% gratuity!! So, they were trying to get a DOUBLE-TIP!!  This was VERY EMBARRASSING for us at the end of such an amazing evening and such a let-down after so many loyal years coming to Hugo's.

KksOVJcR90kv1-VqnDjzIA.text: We have been wanting to try this restaurant for a while...Old School Vegas! The service was very good, the food delicious and nice atmosphere.

aWWrenIQwV3PsGqG3B5p6w.text: This is absolutely our favorite restaurant ANYWHERE. The service is amazing, the food is absolutely lovely, and their wines are to die for. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for great atmosphere and delicious food. Will return again and again!

rFaiy3g0aTM5jJqxkzfxdg.text: Awful. Simply awful. If you want to go back to 1973 quality with 2020 prices go for it. The food was dreadful; table side salad was like a bad Ruby Tuesday's with an ill mannered waiter telling me what I could have. Tasteless and mundane. The "famous" prime rib was over-cooked and completely tasteless, as referenced in the reviews I should have believed. The au jus was watery and the wait staff ignorant and not professional. I asked for a glass of wine while my colleague ordered a bottle and was TOLD i needed to order off The list. I was horrified that I took 8 colegues here. Keep your roses and if you're smart you'll stay away.

BlxV-wFP_e911rzmfjGBEQ.text: No my cup of tea.  Ambience was a bit clusterphobi c for me.  Felt like I was on a cruise ship.. I do appreciate that rose at check in, thought it was a nice touch.  Steak was a 5/10 for me. Scallops 6/10. Can appreciate the waitstaff on being attentive, but my food expectation was set too high and don't think it will be a meal I would crave.  Forgettable meal memorable waitstaff.

vQK9DCfR7gFIrPzpPeSs4g.text: Wow!   Simply wow.   When I saw the menu I assumed this place would be pretentious but it was anything but that.   The salad is indescribable and constitutes a meal in its self.   My Martini with blue cheese stuffed olives as almost bottom less.     The rack of lamb didn't need any sauce or seasoning but melted down n my mouth full of flavor.   They include a dessert of chocolate covered strawberries and other fruit but we splurged on the bananas foster and we're not disappointed.  GREAT service and food.  Totally worth the few extra dollars and drive downtown.     I WILL be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NlvjzZg1Ci8f4zwbnLCCRw.text: I'll begin by saying that Hugo's used to be one of my favorite places for dinner in Las Vegas. I came here many times with friends and relatives of friends in years past. Always top-notch.  We came through Las Vegas on a trip to Zion recently and stayed overnight but couldn't get a dinner reservation at Hugo's. Instead, on recommendation of the reservationist, we had dinner at Top of Binions Steak House which we found to be excellent and above our expectations!    But, on our way back through LV, we made reservations at Hugo's since I had been raving about it for awhile. My BF had not eaten at either place before. He is what I would consider a foodie and a wine connoisseur (not snobby, but very good) and has been to many fine, including Michelin rated restaurants. He likes to discuss wine with the sommeliers, I usually just drink what he orders. Lol.   Anyway, I'm sad to say, Hugo's has lost its way. I'm not sure what has happened but our service was not up to the standards I had experienced in the past. We ordered drinks before dinner but expected our waiter to ask us if we planned to also have wine with dinner. I told my BF that they have a really good sommelier so he'd probably be coming by our table. Well, I was wrong, it didn't happen. Maybe there is no sommelier anymore but our waiter rarely checked on us so we couldn't ask. My BF ordered a 16 oz New York steak with au gratin potatoes with a side dish of spinach. I had the ala carte salad and was going to try a bite of his steak, potatoes and eat half the spinach. He ordered the steak Med-rare as usual. He told me that he can tell the quality of a good steak by the texture and how tender it is when cooked not more than medium rare. Well, I saw him discreetly discard several bites due to how tough the steak was. I kept telling him to inform the waiter, BUT NO waiter came to ask!! In fact, a different waiter brought our food out and we didn't even see our regular waiter until much later...too late to order something else and too late for wine!! YIKES! He left a lot of the steak on the plate... I will say that the au gratin potatoes were delicious albeit a bit salty...I ate more than a bite of those.  Honestly, I don't think we'll be back just for the salad and potatoes.

GmTpfv3iqMjzNjPA7C9ocw.text: I went to this place yesterday to celebrate my Anniversary. The place it self is great but the service was not good..Our waiter messed up our steak order and then he said he would go in the kitchen to see if he could fix it. Ten minutes later we had to get a manager because he never came back out. He never checked on us the rest of the night. For the price we paid, I would expect the service to be great. The food was ok but the experience was kind of ruined..So the bad reviews on here is what I experienced. Make sure you read all the reviews because I was disappointed.

L4s2BKRvGvacCLvlcVtxXg.text: I'm a steady regular at Hugo's for one main reason and that is my admiration for their bartender Dean. An expert at his craft, Dean has been the bartender at Hugos Cellar for over 19 years and in that time his talent has truly shown through to customers and visitors from all over the world. In fact, I recently brought some friends of mine to Hugos while they were visiting from Ireland and right away they were impressed by Dean's charm, professionalism, and his impeccable service. He is attentive, charismatic, and consistent with creating amazing cocktails time and time again. If you're downtown and looking for a delicious cocktail, stop by Hugos Cellar and be sure to order a drink from Dean. Just prepare yourself because not only will you be thoroughly impressed, but you'll be eager to order round two and round three as well!

Kkywcj0urAoQylX2SImxrw.text: After much research I picked this place for the hubby's birth month dinner. It's on Fremont street and the place is a little older. I made reservations for Saturday evening. The service was top notch.  From beginning to end we were taken care of. We ordered an escargot appetizer. It was amazing. Buttery, not too much garlic, a must try if you haven't tried it before.  We got a filet with shrimp and a lobster appetizer as a meal. The filet came with a salad and I added one to the lobster. The salad add on was $21, it was good but not worth the extra money. They make it table side and there are quite a few toppings to chose from. The filet however was not good at all. I was so surprised by the dish in general. The potatoes, veggies and steak looked like something you would get at Outback. The filet had no flavor whatsoever. Fleming's has a way better filet. The lobster appetizer was good but really heavy as it had a thick sauce it was in. Overall the environment and service was great, but I don't plan on coming back especially if I plan on ordering a steak.

Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gin &amp; tonic

ohsQ-TOwDV1pUwQMQlRZSQ.text: One of the last of the Old Vegas steakhouses, this gem in the basement of 4 Queens Casino on Fremont is fantastic. The service from the tuxedoed waiters is top notch and the food is great. All this is in a fun classic old school Vegas setting.  The steaks are good but my favorite was actually the included salad made table-side on a wheeled cart that has probably been used for many decades. Each person at the table is asked what dressing they would like and then multiple salad ingredients are offered one-by-one until you have the salad perfect for you.  Also, a cake plate of desserts is brought to the table (also included with your meal). This included chocolate-covered strawberries, figs and apricots (one per person). Don't miss out on this dying breed of a restaurant.

kWoVNGW_3WCxcKfqU_RNBw.text: Over the weekend, we celebrated with my niece who recently passed Nevada's Registered Nurse licensing exam. Our dinner celebration at Hugo's Cellar was excellent.   Upon arrival, our niece was presented a red rose (nice touch for the Lady). The space in the lower level of the Four Queens felt like an elegant, tucked away, hidden cavern.  If you like the classic mid-century steakhouse & martini ambiance, this is the place to be.   Highlights:   ** The tossed Caesar salad table side is awesome. Whole anchovies available on your salad (yum).  ** We all enjoyed our meal. If you like seafood, the seabass is prepared to perfection. A nice delicate fish filet. I opted for the wild rice as my side dish. The wild rice is seasoned very well. My dining companions enjoyed their steaks. ** In about the mid -point of your dining experience, a small scoop of gelato on a cone is offered to refresh your palate (great touch). **The dessert, prepared table side, is quite spectacular. We called up the cherries jubilee. The flambeed dessert is not only sublime, its preparation is fun to watch.  **Most importantly, kudos to the staff who helped create a very special evening for the niece. Thanks to Rashard, David, the rest of table staff, the friendly host & hostess who greeted us at the entrance, and our sommelier (sorry, I did not get the sommelier's first name).  **The wine selection is impressive. Our sommelier recommended a spectacular Bordeaux. We had two bottles.  **Long stem red rose for the Lady.  We will definitely return to this gem.  Overall, an elegant, casual, and enjoyable five star dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fun to watch- Cherries Jubilee

VqD9OwJmjdBhGEz6NVju6w.text: Yikes. Do your research first. Very expensive. The only reason they got 1 Star is because they seated us right away. Service was bad, food was Ok and oh yeah the price was out of this world. I have eaten at Gibson's in Chicago and their food is twice as good and half the price. I rarely give a restraint this rating.

l-Y2j3LuYkDX81iLcNOMeg.text: Short review: This place is very expensive (for Las Vegas) for mediocre food. You can do much better, even in Fremont St. as the food is mostly flavorless  Longer review: the salad "cart" has some weird choices and they drown your salad in dressing and don't really ask how much of each ingredient you want. The steaks are black angus and not USDA Prime however, you pay Prime prices. Everyone at the table ordered the prime rib cooked medium and they all came out in varying degrees of "doneness." The steak itself was tender but had absolutely no seasoning or flavor and no crust or rub on the cap. They relied on the au jus and the potent horseradish for their flavor. the "pomme puree" you get is just a standard order of cold mashed potatoes and nothing special. The roasted fingerling potatoes are essentially whole baked potatoes but with a bit of salt on the outside. Overall, the entrees were very disappointing for the price.  The atmosphere was vintage Vegas and they gave all the ladies a rose when we arrived and the waiters are very friendly and wear tuxedos. Nothing bad about the service but the food is the biggest factor and it was a huge miss.  Hu-go somewhere else in my opinion. If I had to guess, it's the same Prime Rib they're serving at Magnolia's upstairs for $15.

YfUU166Oj4UOWujmHHmXJQ.text: My Lordy Lordy. This place is a treasure. What astonishing food and amazing customer service! Want to feel pampered in an old school Vegas way? This place is perfection. Salad to dessert - nothing fails. Gorgeous, fun, fabulous food.

z88HAM2JWY-wZoOERFcZ6A.text: Went to Hugo's cellar on July 10. Had. Even there several times and enjoying. This time food was horrible. All 6 in our party did not eat our dinners. My lamb was some of the worst I have ever had. Friends had the veal and the surf and turf.  Neither ate the dinner.  I guess my experiences of going to Hugo's is history.

pCQsDSG2QXsFw4j2UpS7hg.text: While visiting Las Vegas, a friend of mine took me here. Fantastic experience! I ordered the rack of lamb and it was terrific. The tableside salad cart personalized salad making was very cool. The price on the menu is for everything included, including a small, tasty dessert. The servers were very attentive and friendly. It is perfectly "old school" in a city that has way too much glitz and bling. I will visit again when I'm back in town.

qKih8wWMQiEUh0ksEYGGcg.text: "Hey, Hugo, the Late Seventies called and they want their awesomeness back!" Deep in the bowels of the Four Queens, just past an octogenarian with thick horn-rimmed glasses and perched firmly yet precarious upon a red (they're always red) scooter you will find the stairs that descend into the time warp that is Hugo's Cellar. And, I hope you understand that I mean this in the very best sense.  The menu, the courses, the table-side service are all stolen from the late seventies/early eighties, and in what could have been a cheap knock off, instead becomes a loving homage to the best of that time. From the Sommelier, to the very attentive staff (some of my party thought them perhaps overly attentive), I felt like we were in very good hands. Some of the fare that stood out as of a mistakenly maligned era, are the beef wellington, the glazed duck breast, and the ecargot en croute. The table side prepared salad (and for others I saw in the restaurant, the bananas foster and the cherries jubilee) add some entertainment as well.  Most in my party got the steaks, which they enjoyed. I chose the maple glazed duck, which was delicious.  What was also nice, and what felt like added value to the experience were the sorbet that they offered after the salad course (Caesar made to order table-side) as a palate cleanser and the strawberries and dried figs and apricots in chocolate as a dessert, that we had in lieu of a proper dessert.   If you feel like you may have missed something by having never dined at a fine restaurant in 1979, then do yourself a favor and try it. Hugo reminded me that there was a lot of charm back then, and what may have fallen out of favor, or became cliched in the ever-changing food scene still has a lot to offer us.   It is expensive, which is not what I expected from a restaurant nestled in a casino that still has $5 blackjack tables (another throwback to a bygone time), but then again, Oscar's Restaurant sits perched above a MacDonald's one floor below, which I have also been to, and which I will remember forever, but for a very different reason.

Lj8EoemqzOPgzBeh_LXgVA.text: I really enjoy the atmosphere and ambiance this restaurant has to offer. Just take the staircase down and you don't even feel like you're in downtown much less the four queens! The staff was polite and welcoming. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the wine menu and the menu itself. He made excellent suggestions for wine. I ordered the filet. It was cooked to perfection. It was under seasoned but the bearnaise sauce made up for it in a hurry. Every woman gets a single red rose adding to the ambiance.  I think, as far as steak restaurants in Vegas, this place offers the same quality as places on the strip at a way better price point.
