Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon

a7j3VGr6VqyO7S7pXOO5Hg.text: I wanted to try this establishment when I heard the Rat Pack used to hang out here and I'm so glad we did. Our waiter Vidal was amazing and our sommelier John was amazing as well. John has been here 35 years and used to serve the Rat Pack back in the day. So many positives to talk about. The ladies received a rose when we walked in, they brought a table-side salad bar and made our salads. We had an amazing appetizer that they cooked on a hot stone at our table. The steaks were delicious and to top everything off they cooked the bananas foster at our table as well!

gVv8iaSieZI9gDd3w0K4QQ.text: My husband has been wanting to come here for valentines dinner for 5 years, and he finally made the reservation 3 month in advance. So I canceled mine at Capital grill.  We were so excited to dine in the "most romantic place". But I was such a disappointment.  It was a dungeon, minimal lighting, old fashioned framed pictures filled every red brick wall. The decors looks so old. Other customers were all in their seniors age, loud, but seems happy.   So for appetizer we ordered the Seafood on ice for two. Crab and lobster was over cooked, flavorless and chewy, and the best thing on the plate was their shrimp, big, crunchy and fresh.    For dinner, his rib eye was tasteless, no salt whatsoever, after we informed the server, he said we had pour the sauce on it. My sea bass was pan seared with lemon butter sauce, the fish was so dry, portion was tiny, that it stuck in my teeth every time I take a bite. Feels like eating short hair or lemon butter dental floss. The black rice was flavorful. Veggie were soggy and old, definitely not cooked to order. And table side salad below par, I rather California chicken salad in LA, which only cost a fraction.  Oh I highly recommend their sorbet(free) to cleanse your palette after salad. I almost asked my server for second one.   Overall, won't come back. If you want excellent dry aged steak, capital grill at fashion show mall, romantic, especially if you get a window seat. I wish I kept my original reservation. Their steak need no sauce to swallow. And their fish didn't taste like strings. Not sure where they purchased their sea bass, I have had Naked Fish's black cod, it was so buttery and silky, it melts in your mouth. They should send their chief to those restaurants to learn how to cook steak and seafood.  Save your money and go else where. Definitely overrated.

wPceKHuRkT-xGUoJam4NJg.text: From start to finish, Hugo's offers and incredible dining EXPERIENCE!  Roses upon entry, sommolier to assist in ordering wine, tableside salad prep, and the Kona coffee experience!

Xc3LfM6Syed52UOzRLuoSA.text: I absolutely love Hugo's Cellar. This is an old school steakhouse that offers great service and yummy food. If you're a fan of old Vegas, you'll love the atmosphere here. Another plus is the pricing. Steakhouses usually are a la carte, which can get super pricey. At Hugo's you get a lot included with your meal. I ordered the filet mignon for $59. It came with a salad (made at the table), mashed potatoes, veggies and a little dessert platter. (Chocolate covered fruit and whipped cream)   I've always had great service at Hugo's! Everyone is super friendly and I have never had any complaints. When you're greeted at the hostess stand, you're given a rose...such a nice touch! It's little things like this that set Hugo's apart from the steakhouses on the strip.   If you park in the Four Queens garage, Hugo's will stamp your parking ticket, which will make parking free!

mfaEXbQazlIBs7rNIDKNiA.text: Service is 2nd to none. Food is fantastic.  What more is there to say.  Tho Hugo's Chicken is fantastic. The sauce was perfect for this dish and the salad was great.  I had the Walnut Honey dressing. Very tasty.

NW5iMTQZ8YUWMDauNf4s2Q.text: By far the best service one can get at a restaurant. Hugo's likes to keep it real old school with its dim lighting and basement brick feel. The food was delicious and the in between desserts as well. A recommendation would be to make the salad a bit better by adding other options/dressings as the salad is like any other salad at fresh choice but without so many choices. Overall great company, service, care and most importantly amazing plates.

Zil8Ero08b5Ivqb0yWf-qw.text: Service was good. Food was OK. We ordered the Chilean sea bass and the rib eye steak. Sea bass was average and the steak was decent. I've had better steak. We had the table side salad and my salad had a fishy taste even though I didn't get anything fishy. The sorbet to clean your palette after the salad was a nice touch. They have us a chocolate cheesecake for our anniversary and the chocolate dipped fruit with whipped cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NxYDh1SwrPwbi3dgxmHzRA.text: Fabulous romantic dinner for our anniversary. The food and service were superb. We particularly enjoyed the table side salad. My husbands fillet was  cooked perfectly. He loved the garlic whipped potatoes and vegetables. First time he cleaned his plate. I was extremely happy with the crab cakes and shrimp. The lemon sorbet was refreshing. The chocolate dipped fruit was terrific. Strawberries the size of tennis balls. Complimentary molten lava cake with ice cream was delicious and despite being full, we ate all of it. Will definitely return. Highly recommend for special occasions or to be pampered.

NZwFJpB-AV6NE8eFvu11ig.text: Such an awesome atmosphere and incredible service.  Menu is great and the salad creation is over the top.  Steak cooked to perfection.   Wonderful date night romantic place.  Will return Every time we are in Vegas.

yVGfJKf7fG8emn1lyp-fRw.text: Me and my family had a wonderful night last Thursday (4/27) at Hugo's.  As expected, Hugo's food and service are always top notch. My friend and his wife who were there to celebrate their 10 years anniversary and my cousin who proposes to his fiancee were speechless. Our beautiful ladies were greeted with a long stem rose. Our food was prepared to perfection.    Good wine and comprehensive wine list. Abundant and artistic desserts.  Richard and his team were incredibly accommodating and have accommodated our request.

PW1Sp1_IwJEXMEL6_JiRMg.text: My wife and I went to Hugo's for our wedding anniversary and we are very pleased that we did. Hugo cellar food was excellent and the service was was even better. You get treated like royalty and once hey found out it was our anniversary they treated us with and free dessert.  On our trips we depend on reviews on yelp   And I would highly recommend Hugo cellar to anyone. Although it was a bit pricey it was well worth  the experience.

o19hE5rsFqR5Gg_YimV99g.text: In my opinion Hugo's should have offered a replacement meal.

WML6JoC3aMTnNPcVJVOLzw.text: WHAT THE HECK HAPPENED? My God folks, we went in there at 6PM on Feb 22nd and should have turned around.  #1. Ordered shrimp cocktail. YOU NOW ONLY GET 2. I think they tried for 3 but the third one was the size of a quarter. That and no flavor PERIOD! #2. Salad cart guy obviously didn't want to be there as he tossed all the stuff into a bowl. His marksmanship was about 75% on. Salad was good. #3. After the sorbet to "refresh the pallet" we WAITED AND WAITED AND WAITED! 27 minutes later, they bring our dishes. Food quality...just OK! #4 The real pisser is FOOD PORTIONS. I had a dish with multiple items and a piece of fish that was about 1.5 ounces. NO KIDDING... 2 small mouthfuls and DONE! ZILCH AND then I found a whole 2 danged small shrimp next to the "fish suprise".    Then we tried to pay. WAITER? GONE! They lost my business forever AND anyone else I ever chat with.

-iNDZDlbUqOSdW52XOBoxQ.text: I love this joint - been here 3x and every time it has been exceptional.  From the longtime servers that treat you right, to the table-side salad, to the complimentary chocolate dipped fruit, this is the place I always recommend when asked about a great dinner spot.  Both my wife and I had steaks, her the filet, and me the NY Strip, and both cooked exactly as ordered.  We skipped the appetizers and desserts due to the already included amount of food at no additional cost.  It's refreshing to be at restaurant and not have every item ala carte, and with reasonable pricing as well.  A great value for the price.

yepNqMDNsEUA9F0VkdGTgA.text: We went here on Halloween and were so excited to try it! We ordered the crab cakes, lobster bisque, salad, and both ordered filets. Crab cakes were good, bisque was ok but not too flavorful more creamy... The salads were nothing special and definitely wouldn't order one if it didn't come with our entree. Compared to other steakhouses we weren't overly impressed. Service was great though!

xB8OFgpOgekgvV7McIm4wg.text: There is probably no place better known by the locals here in Vegas then the city staple of Hugo's Cellar.  I could write all kinds of information about where, when, what, how to enjoy, find, experience this restaurant.  However, there are plenty of reviews for all that.  So my experience in a nutshell:  The traditional rose delivered promptly to my girlfriends' hand by the staff as we were seated.  The nice sommelier that retrieved the PInot Noir we shared as we paired our meat & fish.  A beauty of a seafood sampler or "plateau" arrived in perfect timing.  Wonderful Caesar salad prepared table side to our specifications.  Then the entrees; Veal Chop Natural for me; bone in.  Veal Oscar for the lady.  The food was tremendous, topped with fresh sorbet and Cherries Jubilee table side yet again.  Yup, so many words to describe how wonderful Hugo's was.  It's an experience, a little pricy.... However, I believe that in most cases you get what you pay for.  Most of the time as a serial restaurant patron I find myself staring at the check asking myself if the juice was worth the squeeze..... At Hugo's; I had some damn good juice.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherries Jubilee
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate covered strawberries and white chocolate figs

sOBqagXR9mcn0eLsioXMcg.text: Just took another trip out to Vegas with my parents - and of course we ate at Hugo's 3 of our 4 nights!  The food is just out of this world.  The salad made at the table is awesome, the dinner is awesome, the bananas foster is awesome!  But if you are there Thursday - Monday, ask for RASHARD, he is by far the best.  He will make your experience memorable! :)

LfrfBCxV6ioDDpgWN8UpMg.text: Great food & service! Food did not take long. If you do end up complaining about service then maybe its your horrible greedy attitude.

gKhcqn0zjm-QeSl7gN8Ywg.text: I have to say this place is very impressive, everything on the menu is delicious and service was phenomenal!

zkuzIZQuDgJEvuO6LjWCZg.text: I thought the food was mediocre for the price. Lump crab cakes were not lump crab meat, just some stringy crab with lots of stuffing. We mentioned this to our waiter and he did take them off the bill, which we appreciate. I did love the table side salad bar, very fun and different. The tomatoes were frozen, but the other salad ingredients were good. The filet was alright, just nothing to write home about. I did enjoy the crab legs and the complimentary chocolate-covered strawberries, figs and apricots after dinner were a nice touch.

QklQA9GT8-92feqtEZsyZQ.text: During a recent trip to Vegas, I suprised my wife with dinner at Hugo's Cellar in Vegas. She and I both loved it.  If you want to score points on a romantic date, this is the place to go for dinner.  It's located in Downtown Las Vegas, at the 4 Queens. When we walked downstairs, they greeted us and then gave my wife a fresh red rose.   We were seated and immediately were offered service. I've had the opportunity to dine at many establishments around the country and few can match the service we had at Hugo's. The customer service we received was excellent.   My wife had the New York Strip and I had the Rack of Lamb. The steak was good and the lamb was EXCELLENT. Both dishes came with salad (prepared table-side) , asparagus and garlic whipped potatoes. For desert, they brought us chocolate covered fruit and a wonderful blackberry/rasberry cheese cake.  Excellent experience overall. I would love to come back. The only thing I wished they had here was a dress-code. The decor is a little old-fashioned but, then again, we didn't go for the decor.   Visited April 2011

Lc0GPcJ_Ty2-KNBy7NrjTQ.text: The food and service was fantastic!   When you first walk in you will be given a rose (female only). We were seated in a booth, a really cozy and romantic setting. We first started out with the jumbo crab cakes. They tasted awesome. The outside was nicely brown and crunchy and the inside was full of crabs.   We also had the Hugo's table-side salad. My husband and I both agreed that this must of been one of the best salad we had ever eaten. We had honey-walnut vinaigrette on our salads.  I ordered a beef wellington and the husband ordered a Filet de Boeuf Atlantis. They were both delicious.   For dessert we ordered a chocolate mousse. What can go wrong with a chocolate dessert? After all it's a dessert and chocolate. =)   Overall, we were very happy with the service and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo Crab Cakes
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hugo&#39;s Table-Side Salad with Honey-Walnut dressing
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet de boeuf atlantis

MO52vTU99ri2d0ydBu77Pg.text: Out right awesome. The wine steward rocks. Old Vegas is just different. For a 5 star restaurant to survive for 40 years is a True statement. A great night to experience Vegas off the strip.

e8cWXMD2KrHLlP4384cCMw.text: This place is like a Sinatra movie set, filled with brick walls, low lighting and waiters in black suits. The ambiance and meal were impeccable!

y9pvG_u1RUfZNZrT9Khu0g.text: Wow! Wow! to the service.  Wow! to the food.  Wow! to the ambiance.  Wow! to the prices.    Walking through "Freakmont" Street, pass through the smoke filled casino of the four queens hotel and descend into another world.  The staff of Hugos remember days gone past and bring them alive in the dining experience.  From the personal attention of the wait team to the very knowledgeable, yet un-pretentious sommelier, this was just an amazing meal.    Your meal includes (not a small) salad, a very generous entree, vegies and starch.    The food was the best we'd had the entire trip and then some.  The table prepared salad set the stage.  The final coffee service with whipped cream and chocolate sticks put the perfect cap on it.    By no means a "cheap" meal, dinner for six of us at Hugos was expensive...but worth it.   We left completely stuffed, with five doggie bags, and very dumb smiles on our faces.  ps.  Like the Coq D'or room at the Drake in Chicago, they know how to make a martini...and small it is not.  :)

dS9Y09Xr9m9niSl6pGjTIA.text: My friends and I went here during  a prior Vegas trip and I have to say I was really impressed!  We tried different cuts of meats (filet, prime rib & the rib eye).. all were cooked to perfection.  I think the thing I loved the most was the fact that that our entrees came w/ a salad, followed by a sorbet to cleanse our palates and after the steaks.. chocolate covered fruit!  yum!  It's definitely a good deal for the price!  This restaurant is definitely worth a trip to Downtown if your in Vegas!!

9U2Q3uL21uuL6zep2aqwng.text: One ofthe last vestiges of Old Las Vegas, Hugo's Cellar is a landmark buried in the midst of a row of unremarkable downtown casinos on Freemont Street. Impeccable fine dining with old school tableside service for all the traditional dishes: artistically composed caeser salads assembled before your eyes to deconstructions of ducks and flambes, the waitstaff attend to every need and whim. Drinks are expertly made as well as an attentive and world class sommelier will help you pair your food with one of 1,000's of bottles ranging from semi- affordable options to "holy crap, my house is worth less" options. Each table gets a team of staff at your disposal, all women recieve roses upon entry of the establishment and they provide light sorbet palette cleansers between courses. The menu is old school american fine dining and all entrees come with a custom salad made tableside with several dressings and easily a dozen different ingredients. Diners also recieve choclate dipped strawberries, apricots and a wonderful homemade whipped creme. The last entree I can recall having there was the Duck L'Orange which was almost a sexual experience. I also suggest the dirty martinis here too, almost a meal in itself and possibly the best mixed drink I've experienced yet. While not cheap, entrees can seem exspensive but keep in mind they come with salads and a light dessert. Add some sides of spinach, potatos and mushrooms for the table and a +/-$100 bottle of wine and 3 drinks came to $300 with tip for two.. The fact that Hugo's has managed to survive in the ever evolving city of Vegas when so many other famously fine dining experiences have closed should serve True testament to its continued dedication to its craft. Instead of blowing a wad of cash in the casino one night, do yourself a favor and try a truly fine dining experience. I guarantee that before the end of the meal you will feel like you've hit the jackpot!  P.S. NO this is not a modern food movement restaurant, they dont try to reinvent dishes or interpret them in their own way, and certainly the menu can be called dated and unimaginative. But thats not the point here. This is an old school experience with expected and known dishes served flawlessly.   -located in the Four Queens Hotel Casino -free parking validation at the check in counter at in the casino lobby

31Sd6W4vRYgvRAAUhtmPFg.text: The food was outstanding. My wife had a filet mignon and I had the Seafood Trio. Both were cooked correctly and tasted wonderful. The service was top notch, staff were everywhere and you never had to "find" someone to refill drinks, salad or bread. The only reason it got a four star was the atmosphere. The 4 Queens Hotel is a little run down and unfortunately you have to go through the whole hotel basically to get to the restaurant and the only restroom is also back out in the casino. Other than, it was a great experience.

406ZbzA9RWn6aebsamF0mA.text: After reading all the stellar reviews, I knew this was the place for my hubby and I to celebrate our first anniversary. I was pretty surprised when we arrived.  I did get a rose but the place seemed as unpretentious as you can get.  There were people in jeans drinking Bud Lite everywhere!  I felt overdressed in my casual dress and hubs in his kakis and button down.   Anyway, dinner STARTED off great.  We were greeted immediately, drink orders brought promptly, dinner ordered in no time flat.  Bread basket arrived (bread just okay, nothing special) and salad cart whisked over.  We got started on our delicious salads (so fun getting to custom order at your table from the salad cart!) Then it was like 'poof', everyone disappeared!  We couldn't get a drink refill or even a glass of water to save our life.  We were so desperate we even tried to get a drink from the food runner (of course he just mumbled something about tracking down our server but never did).  To make matters worse, we were sandwiched between two very large, very loud & drunk parties so we had to shout at each other just to have a conversation.   Dinner was perfectly cooked - I had the seafood trio, he had the prime rib.  Both excellent, no complaints there.  The chocolate dipped fruit was kind of lame (dried apricots dipped in chocolate?  not so good) but whatever, it came with the meal.  We didn't get any sorbet after salad so maybe they stopped doing that?  I dunno.     Finished our fruit and sat around for another 20 minutes until my husband finally started waving his credit card around trying to catch someone's eye.  20 minutes later bill finally arrived.  Brought by the salad guy.  Ridiculous!  Had to leave because we were so parched.      4 stars for food, 1/2 a star for service and ambiance.  I'd spend my hard earned money somewhere else!

7ek3m-IWmkqCQG0Bar2QFQ.text: This dark cellar with low ceiling makes me think Don Barzini (ref: Godfather) is in there and when I take a photo of my food, he will direct his goons to take my camera.  A busy Friday night required reservations.  The good thing about this place is dinners come with veggies, potatoes and table side salad. I had the lobster bisque as an appetizer with my lamb chops.  The bisque wasn't what I was expecting.  I only had lobster bisque at one other place.  That was William B's in the old defunct Stardust.  That soup rocked and this one was meh in comparison.  Not very much goodies in this smooth and creamy soup.  Maybe this is the way it's supposed to be and William B's did it wrong.  I just liked B's better.  The table side salads were a great touch.  I had the classic ceaser which was one of the best ceasers i've had.  My lamb chops medium rare were a bit tough, but it was still flavorful.  They served it with a gravy that had a hint of habenero that kicked it up a notch.   The rest of my family had the 16 oz prime rib, the roasted chicken, and the beef wellington.  We also had a side of king crab legs to share.  This was plenty of food. I ended up getting half a wellington and more than my share of crab legs.  Needless to say, I didn't have the opportunity to de-bone the lamb chops.   I would have loved to knawl all the good meat next to the bones, but there was too much food  and in Vegas, what happens at the dining table stays at the dining table.  A very big meal and worthy of 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 oz prime rib
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. rack of lamb
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beef wellington

llikQZhXrTU5M1bhEfb2jg.text: This Place is HORRIBLE! We had the Prime Rib there.... you cou not even cut it it was so tough. My friend choked on it and the waiters could care less if you die there... All they want you to do is pay and get the hell out. Very Rude and Outrageous prices! Not fine dining as claimed.... Go to the strip for real fine dining leave downtown for quick bites only....

BOdC-q0IvDY5emXs6nF_Tw.text: Love this place!  Bartender, Dean, was excellent.  Service was top notch, food was great.  Especially liked the table side salad prep.  They were very accommodating of a Celiac needing a GF meal.  Love the Old Vegas vibe.

jhea2NRUUv3g4QITxPvJkw.text: Great food with a cool Old Vegas atmosphere.  Only downside is that it is a nice restaurant, but so many people come in off the Fremont Street Experience not planning on a nice dinner and are dressed very casually. Seeing someone in cut off jeans and a tank top might ruin some of the ambiance.

OLEjAe72n7MqKl1j-nBgdg.text: We are from New Jersey and have been going to Hugo,s for many years. The atmosphere is lovely. We have never had a problem with the service. Our meals have always been over the top. We recommend this establishment to anyone wanting to experience the real old time classy Vegas.

x4-s990f_ykjet5hz8qRnQ.text: I've been to this place a few times, I love the 20 topping, table side made salad. The steaks are ok, very tender, but lacking in flavor. The veal chop and duck were good. The lemon sorbet between the courses was a nice treat. If its your birthday, you get a free chocolate mousse! Prices aren't outrageous, your meal includes sides, salad, evian water and chocolate dipped dried fruit and whip cream, plus they have real waiters, who practice the lost art of waiting!

Av7KFWl8KTdYMhSU4BSRTw.text: Yup...like so many others here have said.....this is a great slice of old Las Vegas. From the salad cart to the filet and finishing with the chocolate dipped strawberries, it was a very nice evening indeed. Perfect Valentine's date night with my Sparky:)

k5TUC3lYilWst-YKc7qYpg.text: my friends and I visited downtown Las Vegas. We decided to eat at Hugos. Never been, but heard decent things. WOW..we were blown away by the service that we received. Manager Rich is the nicest guy. class act all the way. We also had show reservations, and informed Rich. He immediately went into action, told the waiters to make sure we were out before show time. Food was great, steaks to die for!!! Better than anything we had on the strip, and it wasn't ala carte. finished off nicely with chocolate covered fruits. a perfect meal, incredible service and the nicest people. We will be back!

nHKNzd72afZOrRO1sYsoJQ.text: Hugo's cellar was a wonderful treat! From the rose for my wife to the EXCELLENT service. The salad cart was awesome....got exactly what we wanted and the ceasar dressing was just right. I had the rack of lamb which was cooked to perfection, tender and juicy. My wife had the seafood trio which was also excellent. The chocolate dipped fruit was a nice touch, but we forced down the cherries jubilee flambe at tableside...fun to watch and delicious. The decor was classic old-school and we loved it! The service from Michael, Anthony and Sergio was top-notch. :-D

f48SrShJUJYxxr_A5KJXlQ.text: We had read some pretty bad reviews about Hugo's but decided to trust the many more good reviews that the restaurant had received. We were not disappointed. Though the decor is heinous, it fits the tradition of the 40+ year old restaurant. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable and were accommodating of my boyfriend's many allergies. The entrees seemed a little pricey at first glance, but the prices were cushioned by many complimentary items. A generous, delicious salad, palate-cleansing sorbet, and a dessert sampler were all elegantly presented free of charge.  In addition, I ordered a Raspberry Lemon Drop martini at the waiter's suggestion, and I would highly recommend it. It was delicious, and it was essentially three martini's for the price of one. They even provided me with an extra sugar-rimmed glass. Overall, despite the establishment looking 40 years out of date, we would highly recommend this restaurant. Don't let the bad reviews deprive you of an intimate dining experience.

j55OiyesFWczXK9lLQZweQ.text: Oh wow.  Where do I start?  I can't believe people actually like this place.  The cheese on the salad was old.  The lettuce was iceberg (not that I have a problem with iceberg, but you'd think for 14 bucks, they'd spring for a nice mix).  The potatoes were undercooked, the veggies were old and overcooked.  The steak at Denny's tastes better.    And, to top it off, my friend's stomach started cramping after dinner.  He threw up his dinner and immediately felt better.  The only thing I can figure is people expect it to be good because it is so expensive, then they leave town and never come back, so the owners can get away with terrible food.  Only plus was that they poor a stiff drink.  DON'T GO HERE!!!!!

CVOk5m9eJnk6k_R8ic4NYw.text: 37 Years ago two monumental things happened.  My husband and I were married AND Hugo's Cellar opened.  We have been visiting Las Vegas one or two times per year  since then and every single time...we go to Hugo's.  We love, love, love it! Things we cannot live without?  Lavosh, shrimp cocktail, salad, sherbet-in-the-middle, any entree, and the chocolate-covered strawberries, coffee with real whipped cream and chocolate chips.  Mmmmmm.....    At 55 years old, we are totally stuck in our habits and LOVE Hugo's.  You should go and start a tradition of your own.  :)

kW8IWaCgZnunTdBtb9F5jA.text: Hugo's Cellar at the 4-Queens in downtown Vegas is a place you want to bring someone you want to impress. It's an 'old-style' high-backed leather booth sort of steakhouse, where every lady gets a rose before being seated. It's straight out of 'Old Vegas'. In short, they wheel an impressive 'salad cart' to your table with tons of choices, which your waiter will prepare before you, and the Prime Rib and Filet Mignon entrees were top notch too. Oh, and the service is unbelievable also. If you're in Sin City, it would be a sin to pass up Hugo's!

fY1rYwWm_EQUb66tnHDWuw.text: Wonderful treat when in Vegas! The rose is a nice touch. The best item on the menu, the table side salad. Unfortunately they made the wrong steak for my husband so we needed to wait a bit. The crab cakes were okay not the best. The salad though..... I want one now just writing about it. Lots of nice little treats through out the dinner. Wish you could get seconds on the salad....

8GdTM66RjvmEXmKEQFTi-w.text: My husband and I were going to Vegas for our anniversary which was 6-16-13. I had never been to Fremont Street and wanted to go for night before we spent the rest of our vacation on the Strip. I was told Hugos Cellar was a must for dinner. We loved this restaurant.  The food was good and the staff was great.  Large quantities! We were miserable, in a good way, when we left.  Fantastic martinis!!! The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because we actually went to Gordon Ramsey's Steak on our actual anniversary and it was like apples and oranges to Hugos.  It was on a different level. Obviously, it is a celebrity chefs restaurant.  But for a great meal and awesome wait staff, you have to try Hugos.  If we make it back to Fremont Street, we will definitely return here!

dGa4udEC8lWcWdxNXtGrMQ.text: Outstanding service. Amazing food. First time here and absolutely loved it. We got the two person filet and lobster. It was delicious.

6M_eOIDO4tCCmK9kUZ5ryQ.text: This was always a classic Las Vegas dining experience for special occasions.  On our last two visits however it has not measured up to its past, or been on level with the many other dining options that Las Vegas has to offer.  While the ambiance is still there the restaurant is filled with dinners in shorts, t-shirts etc.  Not sure that this is as much a societal issue as is the restaurant's however a dress code could help this.  Bottom line, if you are wanting to experience and special night and are surrounded by diners that are dressed for any national chain its not going to feel special.    There are still some nice touches as for the dining experience including; women diners greeted with roses, the salad bar at your table, palate cleansing sorbet between salads and entrees, and complimentary chocolate dipped dried fruit at the end. The problem has been the quality of the food.  This last visit I ordered the Prime Rib, medium rare.  It was cooked properly but it was firm and lacked flavor.  However it was much better than my wife's sea scallops that were not edible as they were overcooked and drenched in oil.  Overall, there are far too many other choices in Las Vegas to choose from for fine dining based our recent visits here.

r1BTTVCKnpgGhfuvVcf0Kg.text: I am writing this review because I was insulted by the receptionist and wanted to share my story! I work for food delivery called post mate. One day I got an order to go to hugo's cellar and make a food order via app. After struggling it took me 1 hour to reach it, cause everybody knows downtown. The rude, inconsiderate, and disrespectful man at the reception treated me like nobody as if I am begging food from him. I was trying to explain to him that I have no control over people's orders and if you don't do take away why do you advertise the opposite. He finally said "if you are not buying anything go away".  Such people respect money only, and if I reached there to spend money he would show respect. Unfortunately, I was doing my job, which is not excluded from being the worst delivery company in supporting there drivers, and I am considering to quite. Anyway, most readers would not think it is big deal, cause they are not going to be in the same situation, but just imagine if you know people work at this job and trying to support their families, would that give receptionist the right to humiliate them?!! Thanks for taking the time to read.

ShRiWXq_ZYPqgNBrO2GTmQ.text: Went here for our one year anniversary. Husband a big fan of steak so we decided this place based on reviews. Service is very good but the food could be better. Very dim and romantic setting.  Perhaps too dim because other guests around us were having trouble reading the menu. We looked at the menu before hand so we know what we want. Kona coffee for two is actually worth it and a nice experience. Husband got the beef Wellington which is 3/5. I got the duck which I will give 4/5. Portions are huge so you won't leave hungry. Table side salad is a nice touch and comes with entree. For dessert, we got the creme brulee, which turn out to be a disappointment. Creme brulee is not smooth! We were too full to get the banana foster but that seems like a better option.

k7XlRNc8JPXfSM-cqjRNrw.text: Great steaks and great service. A must when you are in Vegas. The table side salad cart is awesome.

NYpQDBqkvW1iOCOjyYu1QQ.text: Before going to a show downtown about a month ago we chose to stop by for a meal.  Couldn't have been more pleased.   My wife was greeted with a rose and shortly thereafter our drink order appeared.  Basically it was a triple for the price of one.   We split a ribeye which was perfect.  The salad were prepared table side, a nice touch but more importantly very fresh with lots of choices of veggies.  No need t order dessert as they bring chocolate dipped fruit.  Considering the quality it was more than worth the price..We would go back soon but frankly we want to keep this as a special treat.

xLT8wp1ioWZbCdfdOg-FSA.text: I can't say enough about how great this place was. We were running late for our reservation so I called and they had no problem with it. He told me to drive safe and we will see you soon. The place itself is beautiful with an old school charm. It's classy and welcoming. They give the ladies a rose as soon as you enter and then walk you to your table.   Service was great. Honestly its the best service I have ever experienced. You start out with their bread basket with butter designed into a shape of a rose. It was very pretty and the bread was fresh and warm. You ordered then the salad bar would come to you. The guy made our salads to order right in front of us. He had it down. He went through the toppings while having a full conversation with us and he never missed a beat. The salad was fabulous and my husband ate all of it if that says anything.  He is a meat and potatoes kind of guy.    Our entree's were so delicious. I had the Beef Wellington and my husband had a steak as well.  Mine was like cutting into heaven. It was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. My husband loved his steak as well. Served with mashed potatoes and a vegetable melody, it was all very very good.   Our complementary dessert was chocolate covered figs and strawberries with some whipped cream. I was completely stuffed by then. Our waiter mentioned to the Chef that it was our Wedding night so they sent us out a lava cake! I was so surprised by this. It was so good. Words seriously can not describe how delicious this was. They packed our left overs and put them in a nice bag to go for us. I ate my steak the next morning for breakfast and it still was like heaven.   I hated leaving here because it was such a beautiful night and everything was so delicious. It was the perfect way to start out our first night together as a married couple. I cannot recommend this place enough. We will forever put this on our list of places to eat when we are in Vegas.  Side note: Every employee we spoke with has been working there for years. I'm not talking like 3 years or so. The least amount of time there I heard was 7 years. They joked around and called him a young pup. Our waiter had been there for 30 plus years! It was his anniversary and he said they took very good care of him. I love hearing about places who take care of their employees.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary from the Chef
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WO0-f3kUSacfstUoj9lBoA.text: This restaurant was AMAZING! Not only was the food delicious but the service was exceptional. We had a traditional four course meal. I am telling you, I truly enjoyed every single bite of my food. I ordered the New York Strip steak and my husband had the rack of lamb. Three members of our wait staff were Vincent, Jaime and Nate. Their wine taster brought me my wine. They made sure our every need was met. The atmosphere was romantic and relaxing. This restaurant is ideal for special occasions and worth every penny.

7z98EfNVNDhnu9aTXsQ44g.text: This is the BEST place we've had dinner in Vegas, ever!  It is an amazing experience (staff and food) which we would definitely do again.  Make sure you're hungry when you go

Em60T2QQQ9nG-pOlxvUF4Q.text: The ambiance is what I liked about this place but the service and food has definitely declined. They just hand you the rose now.  It used to mean that a waiter has been to your table when the rose was put into a vase.  The host almost forgot to pull the chair out and help you scoot your chair in. My husband started to but then the host took over. The price has gone up in the last 25 years we've been going here but it's understandable. My filet mignon was ok and my husbands sea bass was delicious. They had his side dish wrong but he actually liked what he got better.  I asked for a to go box which they used to wrapped in foil shaped like a swan but now it's just a box. He cleared the table and even took away my bread I was still eating to box my leftover. I felt rushed and just looked at my crumbs on the table. I guess I 'm just used to the crumb scraper at a fine dining restaurants.

rUdO6MbxiK4d2GtF6nWLkQ.text: Food is amazing.  Have never been disappointed.  I eat here every time I'm in Vegas.  From the table side salad to the appetizers and entrees.  Amazing. Martinis are amazing.  Always beyond impressed with the food. Love the old school vibe atmosphere

cVi47XpgFTEbnW7jOSsveg.text: I will go wherever Hugo goes, except if it's his Cellar!   This place was recommended by a family member who hasn't been to Vegas in a bit.  Th best part is the rose they give to your significant other and then it goes quickly downhill!   We were dissatisfied on a number of levels including; service and quality of the food.  Hugo's is known for their table-side salad, however the cart they presented it on was a quagmire of cross contaminated food on a filthy cart! Not an appetizing scenario.   My wife ordered the fish, which was clearly frozen and tasteless. I ordered the he strip steak which was a nice portion by not properly seasoned with salt & pepper prior to grilling.   Also, we had at least 5 different waiters which made for a disjointed experience. The fact that none of the five could provide proper service just added to our woes!    The best item on the menu is the chocolate covered strawberries which are to die for as is the bill, which is huge, when considering the level of food & service.  I shall not return.

qoWhvlF67VWZ6n60GQkmnw.text: This is hands down the greatest gem in Vegas. At our arrival, I was greeted with a red rose. Overall, the service and food were impeccable and the restaurant has an old school Vegas vibe that can't be found elsewhere. #

5TeEjBKjrw0-J794t1u1qA.text: Classic Vegas all the way!  We've been here a few times and love the older establishments that are still around. It's too bad more & more of them keep disappearing because the way things used to be in this town was awesome! Wish I could have really experienced it!   Hugo's is tucked away & it feels very intimate. When you walk in it really feels like you're stepping back in time. The host is always so nice and all ladies are given a long stem red rose. I have to give it to them because this is such a lovely touch & the experience starts...  This place is dark & romantic with lots of masculine touches all around like the art & dominant blue colors.   The food is great! The value is great as well. Meals include everything so prepare to be stuffed.   We ordered: Beef Wellington & raspberry chicken and both were very decadent. The raspberry chicken is unreal! You get perfectly cooked veggies & a starch (in my opinion the garlic mash is the best). One of the highlights of your meal will be the customized table side salad service. You get to pick all your toppings & the honey-orange-walnut dressing is divine! The lemon sorbet that comes over to cleanse the tastebuds was great & then let's not forget about the complimentary dessert. Chocolate covered apricot, figs & strawberries! And fresh whipped cream! You will love all this indulging!   My man decided to also get the shrimp cocktail which isn't worth the price tag & several drinks which were reasonably priced.   We had a lovely meal & it felt like the days of the Rat Pack.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Long stem red roses for the ladies, nicest touch ever
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary dessert
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry chicken

LsE0zGCfPfDRaCYwxvWvDw.text: Updated review having been here 4 or 5 times since my original review back in 2010, most recently this month.   Hugo's is still the classic it has always been. I read some reviews knocking the location or the environment, but to be honest, that's what I come for. Hugo's is an oasis in a sea of chaos in Downtown Las Vegas (which is an awesome spectacle worth experiencing in its own right).  You won't find many other restaurants anywhere else in the world that offer career waiters that in some cases have been working at Hugo's for decades. I'm always shocked each time I go seeing the same faces.   For the price, Hugo's can't be beat. Sure you might find a similar quality steak on the strip for the same price, but that is going to be a la carte. At Hugo's you're getting a mega salad, sorbet, sides, and dessert included with your meal. The prime rib is easily my favorite entree but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  I've had seafood, beef Wellington, and several steaks, and although they're not the best in the world, they're done well and worth the price.   If you enjoy wine, this is the place to be. The sommelier's are some of the friendliest guys around, and although ordering can be intimidating, just tell them one what you're looking for and they will find it. If you're honest and just tell them a price point and flavor profile you're looking for they'll make a superb recommendation no matter your budget.   Overall Hugo's is one of the best dining experiences you'll get in Las Vegas. If you don't have a huge stick up your butt and don't mind going downtown into a casino that isn't the Bellagio, you'll love it. I recommend dressing well. Although you'll see some turkeys dressed in t-shirts and shorts, don't stoop to their level.

3UuKuqZVqU36w9IT4XdCiA.text: Excellant food and service. I highly recommend for a special date. The service is superb with some waiters working there more than 10 years. They first give you a rose for the lady. Then after ordering they mix a custom salad right in front of you. After your salad a little sorbet to change your palette before your main course. We got the Filet Beouf and the Veal Oscar. Both were cook to perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Oscar

_tEsz0Rb9g9cWx7WY1IH5A.text: Getting ready to make our reservation. Best place in Vegas. Chateau Brion. And lobster tails  for two 175 will cost you 500 on the strip and not be as good or intimate. This is a must see in Vegas. The sommelier is great. Attention to detail amazing. If you want a wonderful evening with your spouse this is it. Your welcome eating you time on the strip for a meal half as good at twice the price

90Wr-84BqUs6wErDLE_Tkw.text: We were downtown looking for some meat, after seeing all the positive reviews from fellow yelpers, we gave Hugo's a try.  The locations a little odd in the bottom of the four queens and the decor maybe getting a little dated.  However, I thought the service was a solid 5 stars and the food 4.    The table side salad was nice and the server Victor was such a character.  I'd order the salad just to talk with Victor, he is what I would expect to be a classic Vegas persona.     In between the salad and main course they bring out the tiniest lemon Sorbet to clean your taste buds.  Never had something like that before and thought it was a nice touch.   My lady friend ordered the prime rib, which was huge.  She thought it was good but maybe a tad tough.  That sucker had to be over a pound.    I opted for the beef Wellington, I thought it was good, better then the Wellington at Gordon Ramsay steak at Paris.  Ramsays steak is really good,overall better, but Hugo's to me is classic Vegas.  They aren't wowing you with the decor and a fancy meat cart.  It's excellent service backed up with good food.   The price was actually really good, when you consider the meal includes salad and sides.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorbet between salad and meal
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g8kbe_g76dEE0r2hF5_gDA.text: It really is that good.   I've seen other reviews complaining about the cost:value ratio. I have no idea where they've been getting their steaks.   In my opinion, cost:value is why you come here.   I got what might have been the best beef wellington in town, with garlic mashed potatoes, vegetables, the excellent table side salad, sorbet, and a modest dessert course.  $62.   Coupled with the excellent service, this might be the best cost:value dining deal in town.

CaPvYFsaUEmWMM631mRK-w.text: A friend suggested Binion's Steakhouse but they close during the holidays for a "Deep Cleaning" Hmmmmm, don't they clean as they go? Anyway I did a search and found Hugo's was highly rated so I booked a reservation for four at 5:00PM. My wife and I met my sister in-law and her boyfriend there, whom had traveled from California. What an amazing experience we had! From the greeting, the women get roses btw...to the seating and our approach by the first server, Michael. Every part of the process was spot on. I love that the water is poured from a chilled carafe w/o ice rather than a pitcher with ice. First, Michael took our drink order and came back with very well presented martini's. He poured them for us and left the remaining "Two extra servings" over ice for us. Basically, for the price of one martini you get three!! Carlos took our main order and I went with his suggested 16 oz New York cut with wild rice. Michael then began to make our salads, table-side. A great mix of greens with all the fixings of your choice, I went with the house orange vinaigrette, Amazing!!! These salads are nor small but rather large. Meal timing was perfect. Shortly after we finished our salads and made time for another round of martini's, the main course arrived. We were all amazed how the steaks turned out EXACTLY like we requested! Fresh sauteed vegetables with the sides were just fantastic! Normally, I push aside at least a few pieces of the less desirable pieces of say gristle/fat, but not here. Every single piece was perfection! Included in the meal were chocolate dipped strawberries, figs, and apricots I think. We did, however, order a rather large creme brulee, to split four ways. Access to the steak house is very easy. You park in the Four Queens parking structure and its a very short walk to the casino entrance and Bingo, you're there! I can't wait to return on my oldest son's Bday which is in January and will allow him and my youngest to enjoy their deliciousness. You will walk out of the place extremely satisfied and will be wanting to return ASAP. I hope this helps in your decision making in giving them a try. Peace out!

9qT0w1nZwbli5rxDG7qjpw.text: This was the first nice steakhouse I ever went to, So maybe I'm biased. But it was the best steak I have ever had! Filet mignon. Love how they give a rose to the women every time. Definitely feels like old Vegas, great service. Would definitely recommend this place.

9CzAGWDNUtIXgDYZVi4qLg.text: Really cool spot...not in a place I ever would have stumbled on. Service was over all good...however there were pretty big gaps at points during the meal we were waiting on service. The custom salad made at the table is really unique, fresh and delicious. The food over all was good. A nicer spot to dine on Freemont. Higher price point than we had expected...and really poor Website.

swy1mg0faPylD7eKh7aU6Q.text: Best service, great food, gave me and my s/o wonderful treatment for our anniversary   Everyone is so nice and warm and the atmosphere is very romantic and classic   Must go when in Vegas!!!

hfK1oZlt4wkAVLlRXK8Eqw.text: Hugo's is excellent, old-school dining in a city where this is now rare, and it is a real icon, a hold-out from the 60's in a town where few places still around can claim to be that "old."    It's in the basement of the Four Queens downtown and has the sort of old-fashioned fancy restaurant/steakhouse decor and character which I grew up being used to in San Francisco - dark with old-fashioned classic decor,  booths with dark wood, etc.  The waiters wear tuxedos and have been there a long time, and every woman or girl gets a rose.  The menu is similarly traditional - Beef Wellington, lobster bisque, rack of lamb, bananas foster, etc.  The food overall is excellent, there is much attention to detail, the traditional cocktails are excellent in a city full of garbage "cocktails" swilled in huge quantities, and service is overall excellent.  There is a complementary light dessert tray (chocolate-covered fruits, etc.) with dinner.    For anyone who wants to have really experienced Las Vegas,a dinner here is necessary.  Keep in mind the classy nature of the place and be prepared to dress adequately.

VgyZyFOiTQ9pNONShRnTcg.text: Wow... I must admit. This is one of the best   steakhouses I have ever eaten at. The price was extremely  reasonable, especially for all it comes with. For dinner if you get an entree you get complimentary salad and dessert. The salad is HUGE! the desserts were also awesome! It came with chocolate covered strawberries, and some other fruits. They also bring out a tray for other desserts you can select from.  The ribeye steak was so tender and juicy. I chose to get the garlic mashed potatoes, which were delicious. Overall this place was excellent!

7xcXKDHJmCEFXsJ5s-GaCQ.text: Hole in the wall - with the total upscale package Simply wow    I was greeted with a gorgeous Red Rose    2nd you are seated and fresh warm cheese rolls are place at your table with a cute butter shaped rose   3rd  you are served a complementary salad is made to order fresh w a waiter and a cart full of goodies to customize you salad  preferences  4th Then a small cute strawberry sherbet Ice cream  in the smallest cone you ever did see is introduced to you and told to cleanse your palette from the salad   5th main entree is served I order the Hugo cellar prime streak omg it melted like warm butter in you  mouth  Once you think  omg I cannot possibly fit another bite in you mouth -  6th A dessert platter with dip strawberries  are brought to the table   It was a lot food but it was such a amazing delicious experience will be back again next time w the hubby to share in the amazing experience

c9_uYQMYO7qED3X8YmZp_g.text: Hands Down, one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas. Its a must try and you'll appreciate this post after attending.

_dSDQvsjEqJbh1ER9ogk0A.text: My Hubby took me here on a recent date night. When I was growing up in San Diego, my family regularly visited Las Vegas and we always stayed Downtown at the Four Queens. I would see the diners leaving Hugo's and really wanted to dine there - mostly because I thought it was really cool that all of the Ladies got a long stemmed rose. Fast forward to now, and my Husband also had always wanted to eat there too, so we made plans for a Friday night.   He made reservations for us to have an early-ish dinner (6pm), and I am glad we did. There is absolutely no rush to get you in and out at Hugo's and our meal took nearly 2.5 hours. The decor is a bit old school - low ceilings, dimly lit and not a very large place. There is nothing fancy about the menu, but the cool thing is that your salad (which is prepared tableside), bread, and a small dessert platter are included with your meal. The service was good, and overall we were impressed with our experience. Sometimes, when you've heard so much about a place and have long anticpated eating there, you can end up disappointed. But I am happy to report that we were pleased with our meal. I mean, this restaurant has probably been open for around 40 years, so they must be doing something right!  This is still a very popular restaurant, even after all of these years. So you'll definitely need reservations. Also, they don't have a strict dress code and we also saw children in the restaurant.

6tETnub5tnIKabVwBilsOQ.text: Thank you for a incredible experience. It was my birthday that day. I have stage 4 cancer so this was on my bucket list. We are Vegas locals and what a look back in time to eat at a old school institution. Service was just beyond. Only the bread was not great.  Thank you otherwise for a great evening. Danielle

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry sorbet to cleanse your palate in between the meal
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chocolate strawberries and fresh figs with apricots for dessert
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye steak. It is 16 oz. We shared it. You pay 27.00 to have your own salad, potato and vegetables as a add on split charge.

YA5d6nenaTXeDpFWHcJTdQ.text: Had been trying to get to Hugo's for a while now. Finally did and boy was it great!  Ambiance was that of old Las Vegas. Service was outstanding.  I had the filet which was perfect. My fiance had the rib eye and loved it.  We both had the Oscar topping which maybe we would skip next time. Not because it wasn't great but because the steak was so great there was no need to add anything.  Cold seafood platter appetizer was delicious.  The custom table side made salads were excellent.  We skipped dessert because we were so full. Will definitely return on our next trip.

Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old Vegas ambiance

n7d7SEAb3bVwQEU-WKZK4w.text: Oozing old Vegas kitchy cool, dinner at Hugo's serves up old school martinis, huge hunks of meat and flaming cherries jubilee with a side of time travel back to the good, bad old days of the Fremont 'experience'.   Hostesses escort guests to their tables presenting each lady with a rose. Low ceilings and dark walls create a throwback dinner club vibe. Martinis are served on ice, with each person getting their own cut glass ice bucket and enough boozy goodness to refill the glass three times over. Frank, Dean and the rest of the Rat Pack would have been impressed.  Food portions are pretty large and the option to split the entrees is a good one.    The staff absolutely added to the experience. If you want a good meal, good value and a great old school Vegas experience Hugo's is a must do. If you're not a fan of nostalgia, then maybe skip this one.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Personal ice bucket for my martini!!

zKJpF3FWTQYzTsNFVEaSIQ.text: If I don't have anything good to say about a restaurant, I normally won't give a review. However, our dinner on September 9, was so bad I feel that a review is necessary, because I rely on what others have to say both good and bad on yelp. I ordered the ribeye steak medium rare. After I took one bite the waiter came by and asked how everything was. I said fine. He never returned. As I continue to eat steak I was constantly pulling out hunks of fat from my mouth and placing them on the plate...it was really bad. I order ribeyes all the time as that is my preferred steak, however, this steak was so fatty and had almost no taste that I felt it necessary to write this review.  Hugo's has beautiful atmosphere, great service, nice wine selection, but on September 9, the ribeye sucked.  I was so disappointed.

WaB9QDp_wNuS69ZspVqp9g.text: My husband made reservations here for my birthday on August 9th. It's taken a while to write this review because we were really looking forward to a nice dinner and it did not live up to our expectations. It's easy to find in the 4 Queens. Upon arrival I was greeted with a rose and seated immediately. The 2 waiters we had were extremely nice. I ordered a rum and coke my husband stuck with water. Went over the menu ordered our food. Bread followed, salad shortly after which was amazing. I didn't expect it to be so filling but it was. We were served a raspberry sorbet after our salad and our dinner came within a few minutes after.  So the reason for the 3 stars isn't about the incident that happened which was unpredictable and not the restaurant's fault it's about how it was handled after. Seated right next to us was a group of four. And my husband noticed that their waiter had said there was a protocol they had to follow. So he was watching but not being obvious and he told me that there was something wrong with the gentleman at the table. He looked ill and everyone was very worrisome security came to take a look at him and ask what was going on which we could not hear their conversation. We were just finishing up our plates and casually glancing over because he honestly looked like he was going to have a heart attack or something serious. Not even a couple minutes after our plates were clear I looked up and this gentleman regurgitated all over himself, the table and floor. Which you can imagine is very unsettling after you finish your meal. After that I felt sick and grossed out because I just witnessed that. I told my husband and he was like are you serious? We were waiting for our dessert and just kinda looking around because at this point the party had left and everyone is going about their business and waiting on tables and what not just bypassing this disgusting table. It was starting to smell and minutes were going by and we weren't offered to sit at a different table. Just sat there next to this damn throw up getting nauseous. I finally got up and left while my husband took care of the bill. The waiters were nice to him and asked if I was coming back so they could sing happy birthday to which my husband responded no she is not. They packed our dessert and gave my drink to go. Nothing else was offered. Apologies for sure and while I don't hold any grudges to my waiters because they were so amazing and nice I honestly can't believe we had to sit there next to that. Minutes were going by and not only was our mood out the window I'm sure most of the people in the restaurant was. BUT we were the closest table to this which was very disgusting. How are we suppose to even have dessert when we're looking at throw up?! The food was great I'll give them that. But there needs to be a protocol for something like that to where customers shouldn't have to be smelling and looking at that. That gentleman should've known his body more to get up and go to the bathroom but we shouldn't have had to sit next to throw up either. I'm not sure if I would want to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Tails
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

xUxMrbbX0IeessSAcc8PSw.text: I really wanted to like this place. The look and feel of It is awesome.  1. I only had 1 drink. Not because I wasn't feeling thirsty, but because our server didn't stop by our table for the entire second half of the meal.   2. Sitting next to us was an obnoxiously loud drunk party. I know that the restaurant can't really control this, but they didn't see a problem giving me a hard time because of the hat I was wearing.   3. The ribeye I ordered was rare or even blue rare. I wanted medium rare. See the photos. The steak literally had no seasoning on it. I'm no steak snob, but I've had plenty of ribeyes before and this one was tasteless. I had to use table salt in order to choke it down.   The salads and the pallet cleansers (sorbet) that they served were excellent.   Maybe it was just bad luck or bad timing, but based on the price tag on the experience and the food, I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Is this medium rare?

FwI-xOysVkQTWXrlyy--mg.text: The meal included a table side made salad for each person. The meal also included chocolate covered strawberries and dates for dessert.  The salmon was very good with the sides being average.  The crab cake was very good and a shareable size. The wait staff was very attentive.  The host presented all women with a rose upon going to the table.  The raspberry cosmo was a recommended drink.  It was enough to share and very tasty. The meal over all was nice.  The only negative for me was the cost of the meal.  It was good, and I don't mind paying good money for good food but it was bit inflated for what we got. Otherwise the restaurant gives you a great experience and good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake

MEsB-DMKLMkTX-rjyqJRtg.text: So for real I don't know why we haven't visited Hugo's Cellar until now, I think the location turned me off a bit but seriously bad on my part. My hubby knew it's been on my to try list forever so what better time to try it than Valentines. He called about 2 weeks prior to but was told they were fully booked until Sunday, 2/17. Oh well we've waited this long lol.   This place genuinely epitomizes old Vegas, with its old school charm and attention to details. As you enter the ladies are given a single red rose, nice touch. Then you're escorted to your table and introduced to your servers: Mark, Jaime and Teddy. Their service is like a well oiled machine, very precise and top notch.  I decided on an Apple Martini while the hubby had iced tea ha! Served table side with accompanying bucket of ice for the remaining drink. Bread service came with a cute rose butter, didn't want to fill up on that but just had to taste for research purposes lol. I had every intention of saving room for dessert and wanted to skip appetizers but hubby wanted to try the spinach dip with crab. Definitely not a regrettable decision as that had to be the best I've had. Next came the Table side salad where they wheel a cart with 11 salad ingredients to choose from and 3 dressing choices. I opted for the Honey Walnut orange and hubby the classic Caesar. It's delicious and a sizable portion. After that was a raspberry sorbet to cleanse your palate prior to the main entree which was a 16oz Ribeye steak with fingerling potatoes and a medley of veggies and mushrooms for me and Hubby chose a 10oz Filet Mignon with garlic mash and veggies. It was accompanied with sauces but honestly it didn't need it at all. Steaks were perfectly cooked, tender and flavorful. They then give you a hot towel to clean your hands before dessert. A tray of complimentary chocolate covered strawberries, apricots and figs are brought to end your meal with a bang. Unfortunately for us we didn't have any room for additional dessert even if we wanted to. The bananas foster will have to wait until next visit, already looking forward to that.   With a 25% tip it was still only $220. Very affordable, almost dirt cheap for the quality of food and service you get. We have been to some steak houses on the strip and paid twice as much with same quality food but less attention to details. Thank you Jaime and Teddy for a memorable night. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry sorbet
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table side salad

xzby-1Z-CTTxu_J416oZyA.text: Extraordinary. And the service is 5 star. But I warn you, it's crazy expensive. My entree was $67. It was worth it. Collectively 4 of us spent $450 I know. Yikes. The prime rib here was very flavorful and like 3in thick. You MUST MUST TRY THE BANANAS FOSTER.   Extensive wine list and in house sommelier to help.  The as a very classy touch by giving every woman a long stem red rose to take home.   While you can come in casual clothes it is low upscale and I recommend making it a fancy date and dressing up.

_Q9F_yozBw8De3HLGCbssQ.text: Hugos has a lot of classic charm reminiscent of old vegas.  Enjoyed a 3 course meal here with 8 friends last month.  This romantic cellar is a nice break from the hustle and bustle of Vegas, and it was wonderful to have a slow paced meal.  I'd say overall the ambiance and service were top notch, cocktails were delicious, but the food was unremarkable.  Enjoyed my lemon drop martini, and tasted my friend's espresso martini which was also delicious.  I've never been to a restaurant that makes your salad table side- it was pretty entertaining esp for a table of 8 to see all the different concoctions.  I recommend Hugos try new table bread, it was terrible (although the butter in the shape of a rose was a nice touch).  I ordered a seafood medley of salmon, shrimp & scallops.  Small medley- wish I had just ordered scallops, they were the best thing on my plate.  The salmon was dry & overcooked and the garlic sauce and rice pilaf were incredibly salty.  Enjoyed the sorbet cleanse in between courses and the complimentary gigantic chocolate covered strawberries.  The seafood medley was over $60, but if you factor in the bread, salad, sorbet & chocolate strawberries the price is more reasonable.  Again our waiters, the wine expert, and ambiance were absolutely wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary dessert tray- chocolate covered strawberries, whipped cream, and other fruit
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KfkVobC45TiU-e3K8VRLfQ.text: Loved this place. When you go through the casino you walk down stairs to an underground, low lit room lined with red bricks everywhere. The staff was so welcoming and took there time to answer any of my unnecessary questions. The meats were cooked and seasoned perfectly, I nearly died because I was almost full before our entrees came out. Very romantic place as well.
