_iwPs3IHxgrLvXoX4V9sTQ.text: 3/12/19 reservation  I had the Hugo Rib Eye cooked M/R it wasn't all that great. Not what I would have expected from a higher end restaurant not a top quality cut of meat Maybe choice at best. The wife had the Lobster Tails at market price. Over cooked rubbery and bland not what we would have expected from higher end restaurant. The service was great salad was the best part of the meal. We have stayed Downtown Vegas for years and have had better at Hugo's in the past. We were a little disappointed with the quality. The quality of the food didn't match the price. We have had much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

awJuvxdZYelS_6MfI9RjtA.text: When there because the last time we where in Vegas for my parent's 50th anniversary we has a great time.  Nice, quiet, great service great food.  Made it a point for just my wife and I to come back again.  Basically it was the same thing.  Only problem was the table next to us.  4 ladies doing their bachelorette thing.  Very noisy and at time vulgar. A older couple who was seated next to them asked to move and 3 persons who sat at that same table walked out.  Even the maitre d asked them to keep it down.  I don't fault the restaurant because they did everything right to us.  Just wish others where more considerate when your spending over $200 for dinner.

WiCJ7S-BUIe2c3uCsFquMA.text: I guy named Stephen from NY reviewed this place perfectly. Look at his review.   I felt like it was a dining room at a fancy retirement home in the basement of a janky casino. The salad was great and everything else excluding the entree was nice, but the entree was very underwhelming. I was glad we bought a coupon for 25% off our bill from Tix 4 Tonight because I would have felt ripped off without it.

k42pGj6FM3C_z1BcQjgIfQ.text: Hugo's Cellar was the first "fancy schmancy" restaurant that my husband (then boyfriend) tried in Vegas about six years ago. I remember being very impressed by the high class service and the intricately made food. I wondered, was this place good because it was in my pre-Yelp days? Or was it really THAT good? Yes, sir, this place is as good as I remembered.  This restaurant is in an unlikely location. It's inside Four Queens. Downtown Las Vegas has drastically improved over the last few years but admittedly I still hold my purse close to me when I walk around. I would highly suggest to valet your car because the garage elevator was broken and I had to go down four flights of stairs in heels! Hey, if you're going to a fancy schmancy restaurant, you might as well splurge on valet!  Once you get to the restaurant, ladies are given a single red rose. The restaurant is dark and has a old school Vegas feel. We were seated in a booth, and I appreciated the romantic ambiance. Waiters were all wearing tuxedos. They even poured water with a certain flair.  My favorite part about this place is the table side prepared salad. It comes free with your entree and you get an array of toppings to choose from! They give a cute mini raspberry sorbet to cleanse your palette. I ordered the ribeye steak and my husband got the Chilean sea bass. We both savored every single bite and still had leftovers to take home!   I'm not sure if it's because they knew it was our anniversary but we got hooked up with lots of desserts! We got an assortment of chocolate covered strawberries, figs and apricots to dip in whipped cream. Then we got a chocolate mousse cake that was melt-in-your-mouth amazing! Oh my, my mouth is watering just writing about it.  If you're looking for romance, good food and great service, you can't go wrong with Hugo's Cellar!

iSQ68hbLa0saCXUPfKDeEg.text: Fantastic restaurant. Old world service, delicious food, great price. You start with a salad cart, fresh made table side. Then we had beef wellington, not something you find every where and it was delicious. We didn't have dessert but they bring you a tray of dipped fruits instead. $180 for 2 of us and well worth the price.

tjPrcw5t5M6Iq0uHhfaF4Q.text: An old school hangout for the Rat Pack back in the glory days of Las Vegas.  Located in the cellar of the 4 Queens Hotel and Casino. The attire should be business casual, some people dressed more formal and some a little more casual, but one should never show up in tee shirt and shorts.  Onto the atmosphere, it is romantic, lit for the most part with candles at your table and the rest of the lights on medium.  The wait staff is fantastic and attentive!  They explain everything to you in detail and also make recommendations. No notepad is needed the waiters remember everything in their heads.  Food also comes out at a good pace, none of those 1 hour waits between appetizers, entrees, and desserts. I dare say after you are finished with your food about 10-15 minutes later the next course arrives.  My friend and I each ordered the lobster bisque,  plus crab cakes for appetizers, then the seafood combo (crabcake, scallops and salmoln i think) and I forget if I had cheesecake or apple pie. My memory is a little fuzzy.  The food was delicious, but the entree was a tad on the small side for the price.  Also order the coffee for two, it gets brewed right in front of you in a fancy contraption.  The meal came out to only 150 before tax and tip.  This included 3 appetizers, 2 entrees, 2 desserts, 2 coffees and 2 cokes.

lA3xddU6S5kWK1nJ8K5-iQ.text: This Place is such a mystery  when u walk in they welcome you with a Rose... not to mention it's such a romantic setting! My boyfriend knew exactly what he was doing!! 2 thumbs up!!  The food... Delicious! Top Notch!  if I weren't so messed up from the turn up I would of been able to eat more...but what i had was delicious...steak, shrimp, all of it FOOD COMA... Service Excellent ! ! So pleased with this place

rdZVPgrI6P95hTXPVQovXw.text: Went to Hugo's recently for a special event. I give this place a 4 star rating. The service is unbelievable but the food quality seems just ok. I had the Filet Mignon steak. It was good and large but, I have had just as good in a less expensive place. The salad bar was nice but overrated. We ordered the bananas foster for dessert. Was just soso.  Having said that...the service was impeccable. The waiters and servers could not have been more helpful. Our every need was met and we never had to ask for anything.   The price was high but not outrageous. You must realize when you are paying those kind of prices, you are paying for the hidden extras like the free rose for ladies and the plate of chocolate fruits that comes "complimentary".   If service is your desire..this is the place. It is fancy and high class. Just don't expect a lot from the food. You won't be disappointed.

Chu19VXxxPECQwxykg_6ag.text: Loved this place!  Awesome ambiance. Lobster bisque was incredible. Table side salad with honey orange dressing was divine.  The prime rib literally melted in my mouth.  The chocolate dipped fruit and homemade whipped cream was a perfect ending.  The service was outstanding!

IN-bmSErk7lm0w5MZg-Gxg.text: We had a party of 8, we visited on Wedneaday April 1st. They sat us immediately, then it took awhile to get a server or order cocktails...but once we did, service was great. They come by your table and build a salad! It's delicious! The spinach artichoke dip appetizer is wonderful!!! I had the filet, it was cooked perfectly. We were too full to get dessert, but saw that they have bananas foster they prepare table side. Wudu our water attendant was fun!

NSD1JwTPX5iGGNzW891z9A.text: So much to say. Very old school vibe. A free rose at the check in desk for ladies. A salad cart that is amazing! The Chilean sea bass is large and delicious. Service is almost always spot on. Its pricey, but when you factor in the salad cart, sorbet, quality of the food and service-you could do a lot worse. A solid 4.5 stars

Dd053bUoLZ3dGO73nODLOg.text: I wanted to love this place. My friend had been bragging about it for three years. The ambience is old school but a table side Caesar salad with prepared dressing and dry duck without a crisp skin just does not do it for me. Maybe the steaks are good, but the duck and salad disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duckling Anisette Flambé

Px3Wbk5crZgmMpgQFhJiGA.text: We have ate here a few times over the years for special engagements. I have to say if your wanting the  Old Vegas feel with the charm of a a really nice restaurant This is the place! It is in the cellar of the Four Queens. You can expect a romantic atmosphere, it is dimly lit with cozy tables. We love the old style service. Every woman is handed a long stem rose , they have been doing this for years. They will make you feel welcomed as soon as you enter till you leave. Well worth checking out for a nice evening out especially if your looking to make your dinner memorable and romantic.

LJ72W8_1pd_E4WE8ppWPNQ.text: Absolutely positively amazing!  Spent New Years Eve on Fremont Street and ate here and it was simply excellent!  Four of us ate and each meal was a work of art masterfully crafted!  The service was suburb as well, which makes a perfect combo, thank you Richard!  I highly recommend Hugo's.

y3P3K3_uCautb5Qn_FHocg.text: When I was told the best restaurant in Vegas was in the Four Queens, I was extremely skeptical.  It isn't the best casino in town, and to say that it's a step up from a dump is a compliment.  However, when you get to Hugo's Cellar, and walk down those stairs, you're entering a whole different world.  Probably the best date restaurant anywhere!   They give all the ladies a red rose when you arrive.  Then they seat you and give you the menus.  You order, then a few minutes later, they come by with a salad cart and they prepare your salad tableside.  I've never seen anything like that.  Then after your salad, they bring you a palette cleansing mini-cone of sorbet.  Then they bring you your entree and the food is amazing!  And after dinner, they bring you a tray of dipped strawberries, apricots and figs with whipped cream.  It is very intimate and romantic.  You really need a reservation and still be prepared to wait a little bit past your time.  It is well worth the wait.  And all of the servers are top notch and very attentive.  The prices seem high, but for what you get, compare it to other top notch restaurants in the city, and you'll see what a great deal this is.

NUzIJGeqYhG7KlsXj29-HA.text: Food was great sea bass, filet 4 cocktails, $250.  Crying infant that nobody corrected for over an hour. Won't return, way too much money to put up with this type of inconsideration from management.  They should do something about this careless adult behavior.

vka6pTs5mXOIV3zW_6HfkA.text: A Las Vegas classic that may be a bit past its prime. Service is great and a reservation still tough to get so your date will assuredly be impressed especially if she's a woman and gets their trademark rose wrapped in foil. However you expect more out of the food at this price point since there are so many better restaurants at the same price. Take your date here to impress her/him with classic Vegas ambiance but don't expect a ton out of the food for the price you're going to pay.

HPWZtwgOyNPiEfbFv-0P3g.text: My husband and I found Hugo's Cellar thanks to yelp.  We were very hungry and walked in with no reservations.  We had a 15 minute wait and it was well worth it.  The prices were high but we were ready to pay for the experience.  All meals included bottle water, a delicious salad make table side, and chocolate covered strawberries.  Chocolate covered dates and apricots were also offered but we were not interested.  My husband had the 10 oz filet and it was cooked to perfection.  I had the beef wellington, which I have always wanted to try.  Both dishes were amazing and both steaks seemed much bigger than 10 oz.    I've tried and tried to find a problem with the meal.  Maybe too much salad dressing?  The meal was amazing and we cannot wait to get back to Vegas to eat here again.

f1Nr8RdpjPBf_ECg6vGikQ.text: We had very reliable food.  Nothing made us go wow.  Reminded us of eating on the cruise ship.  The salad that everyone talked about was a little lack luster.  Not many normal salad veggies (no cukes, olives, carrots, peppers) but the concept was great.  Food was presented in a timely manner.  The servers were very friendly.  There was little seasoning on the beef (I had an end cut of prime rib and my  husband the filet de beouf.)  Mashed potatoes, wild rice, and veggies were good.  Fruit platter was good.  Brought us a piece of cheesecake because it was our anniversary.  Very thoughtful.  Overall it was good...  Just not WOW.

N8u_tYxuEKojN61YoS9EYA.text: This place is absolutely nothing less than fabulous. top notch service the whole way through. it is truly a dining experience, not just a meal. My wife and I shared our five year anniversary here yesterday, I had put in reservations online with a request for a booth in the special instructions, also mentioning the anniversary. when we got there we were greeted, and offered a table but told a booth would be available shortly. I only waited maybe five minutes. it's got such a great vibe, a very classy old school feel. They hand your lady a rose as they take you to be seated. The drinks are expertly crafted, I had an old fashioned while my wife had a dirty martini. We started with escargot, which I'd never had. Wow. Seriously, a revelation. I've been missing out. The rest of the meal was nothing less than superb. I will definitely be back, next time I'll have to make sure I save room for dessert (even though they suprised us with one).

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Atlantic, bacon wrapped on top a bed of King crab meat.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Trio, seabass, jumbo lump crab cake and shrimp scampi with all the fixins. Delicious.

cVYNbWbnR5iyeZAir_yEKg.text: Loved this restaurant. They hand out red roses for the woman. Decor is elegant and dark. Reminds you of old vegas. Food was great. Victor was an awesome server. He made our salad tableside. I had salmon, date has filet mignon and both were cooked perfect and tasty. Dipped strawberries for dessert. It was a wonderful meal on new years day. I will make it a point to eat hear again. Soooooo good!

oL1fhIx5wW8r7tKh_QDJQw.text: Even though I'm under 30, I'm a sucker for an "Old Vegas" experience, and this place is IT!  The ambiance is exactly what you want in an old Vegas steakhouse: dimly lit, deep red booths, great service, wonderful menu, etc. Each lady is greeted with a beautiful red rose and the service is beyond amazing! One of my favorite parts was the table side salad preparation because you have so many options, it's like a salad bar! The cocktails are so generously pored with an overflow glass that you really only need one! You think it can't get any better until you are served your entree! Perfectly prepared!   This is a MUST for anyone who wants the classic Vegas steakhouse experience!

atO48JSNGbsFSoaSvagE4A.text: Great old school steak place in the bottom of the four queens casino. White gloves and old school waiters. Food was very good with the table side salad getting an ok for flavors. Nice touch at the table though. Would definitely recommend it for any friends looking for something in the downtown area.

0IXNv13McfAGJEyOVx6msw.text: Exceptional service. Affordable and extensive wine list. High quality food. Really good, highly recommend.

OcIqHytAyBCTd-vP4kDknw.text: Great old school steakhouse. Excellent service, generous portions, complimentary dessert. Food was spot on and worth the $60 in cab fare from the strip.

wicKaLP7nsSfolndYnf5Kg.text: An excellent meal! Absolutely wonderful experience and wonderful service.   Pros:  -Great atmosphere- very old Vegas glamour  -Great service (An army of waiters, all in tuxedos, all very professional  -Great food (try to portabella mushroom appetizer. Amazing! -SALAD CART!! So fun and delicious  -Excellent martinis in HUGE portions- they come in a caraffe in an ice bucket, it's way more than 1 drink in there  -great soft, romantic music choices   Cons:  -Location. Fremont Street (and all of downtown) just isn't a safe area. The restaurant itself it great- but you take your life in your hands trying to get to it. Crime, homelessness, drugs, abound all around Fremont. I may not go back simply because I was so terrified walking to the 4 Queens and back to the Nugget for a cab.  -They had to butterfly the filet mignon

yoM3KzjfwXbLx2CQ0BRjpQ.text: We have been dining at Hugo's for some time now. I love the Old Vegas ambiance.  I've celebrated birthdays, dinner before the bachelor party, night out with the guys, and perfect dinner with just the wife. They start with a salad made table side (even have anchovies if you request for them). Escargot is our favorite appetizer. The quality of the Entrees and sides are first class. At the end they give you chocolate dipped fruit and freshly whipped cream.   Service is always top notch from the time you arrive until the time you leave. I have recommended Hugo's to everyone that goes to Vegas and no one has been disappointed.

31z5ZILQdn2_HS4tmCZOnQ.text: Great date place.  Very romantic.   Great food and service.  Vincent took very good care of us.  We will be back

0ahTLdzkXLl_qtZkNRl6Cw.text: Loved everything about this place. A bet pricey, but fuck it it's Vegas right? The table side salad is awesome. They make it to your liking right there in front of you. The ribye was perfection. Would definitely go back.

kxpul5Yj8btjwh_2VF1q9w.text: Top of the line!  Talk about a throw-back in time, this is the place!  It's located in the cellar of the Four Queens Casino in downtown Las Vegas near the Fremont Experience.  I felt like I was stepping back in time when I walked in.  There's even an old school smell that accompanies the place, one of those nostalgic smells of another place and time.  The atmosphere is quite romantic, as the lights are perfectly staged for an evening of fun.  =0)  Every couple is given a long stem red rose for their significant other.  I found that to be a rather charming touch.    The wine is absolutely delicious and they have their very own wine connoisseur who delights in telling you a story or two about his wine experience working at Hugo's over the years.  He's quite personable.  ;0)  He promised he'd help finish the bottle of wine off if we had any problems with it.  =0)  The martini's are to die for as well!  I had one that seemed like 2 and a half....wow---is all I have to say about that.    The food is absolutely delicious and the service was superb!  Before I kick in to detail about how wonderful the food was, let me say that every entree comes with seasoned vegetables and baby red potatoes, a fresh salad, fresh bread, sorbet and chocolate dipped fruit.  I kid you not...really.  =0)    So, carrying on---We had the Fabulous Michael as our marvelous server and he was SUPERB, with an in-depth knowledge on all of the meals offered.  I opted for the awesome Salmon and my pal opted for the Chilean Sea Bass.  They were both EXCELLENT!!!!    Prior to the dinner coming over they have a huge salad cart that comes around and you can select exactly what you want on your salad.  I was pretty full just from the salad.  =0)  But, I pressed on and ate a little bit of everything.   Well, we were quite full, but the Banana Fosters looked like such an awesome presentation that we decided to order that just for the experience.  =))  The experience is quite unique and I recommend giving it a try!  You must!!  You will be quite delighted, I promise you.  Yvette L. Brownstone from Ventura, CA

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My awesome salmon....Yum--Yum--Yum.  My partner had the Chilean Sea Bass and he loved it!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh bread....
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you have any questions about the wine, Jon will surely help you.

-qfMRJSJE8bYkEQ5bwJ0Ng.text: My go to steakhouse in Las Vegas. Been going here for well over 30 years now.  I always sit at Victors station. He makes the best salads if you let him build it and don't ask. My favorites: Rib Eye steak, Prime Rib, Crab Cakes, Banana's fosters, and the Kona coffee made right on your table. Let Jon pick out your wine. He is VERY knowledgable....just tell him your price range and you'll be surprised.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Victor!! Best man in the house! He will fix the best salad, banana fosters, and entertain you with his humor. Ask for his table.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let them know if it&#39;s a special occasion
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kona Coffee with our dessert.

9kbPt1ZJCujxIDApP_NwVA.text: When it comes to a romantic night out in Vegas, this is my #1 recommendation.  Hugo's Cellar is extraordinary.  Located on Fremont street, in the basement of  the 4 Queens Hotel, this is one place in Vegas you should not pass up.  You begin your evening checking in with the Maitre D', and grabbing a seat in their small but well appointed bar area.  When your table is ready, they give any women in your party long stemmed red roses to set the ambiance for the evening before leading you through their intimate dining area to your table.  Your wait staff will stop by, introduce themselves, and get drink orders. (Yes, I said wait staff - you will have three waiters jumping to get you whatever you need to make your dinner fabulous.)  They will also offer to send over their award winning Sommelier to advise on your wine options.  They have a well appointed wine cellar, and a wide variety of bottles to choose from.    After your orders are placed, and your appetizers are finished, one of your waiters will bring a cart to the table, and make each person a generously portioned tossed salad, right at your table.  Their salad dressings are all wonderful, and they have a nice selection of salad toppers to choose from.  After salad, you will be given a miniature sorbet ice cream cone as a palette cleanser before the main entree arrives, and this is when your taste buds will do a dance of joy.  Their food is AMAZING.  Their prime rib is some of the best in town, but their Raspberry Chicken is my whole reason for going to Hugo's.  It is DIVINE.  My wife loves their Beef Wellington, and my in-laws both love the Queen's Lobster.  After your meal is complete, you waiters will bring a tower of chocolate dipped fruit to share while you peruse the dessert menu. I can't comment on the dessert offerings because their food is so incredible I've never been able to save enough room to actually contemplate ordering one.  I can say that the chocolate dipped figs and strawberries are delightful.  The best part is that at Hugo's, their prices do not match the extravagance of their service.  An average evening with dinner, a shared appetizer, and 2 glasses of wine or adult beverages, and our average ticket is about $150 after tip.  For a dining experience like Hugo's, I have spent easily twice that much at other establishments.  Do yourself and your wife a favor, and treat yourselves.  it is worth every penny.

OLCdMxZTXH5M53AhRDlFVw.text: Best dinner salad I've ever had ANYWHERE

YVSqXltID_Pn-A7LmDaCDA.text: Absolutely amazing service every time I come here.  The price for what you actually get is a bargain.  I had the surf and turf with several kinds of seafood along with Avery tasty big filet mignon.  Of course we had the table side salad which is always a treat.  The blessing is that Hugo's is one of the few places that isn't a la carte.

IHKGjmuQ_KinY0fx96UUJg.text: Talk about amazing! From the start of our date to the end, Hugos did not disappoint!! We went here on a friends recommendation. It was a treat your self weekend as we are celebrating my graduating from grad school and getting a job. The staff was fantastic and the food OMG the food!!! We can't wait to go back. Please dress up it makes it so much more fun

NsuhZmFPe9qrI3WZsDt9uA.text: Went here 12/21 to celebrate an early Christmas dinner with my mother in law who is 86. AWESOME! Great old school vegas feel, amazing service. Salad was good, sides were good, meat was excellent and cooked to perfection. The portions were huge so don't know how people do apps and dessert. The complementary chocolate dipped fruit was the perfect sweet treat at the end but they even took it a step over the top and surprised us with a chocolate lava cake because we were also celebrating a birthday. My mother in law loved it and she was so happy to relive some of her youth in old school vegas.

uNHsg2k0pI7h44MrCqmL8w.text: My wife and I had dinner at Hugo's Celler on Tuesday 6-4-13.  This is the fifth time in seven years that we ate here.  I found this place strickly by accident in 2006.  I call it our hidden gem! The service is outstanding.  Although the waiters are in Tux's, you can wear casual clothing there.  The food is excellent, the drinks are generously poured and the steak selection is great. I look forward to coming back to Hugo's again.  The prices are also very reasonable for the quality and quanity of the food.  Make sure you tip at least 20%...the food and service is well worth it.

VEeHKAQYKKmgM99ui-2qzA.text: by far the best restaurant I have been to in Las Vegas! The service is amazing. The staff is polite, funny, and super helpful. Than to top it off when amazing food and steak YUMMMMMMMMMMM

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pAyktvV5ceXzkFxipE3Mqw.text: First, reservations are a must! There were 7 in our party and they placed us in a corner booth/table, which was perfect. We ordered drinks, appetizers, had salad prepared table-side. The salad toppings and dressing selection was vast; the result was delicious! Our entrees were generously portioned and tasted great. As we were celebrating an anniversary and a birthday, a special dessert was presented to the celebrating parties; the occasion was spelled out in chocolate on the plates. Very good! We topped off our meal with coffees and a dried fruit/chocolate/whipped cream platter. Needless to say, we were beyond satisfied (i.e. stuffed!) when we left. Each lady in our group was presented with a rose, which was an appreciated touch. In sum, we felt welcomed, appreciated, and were excellently treated. If you're looking for an elegant and romantic experience, Hugo's shouldn't disappoint.

9W2pQdS5iyoEUB7304Iq-g.text: My wife and I have dined here at least twenty times in eleven years of going to Vegas.   Every good thing you read about HUGO'S CELLAR is True. The classiness, romance and "old-school" nature of this place cannot be understated.  My wife does not eat meat but pines for seafood as good as HUGO'S CELLAR at other high-end restaurants. While their steaks are not of the caliber of some high-end steakhouses, the prime rib here is astounding, you may not be able to enjoy prime rib anywhere else after you have had it at HUGO'S CELLAR. The other entrees are all excellent and the price is reasonable for portion and quality, especially compared to some of the high-end places popping up in Vegas.  If I have complaints they are minimal - the legendary custom salad cart seems to produce smaller salads than even form just a few years ago and some of the newer wait-staff is not as in love with the HUGO'S experience as the old team.  But this is quibbling - bring the love of your life here on your next Vegas trip. It will be a great experience.

_dmyfUBjdXEHrICoIiVVwA.text: Took my wife and 4 friends for my wife's 50th birthday. Damn. We have been to a lot of nice restaurants in our day but Hugos gave us the whole experience. Great atmosphere, great service, great food. The best dining experience we have ever had. The apps were great, the table side salad was great and the entrees were great. This is one day we will never forget.

cbzwaieIqRdSB_fUd8BwZw.text: omg awesome thank you, great bday dinner, the table side salad bar was amazing! of course i got beef wellington insane,, sierra got tuna with crab meat,,   the waiter vincint rocked and gave us history on the restaurant... bring my cousin back next time

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. awsome bday dinner

afRARy_ZiCuvBko6RNYzAQ.text: Best martinis ever...and they give you 3 servings in a carafe. Rack of lamb is always perfect. Salad is made to order and spectacular. This time it was the 10 of us dining out. Everyone was happy. I took off one star because the tiramisu was an abomination...come on guys, go pick one up at Costco, charge triple and serve it up. Another huge minus: it's off of Freemont street....I'm so over the freak show, it's just gross. Having to put up with that might be the only reason why I might not return to Hugo's.

GzMzPp2cwgwPGhB74N9qEg.text: Very nice atmosphere located below a dumpy casino...   the portions are huge and it is a throwback atmosphere to the old days.  Service is 5 star all the way and I love how the prepare the salad tableside allowing each person to choose their ingredients... that was awesome.  Giving it 3 stars just because I wasn't blown away by my lobster medallions dish, which was a little rich for my taste personally.  (Heavy sauces)  Everyone else left so full we didn't want to eat for 2 days... Not to say it was bad, but I would try something else next time.

wiNKrGVGGvj15XtcHzNfSQ.text: What a gem. I was pretty blown away by Hugo's in every way possible. Perhaps my expectations were low or it was just really great. Now, I'm not exactly sure what "old Vegas" felt like, but the food and service that Hugo's provided was what I would have imagined "old Vegas" to be like. I would advise that you make reservations. There was a couple of men who walked up to the host just before we did and they were told the wait would be at least 2 hours.   It was my boyfriend's birthday and each year, I try to find a local gem to take him to - something that was different than the usual Strip offerings. Prior to September 2015, I had never even heard of Hugo's. I found it on Yelp and after reading the many positive reviews, I decided we had to go. I have never ventured into a Downtown casino and thought that the parking situation would be similar to the ones on the Strip. Drive in through the front and either valet or self park. Not really the case here. Hugo's is located inside the Four Queens Hotel & Casino. Google Maps and Waze directs you to the front entrance on Fremont. All parking, however, is on Carson. Because of this, we were 10 minutes late getting to Hugo's, Even so, the host had a sense of humor about it and gave us a choice between a cozy booth or a table. After we selected the booth, he plucked out a beautiful, long-stemmed red rose from a basket of roses and presented it to me (as they do to every lady dining at Hugo's).   The restaurant itself isn't huge. It is dimly lit and the decor really is reminiscent of "old Vegas" in a glamorous and romantic way. The waitstaff was all dressed in tuxes and fairly mature. Our server was Michael. He took the time to explain and validate our meal choices by telling us how great the dishes were, and the care it took to prepare those dishes.   For the appetizer, we ordered the crab cakes. Let me tell you...they were the best crab cakes we had ever had. Moderately-sized patties made of lump crab meat with just the right amount of crust. It came with some kind of aioli but I honestly couldn't tell you about it. I just remember the crab cake. I didn't want it to end.   Once the appetizer has been cleared comes the salad cart which comes with every entree. A different waiter wheeled the cart over to our table, gave us each our choice out of 4 different dressings. Then they go through the cart, asking you which ingredients you want/don't want. Once you've picked everything, the salad is tossed and served in front of you. It was a pretty good portion of a very delicious salad.  Now getting to the best part. I ordered the Beef Wellington. Michael recommended I get it medium rare, which I did and I have zero regrets. It was perfect. The puff pastry crust was flaky and moist, concealing the filet of beef topped by a piece of deliciously and politically incorrect food (foie gras). My boyfriend ordered the ribeye medium rare and it was cooked to perfection, juicy and tender.   You'd think after all that food, we would have been too full for anything else. You're dead wrong. We each had a cappuccino and were going to call it quits until a server brought over the dessert tray. We couldn't turn down the chocolate lava cake and I'm glad we didn't. Gluttonous? Definitely. Worth it? Oh yea.  Also, when Michael took our payment, he also offered to validate our parking ticket. We, in our food-induced fog, would have forgotten to validate. 5 stars for the food. 5 stars for the service.

ZTTLO_Y7jo25hRH49Xe6Aw.text: Went here for V-day with the wife and both of us were pretty impressed.  I still can't get over the fact that THIS place is at the Four Queens!    Table side salad was great..we just got everything on it..can't remember the last time I had anchovies in my salad but it was pretty good.  The wife went with the beef wellington and I got the rack of lamb which were both fantastic.    They gave us 2 complimentary desserts.  One was a plate of things dipped in chocolate and the other was 2 chocolate coated gelatos shaped into hearts.  Dropped a little over a $100 for everything but I found it to be well worth it.  I was worried after reading so many recent reviews of this place that said Hugo's was going downhill (even from some that had been coming here for years) that this place was going to suck bigtime.  Well...this is pretty damn good if this is downhill.

UWNMI0uKMY5n8-HXAWB3lg.text: Where do I start?! This place is great. It has a very romantic atmosphere with dim lighting. The service is excellent. We were a party of 6 after a special occasion and we were treated like royalty. They gave all the ladies roses as we walked in and offered us champagne. We had about 3-4 wait staff check on us. I'll admit I was a bit put off by the prices but once the server explained the menu, I was so ready to dig in. I ordered the steak with garlic mashed potatoes and veggies. DELICIOUS!!! The entree came with a salad which is prepared in front of the table as you tell the server what ingredients you'd like. After salad, they served us a lemon sorbet on a cone to clean our palettes. Then came the entree and after that, was dessert which was chocolate covered strawberries, baby figs and dates. OMG!!! I was pleasantly stuffed. They also have an amazing dessert platter. My husband ordered the creme brulee and said it was phenomenal. Wow!! It really put the cherry on top for the occasion we were celebrating. I'm saving my coins to get back here for the next special occasion. I had a wonderful time and staff were absolutely incredible.

F9jfI598sSoU616yoGM5JA.text: We ate here last night and, sad to say, it was less than stellar. We called for a reservation at 5 hoping to get in at 7:00. It was short notice I know. At first, Rich, the manager said not until 9:00. I said ok we'll go somewhere else. Then he said we could come at 6:30. Great! I wish we hadn't gotten in.  Let me start off my saying this is not a cheap restaurant by any means and we knew that. When we walked in as per usual, they gave me a rose. They give Roses to all the female guests.  We ordered drinks which were fine. A little light, but not bad. For an appetizer, we had the escargot which was really good. I was none to pleased when the dirty dishes remained on our table for an extended length of time. I finally stacked them and put them by the edge of the table hoping one of the 3 people taking care of us would notice.  Erik was our head waiter. He disappeared and I called over Oscar to order a bottle of wine. He stated he could not take orders for bottles of wine only the Sommelier could. We had to wait for him. That was about a 15 minute wait. I've known the sommelier there for years and mentioned to him I wasn't too pleased with the service so far. He said I should tell Rich, the manager. I decided to wait it out and see how things progressed. They went downhill from there.  I ordered the Veal Oscar and my husband ordered the filet. First, they give you a salad made table side. It is fine. It is a lettuce salad with your choice of dressing and toppings.   My veal came and it was awful. It tasted fishy. I didn't say anything to my husband, but told him to try a bite. He said the identical thing. I tried his steak. It was dry on the ends and you needed a lot of sauce to get it down.  I had to track down Erik again as I was not paying $49 for bad veal. When I was able to get him and told him the veal was bad, he got rather indignant and stated that the only thing he could get to me was the prime rib. I guess it was sitting there. I did not want prime rib. He got very angry, took the plate and walked away. I just shared my husband's steak with him.  I told John, the sommelier, about the altercation with the waiter. He said to tell Rich. I told Rich what happened and even he didn't offer me something I would like better. He said he would give me his card before I left for a free meal. Yeah right. This meal should have been free. They gave us a desert for our anniversary and you could tell it was not fresh, it had been pulled from the freezer. There was ice falling off of it.  We got the bill and they did take the drinks and my veal off, but charged us $17.00 for the salad that was supposed to come with the meal and that was just wrong!  Before he delivered the bill, Erik came back as I'm sure he was told to by the manager to  make it right. Instead he began arguing with me. Hey jerk I'm the customer.  So for one entree and one desert we ended up with a $129.00 bill. Of course, I couldn't find Erik again to discuss the charge for the salad. On the bill, there is a place for 2 tips. One for the server and one for the sommelier. I gave john 20% of what the wine cost. I gave Erik $1. He didn't deserve anything. Never saw the manager again either. So much for the card for the meal.  This was totally unacceptable for a restaurant of their caliber. I've been eating here since the 1980's, but I won't be going back. Too many other good restaurants in Vegas to choose from. This was the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant in Vegas!

CB4qpqTl5spm57MrVVAudA.text: Came here for our Anniversary last night and i will not be coming back. It was my first time at hugo's cellar and unfortunately it was my last time too.  I noted when I made the reservations that we were celebrating our anniversary and it was not acknowledged at all by our servers, the sommelier did say happy anniversary after we said we were celebrating.    I was so excited to try hugo's cellar and I'm sad that it was such a disappointment.  We got there early for our reservation so we could go to a show.  We got seated right away, got our drink orders taken after a few minutes and didn't see either of our servers for almost 30 minutes.  Nobody even acknowledged that we were just sitting there waiting for our server.    My boyfriend asked an employee about getting our order taken, they didn't know who was our server, he came back to the table and we waited like another 10 minutes for one of our servers to come to the table.  We told him that we wanted to order an appetizer but we were running late now since we had waited for so long.  He didn't even apologize for leaving us sitting there for over 30 minutes.  We had to skip the appetizer and order the main course.   We got the included tableside salad but I felt like I had to rush while eating it.   I work as a server and am not unreasonable but I expect good service, even an apology for making us wait and an acknowledgement of our anniversary would have been nice.

bJ5tTiLelKNo6n2RMYcBjA.text: Will Never Return  As local foodies, we enjoy all the wonderful restaurants Vegas offers. Hugo's has been one of our favorites for 15 years. You could imagine our disappointment when 7 of us dined & were not able to order an appetizer along with our drinks without first ordering our meal. The assistant manager begrudgingly agreed after much discussion to grant us that request. It took 20+ minutes to receive, during a not-packed evening. Our servers were apologetic & attentive as usual despite that Jon, our favorite sommelier, was not there. My husband was ready to call Andiamo's at the D where we had had a terrific dinner for 10 a few weeks before. After dinner we requested our leftovers but when we got home, we found just a portion in each box. Normally, I'd ignore that but not after the condescending, boorish treatment by the assistant manager earlier. He responded scoffingly: Do you expect me to drive over & deliver them? I responded that I wanted the manager to call me the next day so I could explain the evening's experiences. Well, it's been 11 days. I get your message loud & clear, Mr. Assistant. Instead of Hugo's we will dine with friends, business clients & family at our other favorite restaurants: Bouchon, T-Bones, Andiamo's, Botero, & so many others.

BDMiGDKEEKK-wsaKF4Chew.text: Excellent service and food was delicious. We ordered the hot rock specialty for two, new york strip, and filet mignon! All cooked to perfection. Our waiters were so wonderful always friendly and making sure we were doing well.  We also ordered a couple of drinks at the bar and the bartender was so cool, he also came to our table to see how we were doing! Hugos is a hidden gem in the 4 queens! We will definitely bring family and friends back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious mousse! Our waiter did an awesome job decorating it!

jf_T6CIphUtRlwchTv28ZA.text: We had a wonderful dinner at Hugo's. The service was excellent, and the food was delicious. Thank you for the red roses!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent salad :p
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium rare prime rib. Delicious!!!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy steak

i7B6S4JNfbIvZSroAa4Xow.text: I had the scallops. They were cooked perfectly, they melted in my mouth. It came with julienne vegetables, mashed potatoes and like a lemon butter sauce. O my my it was like heaven in my mouth . My boyfriend had the ribeye, and he's a rib eye master. He says it was cooked to perfection. The portions are pretty big here, and they make your salad at the table. Yummmmy

HkIpVRJYVu0lMGtRS6zqkw.text: Just went back for the second time!  And i'm so glad I went back.  We were a little early for our reservation so we went outside and had a drink and walked around for a few minutes.  Then we came back in and our table still wasn't ready, so we sat at the bar.  We ordered a shot of jack and a shot of johnny black.  The shots were in rocks glasses and were almost filled up.  for $7 each? like seriously? no complaints here!  So needless to say, b4 we even sat at the table, we had a small buzz.  We were led to the table with the rose, and of course I got such a great feeling and knew the dinner would be perfect.  The wine sommelier was humorous and knowledgeable.  I think we ordered a bottle of merlot, but i could be wrong! LOL (damn those "shots")  Most of dinner was a blur...Of course, the salad was great! (one of my favorite parts of the meal) and I remember having the sea scallops for my main meal and I remember the portion being huge and really good.  He had the veal and loved it too.    Of course, the chocolate covered strawberries and apricot w/ the homemade whipped cream topped off a great dining experience, once again. :)  LOVE THIS PLACE~

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea scallops

F40DOeaDuaF_XgOr_Cw3Ag.text: I brought my boyfriend here last night for his birthday. I was really disappointed as several friends and family members have raved about the place.   We started with the bread basket which was quite dry. Next came the salad which was ok but nothing amazing. I did enjoy the gentleman who made it    For our main course my boyfriend had the stuffed shrimp which was also very dry. We ordered a side of sauce but that didn't help much. I ordered the filet and shrimp au poivre which the best thing we had. It was good but I wouldn't say $58 good.    The complimentary chocolate dipped fruit is the reason I'm giving them a 3. That was pretty amazing and the manager took my boyfriends shrimp off the bill.   Don't really think I will ever make it back here.

8NYfp-4s16kAqco7g-lOrA.text: Hugo's celler is a classic gem in Vegas. As good or better than all the high end expensive ala cart steak houses. But it's all included with your meal.  Great salads, bread variety, two vegetables, the best steaks and a small desert tray.  I had Beef Wellington.  The service and ambiance is classic.  Most servers have worked here for many years. True professionals.  Not to miss Hugo's.

KCKw-2UmCk-fFdfsnePvmg.text: This place is classic, the food is great. The service is horrible, hence why it's getting 2 stars from me. I believe service to be a critical component of the dining experience.   The manager is extremely rude and not at all accommodating. I tried to organize a dinner party for about 30 people here, the manager told me that he was unwilling to accommodate a party of our size during dinner. He said we could come at 5:30 or at 9 because our party would take up too much space and he had other patrons to think about. Guess what manager, you just turned 30 people guaranteed to order 30 dinners... Idiot.   I've never been spoken to so rudely. I'll never come here again. There are several steakhouse in the Las Vegas area, no need to come to this one and be treated like crap.

miHrPYTjvLYK52fQo-BJVg.text: I was really excited to finally get a chance to try this old school gem that I had heard so many great things about.  I took my friend here for his birthday and we just loved it.  Unfortunately, we were both coming from the Yelp event at Ellis Island and had eaten a little (a LOT) so we weren't as hungry as we should've been.  However, we both got the tableside salad, which was great, and an entree. I ordered the Filet de Beouf Atlantis which is a filet mignon wrapped in bacon served Oscar style (with crab).  It was really good, but I can't say it was blow-me-away delicious.  The quality of the steak is just not comparable to other steakhouses on the Strip.    My friend ordered the prime rib, and it too was delicious, but there seemed to be a lot of fat on it.  The flavor was great though and it was juicy and tender.    The service was on-point.  It was a Wednesday night so it was pretty slow.  The servers were very attentive and nice.  The sommelier came over and took our wine order and they were out of the wine we ordered but he suggested something else in its place that ended up tasting amazing.    The restaurant is very dark and romantic and definitely has that old-Vegas feel. Though I've had better steak, this was a unique dining experience and we really enjoyed it.  You can get a voucher from Tix4Tonight (not the one IN 4 Queens, but any other store) and get 25% off your entire check including alcohol. Can't beat that!

h3N-VriQyExqr9WzNSbXqw.text: Dean is my favorite bartender in Las Vegas. Sit down at the bar before or after your meal for an amazing cocktail.

Te906kvnetxio7FhE9Vcng.text: Repeat guest with a disappointing experience on Jan 19. Actually had a button l, yes a button, in two of my coworkers salads which ruined the dinner. The only offer to make it right was a new salad or free desert. Had always been great up til this point. Not sure I'll make the trip to old town and Hugo's Cellar next time in Vegas.

yeMzTC3Ll3LDzg-WVpE1cg.text: My fiance and I are celebrating our 5 yr anniversary this weekend, and because we don't eat much red meat at home he wanted to go to a steakhouse. In my search for one I came across Hugo's. The reviews sold me on trying this place. I called in the morning to make reservations but was told the restaurant did not have any employees in until 2:00 PM. So if this is where you are thinking of going reserve ahead of time or you'll have to wait until 2, and hope you get lucky with an early dinner reservation. The only time they had available for us was 9:30 PM. We got to our reservations 30 minutes early and they immediately accommodated us. The host even mentioned he remembered talking to me this afternoon. That definately impressed us. We were greeted by our waiter very quickly, he and one other waiter made sure our night went smoothly. I have to say their service was great! Right away we were given 3 types of fresh bread and butter. That was followed by a salad made at your table side by the waiter. We ordered the Filet and Shrimp, and the Filet le beuf (I think that's how you spell it). His was medium well, and mine was medium. Both steaks were delicious, but we liked the medium one best. That's not all, they brought us dessert! Fruits dipped in chocolate and whipped cream. Not to mention they also gave us a chocolate lava cake in celebration of our anniversary. For our entire dinner, a glass of red cabernet and one cranberry vodka (for the Mr., taxes and tip, we spent approx $170.00. We are super stuffed right now. My fiance is currently laying in bed in a food coma lol...I can't forget to mention they gift a red rose to every woman when you check in. At the end of the meal they wrap the stem with foil paper so you won't get water on yourself and for easy travel. We will most definately be returning!   Thank you to Rawshad, Glenn, and the busser (sorry I didn't catch your name) for making tonight special.

4_JjRpK-koy5Xoi3kYnrJA.text: A wonderful experience I will cherish forever. Outstanding service and savory dishes cooked to perfection. We had escargot for the appetizer, the ribeye steak medium rare with freshly made horseradish sauce on top. It's a must I highly recommend you try it with the sauce since there is an option. I ordered an appletini and they gave me a glass bottle in a little ice caddy which came out to be three drinks total. The waiters add a nice little touch by wrapping the bottom of the rose in tinfoil and each waving goodbye on your way out. I felt very special and taken care of the entire time. It made me wish that everyone could experience a night like that at least once in their life. I went with family, but I would recommend for a couples romantic anniversary dinner. Just be sure to make a reservation.

0eZ3ZQicn4A0k_2kjygXhw.text: I was very impressed with this place. They had beautiful long-stem red roses for the ladies in the party. So it set a great tone for the newlyweds with us. The mood is very casual and dim. They seated us in a more private area all the way in the back. Our reservation was at opening, so it wasn't crowded. They have a good variety on their menu and the party had the prime rib, Chilean sea bass, chicken, ravioli, and I had the rib eye. The steak was OK. Wanted a little more flavor to it and it was a good size. Oh, and the salad that's included in the meal was made to order. That was nice. I had the creamy peppercorn with egg, shrimp, croutons, and pine nuts. Very delicious and simple. They serve bottled water as well as part of the meal. Then a complimentary dessert of chocolate covered strawberry, white chocolate covered fig, and chocolate covered apricot. After the meal, we only needed the small dessert with a cup of coffee. The coffee was served with a dark chocolate stick and cinnamon stick. Made the coffee flavorful. The experience was nice. The servers were great! Very attentive to our needs and cordial. Definitely would come back here again!

0vrm2JhMmjJo3dgwGn54xg.text: The service and ambience of Vintage Vegas is here and has never left... You first walk downstairs to a larger than life "cellar," and you and your guest is greeted by a maitre de. The woman of your party is given a rose for just attending their establishment! Get ready for food! The menu is elegant, and nothing is missed for a wonderful steak house. The salad is a joy in itself, the way they cater to your order. I had the Atlantis steak. 10oz filet wrapped in bacon and crab, good. So good! Dessert. Try the banana fosters. I don't even like bananas and I loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Fosters...

F5c-uQETxc3UCGWSHzFi-A.text: We have been hearing about Hugo's for years. We just couldn't justify the cost. That all changed on New Years Eve 2015!  We consider ourselves fairly sophisticated Foodies who cook at home almost all nights.  We want our restaurant meals to meet our expectations.  Hugo's Cellar did just that. From beginning to end, from Rose when we entered to noisemaker when we left..this was an exceptional meal and experience!! The staff were perfect, the food was amazing and this was worth every penny!  Our first trip there..not the last.

ldwewr_RkZ4j51YpSZHDvg.text: Absolutely stuning. If you want above and beyond service, knowledgeable and attentive wait staff, extraordinary food, and a classic atmosphere please visit Hugo's Cellar. Saying "It's a great place to eat" doesn't give nearly the amount of credit that this place deserves. Dining here is an all around luxurious experience. The price is slightly higher than average, but for a very good reason: everything about this place goes above and beyond even high expectations. I absolutely loved this wonderful restaurant for so many reasons. Even if you find no reason to be downtown, or have no desire to go to Freemont street, I still would encourage you to make the trip to the Four Queens for this experience alone. From the moment you walk in, they hand you a rose, seat you and put that rose in a vase. The staff is always attentive and have an in depth knowledge on everything from the way the food is cooked to how the taste should be. The food is absolutely out of this world. Their food is made with such care and attention youre sure to love anything you order. The attention to details such as the type of water you're given, to the butter being kept warm, to even a small rock candy to stir your espresso is just beyond amazing. Best dinner I've had, best service to date, and most wonderful experience I could ask for!

gscpsSKxf7z3hG-EFeKgdQ.text: Ahhhh...what a nice place for a romantic dinner!  The food was good, but I think the staff made it even better.  The salad preparation at the table was a nice twist.  Then to have "bananas foster" made for us at the table...wow!  And did I mention that a rose is given to each of the ladies that dine there?  That made for an extra special touch I thought.  Tip:  Be sure to ask for parking validation and they are more than happy to assist.

IeLX-lHLdHdxoWpuorcBGQ.text: Both the service and food were extraordinary. Plenty of food for the price. Wine by the glass was a little limited but overall the service and quality of food make it a must. Best to make reservations.

UDBoC61W7-Yo_Vnvp2pNPw.text: Overview: Classy traditional dining with all of the extras.  Don't let it's location fool you.  Hugo's is the real deal in classic Vegas charm, a True hidden gem.  Make a reservation ahead of time- they are often booked in advance.    About the experience: As a local, Hugo's Cellar is my favorite restaurant in town and I have been bringing family and friends here for over a decade.  The service and food never disappoints.   Located in the back of the smoky Four Queens Casino floor you will need to take the elevator down or use the stairs to enter the "cellar".  Upon being greeted, the Maitre d' will had each lady a long stem red rose and seat you at your table.  The server helpers are quick with the complimentary bottled water, bread and drink orders.  Hugo's has a pretty darn good wine list and a sommelier on staff to help you with your wine choice.  The menu is fairly simple with your classic seafood, chicken and steak choices.  I am a big fan of the Chilean Sea Bass prepared with the seasoned bread crumbs.  The Filet is always to perfection as well.   One of the highlights of the meal is the table side salad preparation.  The waiter will freshly prepare your salad with an abundance of toppings such as pine nuts, boiled tomatoes, eggs, shrimp, multiple cheeses, etc.  Absolutely delicious.    After the salad course you will get a small sorbet cone to cleanse your palate for the main course. -- Fun, right?   I have often times skipped the main course just because the bananas foster here is fabulous.  It is one of the few restaurants left in the country that still does tableside flaming desserts.... and boy do they do it good.  It doesn't get much better than cool ice cream topped with ripe bananas, cinnamon and freshly made rummed caramel sauce.   If you do not opt for a traditional dessert Hugo's does bring you freshly whipped cream served with chocolate dipped strawberries, figs and apricots.   Finally, don't forget the coffee.  This is my mother's favorite part- served with mint sticks and more hand made whipped cream.  If you have room, they do make an excellent chocolate martini served with it's own ice bucket and shaker.   While in Vegas, be sure to check this place out and bring your appetite.  You will not leave hungry:)

39e15KT3fXlfaf7zS1ss1w.text: I am so disappointed.  We just came home from our anniversary dinner here and I am so sorry that Hugo's didn't live up to all the glowing reviews here on Yelp.    First, hidden gem or not, it's still the basement at the 4 Queens, a less than lovely old time casino/hotel down on Fremont.  Don't get my wrong, I like Fremont Street and don't expect the flash of the Strip, but the 4 Queens is in my view a lower tiered hotel/casino.    The room is dark and it was crowded and we got stuck at a table by the door to the bar.  I thought it was noisy and too busy to be a romantic gem that everyone goes on about here on Yelp and other review sites.  Service.  The older hostess seated us quickly, but she really was just there to take us to the table and didn't make us feel welcome at all.  I don't expect a brass band, but a warm friendly welcome is always nice.  Then there was our waiter, well, let's just say our waiter was not one of the stellar ones that I observed at other tables.  His heart just didn't seem to be in his job tonight.  I don't know it that's every night or if he is just not as good as some of the old school waiters seemed to be.  He wasn't there most of the time and wasn't personable and attentive as other waiters I was observing at other tables.  There were no pleasantries exchanged or even small talk, just order taking.  Started with drinks which were nicely made and bread butter.  Believe or not, we had stale or day old flat bread.  I told the busser and he just asked if we wanted more....you mean like more stale bread!  Uh, no thanks.  The salad really is a nice touch.  Made table side does make it fun and it is fresh and tasty and nice.  But again, no small talk or chat from the waiter.  I had the rib eye.  The meat was cooked to perfection, but I wasn't sure what the unnecessary sauce or gray was on the meat.  The vegetables were cool to cold and the potato was about the same.  It was a good, but not great steak.  My wife had the scallops and she had to send them back because they were covered in a nasty tasting sauce.  The waiter had them redone and they put the sauce on the side.  They were fresh and cooked well, but why ruin good seafood by covering it up with sauce?  All fresh seafood needs is a little butter or olive oil and maybe some garlic.  Let the protein speak for itself.  Why hide it?  The sorbet between courses is again a nice touch and so too are the chocolate covered strawberries.    I like old style Vegas and I like downtown, but needless to say, I am not a fan of Hugo's Cellar.  If I want a steak downtown again, I'll head over to Vic & Anthony's at the Golden Nugget, where we had exemplary service and excellent food awhile back.  For a real hidden gem downtown, try the Second Street Grill hidden away at the Fremont or the Triple George Grill.  All three of these places are much nicer in my opinion than Hugo's....  Sadly, the menu and Hugo's is in my view, too "old school".  To much stuff you'd have expected in an episode from Mad Men rather than in 2013..  An addendum, I did put in our reservation this was our anniversary, and didn't even get a greeting of happy anniversary...to me that was really kind of a big no-no for a place that wants to be "old school"

5Rmcxp3HKvQngNK8aULOvQ.text: Old school Vegas at its finest.   I've been coming to Hugo's since I was a teen. My dad worked in 4 Queens management and we were lucky to be comped here quite a few times. In those days though, I was vegetarian (Womp Womp).   I've developed a new love for Hugo's as a grown woman. My friends and I went for a birthday celebration. Upon entering the restaurant, all women are given a single red rose (classy). On this particular night, I ordered the filet de boeuf Atlantis. With the meal comes a table side prepared salad with pretty much every topping imaginable to choose from. Get the peppercorn ranch. You won't be disappointed. Back to the filet. Oh my. Filet mignon wrapped in bacon sitting on a bed of lumped crab. Does this really exist? Yes it does.   Try to save room for dessert. You must get something flombed. Preferably the bananas foster. It is just such a delight to have your dessert prepared table side and then set on fire!!  If you are really feeling hungry, I highly recommend the Hugo's hot rock for 2. Table side they bring slabs heated to 500 degrees smear them with garlic and then sear pieces of chicken, filet mignon, shrimp and tuna. It is served with 3 different sauces and is quite delightful.   Shout out to John the best sommelier in town and the V team Vincent and Victor who really understand old school Vegas class. Real Gentlemen and really great service.

Gd2Da7ansI2iCVNNs7lxqA.text: It has been a few years since I've been to Hugos cellar. The previous experience was most awesome. The experience last night was lackluster. The prime rib was excellent, as was the salad. The sides to the meal -  not stellar. Additionally for so much staff, the attention to my table was lacking. I had asked my server to see a wine list for wines by the glass. He asked me what type of wine I was interested in, I said Cabernet and he said we only have one of those by the glass. When the sommelier brought the wine for me to taste, he told me he had a secondary Cabernet by the glass (strike one). After the meal was finished, the support person asked if we would like for coffee. But the main server did not come around and off for dessert - he only brought the bill. Lastly, this is the first restaurant including Denny's, we are one of the staff took the signed bill prior to us departing. All in all I will most likely not return to Hugos cellar.

AU2qHKt3Ia7slRXEHY4HDw.text: ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE. If you get the chance to have one fancy, 3 course meal in Las Vegas, make it Hugos. I don't even want to waste time describing the food, because words won't do it justice. I love seafood,  and the salmon plate was one of the best seafood meals I've ever experienced!

XzMH4a8sDocgfsSaS6LIuA.text: If I could give this place 10 stars I would. An amazing gem on Fremont street that truly excelled our experience. This place is voted the best restaurant and that's because it's the best experience. I ordered the filet and shrimp aux prive and it was delicious. But the bananas foster was the show and easily the best dessert. Staff was very friendly, attentive and enjoyable. Truly an evening I'll always remember that you can't get on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ordered filet and shrimp aux prive and my husband got a rack of lamb

GZmLuf6l2cf9THpIlmpqjw.text: First off the service here gives this restaurant a five star.  We had a great dining experience.  I would say this place is more geared towards couples with complimentary roses to the ladies as a nice touch.  I also really enjoyed the intermezzo a nice old Italian touch to clear your palette before dinner.  The prepared at your table salads was also a nice touch.

b8zqqpHkrl-azq_Hb8pzWw.text: OMG! Dined at Hugo's Celler last night.... (years ago was a great restaurant)....  First of all, they seated us at the wrong table and asked us to move....  ok...... the bisque was dark colored and had no lobster in it...  tasted like a dirty skillet had been de-glazed with cream... the fish cakes were pure bread crumbs, fried with a crust... contained no fish... was very dry....  the salad was prepared at the table... with black PLASTIC utensils in a plastic bowl.... iceberg lettuce and sliced tomatoes....  (I make a hundred times better salads at home every day!)  ....the Wellington was horrible.... a paper thin pastry soaked in grease (should be a puffy pastry, dry) ...there was a filet in there... and some muchrooms...  should have a heavenly mushroom pate .....very unappealing.... I had cheesecake for dessert....  cheesecake is cheesecake....  my friend ordered Tiramisu.... it tasted like paste that 6 year olds made in school.....  the bill was $175.00.  The manager was at the door when we left, so I told him how much we didn't enjoy the food... he seemed angry and disinterested... would he have asked, "What did you order?" or SOMETHING???  !!!   I told him, "I can see that you don't care, so good-night..."    We ate GOOD FOOD later when we got home.

_fH9WKYd8FzqdzjIrB4JxA.text: Oh Hugo!!!!  What can I say? Our time there was truly magical. My friends (3 of them) and I decided to make reservations to Hugo's Cellar on our most recent visit to Vegas. Upon arriving to our reso's, we were each given a long stem red rose. My heart immediately melted because really, who doesn't like flowers. We sat at a very nice table and had 4 waiters attend to each of us. It's like we each had our own waiter. We were given so many options, so many recommendations and so many choices. They explained to us that Hugo's was one of the last places that have continued their "special service" of table side salad, picking our own sides, and including dessert in our experience. We each ordered a dirty martini and not only was it delicious but it came out in the cutest container and crystal holder. (please see attached picture). It was like 4 martinis in one. My kind of drink! A nice gentleman came by and made our salad, asked each one of us what we wanted and what we didn't. It's tableside salad making in which you figure out how different you and your taste buds are than your friends. Haha! Of course, mine was the yummiest. After we finished the salad, we were give cutie patootie little tart sorbet ice-cream cones to clean our taste buds for our main dish. This was sooooooooo cool. I wonder why high end LA restaurants don't use this cool and cute tool. Anyhoo, My friend and I shared the Ribeye with crusted horseradish (16 ounces) YUMO! There is an additional $25 they charge for splitting your meal but it's soooooo worth it. They split it, everyone gets the same amount of sides (asparagus, rice, mashed potatoes). My other two friends split the Filet Mignon with crusted horseradish and theirs was just as delicious. Dessert came out a short time after. We got chocolate dipped strawberries, figs and chocolate dipped apricots with the MOST delicious whip cream you have ever tasted. Everything was so excellent. Service, service, food, service. They appreciated us as customers and we appreciated everything about them. The bill came and we were shocked! This time shocked because we didn't expect a place like this to be soooooooo reasonable. We love Hugo's Cellar and it's amazing staff. Keep up the great job.

ilViUtH01d0COFFsTrNWsg.text: Service and staff where excellent.  Salad and breads great.  But not the best seafood we have had.  Tuna was over cooked and had no flavor.  Scallops were average.  We were expecting way better with the reviews we saw.  Way over priced for the quality of seafood we received.  Definitely not on my list of places to visit again.

wViCmBXOc0XJhTRTmbv6iQ.text: This is by far the best restaurant in Vegas! At first, you are sketched out by the location-- but turns out, this is Vegas!!! Don't miss this spot! If you are looking for "the" spot, this is it!!!

RWrXKP8glzLnT4UR9N0Asg.text: Hugo's is just top notch. They give all ladies who enter a rose and the butter is even rose shaped. The best for me is the table-side salad. I mean this is the best salad I have ever eaten and soooo fresh. I recommend this place for any type of romantic dinner. Great place for prom dates, anniversaries and so on. I do recommend wearing nice attire as the place is very upscale. Also, average of about $50-60 a person but worth it!

nNQevuBuGMlCra94fs-RdQ.text: What a class act of a restaurant.   Had reservations for New Years Eve and could not have chosen a better place.   The staff was very sweet and we loved the table side salad.  We were then given sorbet to clean our palette just before our entrees.  I had the beef and it was very moist and tender.  My fiancee' had the sea bass and he really liked it.   My mother opted for the prime rib.  Dessert looked amazing but we were too full.  We were also given passes to Fremont Street Experience and they gave us New Years Party favors as well as a rose for the ladies.   I highly suggest this place!

i6gqkENqA91b38DurKg5rA.text: So many other options in town for steak. This was just okay. The steak was good enough and priced as high as you would expect.  The part that irritated us was we went on our 20th wedding anniversary. Place was louder than expected but that wasn't too bad.  While they have a corkage fee ($20) what they don't bother to tell you is if you happen to bring a bottle they have on their wine list they refuse to open the bottle. Yup. Spend 70 dollars for a steak and they'll tell you no.  So essentially if we had brought a cheap bottle of grocery store wine they would have opened it but a quality bottle we brought the answer is a resounding "no".    Billed as an old school Vegas Steak house where in old Vegas no one was ever denied anything.   The other issue was we felt very rushed. Everything was fast paced and clearly set for turn over. Personally, when I spend this kind of money it's special and honestly for the money I like feeling like they're happy I'm there. Almost like I'm eating a lot a friend's place. They rushed the service, everyone was running around crazy, and I know it sounds odd to notice this but they handed us our salad plates. It struck me as odd in a high priced place - it's like okay I guess I'll pay for the privilege of serving myself. Not what I would expect or look for to be treated like a dollar amount more than a customer from a high end steak house.   The servers were nice enough and the food was good and there was a lot of it.  While it's been around a while and would have been a top notch steak house back then it's just average, over priced, rushed and has some off-putting customer policies I would say look elsewhere for a steak like Echo and Rigg or Herbs and Rye.

GxXNJDaiKNkBIhSVYnZ0Bw.text: This place is a home run! Come a little early and order a manhattan from Dean. He knows his stuff and pours an excellent manhattan (it comes in a carafe, so it's really two manhattans for the price of one!). The ambiance is all old school, and though you will feel wildly out of place in the casino all dressed up, it is appropriate for this steakhouse.   The only reservation we could get was 5:30 pm on a Saturday - make your reservations early! We started with the bread, which is assorted and very good. Their butter is like crack to me, so tray that too. My husband and I both got the salad made at the table. It was very good, but if I had paid $19 to have it as my entree, I would think it a little on the light side. My husband got the prime rib, which as massive, and I got the vegetarian option of the night. Oh my, was this a plate of awesomeness! Raviolis stuffed with portobello mushrooms, covered in a light pesto sauce, with yummy vegetables on he side. My husband could only eat half of the prime rib, but he enjoyed it.   Next time I would bring a change of clothes to better mix in with the crazies in downtown, it was quite a show but we didn't stay long because we were out of place being dressed up. The hotel itself is kind of gross, and we saw some really unsanitary things happen on the casino floor, so be prepared. Hugos is worth it though!

wlS4P2HjtY6iw6JBYrr2vg.text: Ribeye steak was tuff and grisly extremely over priced. Salad was about the only thing that was good. Basically I paid $50 for a salad. Would not recommend to anyone.  Wait staff never commented that I didn't eat the steak or ask if anything was wrong with all of my food being left on the plate.

2HymCaCgEjViz9ceHb4LKQ.text: My mother and I went here to celebrate my 31st birthday. We have dined at other establishments on Fremont but just haven't made our way over to Hugo's. The positive reviews are what made me make the reservation for my birthday dinner..  Vincent was our waiter and Carlos was his back waiter I believe. Both were very accommodating and enjoyable to talk to but not bothersome when my mother and I were talking and eating quietly.  The martinis are fantastic and for $18 I got 3 glasses of a makers mark manhattan. Score! My moms Riesling which she said was delicious was $6... what?!   The crab cakes were delicious but wish they were a tad bit larger and with more of the delicious sauce.. $19 was kind of steep, but they did have great flavor and full of grab, so plus there.   For dinner my mother and I did a split plate($26 to split but you each get a salad and the sides) dinner of the rack of lamb. First off, let's talk about the salad... wow! Table side preparation with all the fixings, was a meal in itself and so yummy! Couldn't finish though, gotta save room for lamb!    Now, we each got about 4 lamb bones, small side of potatoes and mixed vegetables. Lamb was cooked perfectly medium, but kind of difficult to cut between each bone. No worries, still tasted delicious with the Indonesian (peanut based) sauce.   To finish we got a variety of dipped chocolate apricots, strawberries and figs with fresh whipped cream. :-) and a free birthday lava cake. I was too full to finish but it was very good.  Now I recommend this place to most people but to be honest not kid friendly in my opinion or good for first dates. Yes the rose is a nice gesture to impress a lady on a first date but if the date isn't going well there's no music to draw out the silence lol   Hope my review helps! Have fun! Get a martini!

Pxcxdrmjd97tFC_xJLXXgg.text: Absolutely amazing, hidden gem in old Vegas. When we got there, we were told reservations only, as we went to leave they said "hold on, lets see what we can do" we waited ten minutes and they sat us. Best beef wellington I ever had. I asked that it be rare, i was told they would do their best but it might be hard because its wrapped in a pastry. They cooked it to perfection! When I come back It will be the first place I hit up.

QwvVOPIELirT9AggD6GDNA.text: Ate here last night with a party of 8.  We were in Las Vegas celebrating my birthday and told the manager when asked if it was a special event.  My wife and I ordered the 16 oz ribeye split for an additional $26 the steak was medium but when served it was almost room temperature and full of gristle.  I sent it back and refused a new steak but due to us waiting  almost an hour for all our dinners Idid not want to spend my entire evening in Hugo's.  The dinner was not charged but my birthday evening was less than memorable.  I guess I will go to Bern's Steakhouse back in Tampa to actually enjoy a great steak.  By the way not a mention of the birthday was said.

K6cahn_uoRMxmxoyHT0ptw.text: Giant disappointment.  We have been to Hugo's many, many times in the eighties and nineties and have always been pleased with the quality of the food and service.  Went on June 23, 2018 for the first time in 15 years for nostalgia's sake.  Service and presentation is the same great quality as it always has been, but both of our meals were mediocre at best and were therefore way overpriced.  I hate paying high prices for bad food and regret that the last memory of a three decade favorite restaurant is such a let down.

n9BLi6SdPPhlIG2cwOKAvA.text: 5 years ago we started coming here on a recommendation of a client. We Loved it...5 years ago! For the last three years we have made it our go to place but over that time we have seen a DECLINE in service as well as quality of food. The table side salad was not fresh, the leaves were wilted and stale. I ordered the Lobster medallions dinner...TERRIBLE the lobster had a mushy soft texture to it (indication of being old) and my husband ordered the prime rib marbled with more fat than meat. TERRIBLE TERRIBLE :( Needless to say we will not be going back!!!

ZnvIJc940Mc6R5dVMR1Gzg.text: Had a wonderful time here this past weekend. Started out at the bar- Dean made a perfect martini and we had a great time talking with him. We ordered the spinach artichoke dip, filet, and ribeye. All were phenomenal, along with the table side salad... dessert was a chocolate cake (delicious) and raspberry cheesecake (go with the chocolate instead!). Overall, could not have been happier with our experience!

bKKf4KxVAe8aTeEkSdZKaA.text: This was a wonderful experience for us 2 couples. We made reservations early and were seated in a great booth. I can't forget to mention that us ladies were given beautiful red roses as we entered. Perfect touch! We were quickly greet by our waiter who asked about drinks and as soon as we said wine, the sommelier came over to give suggestions. They have a great wine list! The food was wonderful and the service was fantastic. Each had a sense of humor and made the experience even better. We were too full for desert but saw the bananas foster being prepared and were envious. Definitely recommend this Vegas experience!

xQ7nwp8OYWKFwyAHPAWFfQ.text: Me and my friend were planning a trip to Vegas and he told me from the beginning that we have to go here no matter what.  Turns out, we were staying at Four Queens Hotel in downtown Vegas where it is located so it was a perfect opportunity to try it out.  We made reservations and went there. Since it was only two of us, it was easier to reserve but if you have a party of 4 or more, it might be a little harder.  As soon as you entered this place, this place have a very unique kind if vibe like you are in a scene of godfather movie or something.  Once we got seated, we got menus and fresh bread. The bread was fresh and amazing.  The menu have variety of things but we both decided to do Steak with Crab legs and steak with lobster.  With every entree, they serve table side salad bar where you can create your own salad and assorted deserts in the end  After ordering, the table side salad bar came along.
