The host asked us what kind of things and condiments we want in our salad. They had a lot of options. The salad was amazing and it seem like everything was so fresh.  After finishing up with the salad, they server us mini raspberry sorbet ice cream cone, which was the best raspberry sorbet I had. The main purpose is to neutralize your taste buds so you can taste the meat better   After that, we were served steak, crab legs and lobster. Each one of them were marvellous.   After dinner, we were served with assorted desert on a tray which had chocolate covered apricots, strawberries and chocolates. They were awesome.  Overall, an amazing 5 star experience. From the host to server to food, everything was amazing.   We will definitely come here again the next time we are in Vegas.

zparzKJJgW5CLit5uh20yw.text: One of the best fine dining experiences we've ever had.  Booked for our 25th wedding anniversary and far exceeded expectations.  Serving crew was professional and attentive and food was fabulous.  Will definitely be back on our next trip to Vegas!

8Jz8GT6lnPus3vxIkwOfKg.text: What to say about this place. I have been here many times and have never been disappointed. This place is cozy, romantic and has great food and great employees. I have not been her for a few years but as we walked in we immediately recognized employees that have been there for years and years. The food is still great. the atmosphere is great. Just all around a cool place to go for a great night. I just spent my 35th anniversary there. Had a great dinner.  I watched a another couple that I overheard say it was there first time there.  I smiled as they wheeled the salad cart to there table and  the woman had fun making all the choices for her salad.  My wife and I enjoyed the bananas foster and the Kona coffee. I say it is worth the price for such an enjoyable evening. And afterwards you can walk it off around Freemont street and watch all the craziness! Don't hesitate. Just go for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-MPvZwH77kxFFK3PdWT2mQ.text: The staff and service here is impeccable.  They really make you feel good.  We love the coziness of the place and it is very romantic. However considering the very high-priced items the food is barley mediocre. I make better meals at home. And what was really a let down is the bread that the put on the table. It's a combo basket of the bread you see at all the buffets around town. No hot steaming, fresh bread. The butter was cute in a rose formation but rock solid frozen. It's unfortunate you have to walk thru a very old, run-down, smoke riddled casino to get to the restaurant and if you have to go to the bathroom you have to do the same thing. So if you go here it's not to have a great meal, it's to enjoy and old Vegas idea, well at least in the cellar itself.

aIx-eBOBpRkGkb29EqKODQ.text: We have been coming here every year for a long time now.  I lost track.  It has never disappointed us.  One of the nice features of this place is your meal includes sides, salad, an intermediate course sorbet and dessert.  You are not nickle and dimed for every item like a lot of steakhouses.  The food has always been very good and the service impeccable.  I highly recommend it.  Be sure to get reservations as this place is in high demand.

XUnm03M3CKLO-ipfvnoVnQ.text: I have been coming here for years. The service is always top notch and the food is great. I dig the old Vegas vibe and everyone has a smile on their face which is nice. I recommend you stop in and give it a try.

_yXaFXe0Q_NfBJMtkvTrww.text: This was a great find!!! Food was absolutely amazing!!! Service was friendly and attentive. A must try place.

P_v-CcZp5rEiqDMHw-6hVA.text: This steakhouse is located in the middle of Four Queens: close to the craps tables & down the stairs. No restrooms inside so you have to use the casino restrooms (exit the restaurant,  make a right, & follow the wall to the end). I called 2 weeks prior (no availability on OpenTable) & managed to grab the last reservation (for a party of 6) for the night we needed at 9PM, but was told to check-in 30min prior the reservation to see if we were able to get seated earlier. Upon check-in, we were immediately seated. Walking-in, not even half the restaurant was full so we thought it strange that there were no other reservations available when we tried to book. The decor is lush but in an old school steakhouse kind of way: Great for dates & celebrations. Note: Dress is at least business casual. Ladies are presented w/ a rose at the host stand, which I thought was a nice touch. After seating, the waiter explained that Hugo's is Old Vegas-style & went on to say sides and desserts were included with your entree.  *~Our Order~* on 5/13/2017 Dirty Martini ($13) Lychee Martini ($13) Old Fashion ($12) Escargot en Croute: ($18) 6pcs. Sauteed in shallots, garlic, burgundy wine, herbs topped w/ puff pastry Beef Wellington ($62) Filet of beef, topped w/ a duxelle of foie gras & mushrooms; baked in pastry & served w/ bordelaise sauce NY Strip ($52) Premium Black Angus beef (aged a min of 28 days), char-broiled to taste & served w/ mushroom ragout & bordelaise sauce. Add Shrimp Skewer (+$8) Tournedos: ($67) Two 5oz filets topped w/ foie gras, artichoke hearts & bearnaise sauce Hugo Rib Eye ($57) Premium Black Angus beef (aged a min of 28 days), char-broiled to taste & served w/ mushroom ragout & bordelaise sauce Prime Rib - Cellar Cut: ($55) 16oz.  Build-your-own-salad: Salad dressings - Peppercorn Ranch / Caesars / Honey Walnut Vinaigrette. Toppings - Bay Shrimp / Diced Egg / Artichoke Hearts & Palms / Roasted Pine Nuts / Feta Cheese / Tomatoes / Red Onion / Croutons / Mushrooms / Freshly grated Parmesan and/or black pepper  **Entrees include vegetable du jour & choice of roasted garlic whipped potatoes / red potatoes with parsley / wild rice  Hugo's is known for their martinis and their dirty martinis have a very strong olive taste (you get about 1.5 drinks). Beware: their Old Fashion is strong as well.  An assortment of complimentary breads & crackers are brought out w/ beautiful rose-shaped butter while you wait for your food. The escargots came out 1st which were topped by a delicious pastry puff. The escargots were buttery and tender but I prefer mine to have more garlic. The build-your-own salad that is served table-side was then brought out. Everyone LOVED their salad. My BF said he'd be ok with just the salad and no prime rib! Note: if you're usually a vinaigrette dressing person and want to go for the honey walnut vinaigrette, it is more honey than vinaigrette so it is on the sweet side (which isn't my preference). Then came out intermezzo: a pomegranate sorbet on the tiniest cone. Super cute palate cleanser!  Next came, the main event. I ordered the Tournedos. What surprised me the most about my dish was that the foie gras wasn't pate spooned on top of the filet mignon. I could see the whole duck liver on top of my filet! The foie gras wasn't as iron-tasting and was fairly light (but fatty). I ordered my filets to be cooked to a medium rare but they were still a bit chewy (so thought they were just OK). BF liked his prime rib but was so full from the bread and salad, he couldn't finish (had to take 2/3 of his plate home). Everyone else at the table also said they enjoyed their dishes.  For dessert, they bring out a platter of dipped fruit: dark chocolate covered strawberries, dark chocolate dried apricots, & white chocolate dried white figs. There's also a small bowl of whipped cream for dipping. Afterwards, they bring a platter of the desserts that they offer if you wanted additional sweets but we were way too full. They also ask if you would like coffee or any other after-dinner drinks. One person did ask for an affogato, but they said they don't serve it (even tho they offer espresso and ice cream.. oh well).  Service was great. During the whole meal, we had at least 2 waiters tending to us. When we raised our drinks, I added "Happy Early Birthday!" to my BF. At the end of the meal (and before they brought out the desserts), they brought out a bread-pudding with a candle in it. I guess someone took notice because I didn't mention it to any of the waiters. Talk about paying attention! In addition, even though they used the same jokes at each table (I could overhear since the restaurant is fairly quiet even with the casino upstairs), the waiter delivered them each time like it was their first.  Fairly good steaks in an unexpected part of downtown.  Note: Party of 6 is considered a large party and will automatically include a 18% gratuity.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib - Cellar Cut
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tournedos

o9ms9W_DcTsLYi7WeGclmg.text: This long running steak house in the bottom of 4 Queens Casino used to serve the Rat Pack. Turns out the still have that old school charm, service and amazing food! Quite a dining experience!

JuE3Wsbj8MYW5dh59Bcpdw.text: A big thank you to Hugo's Cellar,i brought my Grandaughter to celebrate her !7th birthday,i had the Beef Wellington,she had the Ribeye,we started with the Hugo's delicious salad & ended with chocolate dipped strawberries figs & apricots with fresh cream + a chocolate lava cake with candle for her birthday thank you Hugo's for making her day very special.

aspWnoGB1sPkNQ3mRg8yFg.text: Awesome steak house, had the crab stuffed filet.. Fantastic, plus the salad cart, sorbet, and dessert tray? You're blowing it if you don't go.

PTEdq1CIlzGBa6MWX_VrCA.text: I first came to Hugo's Cellar for my prom dinner about 15 years ago and every year we make it a special occasion to come once or twice. We always say let's try a new place next time but the food & service is so excellent we keep coming back year after year. The salad dressings are to die for!!!! The Raspberry Chicken so moist and amazing that I can't deviate & order everytime I come. This is Truely one of the best restaurants in town & one of the only reasons we come down town.

8N837YpOnKujZeo8WCWO8A.text: Hugo's Cellar is almost like an "out of body" experience. You will not believe that something that classy and nice can be in a "dive" casino like the Four Queens on Fremont Street.  I enjoy the Fremont experience and have stayed at the Four Queens hotel, but Hugo's is just something else. Much has been said about the experience, but I would like to add the "Hot Rock" appetizer as a consideration for your next visit.  Pieces of beef Filet, swordfish, chicken and shrimp are cooked on a sizzling hot stone at your table. A Garlic paste is spead on the stone and you turn the meat enough times to meet your taste of "done-ness" and then you have a choice of Plum suace, hot mustard or Bernaise sauce to dip your morsal into.  Just outstanding !!!  and just enough to not interfere with your dinner. As for the salad prepared at your table, I suggest you get your salad favorites and then ask your tuxedoed server for a combination of the creamy pepper dressing and the vinegarette.  The combination of those two produces a dressing taste that is out of this world. The best salad I have ever eaten. Lastly, being the beef eater that I am, I will recommend the Swordfish ( did I really just say that ) with the Sauce Nantua - a combination of shrimp and crab.  Can it get better than this - I think not. Enjoy the end of your meal with the chocolate covered strawberrys, covered figs and covered apricots.  Walk back up the stairs into the Four Queens gaming area and ask yourself if just you got transported somewhere else for the past hour or two and then were deposited back rudely into this casino.

tXz-nPlGghBE_gnq97NznQ.text: I have been going to Hugo's for the last 20 years. It was my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas for that period. We went last Friday April 29th and were very disappointed in the food and service. All four meals were delivered cold so we sent them back then they reheated them and it was well done when served the second time. We made the mistake of not complaining again and ate the meals, but should have sent them back and left. I suppose any place can have an off night, but it was very disappointing for Hugo's to have one. Hopefully something did not chance permanently, we will try it one more time. The drinks were and the bartender were still great.

YJRqDHzs1xDotQtvarXkQA.text: Subterranean, dimly lit, vaguely romantic restaurant that offers a cool "Old Vegas" vibe, but overpriced for substandard fare. Valet parking at the Four Queens is slow and frustrating, I suggest self parking in the garage. I've eaten here a handful of times, and the food seems to be getting worse and worse. Table side flambeed duckling was dry and overcooked to the point of inedibility, tasteless steamed baby vegetables, fatty and overcooked meat, marginally fresh seafood, and a raunchy table side salad course complete with frozen baby shrimp, wilted iceberg lettuce, and sickly sweet dressings. Service was fine, but nothing remarkable. The high points of this place are the knowledgeable and fun sommeliers, decent dessert cart, a palette cleanser sorbet course, and a cool ambiance if you can ignore the drunk tourists at the adjacent table.

Zhrl14Le1ZO1hURF_V_2Zw.text: My wife and I generally go to Hugo's when we're in Las Vegas and have a special occasion to celebrate.  The food is good, and so is the service.  It's a bit overpriced, but we don't go there alot, so we can overlook that in favor of the ambiance and the little things like a rose for the female guests.  We like to go to Fremont Street even though we stay toward the south end of the strip.  Hugo's is worth the trip if your looking for a memorable dining experience.

Ocr7-9tveodYKarXJIaL1w.text: Was taken to Hugo's for my birthday - what a cool "old Vegas" style place. I would never have know it was there. Ladies get a fresh long stem rose from the host. Service was great, food was awesome. Best sea bass I've had. And the bananas foster flambe made tabel-side was yummy too.

oWpEHCo6XqAxnuD1WuIDpA.text: Fantastic Dinner!! Great ambiance. We had dinner on the strip our first 3 nights in Vegas and decided to try Fremont the 4th evening. Researched and thought we would try Hugo's Cellar. Far Better meal and a far lesser price than the Strip. The Food was great, but the Service was what really caught my attention. The staff were attentive, helpful and engaging. We will definitely be back on our next trip to Vegas.

EGR9HOkthUp4s9WUVE5apg.text: My wife and I ate here a few weeks ago on a Wednesday night. We were greeted right away and only had to wait 10 minutes for a table. I had a very nice glass of single malt scotch and my wife has a glass of cabernet. For the main course I had veal oscar while my wife ordered the small prime rib. The veal was topped with king crab legs and smallish pieces of white asparagus, the veal was perfect but I was not crazy about their version of bearnaise sauce. It was like a gravy than a sauce. The prime rib was near perfect, not the best she ever had but close. salads and the huge side dishes had us too full for desert. Price was very reasonable as we got out for under $150. I am marking them down 1 star (food is 4 stars) because of the lack of  dress code enforcement, guys wearing sandals, jogging outfits and shorts.

o5Dcz8i_ZV0d-8TifYxTQQ.text: I was looking forward to trying Hugo's after having read many great reviews and hearing a lot about how this place really is exceptional. My husband and I went for a nice dinner to celebrate a very special occasion.  I do think they have great things to offer as far as the rose for the ladies, the large amounts of food for the money, and the old school Vegas atmosphere, if that's what you like.  The service was top notch with many attending to our every need.  BUT the mediocre food could not make up for all of the above. I ordered the Filet Boeuf, which is a bacon wrapped 10oz filet with lump crab meat. My husband ordered the NY strip.  His NY strip had great flavor and was a tad under cooked for medium but my filet was way undercooked. I've been to plenty of nice steak places and have ordered my filet medium. This place turned it out pretty much rare. The steak was very thick and did not have enough charring on the outside as usual and was raw.  The lump crab that the steak sat on, was mixed with what appeared to be a dry stuffing mixture and it was dry. I didn't care very much for the texture or flavor.  The green beans were cooked well but had no flavor and the mashed potato was firm. They scooped it with a ice cream scooper and it could have been a little softer.  The meal reminded me of when you attend a seminar or a mid price ranged wedding and they serve you mediocre food that is luke warm.  Although the price is great considering a table side hand tossed salad, all the veggies, bread, chocolate covered fruit tray, and bottled water are all included with the entree and not a la carte like most places, the value really isn't there if the steak isn't done right.  I don't know if it was a fluke with my steak having been undercooked but the overall meal left little desire for me to return for a second trip.

eeHFXsNYr2xKtVWLNeKgeg.text: hidden Las Vegas gem... wonderful menu, top notch service, and low prices to boot... I love this place

e6zvNhkjPhFev5S2dr88og.text: One of the BEST steakhouses! It's pricey but its definitely worth it! The red roses they give out will make any woman smile! I make sure to go every time I'm in Vegas. I have cravings for the salad! The palate cleanser is nice too! A wonderful romantic dinner place. Good wine list & great cocktails!

5zxnIiVZqdkM73Q7KAeVYQ.text: Old Vegas Old Vegas Old Vegas Old Vegas!  If I didn't already tell you, this is OLD VEGAS deluxe.  In the bowels of the 4 queens in downtown, a truly hidden gem for dinner.  Warm dark walls, booths and a menu reminiscent of "the old days".    Not sure if the building or staff have been there longer, but they are all top notch.  First, the wine Sommalier is a fine Englishman with a extremely broad wine knowledge and a very pleasant demeanor.  We eat here perhaps twice per year and he remembers our names and the wine we had last visit.  The evening focuses around the salad cart with over 15 different items  and three home made dressings tossed table side by Victor the salad master.  Thereafter there are the old time standards, rack of lamb, veal oscar, steak diane, etc.  I had the veal oscar with crab , white asparagus and a wine demiglace, it was tender and very good.  My wife had the salad and shrimp cocktail, she wasn't very hungry, it too was nice.  My mother rounded out with the swordfish simply grilled, tender and good.  We chose a very nice, and nicely priced ($65.00) Spanish Cabernet "2003 Torres" mas la planta.  You are served a berry sorbet in a mini waffle cone between courses and finish off with chocolate dipped strawberries  and figs.  Yes, we were stuffed but had the banana's flambe anyway.... a must.  Listen to me!!!  If you go to Vegas you MUST come here.  Forget charlie trotter, aureole etc.  Relax and take a trip back in time.  You'll thank me later.

aATz-fq2idKjlTPCCu_87g.text: heavenly place to have dinner. though a little dark for some ( i actually liked their lights turned low) and tucked away far from the glitz of new vegas this ihas a different las vegas atmosphere. more slow,  no gomba hairy chest with fake bling or the paris hilton wanna be starlets. this is a place to get away from all that for a while and get on of THE BEST steaks ive eaten on the west coast!   the salads were yummy as well. they take full attention as to how you want your salad done and will create it in front of you as you pick out what you want on it. all you do is eat it.  as for the wine list..the wine connessieur/sommelier(?) is very informative and youll learn a thing or two even if your palate was raised on pabst blue ribbon or shlitz malt liquor. dont worry, you wont feel intimidated, rather more refined . try the reisling!

WUOdKqcuT6uC7zu95Fiing.text: Just got back from our first time at Hugo's! We have lived in Vegas for 10 years, and have always wanted to try it, so we decided to celebrate Valentine's Day a week early. We were a bit skeptical based on its location, but our fears were quicly calmed---great place!  We arrived a few minutes early, but were quickly seated...and just like previous posts indicate, I was given a long stemmed red rose upon entry. The ambiance is old school, dark steakhouse, but very romantic. We had the fabulous salad cart as our appetizer...I had caesar, and the hubby had a sweet walnut vinaigrette. Both were outstanding---shrimp, egg, croutons, peeled tomatoes, fresh mushrooms, and loads of parmesan cheese were at the ready. The cocktails were great---I had a martini that really was like having 3--one glass, then they gave me an individual carafe on ice to refill my glass as I needed. Bread basket had a nice variety of breads, but we were partial to the house special cheese lavosh--yummy! For entrees, the hubby had the 16 oz ribeye, cooked to perfection. I had the filet Atlantis--a succulent beef filet (huge!) bacon wrapped, served over lump crab meat with bernaise on the side. It was like butter! We enjoyed the chocolate dipped fruit tray, and also tried a chocolate almond cheesecake---so full! The coffee was excellent, and came with neat little goodies--cinnamon sticks, and chocolate mint swirl sticks.  We also had Anthony as our server--one of the very few True local Vegas people in town! He was very personable and professional... he had a great helper named Eric who was very attentive, and excellent at making sure we were happy all evening. What a great value for 2!!!! Our bill came to $144--that included 4 premium cocktails (grey goose and bacardi), coffee, salads for each of us, 2 desserts and 2 beef entrees with potatoes and veggies---4 premium beverages on the strip alone would be $50 bucks, the steaks would be at least $50 bucks each, plus salads at $12 bucks each, then desserts @ 9 dollars each, not to mention that each potato and veggie side would be  about $9 bucks a piece, then add the coffee..well over $220 bucks! We had a great experience, and will definitely return!!!

1l0oAH5pu81w7kJ6HPsdIQ.text: Everything was very good, but nothing was memorable.  Ordered the Rack of Lamb.  It was good...not memborable.  Other party members ordered the Filet Mignon...I tasted it...it was good, not memorable. The tableside-made-to-order salad was pretty cool.  The guy shows up with a cart of fixin's and literally makes each persons salad, just the way they want it.  This is included with each meal (no extra charge). After dinner, they bring out some chocolate-dipped fruits.  This is also included at no extra charge. I'll give it 4 stars for now.  I need to try it again and it can go up to 5 stars, but it can also drop to 3 stars.  Maybe it stays at 4.

yToQ1fEJqliFprBPSauvJg.text: Every lady gets a rose. This place is old school and still good. Been here many times throughout the years. Decent place to talk and have conversation. Dinner will run you around $50 and includes salad, side, and the always memorable chocolate strawberry touch at the end. I ordered the Veal Chop and portion was perfect and decent tasting. We also had the 10oz filet cooked to perfection. Good wine list with plenty to pick from. Special thanks to Jon for selecting a good wine out of the back. Worthy after all these years.

nuZca5TU4mRORYV8jNnghQ.text: I've heard some mixed things about Hugo's. The atmosphere is old school vegas. The table side salad was good, but can't they use different bowls to mix when people get different dressings??? Had the scallops festival or something like that. It was good, but interesting. The scallops were cooked perfectly, but the sauce they were in was almost like a beef gravy. After a bite I just felt like I was eating a super tender steak covered in rich gravy. Kind of strange. But it was good. The chocolate dipped fruit plate they give for dessert was good too.

hqdu-ne6HUaIUfSBr6FuPw.text: My wife and I ate there Sunday night for the 1st time. We have been coming to Vegas for years but never tried it. I had the 24 oz prime rib and it just melted in my mouth, the best prime rib I've ever had. My wife had the Filet and it was equal in perfection. They make your salad right at your table with plenty of items you can choose to top it with. This place was reccomended to us years ago but we never went, we won't make that mistake again we will visit it again on our next trip.

Bm8gvyy-txFPACJStd7IvA.text: They need to learn the basic of cooking and season their beef with salt.   Do not waste money or time.  I ordered the Chaeuteaubriand and it was so unflavored I had to soak it in the sauce to eat it.  My daughter ordered chicken and barely could eat two bites before saying I am done with this dish.  This place was not blowing your socks away or being pampered type of place.   4 Queens will also charge for parking even if u valet.   Be warned.  Overrated restaurant.

DYPY-17TWPr-JhkCBMFeBg.text: Hugo's Cellar is a MUST!!! Everything from the appetizer I ordered (grilled mushrooms), salad made table side, main dish, and dessert (chocolate dipped fruit) were delicious. The taste is indescribable. Service was excellent all around. You will not be disappointed : )

H7eDYwDW_53aW1mQ-8Xybg.text: It was a Friday and I had made reservations two days in advance.  The place was busy. Nonetheless, we only waited 10 minutes to be seated.  I received a long stemmed rose, like every other lady in the house.  Hugo's Cellar has a classic, vintage, old Las Vegas feel. Some patrons were dressed in coats while others were in shorts and flip flops.  The place is compact with a low ceiling and dim lights. Waiters have to squeeze the carts between table spaces.  I had lobster bisque for my starter while my husband feasted on the bread. The lobster bisque was ordinary, but I was not fazed; afterall, this place had stood the test of time in an ever changing Vegas restaurant scene.  People must come here for a reason.  We each had the Hugo's Table Side Salad. It was salad prepared by the salad master who comes around in a cart.  He was such an expert, but the busy house kind of made the whole making-the-salad-in-front-of-you experience feel rushed. The salads were good but, I would have loved some other kinds of greens apart from lettuce.  For the entrees we had the Atlantis (Filet de Boeuf) and the Rack of Lamb.  The filet was seasoned perfectly and perfectly cooked, medium, spot on with the desired doneness.  It was the most tender piece of meat I have ever had and believe me, I had been to many a good steak houses in town (Golden Steer, Ruth's Chris, Carnevino, The Steak House in Circus Circus to name a few).  It literally melted in my mouth. The Rack of Lamb was equally spot on.  I ordered medium well and it was cooked to how I wanted it done. This place, REALLY knows how to cook meat! The sides were very good too but were more like backup dancers to the stars of the entrees.  Some might say, that is how it should be.  For dessert we had the famous table side flambeed Bananas Fosters and a cappuccino.  Wow! Recalling my experience is making me hungry.   The wine was a memorable experience.  They have an extensive wine list but their Sommelier, Jon, was nice enough to recommend the last bottle of 2007 Paul Hobbs Cabernet in his possession.  Mind you, this wine was not on the wine list, and it was flattering to be in on this little secret. The wine complemented the entrees very well.    The only thing that bothered me throughout the whole experience was the heat in the cellar.  It was hot down there! Perhaps it was because of the number of patrons in addition to table side cooking.    While this place is pricey, there are reasons to justify the costs. All the portions of meals, including the dessert and cappuccino were HUGE!  I do appreciate the complementary bottled water, the freshly baked breads, the sorbet to cleanse the palette and the chocolate dipped strawberries, apricot and figs.  Hugo's Cellar is a survivor for a several reasons. Their service, how they treat their meat, their wine list, how they embrace the classics (like giving roses to the ladies and keeping a good menu) are all note worthy. Overall, it was a wonderful dining experience.  I do see myself coming back on a non weekend, just to see how things are.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table side salad
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paul Hobbs 2007, not on wine list
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jon the Sommelier&#39;s Tasting Cup

DcKTba-mvRzL6aIrCSAdNQ.text: I am not a fan of Las Vegas, but my sister lives there and my husband has to attend shows at the Convention Center.  We live in Los Angeles where there are many good  restaurants.  But, in Las Vegas there is only one restaurant that we have to go too.  That is Hugo's, away from the maddening crowd, you don't even feel like you are in Las Vegas.  My husband always takes his associates there and they are always surprised at how wonderful Hugo's is.  Do yourself a favor next time you are in Las Vegas, get off the Strip and enjoy the wonderful atmosphere of Hugo's.  eca

z7QKend-czEEwPsCSPMvcg.text: This place is always our "fancy" dinner while visiting Vegas!  Every lady receives a rose while being seated. We always think about the taxi driver who recommended this place years ago, otherwise,  we may have never heard of this gem.  The salad cart is always fun for a custom made salad and the sorbet to cleanse the palate is always my favorite.

HF-7UK6M2BqVL2Ao8RzM4w.text: I hate to be like this, but Hugo's Cellar was kind of a disappointment.  After all the amazing reviews, we thought it would be a nice, romantic place to eat.  It  was nice and romantic.  The food...well...   Lobster bisque was very good.  Then it went downhill.  I ordered my meat medium,  and my husband ordered his rare.  Mine came back extremely rare, while his was literally cold.  Both dishes were sent back. They gave me a whole new steak, which was again, very rare. And instead of truly heating up my husband's steak, they simply placed the entire plate back under the heat lamp. So the plate came back hot, while the steak was still cold.  Just very disappointing for a place that is supposed to specialize in this kind of thing.  My husband did not want to make a big deal, so he just didn't eat the dish and asked for them not to charge us.  They didn't...so to speak.  They ended up charging us 15 dollars for the salad he ate beforehand.  Come on.  15 dollars.    Atmosphere was great.  Steak- no way.  Two dishes screwed up? I'd rather not take the chance to try again and just go somehwere tried and True.

QevfD1SZB_6ex3qPMj6S6w.text: I've eaten at Hugo's at least 10 times and it's one of my favorite places to eat downtown.  Now I normally like a restaurant to be modern, open, airy and with lots of light.  Well Hugo's is the complete opposite of that!  However in this case I just love the old school Vegas feel of the joint.  Low ceilings, brink walls, dim lights...don't care...love it!  Food is really good, not "Celebrity chef" great.  I am always comped so value is hard to put a finger on.  All meals come with a made at table salad and with sides included, plus a small dessert at the end.  The size of the meals means that starters or extra desserts are really not needed.  So for $35 to $50 you really get a complete meal.  Based on that I would say value was good.  LOVE the prime rib, bone in strip, rack of lamb and King crab legs.  Other seafood dishes are solid if a little under whelming, all the steaks are prime and it shows.  Made to order salad is great and a mini meal in itself.  Special shout out to the Sommelier from England who is just so friendly and very funny.  Tell him what you like and he will find a great bottle for you.  He always has a bottle of Kim Crawford out that back for us.  Love it!

skcvOwkoNnB52Wqcq_bqvg.text: I had been to Hugo's Cellar before and it was delicious, but last night left a lot to be desired! I enjoy food, and sometimes the sweet and savory dishes I am craving are not offered in the same place. So, last night, I was excited to eat Hugo's heavenly Banana's Foster after my meal. I had talked up this dessert and this restaurant to my girlfriend, and she was excited to see what all the fuss was about. We drove across town specifically to come to Hugo's Cellar and enjoy some wine and dessert. However, after being seated and taking our order, a manager-looking guy comes over saying that they do not serve dessert only and that we had to either order an appetizer or go find room at the bar... um... ok... I brushed it off and said "oh no problem, we'll order an appetizer." After we ordering our appetizer, they come over with the Banana's Foster. Confused, I ask "is that for us?" and the server says "yes." But you guys made us order an appetizer???? The server says "Oh you wanted the appetizer first?" (really???), ok so he takes back the dessert and brings out the appetizer. We're not even done eating the appetizer when another guy comes over asking if he can take it away. I let him know that I am still working on it. They just keep making us feel uncomfortable. We felt rushed. As far as I could tell there was no one waiting to be seated, plenty of empty tables, what's the rush???  I mean it's not like we came for the free bread! We ordered a bottle of wine, an appetizer (THAT YOU FORCED ON US), and dessert... what the hell??? When we finally get our dessert, we are not even two bites into it when they bring the check and return back trying to cash us out. Are you serious??? At that point we were just like "ok, we get it, you're trying to get rid of us, here's our card." It's not even like the restaurant was full! It's ok if you don't want clients coming to just get dessert, that's fine. But man, they could have handled that much better! I was mortified that I talked my friend into coming to eat here, and then get treated this way. There are many places to get a great meal in Vegas, ones that don't require walking through a seedy area of town, to pay big bucks, and be treated badly.

6g7l0cDvO9_ZjTvA4vKefw.text: Heard about this place from a friend and I am glad that we finally tried it out. Awesome food and awesome service!! Love the old school feel that the restaurant gives. We will definitely be back.

uWccqSUC6JyyRI8xxqwrqA.text: I've been to Hugo's Cellar several times and have NEVER been disappointed completely and totally over the top and I loved every second of it.

HNtKOYgK-lzJ8uoM9lrsIw.text: Evening didn't start well. Waiter doesn't take the wine order yet he got to us first. He said wine steward did that and walked off. Problem was steward walked past our table of 4 twice waiting on the table directly behind us. Had to flag him down to take our order. Rude treatment by both waiter and steward, particularly waiter who acted put out with us and didn't listen as we ordered. Food arrived and was well prepared. But don't believe raves about salad...bunch of ingredients that don't work together though your choice on components. Coin toss on whether we'd bother returning given accessibility.

t4raK-3YJtAHU0nrUIorYw.text: I have to admit when I heard I was going to down town I did not have high expectations .  Well I was quite surprised . You walk down a set of stairs into well what looks like none other then a cellar .  They greet the women with a rose when you get to the hostess .  They proceed to walk you to your table and place the rose accordingly to you . I went with 3 people so we all had something different for dinner . My girlfriend and I ordered the fish . It was phenomenal . We paired it with a bottle of wine  , the men had steaks .  After dinner we all sat and spoke about how amazing the food was . I must admit I will be going back .

hcg57i4nMC9VzGlFHCtBVg.text: A Vegas treasure!  This place is worth the taxi ride over from the strip.  The atmosphere, customer service, and food are superb.  The salad cart is fantastic, and we loved the sorbet course before our entree arrived.  And the chocolate dipped fruit is a real treat.  I recommend going for the split entree option with your date as it's a lot of food.

StYdYAjNRgIeGSIgRimFHw.text: arrved @ 8:15 for an 8PM reservation.Maitre D' announces the table was released because they wait only 15 minutes. An obvious lie and ploy to get a tip.  Should have left then since Hugo's announced right away how blatantly they had changed. I was livid and told this cretin about his attempt at larceny.  A turn out this guy is also the manager. After this glorious beginning it got worse. I've been going to Hugo's for years and loved it. My previous reviews have been sparkling. We generally bring our own wine and because they carry the brand there is a $25 corkage charge. I have never paid that charge but reflect the non-charge in the Sommelier's tip. Both the Sommelier and the mgr. assured me there would be no corkage charge. There was a charge. No problem, the Sommelier paid for it. Next was the salad;a great salad served at your choice of ingredients at the table. This was the meal's highlight. The server was pleasant and good and the salad perfect. We ordered the Beef Wellington and lobster tails. The tails were $90 but Australian tails are hard to find. No chef needed here, tails were great. The Wellington meat was perfect but the liver crust was shoddy and almost liver free. That never happened before. However, over all the food was very good. The waiter was ridiculously silly and lazy. Kept muttering something about serving ladies first. We had ordered the 2 dishes to share and explicitly requested the beef be cut at the table so my wife could get the better-done ends. We attempted to get the vegetables we wanted not the melange they wished to serve. This waiter refused to do that; a first at a "fine restaurant".  The meal was not split, nor the meat carved at table. Like the vegetables I gave up the meat carving but insisted the meal be shared in the kitchen. A very unappetizing dinner was had. Oh,there has always been a 20% discount available through the casino which owns the place or at the 2 for stands in town for a small fee. Well they reduced it unilaterally to 20% on one entree. I am only upset at the people who have, in the past, gone here because of my reviews.  This place is now only for people with low to no self esteem, masochists and really ignorant tourists. My hope is that this review will cost at least as much business as the good ones I have given. Oh! I tipped what I was given. Zilch. I wish more people would assert themselves. It still cost close to $200 for a miserable dinner.  A note. Hugo's cancelled my reservation after I had been there. It took a while to figure out why. Turns out that if one has not been at the restaurant one can not review that restaurant on Open  Table. That is a problem that Open Table should fix in my view. However, Trip Advisor is a much better place to review a restaurant. I can not believe the pettiness this place, Hugo's, resorts to cover up some thing that never should have happened.

bbCIrgEhanTZemxHv9jH1w.text: Awesome atmosphere, great service, delicious meal.  Pricier than you might expect for the Four Queens, but worth every penny.

xOmEvEaM5LVAM8oDZYCqEg.text: Great food, great service. At first glance it seemed pretty pricey, but everything was included, they don't charge extra for your salad or potato. They even give the women a rose to take with them. Highly recommend them. Glen

roxPexTAkinz9Ucd5MEP1Q.text: First class place....and a fascinating departure from the noisy, raucous gambling in the casino (Four Queens) above. When you descend the steps into the cellar, it's another world. Quiet, romantic, quaint and classy. The menu is fix prixe so the price, which seem pretty high, includes an excellent salad, some sort of potato, a vegetable and a light dessert. Great service, interesting menu and a martini served like I've never seen with so much gin (real martinis aren't made with vodka!) that I couldn't finish it. Our waiter had been there for 17 years! Highly recommended. Didn't see their wine list, but suspect it was classy. sdm

EOVuefuqbq3tBAbOlXDRLg.text: I was born and raised in Las Vegas. I have been coming to Hugo's since I was a kid. I went to homecomings and proms here. Birthdays and other celebrations as well. Anytime a friend from out of town asked for a suggestion on a good quality steakhouse Hugo's was my first thought. I've been to every fine dining restaurant Las Vegas has to offer and still regarded Hugo's as my favorite. So you would see my great GREAT disappointment with my experience tonight. It's my birthday. My fiance made a reservation for us and was very excited to try my "favorite spot". It was his first time and will be his last. Our waiter came up to our table with a miserable look on his face right off the bat. Did not introduce himself, did not ask what the occasion was (although we told the host it was my birthday, twice) he asked for our drinks and rushed off. Almost 15 minutes later he finally checked back with us to ask if we were ready to order. I am in the service industry and I am very sympathetic to waiters and service. I always give the benefit of the doubt to them when it takes a bit longer due to volume or short staffing. This was not the case. I saw him standing around, catering to other tables and didn't so much as look at us. A thumbs up at that point would have sufficed. We finally ordered appetizers and entrees. As I was about to ask about the table side salad he ran off like we were a bother. My fiance then excused himself to the "bathroom" but unbeknownst to me he actually went back to the host stand to make sure they could send a little cake out with a candle for my birthday. The host said "absolutely". I tried to wave down our waiter to ask a question, he made eye contact and ran away to the back. Our appetizers came first. We were not checked on once by the water until the table side salad (which should have been before the appetizers) were served. Again in a rushed and rude tone. Eggs? Red onion? Dressing? And everything was hurriedly thrown in a bowl and slopped onto our plates. A LONG while later our entrees came out. Both ordered medium. The couple next to us were given great and personable service and their salads were done before ours even tho they were seated well well after we had initially arrived. When we were finished with our salad plates we put them to the front of the table, our waiter walked by THREE times seeing the plates and just left them. Finally a busser picked them up 5 minutes later. I am 31 and my fiance is 29. We look younger and we pretty much chalked it up to age discrimination as we are extremely polite to servers everywhere we go. The Beef Wellington was disappointing and the Rack of Lamb was lack luster. Garlic mash had zero flavor. The food was the least of our grievances though because the service was so bad and impersonal. Usually you have two waiters helping you out. We saw the other waiter maybe twice and he was very polite. His name was Dave and we wish he would have been around more often. The bill came right after the chocolate covered strawberries. No birthday cake, no candle nothing special for my birthday even tho we told the host twice. 200 dollars later and my fiance was really upset. Hugo's Cellar is no longer my favorite restaurant. I will never suggest it again. I work in the number one nightclub in the world and have suggested it many times. Never again. My fiance refuses to come back. In all of my times coming to Hugo's in the past 25 years. (Yes 25 years!!!!) I have always had a pleasant experience and although one bad experience shouldn't ruin it for me, it has. My birthday dinner was not special. I would name the waiter in the review but he never once told us his name and we were too frustrated and upset to ask. We just wanted to get out of there. Go to Mastro's or Del Frisco's their quality of food and service are MUCH better. Maybe this is an end of an era. Very sad.

4gtDfOC3ve2nwO_t833Faw.text: This is my favorite fancy restaurant by far! The food is delicious, the waiters are attentive, and the environment is beautiful. Plus, you can't beat the experience of having a full meal- salad, sorbet between courses, and chocolate dipped fruit- all included with your entree (which is pretty reasonably priced)! Love this place!

6tDnwhLhh8bY8pDofs-W3w.text: Hugo's is the best kept secret in Downtown Vegas...Tucked inside the old and rundown Four Queens Hotel and Casino, Hugo's is well known as one of the best steak houses in Vegas and in my opinion...the best. I have eaten here more then 10 times so trust me when I tell you that I have seen almost everything on the menu and I have never been let down. The food and service is amazing, top notch. Everything on the menu is perfect. You must try this restaurant and you can thank me the next day! Enjoy...

7UxqNbqP1zJRuofLKI-tTw.text: Had a reservation for 8:30, for a group of 6. We met around 8 for drinks at the restaurant bar. Not much room at the bar. When we first walked in to meet our group, I was immediately reprimanded by the host to keep the walk way clear. I get it, but I hadn't even gotten to the bar seat yet, when I was rudely told to move it. The bartender was the ONLY one in the place with any personality. Great at mixing drinks and friendly. Dean was awesome, I wish he could have been our server too! On to the server... Quirky at best. Not really personable. Took our order and that was that. The Sommelier was informative and friendly, I think we saw him more than we saw our server.  The food was good. Mixed reviews from our group. Mine was fantastic. I got the filet wrapped with bacon and crab. Sides of veggies were unusual. They took our plates very quickly, like they were trying to push us out. We had plenty for leftovers, but they took our plates and did not give us a chance to request boxes.    We ended with the bananas foster. Eh. Usually it's a presentation, but that left a lot to be desired.  Overall, the food was great. And besides Dean, our bartender, service was shockingly impersonal and a bit rude.  When I spend that much money on dinner, I love connecting with the staff, it makes the experience a lot more fun, and worth the money. This place just didn't do it for me.

usebePa8Wa_AFylQ8fw0NQ.text: Wow, is this place popular!! And I can definitely see why.   It's like being transported back in time. As soon as you walk in you are greeted by someone who hands you a rose (as long as you have b00bies) and then you are taken to your table. The ambience is wonderful. The place is dimly lit and everyone is dressed up in suits.   The waiters are all very friendly, although that could be because I was about 60 years younger than anyone else in the place....and I'm not exaggerating.   Apparently, they specialize in martinis. I didn't have one. I'm just putting it out there :)  Anyways, the salads are awesome! There is a salad cart that comes to your table and your salad is completely customized. I can't recall all the options but here are a few: bay shrimp, egg, bleu cheese crumbles, croutons, onion, tomato, and pine nuts. As for dressings they offer caesar, pepper ranch, and a really good honey something rather vinaigrette (which I opted for). Not something I usually go for but I'm glad I did. It was delicious!   To start with, I had the shrimp cocktail, 3 jumbo shrimp with cocktail sauce and a super yummy remoulade. That really made the dish!  In between the appetizers and meals, they bring over a tiny scoop of lemon sorbet on a mini cone to clease your palette. I have never been to a place that did this before but I thoroughly enjoyed it!  I also got prime rib, prepared medium rare. It was very good. You can also get them crusted with bleu cheese or horseradish, which I accidentally forgot to ask for :(  To top the meal off, the include chocolate covered strawberries, apricots, and figs. Really special touch.  I loved it here! The ambiance was really amazing and it is definitely a place to go if you are celebrating something special! Be prepared to spend some coin though. Really worth it

aKMqCzFNZ6ywzOiN_melvQ.text: Our 6th time here in last 12 years and still one of our favorite places of all time. Best table side salad ever.

CnplmMfat5PCWWQv8xH73w.text: My review is totally late (life is so busy), but my husband took me here for our weekly date night. Start to finish, our experience was AMAZING! I felt so comfortable here. The service is SUPERB! Water glass was never not full, our wine glasses were always filled, and we never had any wait time issues. Loved our experience here. The Atlantis was ridiculously cooked to perfection. Definitely on my top ten list of best dishes! What an amazing way to forget you're on Fremont or even Vegas. We'll definitely be returning to explore the rest of the menu!

VIpDKBeXr03Q-GllXH8qiA.text: Delightful. I loved the salad, made to order. Clense your pallet with sorbet ( could have been served in a crystal, not a cone)  My server, Anthony,  has been here 11 years and he's low man on the totem pole, with other servers having more than 20 years.  Table #36 straight ahead,  up against the back wall. Highly recommend that spot. Although I was dining alone,  Anthony gave me a rose, maybe I'll find a lovely lady to give it to along Fremont steel.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad to order

hHc6NQqKIN7QYOCX3P0CoA.text: The absolute best beef Wellington I have had. This place is a must stop if you want a rustic, chill and relaxed dinner. Carve out at least two hours for a nice sitting. Worth every penny!

KS6KHAYYmuHu3GBQSFXBJg.text: Well, what can I say! I love this place. Took my honey there for his bday, and it was so romantic. The table side salad is the best! I would go there just for the salad. Everything is great. Also, the prices are not that bad considering all the food you get. Excellent customer service as well.

OCmHUOqKOWT8LLcrlVq5Cg.text: We had our wedding dinner at this old school hidden gem. The staff was real friendly and the food was delicious. They give all the women a rose at the front door when they seat you. I really like the old school dark swanky ambience of the room. She ordered the Filet and Shrimp and I ordered the Beef Wellington.   When you order an entree it comes with a table side made salad, a sorbet to cleanse the palate, and for dessert a bowl of cream with chocolate covered strawberries, dates, and figs.   The salads were really good and custom made. The entrees were even better. My wife's filet and shrimp was wonderful. My beef Wellington was top notch. We both finished every bite. The dessert was a nice touch, but we were full when we got to it.   I'll definitely be back for special nights out.

Sc_mxBs5t7X4spkLBYWLyg.text: I've been going to hugo's cellar since I was a little kid and plan on it until I die or they close lol. The service is amazing. There are always two or more people taking care of you, the food is excellent, the wait isn't long and the banana foster is truly mind blowing! If you choose to try this out ask for the server Victor. He makes the dining experience complete.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eat this and close your eyes. Try not to imagine how empty your life would be without this flawless banana foster.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana foster
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White and milk chocolate dipped fruits

E-2wF-JK6qb5rZddcp5GaA.text: Old school Vegas dining at its best. Transports you to an era of quality service, chivalrous etiquette and perfectly prepared food. Love the blue cheese stuffed olive martini and the table side salad experience. Palate cleanser in the form of a small raspberry sorbet cone was so endearing. Perfectly prepared scallops and my date had the Chilean sea bass with crab.  After which you are greeted with chocolate dipped fruit and whipped cream. I was too full to have more than a bite of the fig and apricot. The strawberries looked perfect, but I had to save room for the amazing dessert coming our way. Meal was finished off with the flambe cherries jubilee. A hint of cinnamon and I believe homemade vanilla ice cream made this decedent treat worth a return visit. And this is coming from a woman without a sweet tooth. Yum yum yum.  Don't miss Hugo's if you're in old town!

k2yl_dWUHm9O9_-F2f1zGg.text: Hugos Cellar has a classy vibe to it. One star knocked off only because it says there's a dress code but people came in with shorts, etc. I would have not worn fancy pants and wore my lucky shorts into the restaurant if I knew a dress code won't be necessary.   On important news: food- the escargot and crab cakes were great as well as the bread was filling. Escargot had only 6 pieces. Crab cake 2 pieces.  I was ready for my entree  (2 filet mignon with foie gras). But to my surprise they gave a pallet cleanser of yummy sorbet in a cone. *i thought that was cool.  Unfortunately yet fortunately surprise! A salad bar swings by and gives you a HUGE yummy salad (that's why there's a huge green plate on your table)....I wasn't expecting such a huge salad.  My stomach was filled to the brim with salad and i didn't have enough space for the entree as well as dessert? What the?  Chocolate dipped strawberries, figs, and apricots...as well as cream? *all complimentary  Food overload. Delicious but wow!  Also prior to dessert they show you a tray of desserts  Be warned  that was delicious but not part of your meal so it'll cost more....but the creme Brulee was tasty.  Why Hugo? Why did you pounce the salad bar on me!?  Entree unfortunately had a small sliver of dry foie gras (2 inches width and maybe 1/4 an inch of height) on top of the filet mignon.... so i would pass on that entree next time. Personally i do like a decent sized buttery melt in your mouth foie gras for the price. 60 bucks. *I've had fist sized foie gras or all you can eat foie gras for the same price at some restaurants. No joke. If on the menu...make it a decent size and don't skimp on it. Salad was deliciously huge....why not the entrees foie gras? *prior to the meal, I asked the waiter about the size of foie gras and he shaped it like a baseball size but it was more like a pog size (a half dollar coin size) Remember them pog toys?  My bro had rib eye and that was huge and delicious.  Overall. Great place. Pricy but good for special occasions. Eat less of the salad and bread so you have more room for the entree.Also takeout box is fancy and tasty food.

KDyYfWna_3k2VDWi0Fad_A.text: My husband and I came here as a splurge for our anniversary dinner on the recommendation of someone who used to live in Vegas. The maitre d' was so nice and funny, and gave me a lovely rose. I was a little nervous because I never go to fancy restaurants and am not really used to the austere demeanor of our head waiter--he was very nice, just more formal than I'm used to. One thing I did appreciate was how he wasn't pushy with drinks. My husband and I don't drink, and I always feel awkward and bad when servers push bar drinks on me, but he was great in that regard. We ordered the ribeye and salmon which both came with the AMAZING tableside salad. Now the guy who came to make the salad was so much more my type of server :) He wasn't unprofessional for an upscale restaurant at all, but he cracked jokes and made me feel a lot more at ease (I wish I could remember his name--he was originally from Houston, so if the salad guy from Houston sees this, you were great!) The salads were so good and filling that I actually ended up taking most of my salmon back to the hotel, but it was amazing. I'd had salmon twice in the prior two days, so I was feeling a little salmoned out, but it was prepared so well that I really enjoyed it. Overall a great meal and experience!

99pKDGBXuxLV6H5N4YsNcA.text: This place is really nice and the food is delicious. The atmosphere is very intimate and cozy. Every lady receives a rose. Each table receives bread and butter in the shape of a rose. Your entire comes with a salad. They bring a cart to your table and you choose everything you want on it. I'm not a fan of salads but this one was delicious. You also receive a small complimentary chocolate covered fruit tray after your meal. Our appetizers never came out but even with that I still feel it was worth 5 stars. The staff was very attentive otherwise. Loved it and would definitely go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot.

n5XOJTffUSUS-1kYj0exyg.text: I took my husband here for a bday one year about 2 years back. i never remembered to write a review for it, but i still remember it like yesterday! this place is wonderful, great food, great romantic ambiance, great staff from the door to the floor! this place is an old school cellar with a nice drink and dinner menu. they serve salad first on a cart in front of your table, then bring out some kind of sorbet before your dinner, after dinner they serve different chocolate covered fruits and figs! you will definitely leave FULL & SATISFIED with a bag in hand of the rest of your food! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! DEFINITELY RETURNING! :) LADIES GET A ROSE WHEN YOU WALK IN AND THEY PUT IT IN A VASE AT YOUR TABLE AND PACK IT TO TAKE HOME. HAPPY COUPLES DATE NIGHT :)

gFkfOxyXVbmKDFUa9j_-ug.text: When folks come to Vegas I believe what they seek is an experience.   Whether it's a show, their hotel, the casino, people watching or the food.  Hugo's Cellar excels for a food experience!  The ambience is what I imagine was typical for old-school Vegas, a place for regulars with, ahem, "connections".  The wait staff is attentive and professional without being in the way.  Carlos is a fine waiter and Diego kept our water glasses full.  Then there was Victor.  At Hugo's they make each diner a salad to their specifications from a table side salad station.  Victor was the salad guy.  But he was so much more.  Victor was the story guy, and the "tell it like it was" guy, and the guy who embodied the ambience of Hugo's.  The name over the door read "Hugo's Cellar", but it could have easily read "Victor's Place".  Our party of 8 dined for close to 3 hours.  Mine and my wife's bill was around $170 for two entree and two martinis.  Expensive? You might think so.  You could think of it as comparable to two tickets to a Vegas show with a free steak meal.  I think of it as a Vegas experience and well worth it.

5BaYYRu9eODhfSwbkHj9VQ.text: Aw, Hugo's Cellar....you NEVER disappoint!! Every time we come to Las Vegas, we make it a point to visit Hugo's. We arrived a little before our reserved time and were seated right away. We love to get a martini, which is served along with the remainder in an small, individual ice bucket! Yes, the prices at first are daunting, but as other reviewers have noted, it includes an awesome salad, prepared table side. My husband had Chilean sea bass, and I had the seafood trio (sea bass, crab cake, and shrimp scampi). Both came with potatoes and vegetables. Oh yes, and a sorbet to cleanse your palate between the salad and entree. Included were chocolate covered fruits (strawberries, apricots, and figs) for dessert. We would like to again thank Michael, our server, for a wonderful evening! Can't wait to go back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute display of butter!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood trio- sea bass, crab cake, and shrimp scampi
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uRhR7KsmYTq77yzz6InXpQ.text: We stayed downtown for a birthday celebration and decided to venture out to find a location for dinner.  It was a Friday night and checked open table and thought we would check Hugo's.  Fortunately, they had a no-show for a reservation (reservations are HIGHLY encouraged!) so they were able to squeeze us in.  We waited in the lounge while our table opened up and met one of the most amazing bartenders - we ordered a Side Car (made his way) and Harvey Wallbanger, which were both fantastic.  They also had some very nice "munchies" at the bar.  I would definitely return to their lounge just for drinks.  Dinner was fantastic!  They have a very classic menu with amazing service.  Every single person who came to our table was friendly and well versed.  Our Sommelier was quite entertaining and we invited him back to join us for a toast.  The freshly tossed salad was impeccable.  We considered ordering dessert, but were so stuffed especially with the delightful little treats served at the end of the meal.  My only "complaint" was that some of the clientele did not dress appropriately for the venue (as noted in other reviews).  Downtown Las Vegas has come a long way with some great new options, and this one has remained True to its origins with service and quality befitting the heydays of Las Vegas.  This is a True gem that I had heard about for years and am glad we made it there to enjoy.  I will definitely return again and recommend it without hesitation for a special evening.

5IRKQdbtlUNZXmWISBSlFw.text: The overall experience was amazing. The host was very polite and accommodating. We got the perfect booth in the back corner. Very romantic setting. When you first walk in all ladies are greeted with a beautiful, long stem red rose. Our waiter was very friendly and knowledgeable of everything on the menu. Our orders came out perfectly. Everything was timed very well so as not to over crowd the table or defer interest. Sommelier was very helpful and informative of the wine list and pairings. Our steaks were cooked actually to our request. Dessert was exceptional. Mascarpone cake and complimentary chocolate dipped fruit plate. I will definitely be coming back. Thank you for the great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pre-game. Exceptational made table side Caesar salad with real anchovies in the dressing. A great way to start the meal. Yum!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot. Not really my thing. But definitely a must try if your up for something different and adventrous.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16oz. NYstrip. Cooked beautifully to a perfect medium. Excellent flavor.

h3nZSvH6Db6qDkY1h9jdfw.text: SO much fun. Old School Vegas all the way. Roses at entrance for the ladies. Went here for Valentines day and it was very nice. One of the few places where you get a complete meal at an expensive steak house. LOVE LOVE LOVE the salad. I was so full I took 95% of my meal with me. Not cheap but what steak house is?

pSIcGCmHPC638PgYKx2L5w.text: This is the hardest three star review I've rated because I actually loved the place.  First, the ambience is great. Located in The Queen casino, you walk into a candlelit cave of old school class. The staff is friendly and professional.  Second, the intangibles of Hugo's are fantastic. Each entree comes with a made to order salad prepared at your table-side that was surprisingly filling and delicious. Between courses they provide you with a sorbet palate cleanser.   The reason I couldn't give a review higher than three stars is due to the steak quality. I had the ribeye and the gf had the filet mignon: both were okay but not great. Better than a chain restaurant but no where near the quality you would expect from $50+ steaks. This is unfortunate because everything else was done so well but they failed to stick the landing where it matters most.   Bottom line: loved everything except for our entrees. If you're going to try Hugo's, be prepared to be charmed and order something else besides the steaks.

T_XuiOk32dSdylq9iRC77A.text: I just first want to say that this is not the type of review I thought I would write for HC because I have enjoyed it in the past but that was a long time ago so I have to treat my current experience separately. I also understand that It was getting close to closing so we get that the staff may be tired or not on their game.   My big pet peeve is the hostess staring at you like she has no idea why you are coming towards her. If I ran a restaurant the hostess would lead the conversation not wait for you to inform her that you are there to eat at her restaurant. They presented my Wife with a rose which was a nice touch but the stem looked as if it came from a corn field. A little cut would have been better. We felt we had a sunflowers towering over us the whole time.   We were seated and met with a couple different staff members who all tried to get us to buy alcohol and then had a look of disappointment when we declined as we always do.   After a longer than I would have liked wait, we were asked to give our order. I have a Strip Steak and my Wife the prime rib. Before hand they brought out a salad bar and made our salad's before us which was nice. Everything was fresh and was well prepared.   Then they presented us with what can only be described as a tart, raspberry sorbet.  This was a pallet cleaner, I decided to leave mine dirty after one bite.   Our steaks finally came out and the first thing we noticed is how hot they were. I've been to enough steak houses to know that it was an abnormal temperature. We wondered if they had put it in a microwave. Pure speculation. Though the steaks in general were good but my strip steak was just a little tough in the initial cut.   We declined dessert and handed the waiter our CC to pay. It must have taken him 10 minutes to come back. Again too long and he took my ID with him. I just feel like when you're running a business there should always be someone there to take the money.   Anyway, a three for me. No Lawry's that's for sure. That place knows how to run a restaurant. I wanted to give it a four but too many details overlooked.

4Gy5sVzUme0RyCufPROYcQ.text: Ours was a party of six, a very special surprise Birthday celebration.  I hadn't been to Hugo's in over 20 years, and didn't remember much about the restaurant. The service was wonderful from the moment we entered.  As others have mentioned, the ladies I the group were greeted with a long stem rose. Service was prompt and very good.  I think every employee at Hugo's stopped by the table to wish our birthday guest a happy b-day.  Nice.  Food was served in a timely manner, and was great (except the tough, stringy, white asparagus-no one liked it).  A small pyramid shaped mousse cake was presented to the Birthday guest, along with the dipped fruit dessert.  Very nice!  Everyone had more than enough food, and left very satisfied.  The ONLY hitch was after we had left the restaurant, and went to pick up our car in Valet.  We took our validated ticket to where we had dropped the car off.  After standing, being ignored, for way too long, I hailed the valet (Lamont).  He barked "you're in the WRONG PLACE".  He said we needed to take the ticket to a window half way across the property!  I am disabled, and had walked about as far as I could - and explained this to him.  He said that "that was where I had to go if I wanted my car".  He said, very sarcastically, that if I "couldn't possibly" walk there, that my guest would have to schlep the ticket there, and ask them to bring the car to 'this side'.   I was totally embarrassed!  The Birthday guest saw my anguish, and she offered to go turn the ticket in for me.  She returned, some 5-10 min later, and we bagan the wait.  Nearly 15 minutes later valet, Lamont, walked by and said that our car is sitting at Valet - across the building.  I made the painful trek with the help of my guest.  More embarrassment!  I was nearly in tears from the pain by the time we got to the other Valet area.  Needless to say, my evening was ruined! NONE of this should have happened.  I had gone thru the trouble of visiting the valet area, and walking to Hugo's, then back to valet, some 5 hours earlier.  Knowing that I can only walk a short distance, I wanted to make sure that I would be able to make the walk.  I didn't want my disability to interfere with the other guests enjoyment in any way.  Instead, I was made into a gimp spectacle.   I doubt that we will EVER return for more abuse!

Ku7r5VKoiEKLQv4tW_IiSQ.text: The Hugo's cellar is a hidden restaurant in the 4 Queens... What a good surprise to find such a place there! The service is good, the staff is friendly. We went there for dinner on a thursday night, and the restaurant was pretty full, with a mix population of tourist, locals and business event. The food is typical american steack house with some added value: the free giant salad (we had the Caesar sauce... there is anchovy flavour in it... We didnt like), and the very famous banana "flambee" made in front of you! Awesome! I recommend this restaurant and 100% sure I will go again!

KxsGRQWOvpo8DCT28guoxw.text: In my opinion there are much better steakhouses here in Las Vegas, maybe not for the price for quantity aspect, but at least for the quality of their steaks.  I went here on the recommendation of a long time family friend, and I failed to find all the great things he told me about.  The service was fine, but nothing spectacular.  The steak was cooked properly but to me lacked the flavor or of high quality steak.  The salad they make for you at the table was nice, but again, nothing special.  I'll be honest in that I felt that the sides that came with my steak were better and more flavorful than the steak itself.  The highlight of the meal tonight was their sommelier, a Mr. John Simmons.  I told him what type of wines I like, what I was having for dinner, and then he suggested a price range and went to find a nice bottle for me and my cousin.  His choice was from a winery in Sonoma, CA that I had never heard of, and the price for the bottle was at the lower end of the suggested range, a pleasant surprise.  He also seemed to have the most personality amongst all the servers waiting on the table.  On the whole, if you want a romantic date spot, you can do worse than this place, where they do give roses to all the ladies that come in.  It can be rather intimate, and is quiet enough that you can have a nice conversation without having to shout.  In the end, I seriously doubt I will be coming back here as there are several other steakhouses in Vegas that I prefer.

wzt58P0JYCEDlPxX_wLrUQ.text: I want to make sweet, sweet love to Hugo Cellar. I mean, I was given a rose when I walked in the door AND a custom salad was made for each person in my group, in front of us, at the table. That calls for some major lovin'.   This place is old school classy and I loved it. Ignore the fact that it's in the Four Queens and GO, now. (If you have some cash to drop, that is...) It looks like a Cellar that your Dad or Grandpa might frequent, all brick and leather chairs and green glass chandeliers. But Oh, the food. Oh yes. And the wine! They have an on-site sommelier and he has personality to spare. Loved him.   Starts out with a salad that is custom made off a cart for you at your table. I recommend the Orange Vinaigrette, it was blow-your-mind good. I ate my whole salad, even though I knew a ton more food was coming, it was that amazing. And you can have it made really simple, or do like my guy did and get the works...which includes anchovies, hearts of palm, pine nuts, red onion, etc. Then you get a little mini raspberry sorbet to clear your palette. It worked! I had an amazing chicken and mushroom dish, but also know that the scallops and filet mignon come highly recommended by my foodie friends. After all of the moaning and giving each other bites of the deliciousness, you are treated to freaking chocolate dipped strawberries and figs with creme fraiche. (it's an all inclusive price.)   My friends had been there before and raved about the Bananas Foster. Now I see why. This guy in a Tux stands at your table and makes an AMAZING Bananas Foster, we are talking flames rising and the whole shebang. So delectable, I had said I would have a bite but ended up having like 5. And I double licked the spoon.   If you are looking for a True experience type restaurant, this is your place. I truly enjoyed myself here and will definitely go again.   I want to go to there!

zZ31DRIp-KpGEbyHCgyZmA.text: We were excited to go Hugo's for 20th anniversary.  Service was awful. I had baked stuffed shrimp. Shimp was hot beause plate was hot but stuffing was cold. Sent back and came back hot but shrimp was over cooked. The waiters never came back to check on us. I ate 2 of the 5. The busser came and took our plate  I was to mad to say anything.  He also was the one who brought our chocolates at the end. They didn't offer dessert or coffee. We normally go to Michael's and everyone said to try Hugo's. I was very disappointed.  My husband did enjoy his beef wellington.

BzXydG9zVkxb-cj2XQBVJw.text: The perfect place if you want to relax and be pampered Old School Las Vegas style. no rush but attentive staff. Just tell Vincent what you are having and let him take over with a great glass of wine. stay for the Bananas Fosters table side show and have a heater Brandy. The experience is even better when you go during the week. It does get a bit loud on weekends. From Dean's smile at the bar when you walk in, to the team of servers who work flawlessly together to make your experience great. Hugo's Cellar is special so get dressed up and treat yourself.

INkm1JJ22mzcmjlEeHO2hA.text: We really enjoyed our evening. The sommelier helped us choose a lovely affordable bottle of wine, he had been there 31 years and we talked about the old days. Our service was spectacular our waiter was fairly new he had only worked there 12 years! The Lobster bisque was creamy, piping hot, and lots of lobster chunks. The table side salad was superb. We split a meal, for a $25 charge you get entree split in kitchen with full sides and salad service. I really enjoyed the after dinner coffee served with their house made whipped cream, cinnamon sticks, chocolate mint candy. A perfect evening. We both left full and satisfied

vJ-3xwvYNx37ZPAV2wSGmA.text: 5 star service, 4.5 food and 5 star value. The often yelped about salad cart is overrated. Plenty of choices for a custom salad, but 3 standard dressing choices. Most places BOA or any steakhouse has way better salads. The rib eye was terrific and cooked to order exactly how I expected. The room itself was an old school Vegas restaurant that impressed me. The hostess was pleasant and the waiter was attentive and very nice. I did not love my side dishes, but they are not a la carte. They were included so I could hardly complain. I had a great experience and will go back next time in Vegas.

vDBrpF0wapb3djQ_fKRx8Q.text: My fiance and I were looking for a place to have a nice romantic dinner during our Vegas trip and we found it at Hugos! The atmosphere was the best the brick walls and candles had such an intimate touch. The service was great I wish I remembered our waiters names but my pregnancy brain won't allow me to do so lol. We both had the filet which was cooked to perfection, garlic mashed potatoes, and asparagus. The Salad with the pepper ranch made to your exact desires was a great way to start the meal. Overall it was a wonderful experience and we will definitely be coming back to have more dinners here during future trips

vyn8hhv1axoD7rcR6wT-oQ.text: Went to Hugo's Cellar last night for the first time. Omg!  I have to say the best steakhouse in town. I've lived here 28 years. Greeted at the door with a rose and treated like gold. Had the filet cooked to perfection. Came with table side salad. The waiter (Victor) was amazing. He is retiring soon and I feel that the restaurant won't be the same without him. I can't put into words the amount of pleasure we had at this steakhouse. It is so worth the money!!!

oi10mKVj7v9UjDxl6ftdpQ.text: Even though this place is downtown, an area I usually don't visit, this restaurant is a good one. The things like the rose upon arrival, the salad cart and the deserts that all come at no extra cost are very nice touches. The martinis essentially come as 2 martinis, and the escargot was also very good. The food our party of 6 ordered was all very good. If you find yourself downtown, I'd recomend this place!

t2_s2f824YEpnoAwNs4SKw.text: Great old Las Vegas steakhouse.  The service is excellent and the food is great!  The table side salad is wonderful and the atmosphere is perfect!

hDemAtuOhm4wLk0jrIbr9g.text: We've been going to Hugo's almost every year for our anniversary (17 years).  Victor was awesome as always and is THE best waiter in Vegas, bar none.  John the sommelier is always great with the wine!  See ya next year Hugos!

bQ85afeoQUsaCsR4RgXcuQ.text: Went to Hugo's cellar last night for our one fancy date night meal while we were in Vegas. I loved the old school service and ambiance. Good food, but not the best. But still very good. Pricing is very expensive but there is a lot of service. Being located under the casino main floor may effect the clientele. We had a intoxicated dip sh#t that was loud and distracting. Almost had a confrontation except my sweet girl asked me not to engage. That was the biggest distraction from the good food and service. Excellent Martinis and cocktails. The hot stone appetizer was excellent! Salad is a great experience and delicious. My steak was a bit tough on the outside but tender once I got inside. My girls scallops were good. It was a great dining experience but expensive. I give it a three because of the price.. Food is 4 plus..

fyxHUQ9IY9F4s7XFvukgxQ.text: Hugo's Cellar blew my hair back, knocked my socks off, pampered us, tucked us in and made sweet love to us all night long!  This place was orgazmic to say the very least. We arrived without a reservation and were able to accommodate us immediately. The maitre d' handed the ladies in our party a long stemmed rose and treated us like royalty. Our server, I believe his name was Anthony, was a True professional. He got us all excited about the meal we were about to experience.   Our meal was something that we are still talking about.  it began with cocktails and a salad server arrived with a basket of fresh breads and built our salads tableside. We had over a dozen toppings to choose from and several dressings....so good!  After the salad we were served a mini sorbet to cleanse the pallet. I think mine was raspberry and it was so ideal after eating the anchovies in the salad.  Jason and I ordered the Chateaubriand for two and lobster tails. it was served with baby new potatoes and fresh spring vegetables. Our chateau was cooked to perfection and melted in your mouth. It burst with so much flavor that it made us both pause and look at each other with the look of satisfaction, kinda like the look you have after some really good circus style sex.   Our friends ordered the rib eye and they were completely amazed with it! We all said over and over how that meal was the absolute best meal we had all ever had.  We thought our dinner was over.
