But, to our surprise "Anthony came over with an assortment of chocolate dipped fruits (strawberries, figs & apricots) and REAL whipped creme, and the dessert tray. We ordered two desserts from the tray and they were both served with REAL whipped creme and were TO DIE FOR!  During dinner we were talking about how we could just feel how good the coffee was going to be and sure enough. The coffee was so yummy!  The service was IMPECCABLE! We did not want for anything. Several times we commented on how we had NEVER had service like this EVER before, EVER! We felt as if we were waited on hand and foot! Our drinks were never neglected and we did not have to look for our server once. He was there every time we needed him and was not intrusive at all.   We are going to back to Vegas just to eat here again!  Bravo Hugo's Cellar!

YwnZ9WQw5wPkfnVLFda2kQ.text: Classic vegas dining in the cellar of the four queens hotel. Long stem red rose fpr my wife. Waiters in tuxes. Table side salad service. Incredible entrees and a desert platter to finish it off. Amazing night and dinner!

YkUTA4lIe-X46d3-Bmh7mQ.text: We took my mom to Las Vegas for her birthday. The only thing she wanted was a good lobster dinner....I Googled "the best lobster in Las Vegas". I researched many of them. Then I found Hugo's Cellar, quite by accident. ~ Let me say that this was the BEST meal I have in a long time.  The service was exceptional, the food was wonderful. The tabe side salad service and the chocolate dipped strawberry & fig desert was perfect. The prices were a little high, however the dishes came with salad, sorbet, small sides, main course and petit fours. The atmosphere reminded my parents of the old days ~ cozy & quaint, the only thing missing was the "Rat Pack". I must say, we were so pleased to find this gem in a downtown casino restaurant. The only other thing I would say is make reservations!   I am so glad I found Hugo's Cellar on Yelp!

I2akpWYHdiCKu83RC9idDw.text: If you found the place, you found one of the three reasons to be at the 4 Queens.  The other two: reasonable table games and Chicago Brewing.  Judging by the number of reviews, Hugo's is not a hidden location any longer.  Even though reservations are not required, it is helpful to ensure you get a table during the peak dining hours.  What are those in Vegas?  Between now and then...  There have been times that we messed up and didn't call ahead, and we waited.  Then, other times, we were seated right away.  It's Vegas and all about the gamble, right?  The rose upon entry for the ladies is such a nice feature.  Late in the evening when you walk around downtown, it's interesting to count how many roses there are floating around.  That Hugo guy must have been a huge romantic!  Probably has a lot of children as well.  (wink wink)  The food at Hugo's has yet to disappoint.  From the salad cart where you get to pick what goes into your salad, to the entree's served fresh and hot, to the complimentary chocolate-covered fruit.  All of this luxury, and a wine list to make any oenophile happy with the varied choices.  Stuck on which wine to choose? Help is what the sommelier loves to offer.  They are easy to spot because they have the gold medal hanging from their neck.  Just kidding, it's a tastevin used to sample before your first taste to ensure the wine is proper to be served.  Another nice touch.  For mixed drink fans, the bar makes solid drinks, not shy on flavor or punch.  This is a place where it is perfect to dress to impress.  One of the nicest restaurants in town, you want to look sharp.  We just wish they would bring back the original Hugo's chicken.

X6kohZ_YnuOa1sN7tE5iBg.text: I heard about Hugo's Cellar through an email from TripAdvisor titled "15 hidden gems" which described attractions/restaurants around the world that weren't well known, but worth a visit. After a little more research I discovered that reviews on Hugo's were stellar. However, I can't say that I completely agree. To start, Hugo's is definitely "hidden" as it is tucked away under the Four Queens Casino in Old Las Vegas. (Old Las Vegas is worth the trip if you haven't been but expect a $30 can ride from the "strip")  Walking down the stairs into the restaurant definitely transforms you into a different world away from the crowd, noise and hustle of Vegas. There was no blaring music or flashing lights to disturb your meal. The cellar-like atmosphere with brick walls and dim lighting created a comfortable dining atmosphere. The well dressed clientele was a plus too - a very civilized meal compared to many Vegas restaurants which are sprinkled with the occasional obnoxious dinner guests. The service was some of the best I received in Vegas: friendly, attentive and knowledgable staff not just looking for an "up-sell". Thesommelier ,in particular, recommended a wine that wasn't on the menu, but exactly what we were looking and reasonably priced.  Based on the atmosphere and service, Hugo's Cellar is absolutely a hidden gem in Las Vegas. The food, however, was nothing to brag about. I had pretty high expectations based on some of the reviews I read.  We started with the escargot which was overpowered by garlic and topped with a random puff pastry - quite tasty if you're a garlic fan but disappointing for those who actually enjoy escargot. It's basically escargot for those whole don't actually like the taste. Next was the famed "table-side salad". A novelty idea that brought fun and personalization to the meal, but honestly was limp romaine lettuce with mediocre toppings. More exotic lettuce choices would have been a plus. The tomatoes were mushy and lacked much flavor. I was a big fan of the pine nuts though! Fresher ingredients are necessary all around. For the main course we shared the stuffed jumbo shrimp and the Tournedos Hugo (two five oz filets topped with foie gras and artichoke hearts). The shrimp were small (far from jumbo) and dry. The stuffing was bland and was overpowered by breadcrumb instead of crab that the menu boasted. The filets were mediocre. The fois gras was something you'd find in a can and I didn't see any artichoke hearts on the plate. I figured this dish would be extra special since it bears the restaurant's name; guess not. A free dessert of chocolate covered strawberries, figs as apricots with fresh whipped cream was included. We also tried the creme brulee which was just average. Bottom line: if you're in the area and looking to escape the Vegas atmosphere for a few hours you should consider trying out Hugo's Cellar (but not if you're on a budget). Otherwise it is not worth the trip to Old Las Vegas.

llb_US-ySKPK830rKnpxMg.text: Hugo's Cellar has had very nice food for years. The decor hasn't changed the past 15 years in cluding Victor. It's great he looks the same but the Cellar needs a facelift.  That is why 2 stars.Dining should be an experience, not eat and run. With so many new places that make Hugo's Cellar look like a old Denny's. I understand the food is inexpensive for all you get, salad, main dish, starch and vegetable, bread basket, chocolate covered strawberries and coffee for one price. If you live in LV ok, but if your in Vegas for a dining experience try Wolfgang Punk -The Cut it's at the Palazzo . Comme-CA at the Cosmopolitan or Jean Georges Steakhouse at Aria. They are beautiful. The Fluers at Caesars is so beautiful you leave relaxed and happy.

0ePm4n_TFxERgmONXYMpag.text: Soo Very Impressed with this place! Perfect pick for our Anniversary Dinner! Five star service - In ALL Categories!!!! Upon arrival, all females are handed a beautiful long stem rose, then guided inside the restaurant which had an darker intimate/romantic setting. We then were presented with 2 types of bread, heart-shaped crackers and rose-shaped butter. We picked an appetizer, entrees (prime rib and NY strip) which included a custom made salad, our main entree and complimentary dessert (2 choc covered strawberry, 2 white choc fig and 2 choc dipped apricot). We were given this cute little raspberry ice cream cone to clean our palette before our main course. In additional to this, we received a chocolate molten cake a la mode with gorgeous artistic writing that said "Happy Anniversary". I could go on and on! Don't forget to check out the booth where Frank Sinatra used to hang out. If it's good enough for him, it's good enough for all of us!  HIDDEN freakin GEM!!!!! Please make sure to check out my photos! Goooo already!!! *drool*

drSoU7Yjuy6d5h1UsEGm3Q.text: Nice touch to give all the ladies a rose as soon as you walk in. The place is one if the first steak house and its got the rustic ambiance. The plates are about $48 and up but the serving is big & comes with salad.. Served table side. The servers are first class. I split my meal with my friend, we ordered a 16 oz ny steak and all of my other friends did the same. They charged us all extra fr the salad because we did not explain that we split that too, although they split the steak automatically. They removed it from the bill though so its all good.  The place is cozy but the price is quite high, I've been to other steakhouses that are around the same price but the ambiance is better & they do more table side services plus it comes with more stuff. Overall, the steak was good.. I ordered the NY steak.

SmqsCjz5i_KuMpvKehVUOg.text: This was a bit of a surprise. Leading into the restaurant is rather sketch. The parking garage felt much like parking to enter skid row so we were nervous about what to expect upon exiting the car. Upon entering the restaurant itself, we were pleasantly surprised. The service was absolutely excellent. The food was bland and tasted as if it catered to a much older diabetic crowd. All in all it was a great dinner.

wwJXdtqd3WIViGjrIVRDdA.text: This place is the BOMB!!  The gal next to me on the flight told me about this hidden gem!  I promptly made reservations for Friday night at 9 PM, which is a bit late to eat dinner, but are we glad we went!!  A rose is presented to each lady upon entering the restaurant.  Classy!  The service is awesome, the table side salad is enough for a whole meal and all the sides go with the entree--no paying extra for them.  The bread basket is divine too.  Our steaks were amazing as well.  PLUS, you get a free dessert which no one had room to eat but we did anyway!!!  This is THE place to eat in Old Vegas located in the 4 Queens Hotel/casino. DO NOT miss this restaurant!!!!

lI6HC761Kt-pibWwdBi1bA.text: This grand dame of Vegas has lost her way around the kitchen.    Unfortunately, for years now, they have not served the original Chicken Hugo with pine nuts.  Remaining entrees have so much msg, we can no longer safely eat there. Our produce was not first quality.  Tasteless tomatoes in salad, and the topping on broiled tomato lacked salt of any kind.   Filet was tender but they need to offer a smaller portion.   The  dish now called Chicken Hugo is a sad replacement seemingly  full of asthma inducing msg.  We also miss the original large flat crackers.    We are so sad because we love the staff and impeccable service.  It has always been our favorite restaurant in the world. Alas, no longer.

77KdWlSOlN0kKOMWvd9dag.text: We had a wonderful romantic dinner at Hugo's.  The service was perfect.  We both ordered the ribeye steak with red potatoes.  First they served bread and filtered water.  We also ordered coffee.  It had good bold flavor.  The bread was fine.  Next they served salads made to order. Extremely tasty with shrimp, avocado and pepper ranch dressing.  The steak was good but not excellent as the beef was Angus and not prime.  After dinner they served a small dessert tray.  All things considered, a fine value at $50.

SCkU0Tj-_QZRoR4mmWrRVg.text: Best steakhouse of all time. Loved it! Great food and service. Brings you back in time. You can picture Dean Martin and Frank Sinatra eating here! Hugo's is my favorite restaurant, hands down.

cjsjOwmnq28iXKso1gO7Sg.text: The food is great here, I come here every time  I get to Las Vegas, I would go for the prime rib, it is very flavorful. The reason I am rating them a 3 is because I went there yesterday at 930 pm for dessert and was told they just don't sell desserts. It was 930 at night, the restaurant was not that busy on a Sunday, so I took my business to another restaurant. All the other times the service has been extremely good!

H33pfsViWm-pKyrBMPo5Bw.text: Wonderful old time service and food. Vintage Vegas dining experience.   Table side salad was great. Overall just a great dinner and experience.

L5mxe0wBXgrpg3BQnCrEqQ.text: I can't tell you how disappointed I am that I have to give Hugo's Cellar only 3 stars.. I had heard such great things, I'd read so many of the raving reviews and I just couldn't wait to go there. The bf and I went last night for a belated Valentine's dinner.  I wasn't expecting it to be difficult to make a reservation, but the earliest seating they had was at 9:00 pm. That's later than I like to eat dinner, but hey, we were willing to for the experience. Upon arrival I received a long stem red rose and there was a vase on the table to hold it. We were seated in the back of the restaurant, passing several booths and intimate looking tables, many of which were open.  The menu looked amazing! We really struggled to decide what to order. We asked the market price on the 2 Broiled Alaskan Lobster Tails ($89), as well as the lb. of Alaskan King Crab legs ($110 or $120 - I can't recall). We decided to share the lobster tails as well as Filet de Boeuf - Atlantis (Ten ounce filet wrapped with bacon; served with lump crab and bearnaise sauce) ($62). Up to this point everything is good, the atmosphere, the service, etc.  The table side salad arrived and I ordered Caesar dressing, tomatoes, egg crumbles, artichoke hearts and hearts of palm, pine nuts, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper. It looked amazing! And the taste? Fishy. I didn't get it. I didn't add the shrimp. Maybe they use anchovies in their dressing, but I typically like that. For whatever reason my salad tasted fishy. I ate most all of it anyway.  They seated a party of 6 adults directly behind us, and a party of 6 or 7 young women directly behind them. What started out as a nice romantic evening turned in to loud conversation and boisterous laughter from the surrounding tables. Then when their salad service arrived the waiter was talking louder than everyone trying to take the orders. We sat and ate and complained about the noise, but there was nothing we could do.  When our meals arrived they looked so delicious! They removed the tails from the shell foe us and brought heated butter. The first few bites of the filet were good, but not very tender like you would expect filet to be. I kept finding bites of fat from the bacon that surrounded it. By the time we got to see the center of the steak it was obvious it was not properly cooked. We ordered medium, and not only was the center bright red but we both had bloody plates. We didn't send it back but we should have. We didn't finish the filet but we brought it home for leftovers. The lobster was actually pretty good. It was cooked perfectly, not at all rubbery. The mashed potatoes were delicious, but the asparagus was a let down.  They asked us if we wanted coffee after dinner, but didn't ask if we wanted dessert. I didn't, but I thought it was a little rude that they didn't offer. Instead they did bring out our plate of chocolate covered strawberries, apricots and figs. The strawberry I had was good, the bf said his had little flavor.  All in all, it wasn't the hyped up experience we were expecting. The food was meh...  and not properly cooked. The service was good, but the atmosphere was ruined from the noise. With tax and tip it was basically a $200 dinner. For that price I'll go elsewhere next time.

vCsP3eqRiHkt4ZaQs3K1uQ.text: This is a great place to eat at when celebrating a special occasion.  They have a big menu that covers the gambit of high end dishes.  I love steak but I go a little more exotic here with the rack of lamb or sea bass.  The best part of the meal is the table side service like the salad cart and dessert flambe that are fun to watch and harken back to the classic high end dinning experience.  They also have a sommelier which was kind of cool to see him at the tables tasting wine with his giant medallion hanging off his neck like flavor flav.

umIbFYX6JYMgVEgKMtOVDg.text: My husband and I went to Hugo's last night for our anniversary dinner and it was phenomenal! From the moment we stepped into the restaurant to when we left, we received top notch service. The food, wine, and ambience made our evening so special. A shout out to Dean, who made the best dirty martini I've ever had! Thanks to everyone at Hugo's Cellar! We will be back!

6WObMuxKEOv9Cj0jmtXEPQ.text: Over priced Dive.  Disappointing on every level.  If I'm going to spend $75 a plate, it needs to be better than this.  Flavorless steak, small portions and wait staff was attentive, but rude and impatient.  Decor is uninspiring and dated.  I know it's supposed to feel like a cellar, but we were seated in a corner next to the fire exit. Left feeling ripped off and still hungry.

1fymj2rCGbj5ezu-A7eyzQ.text: Absolutely the best meal I've ever had!  They make your salad tableside, and the staff are there to pamper you.   It's a bit pricy,  but well worth it!

PWszYMj0_H_TX_8vJELaOg.text: This was recommended to us for a celebration dinner. Totally on point! Even without telling the staff, Diego, Eric and Gene took excellent care of us and made us feel like we were the only ones in the restaurant. Without overwhelming us, their attentiveness was comparable to places where entrees cost twice as much. The food was phenomenal, from the salad made tableside to the palate cleansing sorbet to our entree to our fruit plate. Even skipping dessert, I'm truly glad I wore my stretchy pants. We will definitely return the next time we are in Las Vegas.

eJy7uJu3BAuR5g9gUZz4eA.text: This place was great. We walked in w/ no reservation, and w/out a wait we were seated right away. As soon as we were seated we had a total of 3 gentlemen help us from beginning to end. The food was great, I feel they gave us generous portions PLUS some.  The place is a little dated, but it gave that old school Vegas type of feel. I totally recommend when coming to Old Vegas.

5KKvXtUZuo6TxeBS4ETWFA.text: We tried this place last night because it had come highly recommended. We enjoyed it, but we probably won't be going back. They greeted every woman with a rose upon check in. It was a nice touch. I got a glass of Cabernet that was very good (it was more expensive than their house red). For appetizers we got shrimp, escargot and crab cakes. The shrimp and escargot were great. The crab cakes weren't good at all. Very little crab and way too much bread crumbs.  The salad was great, but the guy who made it table side was even better. One of the high lights of the evening for sure.  For dinner we got the filet and a lobster. The filet was good but they were either a little skimpy on the sides or using too large of plates. The lobster was over cooked. For dessert we stuck with the chocolate dipped strawberries and they were nice. Overall it was nice evening.

YQqv8e9Meea5svRwbEyiNA.text: Customer service was great. They gave my lady a rose when we arrived. Ambience was nice as I expected for an old school traditional steak house. The table prepared salad was good. The bad news is I ordered a rib eye that was sub par for a fairly expensive ($56) steak. The steak didn't look appealing and the taste was bland. It was not a top quality meat. I may go back to try their sizzling combo appetizer. The people sitting next to ordered it and it looked and smelled good.

v-BF5KOpfcuAEC-LN04ZJg.text: I've been to a lot of Steak houses with history and charm and a great steak. The service here was by far the most excellent and the food and wine was outstanding. We loved Hugo's! Go Here!

g8tlrH1hUVKueYUBsmQH7g.text: Our favorite place for 39 years has slipped to a level that forces me to write this review and say stay away!!  We took friends there and the food was unremarkable. In fact, both my wife and our friend were sick the next day from the crab (or the butter).  When my friend called to speak with a manager the next day she got the runaround and then the brush off..."oh, did you go to the hospital? You will have to make your complaint to our security department".  I should add that some of the service was a s good as ever (cocktails and salad) but our waiter was not good and got a number of things wrong.  Sad, sad sad but based upon the experience and the "who gives a s**t attitude of the manager we won't be back.

Fn2SzcUtD5Ihk8Nw2KrnyA.text: Had our team dinner here (11 people).  I had been coming here since the 1970s so I knew that the 7 ladies in our party would enjoy the special treatment.  The dining experience us second to none here in Vegas.  The table side made to order salads are fantastic.  The palette cleansing sorbet was link dessert before our entree.  I ordered the cellar cut prime rib.  Since it was a team dinner, we are on a strict budget.  With the chocolate covered fruit topping off the meal, we were able to stay under budget.  We all ordered a cocktail, so the experience was complete.  I told my wife back home that my work group was coming here, and she was jealous.  Not to worry, I made reservations next month when we're here to see John Fogerty perform to bring her here so she can enjoy the experience.

0gTB1-FkdVQDJ23uX0A-Kg.text: I was so surprised when we entered the restaurant on Friday June 1st. I would have never guessed it was completely different from the casino. Very nice ambiance & everyone so friendly. We went to celebrate my Mom's 75th Birthday & my aunt went with us.  The food was very delicious & a generous amount. Our waiter & server were very attentive.  When we were leaving most of the other waiters greeted us.  When we were leaving the hostesses  agreed to take a picture of us, he was so friendly & funny. I would go again and take my husband. Thanks for a memorable & delicious evening.  My mom really enjoyed it, she really loved her rose, dinner (surf n turf) & desert.  Thank you

k8xV5NHNi3hCWp-TgIVDKA.text: Wow. What an experience! They don't make places like this anymore. I felt like we were transported back to the 1950s in a jet-setting rat pack dinner party. The service is impeccable. Truly flawless. The food was top-notch. Can't find fault in it. Will definitely return, as long as my husband is paying!

RfEHDNp4lFYYgviAi0kyvQ.text: The best restaurant for couples wanting to have a  romantic dinner. This is the place you take your sweetheart for her birthday, Valentine's Day, your anniversary or just to celebrate something special. First class service all around with an incredible menu and strong drinks. Every woman gets a fresh red rose when she arrives. The lighting is dim and romantic. Even the butter is hand carved in the shape of a rose! This place is a classy, charming and authentic old Vegas gem. Take her there if you really love her - she won't forget it.

YbcvoaIX-XBK-Idv3C9-Qg.text: My friend and I had dinner here 8.29.18.  I had heard about Hugo's from a co-worker's wife, so I decided to give this steakhouse a try.  Located inside Four Queens, this is a hidden little gem of a restaurant.  It is definitely and old school steakhouse.  Dimly light with low ceilings; you can just imagine the type of business dealings that went on back in the day.  The meal we had was our typical standard fare.  We shared the crab cakes and had a wonder table side salad prepared customized to our liking-nice touch.  The entrees were presented well and although they took a lot of time, I will cut them some slack, because it was busy.  I had the filet and my friend had the lobster tail.  My filet was a little under cooked but not so much as to have it re-fired.  It wasn't the tastiest filet I ever had, so for me, it was a miss.  The lobster tail was cooked to perfection and tasted great.  The sides were good as well.  The service was spot on-even on a busy night.  Would I go again?  I suppose.  I think the whole rose thing is a nice touch given the occasion.

CMMR66TG4lcew_Reea36jg.text: Went for dinner here a couple nights ago.  Wife and I shared a seafood on ice appetizer, a 16 oz NY steak, and 2 soft drinks.  Service was great and the staff very attentive.  Food quality was good to very good.  That said, our total (including tip) came out to $190.  In our opinion, it's a bit pricy for what we got considering we split our main entree.   We're glad we tried Hugo's as we heard great reviews of this steakhouse, but we'll be exploring other options in the future.

GyMFskCwi4YnGuWSN3P6AQ.text: We went back tonight and had a wonderful evening.  The staff is wonderful and the food is divine.  We had an absolutely amazing meal.  My husband had the Beef Wellington and I the filet and shrimp.  I highly recommend Hugo's Cellar for a date night or special occasion.

Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry chicken

eYD2aHuRpsRbX__apYn7Uw.text: Wow. I don't even know where to begin.  When my grandparents would tell me about Vegas, they would boast about fancy dinners, high-class gambling and shows that would amaze you beyond your stay. Well, this place kinda confirmed that.  If you're looking to impress that one person, who just lights up for the little things in life, take them here.

9i2-OSfz4MssdDNZcXNtrg.text: If I could give this restaurant 10 stars I would.  Definitely one of the top meals I've ever had.  We arrived early for a birthday celebration and ordered a bottle of wine with the sommelier.  He removed the cork and poured a small taste in the cup around his neck.  Now I've seen hundreds of somms with the adornment here in Vegas and this was the first time I'd ever seen it used so it was charming that he really made the experience.  While chatting with him we found out he'd been at Hugo's for 32 years serving some of the original Rat Pack and famous Vegas gangsters.  Definitely a treat of some old Vegas charm.  When our party arrived and we were seated, we had nothing but the best and most attentive service.  Our waiter Ahmad was right there for any request we had and made some wonderful suggestions.  With 9 of us and each trying something different we tasted a large portion of the menu and everyone raved about the food.  The butter, while very pretty in it's rose shape was THE BEST butter I've ever tasted and the sweet heart shaped crackers were a lovely touch.  This would be the perfect date night for a romantic dinner but were also great for a crowd and were on top of our large group.  When looking at the pictures on here I didn't seen the hot stone appetizer but it's a definite must try.  We even ordered a 2nd for the table because it was such a hit.  I had the lobster which was perfectly prepared and was delicious.  From presentation of the food, the small details like the sorbet and roses for the ladies they excelled at every point.  Honestly I can't say which was better, the food or the service and experience.  I've been raving since we left that it's the best kept secret in Vegas.

9I0bBA0ioQTykjsjQMzWAw.text: Friendly service and solid food. Entrees include table side salad and a dessert which makes your meal a better value. The salad could have been fresher. The stuffed mushrooms are great but for seventeen dollars you expect more then three of them. The steak was ok for the price. Lamb was also ok. Excellent martinis.  The rose for the lady was a nice touch. I would have gave this place a four star review but had to deduct one star for the location. The hotel it is in attracts the lowest class population.

ja-OnXF-U4oKDP64ig-YRQ.text: My husband and I have had our anniversary dinner every year in December at Hugo's. I love the atmosphere and John the wine Somali is amazing. Out anniversary falls during the National Finals Rodeo so they are always busy but we have never had a bad meal until this past December. The new owners changed the menu and for what the meal costs it was definitely a let down. The Brussels sprouts were undercooked, might as well been served raw. The potatoes were not real potatoes which is what I would expect at this kind of restaurant. We ordered a shrimp cocktail as an appetizer and since it only comes with three the waiter told us he would "throw another one in" which we assumed at no charge. WRONG, they charged us an edition all $7! After 23 years of anniversary dinners, this one was disappointing and certainly makes me rethink where we will go next December.

VqNwcR48DWnaBf7HDbgdRw.text: I really wanted to like this place more than a 3-star rating, it has an amazing "Old Vegas" ambiance. There were three aspects of the visit that were lacking for me: The service and attentiveness of our waiter(s), the quality of the food for the price and their inability to be have the wait staff sing happy birthday to my brother (his 60th birthday, btw).   It took our water a long time to approach when we were first seated.  He took part of our drink order, but then had to call over the wine steward because my wife wasn't sure which sparking wine she wanted.  We had been seated for 30 minutes before we had our drinks. By this time we had killed our first basket of bread.  It took three requests to three different people to get a second basket, which ultimately came as we were finishing our entrees.  We had been seated for almost an hour before the salad process even started. Salad was good, but not great.  No bacon bits? My rib-eye steak was good, but not on the same level as Ruth's Chris, even though more expensive.  My wife and sister in law ordered the "add on" Crab Legs as a compliment to the steaks ordered by myself and my brother.  The crab was almost flavorless.  The add-on portion of the crab was $61.00 per plate, plus a $27.95 "split plate fee" for a salad and overcooked veggies.  We had told both the host and the waiter that we were celebrating my brother's 60th birthday.  As we were at the restaurant for over a 2 hour period, several other guests had the collective waitstaff acknowledge their birthdays with song and a candle lit dessert.  Our waiter either forgot or didn't care to extend the same courtesy to my brother.  When we reminded him after the strawberries had been served, he returned with a dessert and a candle which he lit and then vanished.  Not what we were hoping for.   Overall, I felt like the waitstaff ignored us.  The tables around us seemed like they got their drinks, salads and entrees much quicker and had many more check-ins than we did.  Maybe this is an issue of locals vs. out-of-towners, meaning the staff could tell that we were tourists and didn't have to worry about repeat business.   With all of the fantastic restaurants in Vegas, I would be reluctant to return to Hugo's Cellar and spend another $424

EDStWw8zmTM2z1FSYyLFeQ.text: Hugo's Cellar came highly recommended by a couple of very good friends. So when the opportunity arose to finally experience it, we jumped at it!   Located in the basement level of the Four Queens Casino downtown, you would never imagine such a place would be found here!  Items Ordered:  - New York Strip Steak 16 oz. (medium) ($58) (included: table side salad, garlic mashed potatoes, vegetables, and chocolate dipped strawberries) - Diet Coke ($3) - Three Layer Cake ($7)  New York Strip Steak, 16 oz. (5/5) Steak was very thick and juicy and cooked to perfection! Absolutely delectable!  The garlic mashed potatoes (4/5) did not disappoint as well. I just wish the portion size was a tad bit greater, but still, they were very good!  The table side salad (4/5) was a real treat in itself! I opted for the Caesar dressing with some shrimp, croutons, parmesan, and tomatoes. Very tasty and great portion size! Not a tiny salad by any means!  Chocolate dipped strawberries (5/5) were a great treat after the main course! Strawberries were HUGE! I could have had a couple more of these!  - Three layer cake (4/5) was a very satisfying way to complete the meal. Not too sweet, but very delicious! Also was the perfect portion size, as I was stuffed after the main course!  Service (5/5)  Absolutely charming and attentive service! Some of the staff have fantastic stories about some famous people who have dined here in the 70's and 80's! It just adds to that classic, old school vibe that I absolutely love!  My only complaint was with how the deserts were presented. I was led to believe that the desert was part of the main entree due to the fact that the waiter approached us and just told us to pick one. Every other steakhouse I've been to will ask if you wish to have desert before asking you to just "choose" one. I was so stuffed by the awesome steak and potatoes that I probably would not have had desert otherwise. It's not  huge thing, but I didn't care for that. (minus 1/2 star)  Ambiance (4/5) Classic, old school feel to the place. All of the waitstaff were in tuxedos. The room was tastefully decorated. Ladies were given long stemmed roses. Great little touches led to a fantastic atmosphere!  This was a great experience and I will be sure to recommend Hugo's Cellar to others as it was recommended to me!  4.5 stars!

Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 oz NY Strip
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bread bowl

KTFj6b7jI3SeLRxafghbpg.text: OUTSTANDING!!   Located in the Four Queens Casino, it reminds you about the glamour of how Las Vegas used to be. Every staff member is dressed in 3 piece suits, polished and friendly. They give every lady a single rose upon entry. The decor is old school Vegas with the brick work and stained glass light fixtures. It's dark and it's the perfect spot to have an intimate dinner date. My BF made reservations for my birthday so we were seated right away.   The dinner starts with a delicious bread basket and drinks. My vodka martini was nice and strong and the left over drink was served over ice. The amount of drink they gave me was close to 3 glasses full. A+ for me!!!  Next, someone comes to your table with the salad cart full of options. Toppings included tomatoes, onions, eggs, croutons, mushrooms, artichokes, etc. Their Cesar dressing was amazing!! They make the dressing fresh so you can really taste the anchovies and all the other spices. My only gripe was the server poured waaaaay too much dressing over my salad. After finishing the salads, they serve you a raspberry sorbet to cleanse your palate for your main course.   I ordered the seafood trio which came with a jumbo lump crab cake, Chilean sea bass and grilled shrimp. The crab cake was full of crab meat and flavorful. The sea bass was so flaky and moist. The shrimp was lackluster compared to the other two and a tad bit over cooked. My BF ordered the rib eye medium rare. Perfection!! The steak was tender and cut like butter. Super juicy!   Your dinner comes with a light dessert consisting of two chocolate covered strawberries, figs and apricots served with fresh whipped cream. The whipped cream was the best part! I could have licked the bowl, but I held back. Lol! Of course they do offer more decadent desserts on their menu. As a bonus, our server Oscar brought me a chocolate lava cake for my birthday!   Thank you to the staff of Hugo's Cellar for making my birthday special. This will definitely be a spot to visit again!!

ONNnCk_AZtqZ69upeH8mVA.text: My husband and I went here for our anniversary and we were blown away by Hugo's. The service was impeccable. The food was incredible, the place is top notch.   When you go into the Four Queens you actually go down to a cellar of sorts. Once inside you are given a red rose which is very nice, you won't have that experience anywhere else. The dining room is quite spacious and the lighting is perfect, it sets the perfect ambiance.    There is honestly no need to order an appetizer prior to your main course they make a tableside salad that is very filling. Prior to dinner, you are given sorbet to cleanse your palate.  For dinner, we had the prime rib which was cooked perfectly and the Chilean Sea Bass both were absolutely delicious. After dinner, we received a molten chocolate lava cake which was to die for and an assortment of fruits.   We look forward to making Hugo's a tradition for whenever we are in Vegas.

mSH76OibvfV_E8TuRNMeRQ.text: I've been going to Las Vegas since I was 18 in the mid-1980's. I've been lucky enough to have friends and family out there to suggest many things. Between that and my adventurous spirit, I've been to & experienced great places\events. Was pleasantly surprised when my aunt & uncle (originally from NJ) took us here. Hugo's is in the older, downtown section near Fremont. In the basement of the Four Queens Hotel & Casino. it's been there over 30 years and is TRUE OLD SCHOOL dining. Waiters in tuxedos, Sommelier available.  Table side service : Salad (cart) prepared as you tell them what you want in it. certain entrees like fish flambeed, desserts too..... Professionally made cocktails. Great selection of spirits. Wine Spectator Award of Excellence since 1993. Best of Las Vegas Reader's Choice since 1991.  If there is just 1 "hole in the wall", top spot you try next...this is it. romantic for dates & special occasions (all ladies get a fresh rose on entrance) Just as good for a group of guys or gals who know they are getting a great meal\service.  Look, there are a TON of places to get a good meal in Vegas..from buffets to casual , to celebrity chef. Heck you can get a $5,000 burger in Vegas. BUT if you're a foodie, you MUST try Hugo's and you'll be back. Just make reservations!  THE FOOD-- Complimentary bread basket has a wide array of artisanal breads including crackers shaped like hearts and the butter in the form of a rose. Most meals comes with a salad prepared from a cart with all types of toppings or you can order it as an app...Crisp romaine lettuce, WITH CHOICES OF  peeled tomato wedges, marinated artichokes,hearts of palm, sliced mushrooms, blue cheese crumbles, toasted croutons,  roasted pine nuts, chopped eggs, red onions and bay shrimp, anchovies, etc etc... Our selection of dressings: Caesar, creamy pepper or honey-orange-walnut vinaigrette....DELISH There are plenty of apps and entrees "FOR TWO", that add to the romantic element. APPS--- -Escargot en Croute-- Six plump Escargots sauteed in shallots, garlic, burgundy wine, fine herbs with a puff pastry topping was top notch. -Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes-- Pan-fried jumbo lump crab cakes with citrus chili aioli was very good..more crab than filler that's for sure.... ENTREES--- Although considered a steak house, it has so much more............. -Hugo's Chicken-- Breast of chicken stuffed with sun-dried tomato pesto; served with roasted garlic sauce. -Duckling Anise Flambe-- Duck roasted with licorice spices and herbs; flambeed table-side. usually only salmon and  Chilean sea bass is on the menu. Each offered in 4 great styles. 1-Grilled au Naturel with herb butter. 2-Grilled New England style with seasoned bread crumbs. 3-Pan-seared with Sauce Nantua (on a bed of crab meat topped with delicate shrimp sauce). or 4-En Papillote served with shallots, white wine, julienne carrots, leeks, mushrooms and butter. We had the 3rd, which was Fantastic! There is a dish for 2 for $175 that sounded like a no -brainer: *The Cellars Champion Chateaubriand and Lobster for Two-- Fourteen ounce roasted Filet with two broiled Lobster Tails ...... (save room for )Desserts-- Bananas Foster, Cherries Jubilee, cakes, freuit to dip in chocolate sauce were all great.  Just a great time

rmi5eU09_9MKCY10F0sTOw.text: My wife and I dine here every time we visit Las Vegas, average twice a year for last 6 years. It's always been fantastic until last night. What a disappointment. Ordered our favorite, veal scallopini Marsala. The veal cutlets were way too thick for scallopini and had a soggy bread crumb coating some of which had a burned taste and the Marsala sauce was tasteless. Totally different preparation than in the past and just wrong for $69.00.

SaCgQZmVN3TVnUkaJ2CIEA.text: Tried this place for its high stars, and was not disappointed.   I had the rib eye and wifie the filet. Both were of high quality and well prepared. Next time I will go for the filet myself as it appeared to be better. I like my steaks thick and the rib eye was large and thinner.    The accompaniments asparagus carrots and red skins were tasty as was wifeys wild rice. Included desert of chocolate flavored fruit along with REAL whipped cream hit the spot.  Also had real butter with the breads   One table over had the banana foster table side show and it was inviting. We would of done the same but were well filled and a standard desert is included with any entree as is the salad.   Drinks were martinis and here was  really surprised as it actually 2 1/2 martinis. They serve with a chilled crafte  and it refilled the glass  1 1/2 times. Sort of put the stops on wine with dinner.   Service was a 5 star establishment with a well intending staff. Many have been here for a decade or more. Our main waiter has been here for 29 years.   Down side is no view as it is actually a cellar.   Will definitely return.

w12KUrjxw38MBksV3e8Oqw.text: The best place to eat if you're celebrating or just want a quality dinner experience. Staff are exceptional, professional and warm, service is prompt, the atmosphere is beautiful, with low ceilings, brick, roses, candlelight. It feels like you are dining in a world class wine cellar.   Food: it was so hard to pick from the menu as ALL the entrees sounded amazing. We had a bacon wrapped medallion, with shrimp, vegetables and potatoes. The meat was tender and juicy, DELICIOUS. If you are looking for the best steakhouse on Fremont, you just found it!!

_d3uhQB7znJljckdAuFmfA.text: This restaurant came highly recommended and it lived up to its expectations. From the moment we arrived we were kindly welcomed and I was given a rose which they wrapped up before we left. The salad was included and prepared tableside. The service was impeccable. I ordered the scallops and my husband ordered the duck and both selections were delicious. To end the meal were chocolate dipped strawberries and we were treated to a special dessert for our anniversary in addition to a very thoughtful card signed by the wonderful staff. We loved the whole experience and will definitely return on our next trip to Las Vegas.

nKBPe6y3DehVpborqgKGPA.text: My niece and I ate here for the first time earlier this week. We had visited a museum and were looking for a steakhouse for an early dinner. She looked online and found this one, so we headed downtown. We didn't know exactly where it was located, so we parked in the D parking lot. But it's in the Four Queens, so if you want your parking validated, make sure you park in the right lot. We had an amazing experience, from the host who gave us beautiful long stemmed roses, to the customized salads, the delicious dinners (scallops and filet mignon), and the desserts. I've attached some pics. It's a pricey restaurant for a special occasion, but it's well worth it!

ltduNOUVMyd5BXJQbMhyQQ.text: Quick stop in Vegas , Hugo's was recommended by a co worker.... All I can say is wow wow wow !! Old school awesome from the moment we stepped down the unassuming stairs to the roses handed to my 2 accompanying ladies. Staff was impeccable , filets were mouth watering melt in your mouth perfect and the dessert I highly recommend is the Bananas foster. There aren't many classy places like this left anymore and Hugo's takes you back to a time when people cared and took prides in what they do..... Tip of the hat to the staff at Hugo's

gpQPV6BkSsyZHLahL5DJFw.text: We had the most amazing evening at Hugo's Cellar! What a special treat...from the red rose to dessert. The tableside salad, steaks, wine, and chocolate covered strawberries were all outstanding. The service most excellent. I'll remember this evening for a long time!

IQUHKXAbCXZd93GWo-pUXg.text: Had a most wonderful dinner two nights ago.  The tone is set from the time you make a reservation to the time you finish your meal.  I am very particular when dining out and Hugo's more than met my expectations; i.e. from the perfect table too the very attentive staff, and great meal.  My most favorite restaurant in Vegas because I feel it is a great value for the money.  My dinner date was very impressed; as this was her first time dining here.  Many thanks for such a great night.

yw6Xtm5UoNLQjZTKcmv3Eg.text: Happened by this place on a whim. The entrance is a little difficult to spot but that's the charm. My wife was given a long stem(4 feet) rose. We were well dressed because we enjoy going out on the town in style. The staff was impeccable dressed and very welcoming. We didn't have reservations, they accommodated us anyways. After looking over the menu I chose the Beef Wellington. The initial course was a fresh bread basket. Then my wife's Lobster Bisque came out. There was a table side salad bar that the staff carted to your side and mixed together before you. After that we were given a gelato palate cleanser before our main course. The Beef Wellington was perfect. Crust was flaky and well cooked the fillet was a perfect rare steak. I was able to take a portion off with my fork. This kind of meal is what makes Vegas a destination city.

yELxNaLec10X5dE-uT9cDA.text: Everything was perfect, Again. The lobster bisque and steaks are the best anywhere. Everytime i go to Vegas, I eat at Hugo's Cellar. The Food is always perfect and the staff is the best there is. If i could give them 10 stars, I would.

sIO6nqSfhk86gpPUTnbmBA.text: Don't need to repeat the other reviews but Hugo's rocks. Martinis were generous, bread was cheesy goodness, rib eye steak was delicious and table made salad was off the charts. Wish I found Hugo's 20 years ago.

sGC3yFgzJCndfdnPfxSeFQ.text: This is a nice, fancy and romantic restaurant. I took my wife and father for some great steaks. They had a good cherry jubilee that is flambe table side as well as salad made table side. My wife received a rose while being seated which is a nice start. It's definitely expensive but expected for the type of food and environment. I would come again and recommend if looking for a romantic dinner in the Fremont street area.

7bMy7WqlxL_yRzc3caBIVA.text: Excellent fine dining! Loved all the attention and descriptions of the menu items. We had an entertaining evening.

oTjK0zeepVFPRET7vvywBg.text: If you want a romantic place to dine, do not come here!  Last night my husband and I came here to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We chose Hugo's Cellar because this restaurant was on many lists for romantic restaurants. It wasn't romantic at all.  It was nice to get a rose when we first walk in. We get to our table, and it's nothing close to romantic. It was VERY loud, mostly because there were 2 tables of guys squabbling back and forth, and NO background music whatsoever.   The professionalism of the wait staff was below par, the only professional waiter was the wine connoisseur. The waiters were disorganized and easily distracted.  The food was good, that was the extra two stars I gave, but it wasn't better than the food from any other reputable steakhouse.   You are better off going to another place and paying less per meat item, and it being just as good!

gvJAZ4kRn_3CWMmHNR4-Ng.text: Wow. It has been a while since a restaurant was a 5 star in my book. Everything was perfect. I arrived and was quickly seated. The host picked a rose that was perfect for me, meaning he didn't just grab any one.   The menu has plenty of upscale options. Unfortunately I do not like seafood and did not try their shrimp or lobster options. I opted for the filet minion. I ordered it medium well and it was perfect! My meal came with mashed potatoes and veggies which were perfect. The portions are much larger than I expected, and was able to take my meat home to enjoy for breakfast, as well as my husband's prime rib.   The service was above and beyond amazing . The waiters were attentive and had great conversations. Our wine specialist (forgot what he was called) suggested I wine which I did enjoy.   This place has history and the best service I have had in a long time. The only thing I didn't like was how some people did not have on business casual attire and still were allowed to dine. Some people had hats and tshirts while dining while my husband and I made a little more effort to uphold the business casual expectation.

T4Lu4w3YcPfGv744rh-Bfg.text: Hands down quality and quantity worth the money The food is super good and the restaurant is super romantic ask for Rashard or Richard. The women get a rose and chocolate covered strawberries this place is a must when I come back to Vegas thank you !

_Ocs-CpkEwj-20hon3lZKQ.text: We went old school tonight for our anniversary. The welcome is great, the ladies get a rose and the guys get the check, according to the maitre d... We had a martini, served in a separate flask and sitting in ice to start it off...very Frank and Dean!we were served the bread basket which was good. Now for more old school....tableside prepared Caesar salad, done very well and tasted great. My beloved chef wife was a bit miffed that the croutons weren't home made...lol. To clear the palate, they deliver a taste of sorbet....We each had the NY Strip, it was very good, comes with garlic mashed and asparagus...no exceptions and no other choices. The real hit was the service and Jamie an Mark were the best. Wonderful ambiance as well.  Finally for our special day came chocolate covered strawberries, figs, and a lava cake. Put all that together and we had a romantic evening

eM1Lr-JXpbkdUICYsIwwmQ.text: A very disappointing evening for a repeat guest of 30 years.  We arrived on time for our 6:30 reservation and I let the hostess know that the reservation was under Rick, Lee, or Leroy.   The hostess replied that no such reservation was made. I showed her the confirmation on my phone and she said it was not submitted, but a table would be available at 7:30, which we took.   Meanwhile,  i was contacted stating that I had not honored my reservation. I responded with a summary of the events. When we went back, I showed the hostess the email exchange. She said she didn't know I was the Rick on the reservation , as she had three other Ricks... Sure.  Best part of the meal: the salad cart.  The steaks were bland, only mashers and fingerling potatoes, no baked.  A bland assortment of mixed vegetables.    After our order,, the waiter all but disappeared. We were served by bussers and helpers. The waiter didn't even show to present the bill.   No apologies, nothing. A table in a corner with a waiter who served us at his convenience.  Not worth it.

NRK3RFkJRdw6dsAHA7anJQ.text: Always worth the trip. A rose for my lady, a good menu. I always forget how filling is the tableside salad. I order too much entree!  A memorable supper.

VxolVokZzgRO2AZJWo9myg.text: I keep putting a review every time I come here because I am always blown away by the fantastic food quality and customer service. This restaurant always does right for everyone and it's just fantastic. The greeters are always friendly and polite. The tables are comfortable and we got a booth this time which was really lovely. The service from the waiters and all of the staff is bar none. Respectful, friendly, professional. No matter how busy they get, they are always at the top of their game. We ordered the Chateau Briand and lobster tail for two which was amazing. It comes with two salads which are made at your table which were delicious. Really delicious bread and butter comes before that and we did not get an appetizer because we knew we would be getting a lot of food, which we did. After we were done eating, even if you don't order dessert, they bring a lovely tray of some chocolate covered fruit with a fresh little pot of whipped cream in the middle. It is delicious! The prices are more than reasonable for a restaurant of this caliber. This is our favorite place to go to the eat before we go to a show at the Smith Center. It is very close. It is located in the four queens hotel. The four queens hotel itself desperately needs a massive overhaul, but Hugos cellar is located downstairs off the casino floor and it is a hidden gem.

oxAz5yZAZ3rzuQlM8iyjAw.text: Absolutely, from the Maitre d'  Richard welcoming us to Jamie, Glenn , Leo and Jon's detailed attention to service.  Everything was perfect!  All of our meals were wonderful and Jon was suburb at helping us with the wine selection.   Hugo's always delivers high quality and service from the first time we visited 30 years ago.  We love the Old School atmosphere with a beautiful rose to set the theme!  Thanks to Terry for knowing sometimes you don't want what's trending at the moment.  We wanted to step back in time and that's exactly what we did.  Thank you for making our celebration perfect.  Afterwards, a short walk to Container Park was truly a fun ending!  Thanks again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ftLasmzNv3Ivqv7JEsTgLw.text: Dark wood ceilings, brick walls, dim lights and mustard colored table clothes. Are you in 1970's Vegas? You could be if you came to Hugo's Cellar.   The Four Queens in located downtown and not in the best of areas. We pulled up to the valet and no one was there to greet us. We waited a while for someone to finally show up to park the car but thats another story. Hugo's is located in the center of the old casino, down stairs. It is downstairs and dimly lit. A classic old  Vegas style steakhouse.   We were greeted by the Matre'D and seated in a half booth in the back. Our waiter arrived quickly to greet us and take our drink orders. After that, we didn't see much of him. He did return for our entree orders and then not again until we were finished with our food. I loved the salad cart. You are able to customize your salad with several different items and dressings. The person making the salad will ask what dressing you want and then go through all the toppings. The salad was excellent.   For our entrees we chose the prime rib and the rib eye. They were both good,  but nothing I can't find at any other steakhouse without having to deal with downtown. We had the chocolate lava cake for dessert which was good.   I didn't find it as great as others, but I have been to a lot of great steakhouses. There is no reason to go out of your way to go downtown if your just looking a great steak dinner or romantic evening out.
