Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye

IpOZq7CEYaY4NJW3Erkj8w.text: Do you want to impress your girlfriend? Do you want to impress a date? Is valentines day or a anniversary or another special occasion coming up and you don't know where to take him/her. Well look no further because Hugo's Cellar is the place for you.    This is one of the  most romantic dinner dates I could have taken my girlfriend on for valentines day.  When you first walk in the lady gets a long stem red rose.  You are the seated and you are in a beautiful environment.   With your meal comes with a table side salad that is made right next to you and you have the option of adding whatever it is you want to it.  For my entree I had lamb and my girlfriend had a steak which we both really enjoyed.  You also get a dessert that comes with it all as well.  When you are ordering your food it may seem pricey but remember that you are getting a huge table side salad customized before your eyes but also a delicious dessert as well.    They waiter was amazing and they sommeliler was very knowledgeable about his profession and not only seems to know a lot but seems very passionate about wine as well.  He knew a about the history of whatever wine you were choosing and whatever year you are choosing from and had many stories to tell as he was pouring up your wine.   This place is amazing and I cannot wait to come back.

eFU8jw85yeFZJoWdnDJBww.text: I love Hugo's. We go every time we go to Vegas. You walk down the stairs into a cove of heaven -- a rose for the ladies, the best food, and a staff that treats you as if you are their only table. We order the same things every time because why change perfection. We start with a seafood tower for two and the hot rock for two. There are four of us. Next is salad time with all your favorites, table-side prepared, of course. I move onto a blackened, Pittsburgh-style Ribeye and the garlic mashed potatoes. This time I ventured off to the potatoes au gratin (wasn't a fan). The cosmos are a two-pour and you get this cute little chiller for the second half so your cocktail stays cold until you are ready to drink your second.  At the end of your meal they bring you chocolate-covered strawberries, apricots, and, I think, dates.  You can eat those but don't go without trying the banana's foster. This place is 10 stars and the best bang for your buck in Vegas. Definitely a must-try!

PtMKtoRNEanVYSmi33ZANg.text: so dinner was really good...it was much less expensive than i expected our bottle of caymus was actually almost most half of our dinner cost. lol...the decor is dated as it is an older place but still really cool and vintage as you would expect at a steakhouse on fremont...the sommelier who has been there for 30 yrs was super nice and was telling us old rat pack stories...they give all the ladies a rose when they come in and all dinners come with individual salads made table side which is a nice touch...servers Eric and Josh were great!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_pszNbvD1oPqUhvLRAyyYg.text: This place is damn good. The salad experience is awesome. Pretty much everything is great. Steaks, the filet was awesome

GznZkeApD8QnU2m2c7GCrQ.text: Hugo's cellar never disappoints. The staff is always friendly and very accommodating. The salad cart is unique and one of the best elements of this restaurants' experience. Our waiter even boxed up complimentary chocolate covered strawberries at the end of our meal. This is the perfect old school Vegas dinner spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef wellington 4.5/5. Cooked perfectly.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary birthday lava cake.. Delicious!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry lemon drop martini! 4/5

JTesbIPQKoTeqp4Uv4I2RQ.text: As usual in 30 years coming here, another great dinner with fabulous service. Veal this time instead of prime rib. Just as wonderful.

PknsDf0FSyycB6o_UUenJg.text: I love the atmosphere of this place! Has that old Vegas feel with low ceilings. The long stemmed roses were a great touch! I got the prime rib and struggled to cut the thing the whole night, by my husbands filet mignon was melt in your mouth perfect! This place is very pricey so who knows when we will be back, but it is was definitely a fun experience and worth checking out for a special night out.

KOHrS0jyHSAAUkr3WL1CdA.text: I am seriously astounded why this place has high ratings on yelp. This restaurant doesn't hold a candle to the steakhouses of Dallas, Seattle, NYC, Chicago, or SF.   Called ahead to see if gluten free options or accommodations were available as a member of our party has celiacs. The host confirmed, so we made the reservation. However upon sitting down at our table, the wait staff made if very clear they didn't have any gluten free options other than a side of vegetables, and their "accommodations" were serving the food without any sauces/binding agents. Meaning their kitchen lacks the technical ability to create any sauce without flour (RED ALERT, their line cooks can't work beyond a predefined recipe, cooking 101).   Decor was cheap, mis-matching chairs, faux brick walls.  The salad they hyped up could have been achieved with a run of the mill salad bar.   Initial drink orders took 25+ min and were average at best. Took our food orders before drinks even came out.  All food lacked seasoning!  $45 Salmon was a pre-packaged frozen filet with manufactured grill marks.  If you have had any experience with modern cooking styles and standards that exist in larger cities, don't bother with this place.

UQxDdUs4XSTFpmHpueLInw.text: Absolutely recommend this place to everybody. I'm not one to give 5 star reviews... And I'm not a fan of going downtown for food... But this place... Wow.  From the moment you walk in, greeted by a rose, escorted to a lovely quiet table in the very mafia-aged dimly lit restaurant... To the server and the food!  Our server greeted us quickly, offered the wine menu and sent for the sommelier. The sommelier was very nice and struck up a nice random conversation. They offered a couple half bottle wines.  Started with lobster bisque and spinach artichoke dip with crab meat. Yum! Both were very rich and very flavorful. Already getting full from that plus the delicious bread and rose shaped butter.  Ordered the beef Wellington (server said its about 10oz filet) and rack of lamb. Both were cooked perfectly with an amazing garlic mashed potato and veggies. And by ordering entrees, we had salad made table side (honey orange dressing..?? Sure! With some artichokes, shrimps, tomatoes with Parmesan and fresh pepper), a mini sorbet to cleanse the palate, and chocolate dipped strawberry, apricot, and fig.  But I can't finish the night without trying the awesome loan coffee and a small dessert. Nothing disappoints. I'm amazed. This place is the real deal. Can't wait to go back!  Price was... Not bad at all. And dress code isn't that strictly enforced seeing how other were dressed.

KzlfIFLwozeuhYR97O_cpg.text: Everything was great. From the moment we arrived to the moment we payed. Service and food were great. Ladies receive a red rose when they come in (what a nice touch).. I will definitely come back again when ever I am in Vegas.

HEdMtIEjc1YEdIQhfw73vQ.text: My last visit to Hugo's Cellar was 30 years ago and I loved the place. Now fast forward to my 7th anniversary and I wanted a special dinner. In 30 years, nothing had changed. Even the sommelier was same. They have perfect every element in a dinner. From service to ambiance to food and even overall value. From the red rose given to every female at the entry to the salad made at your table to your perfection. My vodka martini was perfect and easily the equivalent of 3 normal drinks. Her cocktail was also perfect. I love their salad, I chose Caesar dressing and asked for anchovies and got a big plate of them. We shared the rack of lamb, cooked just right and tender as could be. Maybe the vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes were a little underwhelming but this is being very picky. Every table gets a selection of desserts from strawberries and apricots dipped in chocolate. Even the cream for the coffee was whipped with cinnamon sticks to add. We have decided to come back every year for our anniversary. Overall considering the salad, dessert and service I even feel the price is reasonable for the quality and feel.

vWPT6-q7LfZSPnmqaYtnEw.text: Pricey, but the service is exactly right; the salad is custom-prepared for you at your table (and is by far the best I've tasted), and the entrees are superb.  Then, there are the drinks--very generous and top quality.  The next time we go there, the prices won't shock--and we will go there!

99glJ0oTAC319cpwtAtpOQ.text: This will be expensive meal.  However, we spent less then other nice meals in Vegas.  The atmosphere is interesting, it definitely feels throw back and its nice that's its literally steps down so it feels like it is in a cellar.  Its dimly lit and has a very cozy feeling.  They give all the women a rose, which is cheezy and vintage in the best way.  I did really dislike the fact that there was no bathroom in the restaurant, you have to go into the casino and the casino and the bathrooms are not near as nice as the restaurant.  There is a lot included with entrees.  This is really nice because it allows you to enjoy the evening with spaced out servings.  However one of my complaints were its way too much food.  We started with a bottle of wine and the bread/lavosh.  I love the fact that sommelier serves and tastes every single bottle.  At other places we went to they didn't seem to bother for cheaper bottles.  The bread was really good and I was big fan of the lavosh, I haven't had good lavosh in ages.    There is sorbet that was nice to cleanse the palate.    Then was the salad cart.  Again vintage, but I loved it and honestly wish more places did this.  It's not just a garden salad there are tons of selection of items to add and different dressings.  My husband and I can both be picky, so it was nice to not ask to hold things and just be able to add what you want.  Everyone said it on here and it really is when of the best salads I have had.    Then with your entry comes vegetables and potatoes.  I got the ten ounce filet.  I love filet but this was about 2 times too big for me.  It was amazing and the Bearnaise was really good, but I was stuffed just getting through half of it with everything we had before.  I wished they had a smaller option.  My husband got the filet with shrimp and loved that.    The chocolate dipped fruit was really good and nice to end the evening.  I was so stuffed I only ate one.  I wanted more of everything, so it was hard to control myself, but next time I will eat less bread to save room for entree and dessert.  Overall service was great, very attentive.  We were in a little bit of a hurry and they were good about taking care of us quickly.

oa9OaxfUoqtR881tdQg9iQ.text: This was one of the best meals I have ever had. From the knowledgable wine sommelier, to the impeccable service, we had an awesome experience! The food was absolutely outstanding. We ate at Top of the World at Stratosphere a few months ago, and Hugo's was leagues above Top of the World. This will be our anniversary tradition for years to come!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hugo&#39;s menu
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our table with the rose lampshade and my long-stemmed rose!

aTEoWz-loy1CutvrHYtZSA.text: It never fails. Alway a must stop ever time We are in Vegas. It's one of Vegas's best kept old Vegas treasures. Prices are in line with the best Steak houses but it never fails. Top notch all the way. Never had a bad steak or any other Entree.

_UDzZzBey82OmFscrBWMNw.text: I think I just had the best meal I've ever eaten here, and the experience brought by the serving staff made it even better.   My fiance and I brought my grandad to Vegas as he's visiting from England. We figured we'd do one fancy dinner while we're here and I'm so glad we picked Hugo's Cellar. Jaime, Eric, John and Wuudu were all extremely friendly and welcoming and made the experience one of the best we've ever had when we hadn't even received any food yet!   I got the beef Wellington, fiance got rack of lamb and grandad got ribeye. You get a tableside salad before your entree which was yummy too. The meals were all gorgeous and cooked to perfection. I have never tried Wellington before and this meal blew me away.   We ended it with chocolate covered strawberries, figs and apricots with fresh cream. We had no room for the extensive desserts they offer (next time!)   Thank you all so much again for the wonderful dining experience.

PCXAOrrLS-nMwCk7EBvYEw.text: Love old  school dark restaurants!  This is a place to most def check out! Service is amazing and the food is heaven!  Salad cart was a big huge surprise for us- they really make you the best salad at your table - it's huge! be careful dinner is still coming!   I'm a sucker for prime rib and so is my family. The meat cut like butter and had great favor.   The service was so refreshing- old school vibe and every restaurant should get training from them before opening! These people are beyond professionals ! Way to go!!  Can't wait to come back here! Until then, I will dream about the salad cart :) lol

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib. Great cut- you won&#39;t regret !!

-S1l6PpxH-0zzg74J3c0HA.text: My husband and I had dinner at Hugos Cellar for the first time about three weeks ago. We read a little bit about it online and decided to take a chance and try it. WOOOOW!! From the moment we walked in we were impressed! It felt cozy, romantic, old Vegas type atmosphere.  The host welcomed us in a warm and professional manner and gave me a beautiful red rose as he showed us to our table. The service was impeccable!! My family tends to eat out often and I have to say again, the service was impeccable!! The food was fresh, savory and well prepared, well worth the cost. We will definitely return to this wonderful restaurant, and bring our daughters to enjoy it as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kq7OP1MNMbdpOZECKCORCg.text: Wow!!!!!! The reviews do not lie - this place is five star all the way!!!!  Who knew there could be life outside if the Strip, much less a fabulously amazing restaurant with impeccable service ???  Tucked away in the four queens hotel, you walk downstairs and every lady is handed a long stem rose.   You can take a prom photo at the stairs. :)  The salad service was delicious. Best salad of my life!!  The food is amazing and the presentations are creative and clever.   We had an amazing experience here. Truly one of the most romantic restaurants in the world. World-class.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prom night.

pS3CJ2LwLvS6jtcRhjyNqQ.text: Wife and I went here for our anniversary.  It looked like it would be a nice, romantic place to eat.  Everything started off well. No complaints with the ambiance.  We shared crab cakes as an appetizer and they were excellent.  The at the table salad service was pretty good.  Main courses came out and it was downhill from there.  Wife ordered the beef wellington. The server said it comes out medium/medium rare. It was rare.  I ordered the prime rib and it was nothing special...pretty bland as far as prime rib goes.  Usually the prime rib has some crust around it, some flavor. This one did not.  The ticket came out to $170 after tip. For this kind of money, everything needs to be on point.

Loi49LOxfmG0eqVlVAYEnQ.text: This place was a hidden gem for Fremont Street. My husband and I were looking into eating somewhere normal and nice and yelp requested this restaurant.   It may look expensive when you look at the prices, but be prepared, the prices of each item includes bottle of water, custom made salad in front of you and desert as well as side dishes for your main course.   When you walk in, they give you a red rose which has a spot for you on your table to put up, also it is yours to take home. If you are looking for a romantic place to go on a date with your significant other, I would def recommend it.   Food was very tasty. Wine selection is amazing and sommelier was very helpful on our selection. Unlike upstairs the casino, restaurant was very quite.    Overall great! Recommended for everyone without kids!

K1wFqc50ZhhPtNa0zuqAHg.text: What a wonderful dinner we had here! A good friend recommended this place saying it is her favorite place in Vegas. Loved the service and fabulous food. So nice getting greeted with a long stem rose and love how the servers are all so nicely dressed! Can't wait to go back!

Gm2q2luOdQe72u5Jn_ibUg.text: The bar at this place is awesome...good pours and reasonable prices compared to being on the strip.  The service is top quality at this place and I would recommend it for couples or non-couples.  The salad cart is kind of cool, but doesn't compare to my experiences at HOPR in SF.  My salad tasted like anchovies because they use the same tongs to mix everything...just an fyi.  I ordered the rib eye which was pretty awesome.  The sides were mediocre and it probably didn't need a slathering of sauce...it was such high quality beef and cooked properly, so I felt bad about it  being all sauced up.  My dining companions ordered the beef wellington and the filet with foie gras.  The wellington tasted good to me, but my friend eating did not feel the same.  The filet was a bit overcooked (medium rare was ordered, and it was medium well), but still pretty tasty.   So I am kind of mixed, a lot of things were great but some things were not so great.  For now, they get 3 stars and I will probably go back.

l7rpO0EVLnmMHcxuBF4TCg.text: My wife and I went there on Saturday night before going to see O.  Had reservations for 7 nice booth was ready for us and she was greeted with a nice long stem rose.  Place was very busy and service was terrible.  Only bright side of the service was John the Sommelier.  Only thing neg about him was it took about 30 minutes for him to come to our table.  Our waiter rec we skip him and just let him pick us a wine... he brought out a Robert Mondavi I smirked and said please go get the Sommelier.  He rec a great bottle from Napa.  So 1 hour into our evening and we have our wine and bread still waiting on the shrimp scampi and the crab cake.  The whole night it felt like we were forgotten about was very disappointing.  Finally the apps arrive both tasted good no complaints.  This time we are almost at 2 hours in the cellar and I'm beginning to get inpatient but the rave reviews I have read on Yelp had me looking forward to our main courses.  They arrived I ordered the 16 oz NY and the wife ordered the beef wellington.  The 16oz NY was VERY disappointing not sure they seasoned the steak with any salt and pepper.  It was cooked prefect medium rare which is what I ordered but was missing flavor.  Also I expected a much better quality of steak.  I would have graded the steak Choice or select far from the dry aged prime discribed on the menu.  I ate about 1/4 of the steak the mashed potatoes were very buttery and fatty.  They shimmered in the lighting.  My wife ordered the beef wellington and she was pleased with the taste and flavor of it.  I tried it and also thought it was very good.  finally finished the main course 2.5 hours into the evening had to rush out to make it to our 10 O'clock show.... Never again unless you like a 2.5 hour dinner I would look somewhere else.  Don't order a NY steak you will likely be disappointed.

-RYqRKom1GFPXRUxEl6sSA.text: This restaurant located below the first floor at the Four Queens is kinda pricy , but worth it , especially if you hit a jackpot, or even if you don't....the meals are 5 course...I had the Ribeye and  Shrimp Cocktail, (appetizer), Hugo's Table-Side Salad, and the Bananas Foster...all meals are started with Sherbet to get those taste buds going....and after you eat, you can hit that slot machine again....

V3s1qSDZOeWval4IjVOfEA.text: Went here for our anniversary great food intimate setting ladies even get a rose before seated very good experience!  Well be there for our 12th

oBGeF6sD-2c2xUljbhGoBQ.text: I was so surprised, I live in Las Vegas 9 years and I never ate in any restaurant at Fremont st,  The rib eye steak was amazing and so was the Oscar medallions made from Beef angus. The atmosphere was great and professional Thumbs up!!! Big time

U89MuaEMAwAN2dGmp6esEA.text: This restaurant is absolutely fabulous for many reasons. Although, I'll give 4 of 5 stars because there were a few opportunities for improvement too.   Starting with the good - my husband and I went there for our 5 year anniversary and it was a special night for us also because this was where we got engaged. We were seated right away and were pleasantly surprised to see that we had the same waiter and sommelier as we had at our last visit, nearly 6 years ago. Service was great, food was equally great. The table side salad preparation is unique and interesting. I had the raspberry chicken as my entree and it was delicious. For dessert, we had the complimentary chocolate covered strawberries, figs and apricots (yum!) and then we were surprised with another dessert, with "congratulations" written in raspberry sauce on the plate. Finally, our waiter was preparing bananas foster at a nearby table and asked if I had ever had it before. I haven't, so of course, he surprised us again with a small portion of that dessert too. I was incredibly full and certainly shouldn't make any habits of indulging in three desserts in one night but it was a great gesture and of course another ridiculously tasty treat too good to pass up.  Now, for the suggested areas of improvement  - when making our reservation, my husband specified in the notes that it was a special night because of our anniversary and engagement, so, for a restaurant of this caliber, you'd expect the hostess, who has access to these notes, to welcome you back and congratulate you on your special day. Instead, the hostess was less than personable and simply escorted us to the table and left. Not a deal breaker move, but it would've added that special touch you would expect here. Additionally, for a restaurant with these prices and this reputation, I was surprised to see that the lamp on the hostess podium was held together with scotch tape. A dap of wood glue would do the trick .. Just a bit tacky as a first impression when you walk up to check in.  Finally, I really like the cozy, dated ambiance but the blue tableclothes have got to go. A warm cream cloth would do wonders and make it look a little brighter, fresher, and clean.

BAUKz0WGu5uJZnHqNucyyQ.text: Great experience.  Celebrated my wife's birthday and she was properly appreciative.  One of my top 3 dining experiences  in the U.S.- atmosphere, service and food were first rate.  I like Scoma's in San Francisco, Commander's Palace in New Orleans and Hugo's Cellar in Las Vegas.  Will go again when next in Vegas.

v66Or2J2Bu2IxrNFK6iDcQ.text: DeeeLISH!   The meal price includes a large custom salad appetizer, all your side dishes and  a significant dessert - I hate it when steakhouses make you pay for everything separate!! (Ruth Chris??!! Sheesh)  My steak melted in my mouth, it was AMAZING, best I've ever had in Vegas. The service was also stellar.   Even though it's in a trashy hotel, it's nothing but class all the way at Hugo's ...

PFFWu_6wjWnsaKKAj1FaTA.text: Holy crap was this place awesome!  Was about to eat @ the Golden Nugget buffet w/ my parents on a recent Vegas trip.  Then my aunt remembered where the "other' place was that they wanted to eat @ on their last trip out there.  It is located in the lower level of the 4 Queens Casino in the old downtown area on Freemont St.  Upon arrival in this little basement restaurant, the ladies were given roses to take to our dinner table.  The place was very seductive looking, w/ very low lighting and some nice jazz playing softly in the backround.  Three waiters took turns pouring our Evian water, handing us menus, and taking our cocktail orders.  The menu was a great mix of top notch seafood and Grade A cuts of meat.  I ordered the Tournados Hugo.... two 5 oz filets wrapped in bacon and topped w/ foie gras sereved w/ a delicious beef stock reduction.  Dad had the swordfish, aunt had the scallops, mom had veal oscar, and uncle had the veal chop.    Before dinner, your waiter comes tableside w/ a salad cart and prepares each salad separatly!  It's like going to the salad bar without actually getting up to go to the salad bad.  Friggen Awesome.    After the customized salad, the table is sereved a mini sorbet ice cream cones to cleanse the pallet.  Raspberry sorbet to be more specific.  How cute and delicious.    All of the diners were A- or better.  my foie gras left a bit to be desired, but that is about the only thing i could find wrong during the entire dinner.  The prices look pretty hefty when you first sit down and look @ the menu,(most dinner are $40 and higher) but you have to realize how much you are actually getting w/ this dinner.  The amount of food was perfectly stuffing.  And even if you don't want desert, they bring you a tray of chocolate covered strawberries, figs and apricots w/ whipped cream!  Other nice things:  Martinis come in small, iced carafes, so you can drink and then pour more when you are ready.  A wine steward actually brings your wine directly from the wine cellar, not your waiters.  Nice to have a wine steward so they can answer any questions you may have about your fermented grapes.  When in Vegas, GO~!

Pd88_x6XNDVyjrHVP6UWQA.text: Waited months to put this on our dining list as the last few times in Vegas ,we ran out of time. Was disappointed and will not be going back. The great thing, was the service. Our waiter was so friendly, not pushy and so kind. We had 8:30pm reservations. My sister and I. Appetizer was spinach/artichoke dip. Very good flavor, but runnier than most we've ever had. The salads, yes, they do table side,molts of choices, excellent display and server. Sister ordered triple seafood sampler, and I had the prime rib. She really liked her food, me, my prime rib was cooked perfect to "medium", but not very warm/hot. I did not want to send it back, ( really, at Hugo's), no, I just couldn't. The red, garlic mashed potatoes and fresh asparagus were good. Just so disappointed in the meat. Prime rib just also didn't have a lot of flavor. I like that the au jus is served on the side so it's not swimming in it. They do give roses to all the ladies upon arriving and wrap them for you on leaving. It is Old World like in Al Capone days, but so so neat a place. It is not cheap, but do not mind paying for an excellent meal, no matter where I'm traveling. Just was disappointed, as sister had been there many times and I just can't return. I do not believe a chef should send out just warm food, especially a steak.

DN1_p_YKYOch6fGOXSqtYw.text: We went to dinner here on Sunday night at 6.  We had a reservation and they sat us immediately and gave me a red long stem rose.  Nice start so far.  The restaurant is in an unusual lower part of The 4 Queens Hotel which does kinda feel like your in a cellar.  We had a booth along the wall.  The service was top notch from the beginning to the end.  We had a busser that brought bread and water, a server that took our order, a man that had a rolling salad bar that had tons of goodies to choose from that he made at your table.  I ordered the bacon wrapped 10 ounce filet and crab, I talked my husband in to the Chilean Sea Bass.  Both entrees were served piping hot and they were delicious and cooked perfectly.  The portions were huge on the fish and the steak was def at least 10 ounces.  Both our sides came with the entree and both were very good, I had garlic mashed and he had rice.  My glass of wine was very reasonable at $6 a glass.  The best part though was my husband ordered a martini and it came and included a crystal ice bucket to hold part of the martini and keep it cold..  REALLY IMPRESSIVE idea (we think any way :))! With the meal, they included chocolate covered strawberries and figs, that was a nice touch..  We both had an entree, I had one wine and he had 2 martinis, our bill without tip was $149, which I felt was fair for the level of service and all the little extras we seemed to enjoy.  Def not somewhere you'd probably go once a month but I saw a lot of folks celebrating anniversaries, great place for special occasions.   I would have given it 5 stars had the bathroom not been FOREVER away... this type of establishment should have its own restroom but it is old and space is limited so I doubt it's an option.

CODRVD7qh3cmkK-0OEcViw.text: Vegas is filled with steakhouses.  Palazzo, alone, has three of them.  So with so many options on the strip, its going to have to take a pretty good recommendation for me to stray off the strip for my savory appetite.  Hugo's cellar was recommended to us by one of our customers and he mentioned that it was one of the best steaks he has ever had.  Big words, when it comes to steak in Vegas (..and it was mentioned to us during dinner at Delmonico's).  Nonetheless, my girlfriend and I made it our mission to try Hugo's the next time we were in Vegas.  Here is the short of it:  Pros: Your lady friend gets a rose when you enter the restaurant.  The amount of food you get for 50 dollars (steak) is a lot.  You get bread, chocolate covered strawberries, salad, and potatoes or vegetables. Reasonably priced compared to most, if not all a la carte steakhouses  Cons: Decor is more old school (or hasn't been changed in a while).  Fits in well with the Fremont street casinos. The steak and the meal were just OK for me.  I definitely left full but I wouldn't necessarily say it was melt in your mouth or the steak was anything to write home about.    Vegas Cons:  In a city where image can be anything, this place just doesn't cut it.  Its in a cellar and it is on Fremont street.  There are so many other choices in Vegas that can give you a better view, or a more comfortable seating, or give you better recognition or name.   The crowd is older, not as dressy and fits more with the surroundings.  I wore dark jeans and a nice shirt (standard guy-wear) and I felt overdressed.    In the end though, I would eat there again.  However, one has to understand the type of meal you are getting and what you are paying for.  With that in hand, its one of the best deals on the strip.

knJOfdq-VntC4egrKCpZ4A.text: My wife and I were introduced to this place approx 10 years ago by some friends and it is still as great as it was back then.  We recently just came went back and things have not changed (which is a great thing).  All I can say about this place is it is Very Old Las Vegas (where the the attention to detail is only parrelleld to the Romance that this place ooozes..  Do your self a favor and hit this place up with your loved one.  It is easily the most romantic place in Vegas.

bmHKxFjWL-bSivaJt0lm2Q.text: While staying at the Four Queens we decided to eat at Hugos Cellar because it was in our hotel which was a plus. A beautiful rose is presented to the ladies as they take you to your table. We were a little pressed for time so we didn't order appetizers.  We ordered the rib eye but they didnt let us choose the potatoes and the menu gave a choice. The salad arrived and the portion was enough for a meal in itself and very good. The rib eye arrived with mashed potatoes and asparagus. It looked good but was a tough piece of meat for the price. All I can say is eat anything but meat. Chocolate covered strawberries to end the meal was nice too.  I should have read the reviews first. Live and learn I guess.

Wg_ysWONv-fwiomBCJPSWA.text: I'm with the band: Hugo's should not be missed. It is as it should be when one parts with hard earned dollars for another to prepare and serve them a nice dinner. Isn't that what we all want?  Excellent cuisine, unobtrusive service, and chivalry.   Save room for dessert and the Kona coffee--a nice finish.

GeRC8eV2RwVs1jga3KLJ4g.text: Wow!!! I took my friends here after their wedding. All I can say is I highly recommend this place. Your greeted at the entrance with a long stem red rose ..you're seated and they have a vase for you to hold your rose until you leave. You get a taste of some breads.. and the butter is shaped like a rose!! They keep your water and drinks full all the time. The staff here is amazing!!!! So nice and constant watching your table. It's pricey!! But so worth the special night.  They pull out a salad cart and make your salad table side. I loved it!! After your salad they bring u some sorbet to cleanse your palate and a hot napkin for your hands. My friend had lamb and his wife had steak and shrimp it comes with garlic red potatoes asparagus and rice . When the plates are placed before you,, you will want to get your camera!! not only is it delicious!  the presentation is gorgeous.your dessert is included it's chocolate. Dip figs strawberries This a place to go . And very candle lit . Sorta under ground. You won't be disappointed here :)

OCEgK007zWZKvl9yorzqrA.text: A fine dining establishment in the Four Queens?  The hell, you say!  The fam was all fired up to go to Binion's Steakhouse, but it was closed over the Holidays.  I suggested we try Hugo's Cellar as I had read some good reviews on Yelp.  We made reservations with the snooty maitre d', and headed off to the casino bar to have a few drinks.  Ugh.  Snooty maitre d'.  Oh well.  I tell you what, I was impressed by the quality of the food at the Cellar.  Everything was outstanding.  My steak was fabulous.  They make individual salads to order at your table - the poor salad dude had to ask everyone at the table what they wanted on their salad, one item at a time.  Playing twenty questions with the salad guy got a little tiresome, but he had a good sense of humor in dealing with our (my) general drunkenness.  Artichokes?  No.  Olives?  Yes.  Anchovies?  Shit, why not?  Croutons?  Yes. Hippopotamus?  What?  No.  Etc....  Our waiter and the sommelier crossed way over into the Land of Pretentiousness, making them easy to mock for a drunk guy such as myself.   Having said that, I've got to say that the service was very good, especially if you like pretentious servers.  Everything was included in the price of an entree, including the salad, a starch, and even chocolate-covered desserts.  Did you know that apricot is pronounced "APE-ri-cot?"  I didn't.  Really, you did?  No shit!  I'm from the Midwest, sue me.  I don't really care for "APE-ri-cots," so I gave mine to a fellow diner.  And I giggled like a little girl every time the waiter said "APE-ri-cot."  Not a good performance by me, I have to say.  We were there late in the evening and were among the last folks to leave.  This gave me the opportunity to actually see snooty maitre d' guy step out of character while talking to water refilling guy.  Snooty maitre d' guy actually seemed like a decent guy, which was nice.  Let's bring this home.  I thought the food and service was outstanding at the Cellar.  And the entrees were all priced at around $40-$50 or so.  Very good value.  I would highly recommend this place, and I'll try to be sober next time I make an appearance.  Really.  I promise.

3qRBKOYqGrQbEm0hmzbkiw.text: So I returned a year later.    Steak is still good.  Salad is still the bomb.  I had the single lobster tail this time.  Perfection.   Thanks Hugo's.

U9DnODsUkeUSzBI19GioEg.text: Don't let the location of Old Las Vegas fool you, this place rocks!  On arrival, I was given a rose. It is a very romatic setting and the decor is old school Vegas, which I love. The drinks were stiff and service was great! Victor rolled the salad cart over and prepared a custom salad, which I was sad I had to stop eating so I wouldnt be full for the main course. The entrees were of generous porportions. My honey's piece of delicous salmon was huge! At the end of the meal, they brought complimentary chocolate dipped strawberries and other fruit with whipped cream. As I was sitting there, I was already planning the next special occassion/excuse so we can enjoy an awesome meal there.

ycRoDBHOp7_dl4cLNcX8tA.text: So this is now the talk of L.V. when it comes to high end, high priced dining..   I can say anything you order comes with potato's, (boiled red, or whipped), veggies, and a salad that is made to order; right at your table..   The steaks are all large portions, and the fish is well prepared.  But NOTHING but the salad, really was above average..   So, If your in the area of downtown L.V., and you want to impress a date, or have an occasion to celebrate, (and your not concerned about spending an average of $40 bux per entree); come and enjoy.   Otherwise, I'd say stay on the strip, and go to Encore or Something nice @ the MGM or Mandalay Bay. (The MIX that is on the top floor of THE HOTEL is MUCH better, and there the ambiance is topnotch..

nB7IrB6YxMNFReQfEpqyZw.text: Me and my fiance likes to try new restaurant  and if you search the must visit restaurant in Vegas Hugo cellar is one of them and we decided to have it a try but what a disappointment the only thing positive is the flower they gave me at the entrance .

cLO7MCkaaqkKFcCyXkMyiQ.text: Very classy & 'old school' & a great atmosphere, we loved it. It was quite pricey but the food was outstanding so it was worth it. We had the steak, which was just delicious & breaded shrimp. Definitely worth a visit.

-UFkmz0WNIeia8XuBjzXNQ.text: First, reservations are a must! There were 7 in our party and they placed us in a corner booth/table, which was perfect. We ordered drinks, appetizers, had salad prepared table-side. The salad toppings and dressing selection was vast; the result was delicious! Our entrees were generously portioned and tasted great. As we were celebrating an anniversary and a birthday, a special dessert was presented to the celebrating parties; the occasion was spelled out in chocolate on the plates. Very good! We topped off our meal with coffees and a dried fruit/chocolate/whipped cream platter. Needless to say, we were beyond satisfied (i.e. stuffed!) when we left. Each lady in our group was presented with a rose, which was an appreciated touch. In sum, we felt welcomed, appreciated, and were excellently treated. If you're looking for an elegant and romantic experience, Hugo's shouldn't disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

htWkClxzIEEcF2zDpdfkCA.text: First of all, this was my first "Old Vegas" dining experience and it was fantastic! I had SO much fun. It actually made me wonder why we started to move away from this type of dining. Thank goodness there are still places like this keeping it classic.  The hotel offers free valet and self-parking (four hours with validation) and it's just a quick walk down Carson to Fremont.  When you walk down the stairs from the casino floor, you really feel like you're in a cellar. There's a small lounge/bar area near the host stand. Even if you're here for dinner, I'd recommend some time at the bar with veteran bartender Dean. What a personality! Tell him what you're in the mood for or what you like to drink and he'll make you something new and name it on the spot. Your cocktails also come with their own refills - a beautiful crystal bucket filled with crushed ice and a carafe of whatever you're drinking. I had the Raspberry Lemon Drop and it was great; the right balance of sweet and liquor. Also only at the bar are complimentary mixed nuts, adorable heart-shaped water crackers, and spreads: Chicken Liver Pate and Smoked Cheddar with Bacon and Pimientos. The pate was amazing! I could have sat at the bar all night eating pate and crackers.  If you're a lady, you receive a fresh red rose prior to seating. They even have vases at each table to place your rose(s) while dining. Then, when you're ready to leave, they wrap the stem in foil to take with you. They do this EVERY DAY!   Want to know what you should eat? Anything that involves table-side service! After all, you're here for the Old Vegas experience. Gosh, it is so much fun. Especially if you have the honor of dining with server extraordinare Victor. He's been here since 1983 and you'd never guess it with the amount of enthusiasm he has for everything!   We started with the Table-Side Salad (this comes with all entrees or $19 a la carte). The cart has all the salad elements and you tell your server what you'd like and they put it together. If you're with Victor, just have him make your salad. If you're not picky or allergic to anything, tell him to put whatever he wants. It's quite the show and he is extremely entertaining. I had a blast just watching him make the salad! And the salad had EVERYTHING. Romaine lettuce, tomato, red onion, mushroom, anchovies, bay shrimp, marinated artichoke, hearts of palm, hard-boiled egg, parmesan, blue cheese, roasted pine nuts, and croutons. There are three dressings: Caesar, Creamy Pepper, and Honey Orange Walnut Vinaigrette. Victor recommends an unique combination of all three, so of course, I said yes. The salad was delicious. This is a must!  We shared the Duckling Anise Flambe ($40). The duck is roasted with licorice spices and herbs, then flambeed table-side. More of that table-side action. It's also topped with a Grand Mariner duck confit mandarin orange sauce. Served with wild rice and roasted vegetables. The duck was delicious and I loved the sauce.   All entrees come with bottled water, assorted breads (cheese-toasted lavosh and rolls) and rose-shaped butter, their famous table-side salad, fruit sorbet as a palate cleanser (we got adorable mini cones topped with lemon sorbet), fresh vegetables, choice of roasted garlic whipped potatoes, red potatoes with parsley, or wild rice, and chocolate-dipped fruit (strawberries, baby figs, and dried apricots). I mean, WOW.   We finished with Bananas Foster ($18 for 2 people) which is also flambeed table-side. Served with vanilla ice cream in a beautiful goblet and long, slender spoon. YUM.  It was an amazing meal and even better experience. I really didn't understand the hoopla, but now I get it. Service was IMPECCABLE. Each table has TWO servers and a bus boy. Everyone is so professional, crazily attentive, and importantly, thrilled to be there. Our drinks were never empty, our table was always clean, and one time I didn't even realize I dropped my napkin when I stood up and before I knew it, there was a new, folded napkin waiting for me on the table! By the way, if you weren't impressed enough, all the servers have culinary training for their table-side cooking! I truly cannot wait to come back - no need to wait for a special occasion!  Notes: They tend to get busy every night, so reservations are recommended in advance. It's a popular spot for locals and visitors!

n2EnZaGyRWwVEoQRH1SQoQ.text: Was recommend this place by our Uber driver Drew! He was right this place was amazing and the perfect place to share our first meal as husband and wife! The staff was super friendly and the food was amazing! I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting the area! Cheers

kAPnUP_9OxmfSK_bivQWnA.text: Old-school style Vegas experience. Females are handed a rose prior to being seated. Table side salad preparation, awesome steaks,  huge king crab legs, and a included fruit course. Great food great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon sorbet palate cleanser after the salad.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ending fruit course.
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs.

Ac_1uQ-7jsUDF5WFjsPZmQ.text: Last night was my younger sister's 21st birthday. We decided to go to Downtown Las Vegas without a plan and Hugo's last minute. As we walked into the 4 Queens, we had no idea what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised that we were greeted with roses. We ordered our drinks and food and had a nice bread basket with a table side salad made for us. Our food came and the steak was perfectly cooked. The king crab legs were soo good. Before we left, the wait staff surprised my sister with a small chocolate cake and a beautifully decorated plate for her birthday. A great place to splurge on a nice meal and wonderful atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vHgg_S2n3ofe0LUyVP_udA.text: We came here for the first time on May 21, for my mans birthday and I have to say, this place is definitely a hidden gem. U think "Four Queens? Isn't that place super old and run down?" Well it is! But this place is located slightly underground when u come in and look for it u go down a set of stairs and end up at the front of the restaurant. It has to be the most romantic place I have ever dined at. It's very old school with the brick walls and the servers dressed in two piece tuxs. The ladies receive a rose when u come in, so cute! The tables or booth have a cute candle light area with a single flower vase for your rose. And surprisingly, my man knew the manager who he worked with at a different restaurant, so it was nice to run into someone we knew there he kindly got us a booth in the corner which was perfect! Richard is the manager, and he was kind enough to buy us a drink for my mans birthday!   Now onto the food/drink service - I got a raspberry cocktail (recommended by our sever, so didn't get the name) and my man just got the house cab. Our servers were David (I think) can't remember his name because he didn't really make an impression on us, sadly. But his partner Victor, lat me tell you, he's been there for years, he's an older gentlemen but such a great person! He was the highlight of our night! He was attentive and had a great sense of humor with everything. So thank you Richard for giving us his station just as u recommended he was really great. If u plan on going in, ask for victor u will love him!! Ok so u get bread service they drop off a basket w about three kinds of bread and then u get a cute rose shaped butter (to make it more romantic) hehe. Then we got seafood on ice for two as shown in picture below. It was good nothing special since it is a simple appetizer but it was still yummy. Then you order your entrees and you get a table side salad service! So Victor starts it for u and he just kinda goes down the list and u answer yes or no if u want it in your salad and he makes it right in front of u and he's funny you're guaranteed to laugh with him. Then you are served your salad, u get to choose from three kinds of dressings and he tosses it for u. It comes with every entree! So then u finish your salads and the busser comes and serves you a cute little raspberry sorbet on a cone it's called a "palette cleanser" I believe and that was cute and yummy. So they do that before u get your entree. Then u get your food and ugh it's amazing! It comes w a garlic mash and few veggies. I get a ribeye which I personally love ribeye so I always get that (done medium) and my man got a filet (medium rare), it has a name to his entree which we couldn't pronounce it n I let alone can't remember  lol but it all tasted great! (See photos) then we finish our food and move onto dessert. You get a complimentary platter of fig, chocolate strawberries, & apricot. And then we got a birthday dessert it was a chocolate cake that I didn't eat bc I don't like chocolate lol. But the dessert we did order was AMAZING!! It's called a banana froster and it is made table side. Omg I have never had anything so amaZing! See pictures. It has alcohol in it, bananas, and ice cream. U must get it if u dine there!! And before I forget, as Victor made our banana dessert, there was a couple next to us celebrating an anniversary, so with the left over he put it in a little bowl and hands it to the couple which I thought was a sweet touch! They did love the dessert and thanked us for ordering it hehe. My bf joked to myself and said "should we split the bill for dessert haha. But not really we would never do that and it was their anniversary I'm so glad they enjoyed it as much as we did!! Overall everything was great from when u walk in to when u leave. Sorry if I don't go into too much detail about the food I didn't exactly study the menu and remember what was in it but the service was impeccable. We will definitely return! :) don't forget to ask for Victor!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great shot I got of him making dessert!!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is Victor!!!! Making our banana froster dessert :)
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary platter

jgIZRnT3zhhu0dp4gxmshA.text: A dream come True!!!  I can't say enough GREAT things about my magical visit. This was definitely a bucket list item, however, I'll be going back!!!  Such a cool place. Dinner was AWSOME.

gEolN-ftnIxNvE4iepWaSw.text: Best steakhouse I've been to in Vegas. This is always my family go to place and where we bring out of towners for a nice dinner. We used to frequent the Burgundy Room before they closed but Hugos does not disappoint! Great place for a romantic date, celebration dinner, or just a nice night out. Women are always presented with a rose on entry which is a very nice touch. If you're drinking wine, you have a sommelier with a tastevin to taste the wine before you drink it. You have a salad cart that comes around and you are able to pick all the toppings you want along with dressing before they toss it for you. The meal is always outstanding. Steaks and chicken always have great flavor and are cooked to perfection. After your meal you are given chocolate dipped fruits for a final touch. If you haven't tried it, do yourself a favor!

FB1M_6Of1NkViGVgmDsM7A.text: Love this place!! My first visit was Feb 2014 and I returned last night and I was not disappointed. I have had both the salmon and the filet cooked a perfect medium rare.  If you like a perfectly prepared steak this is the place to get it in Vegas. This place is old school, they present all the ladies with a rose, they have a sommelier who comes by to give you wine advice and table side salad. Do not skip the salad, it is delicious. The portions are generous and I have never left hungry.  I look forward to coming back to this place during my next Vegas trip.

ma4pCXbKpvP1utpC6mEgAA.text: We go to Hugo's every time we make a trip to Vegas. It's an awesome little hidden treasure to go to on Fremont Street. It's a bit pricey, but well worth it. When you walk down the stairs it feels like you've stepped back in time to  vintage Vegas. It reminds me of a place where the old time mobsters would go to have a steak dinner. It's worth checking out if you're ever in the area. The food is very good, and the service is outstanding.

BhwZWeNBB3mYcL8mAXYegw.text: Imagining a perfect meal with a man I love - this place would top the list if steak was the craving.  On this visit I was with my Mom and we were treated like the Queens we are.  This place is in Old Vegas in the cellar of The Four Queens Casino and has been around forever, or so I hear.  This place was recommended by a friend who ventures to Vegas quite often and suggested it as one of our splurge evenings.  And splurge we did...  How classic to offer every lady a rose as we walk in the door, an add on that made me giddy and smiley the minute I walked in the door.  It makes a lady feel special.  The menu is Old World Steakhouse, no surprises here, steak, seafood, salads and everything you would expect from a Steakhouse.  The choice for the evening:  Table-side Salad - romaine lettuce, peeled tomato wedges, marinated artichokes, sliced mushrooms, blue cheese crumbles, toasted croutons, crushed eggs, red onions and bay shrimp.    Escargot En Croute - Six plump escargots sauteed in shallots, garlic, burgundy wine, fine herbs and topped with puff pastry.  Palate Cleanser - Raspberry Sorbet - A refreshing sorbet before steak time!  Filet de Boeuf - Atlantis - A ten ounce filet wrapped in bacon served on a bed of lump crab with Bearnaise sauce.  Included dessert - Chocolate covered fruit, strawberries, figs, and apricots.  The table side salad was a fun experience. A sweet man presents himself with a cart full of fresh ingredients and asks how you want your custom salad.  He makes your salad with flare and finesse.  The honey walnut vinaigrette was unique and gave a kick to the exceptional salad.    My first experience with Escargot and I have to say, may I have another.  I always thought Escargot would be gross which is a total error on my part, they were salty, rich and buttery.  A squeeze of lemon and I was in utter heaven.  Jenn + Escargot = Happiness.  Now if only I had someone feeding them to me...  The Filet de Boeuf was cooked to my requested temperature, medium with crispy bacon encrusting the outside.  A ten oz. filet is a huge portion and I was pleased to take each succulent bite and sop up the Bearnaise sauce on the way to my mouth.  The crab claws were buttery and cooked nicely and I loved sucking every last drop from each claw (sorry, no picture of this, I know you want one).  A menu doesn't need to be complicated when you can execute a steak this perfect with the right amount of seasoning.  Your meal comes with chocolate dipped fruit, which we took to go since we were both stuffed with the best steak of our lives.  If you so desire, you may order additional desserts, one of which is Banana's Foster flambeed table-side.  If I was hungry, this would have been my additional dessert of the night.  Service was impeccable and I wanted for nothing the entire evening.  My mind was read without me knowing it.  Dinner was paced well and everyone was attentive to our needs at every turn.  Well worth the splurge anytime.

iVnOH6NLfrNwd-B6D8HUow.text: We visited Hugo's a year ago to celebrate our friends' wedding anniversary. I know my review very late but I have only started with Yelp a couple of months ago. It was our first visit to the Cellar and it was a wonderful place for an old style Vegas meal.  Each of wives was presented a rose when we arrived.  Our salads were prepared individually table side - I did not know places still do that.  We are non drinks so we did not have that service. The prime rib was delicious. The table service was good. The after dinner chocolate tray was good. Our friends were happy with the meal and so were we.

2xXiC1peYdeW-w3O3Wd2hw.text: Such a lovely, hidden gem that I'm kinda of kicking myself for taking so long to try! The staff made an impressive experience out of every aspect of the meals. Roses for the ladies, flowered-shaped butter, elegantly set tables, sorbet between courses for a palette cleanser, chocolate covered fruit at the end - every detail was attended to. All of the food was so delicious.   We started off with several seafood appetizers - the chilled seafood trio was outstanding! Table-side salads def live up to the hype. I was disappointed they were out of beef wellingtons (never had one), but I had a hunch with a late reservation that might happen & had the steak aux poive as a backup - it did not disappoint. Next time, we'll make an earlier reservation to make sure I get to try a Wellington. The drinks were quickly refilled and poured with a strong hand... Because the service here is just amazing. Really wonderful, professional, attentive and personable waiters here. I think we had Oscar and Victor looking after us. And even though you probably won't have room for dessert - try to power through it - they are as delicious as everything else was.   It was such a special night, a dining experience like I've never had before. We had a group of 6 and it was everyone's first time here and we all loved it. It will definitely be on the itinerary for our annual trip to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everyone had a fantastic time here!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extra chocolate-covered fruits and our roses packed up to take home!
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This chocoalte-caramel pyramid was just delightful. Like a chocolate mousse with crunchy caramel toffee-like pieces inside.

DfAwDeWfLtPlbxTVLx3NlA.text: Awesome dinner. Great service. Delicious food. Leave the strip and go downtown. Worth every penny!

bNJ4w1SkQFl3h6lIzPciGA.text: Very elegant restaurant. Every lady gets a long stem red rose as they walk in, along with a vase at the table to put it in.  Everyone working there was very friendly and attentive. The food was AMAZING. My fiance and I both ordered the filet mignon with the garlic mash potatoes. The filet mignon was extremely tender and the mash potatoes were delicious. The meal ended with chocolate dipped fruit. We will most definitely be back!!

2Vsc-f_KH7dPeMyiSLYbfw.text: We dined at Hugo's Cellar on Friday July 15, 2016 and I will admit I was slightly nervous. I was nervous because our party included my 9 year old niece.  I know this is not a typical "kid-friendly" restaurant (no kid's menus here) so I wasn't sure how staff would react to her dining with us. My niece is generally well behaved, and LOVES her food, so we figured she would enjoy a meal here. After getting dressed up in our "special occasion clothes" (as the child calls them) we headed downtown. We made the reservation for 7:00, because this was our arrival day and we weren't sure how long it would take for the deuce bus to make it from the strip to Freemont Street; we wanted to make sure we had plenty of time. We arrived shortly after 6:00 PM, nearly a full hour before our reservation time. We were hungry, so we decided to check and see if they could accommodate our early arrival. As soon as we walked in the Maitre D greeted us and singled out my niece, complementing her dress and calling her the prettiest lady in the room. After handing each of us a rose, they escorted us to our table. After we placed our order, bread and drinks were brought to our table. The bread was superb, with the Lavosh becoming a particular favorite. As other reviewers have mentioned, the table side salad service is delightful. Their orange honey vinaigrette was outstanding. I would return to this restaurant for the salad alone, and I am most certainly not a salad person.  Shortly after our salad plates were cleared, a palate cleansing sorbet was brought out. Our entrees were brought out shortly after this. I ordered the prime rib, which was excellent. It was juicy and tender - it practically melted in my mouth. My best friends each ordered the fillet mignon and my niece ordered the scallops. Everyone raved about their particular orders. After dinner, the complimentary chocolate covered fruit was delivered to our table, along with the desert tray. We decided on a creme brulee (as my best friend can't turn down creme brulee when it's available) and the cherries jubilee, as we knew my niece would enjoy watching the preparation. The creme brulee was average - not bad by any means, but not particularly outstanding. The cherries jubilee was very good, but I think I'd prefer something else off the menu next time.   Hugo's Cellar was a big hit with our group. All staff was welcoming and went out of their way to speak to my niece - my concerns regarding her presence were completely unfounded. When asked about what her favorite part of the trip was all weekend (a weekend that included going to see a show and the Avengers S.T.A.T.I.O.N) she said the "fancy dinner". We will definitely visit Hugo's again, but will probably limit ourselves to a splurge once a year. Cannot recommend this place highly enough!

ub3-Lw4reT8DqlxeS83-gA.text: An old world Vegas classic in every sense... Must visit!!! After entering the rather outdated but very lively casino floor we recognized the thin red brick walls and began our journey downstairs and into a time of Vegas past.  Greeted by the maitre d' very humble and welcoming, my girlfriend was given a lovely long stem rose and we were escorted to a quaint, low-backed booth in the corner. Quickly the seasoned veteran servers began their well rehearsed procession of drink orders, sommelier service and menu consultation.   One of only a few restaurants that dares to serve French Bordeaux I'd give Hugo's 5 star just for that! Our Martini was served up in a large carafe in a chilled bucket and I'm pretty sure the phrase "three martini lunch" was coined here.  The food: Excellent all around. A little too much butter for our diets but expected.  The most remarkable about our evening at Hugo's was the service. We felt as if dining at a friend's home, never rushed or bothered with constant "how is everything." The table-side salad server had been there for 31 years, the sommelier 14 years and all others so kind and welcoming, professional on a level to best those at the Wynn!

Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9dQITi1nldTc5dZumNIUcw.text: Thank you Hugo's Cellar for a wonderful 16th Wedding Anniversary. The food was marvelous, the service extraordinary.  Rashad and Gene were spectacular. Again Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gene Your attention to detail is awesome. Brought tears to my eyes. Thank you for everything. Food and service were exemplary.

HQMHSM9qRpqGkPefbBFt3g.text: We had the worst time at Hugo's Cellar!  This is the first bad Yelp review I've ever given (just to show you I'm not one of those picky people).  We got there and were seated.  The sommelier didn't come by for 15 minutes!  We had three people come to our table asking if he had been there yet.  We were not happy from the beginning.  When we saw the prices of the meals, it just got worse.  The food was okay.  Not worth the price.  The last two glasses of wine we poured (once we finally were served our wine) were filled with sediment.  The sommelier wasn't sympathetic.  He just said that he now knows not to serve that wine to anyone else.  That's it... no comp or anything.    I will never go back here!!!  I thank them for ruining my evening on Fremont street.

SC80cfwVWm6mgzxhE_6NuA.text: Our friend had raved about this restaurant and we were so looking forward to it.  Unfortunately, we were immediately disappointed by the behavior of our server.  Our friend was wearing a fedora as part of his outfit and the sever made him remove the hat even though there is no dress code for the restaurant.  Secondly, we had a 3 year old with us and no food accommodation was made for him even after being told on the phone that there would not be any problem.  The child had to eat crackers.  The food was very good but not an enjoyable experience.

Lp_nHTrfRRwWOV6d2VD5cQ.text: hugos is in the four queens hotel/casino. their prices are right in line with Fremont st . when in Vegas definitely visit this place. the food is delicious and the service is better than the strip.  don't expect to be treated like a whale, but its nice to hear please and thank you from the staff. also I liked that they brought drinks when we needed and had good intuition of when to check on our table...

SU-sJujGkpROvFLowJgFBw.text: Don't let the fact that this is in the 4Queens scare you. This place was fantastic.  Everything was awesome, from the bread to the salad to the entree to the dessert.  The decor was cute as well.  Very romantic setting.  Order the prime rib, it was the best I have ever had.  This is a great place for any sort of celebration or romantic evening. Thanks Hugos for an unforgettable experience!

21iTuIbGW-NM7NgkBlKi1g.text: Eat anything from menu and you will love it!  Best food & service ever!!!!!!!!!!!  Okay so let me just start off by saying if you like going to fufu restaurants because they are the "it" restaurant at the moment...or maybe hip because celebrities are going to them (like BOA) then this isn't the restaurant for you. It is not hip and trendy in any sense of the word, more like on the dated side which makes it in my eyes old school Vegas and on the hipster side.  So anyways...ambiance aside. It still is a great place for a date. They hand each woman a rose at entry..little cheesy but I like it :). Like I said the restaurant is a little retro , if you go on their website even the one picture they have up is dated. Don't let that stop you from going to Downtown Vegas though. The food is nothing short of amazing,  You can have a five course meal here if you choose but with any entree they start you off with a salad. They waiter will pull of salad cart and have you personally choose what you want/don't want in your custom salad...and get this, if you don't like salad dressing options they can create one for you. Love it!!!!!!!!   After you custom made salad you get a lemon/ lime sorbet in a tiny ice cream cone to cleanse the pallet.  After that your food (great portions not too small or too much) and anything you order will be DE-LISH.   As if that were not enough they bring you a platter of assorted chocolate dipped fruit & dried fruit with their very own in house made TO DIE FOR whip cream. I am not a whip cream fan at all and the whip cream they served was beyond beyond words.   By the end of that you really won't have much room for dessert but if you do they are good as well. I've had the creme brulee and its silky and yummy.  The service is top notch, food is great...if you go make sure you make reservations. I've been there a bunch of times and the earlier you go the better...when there are big parties there they don't manage as well. It is a hidden gem that mostly on locals know about so I am so glad I found out about it.  I have had thoughts of just flying out to Vegas just for dinner there, that's how much I heart this place.  If you go, enjoy!

oVBHLvvI2wpBE3PsCyXFwA.text: This was the BEST dinner I have ever had.  Amazing table side salad service, the best dirty martini in town (more like 3 servings) and perfectly cooked steak and the best king crab legs I have ever had.  They had chocolate dipped fruit for dessert included with the meal and raspberry sorbet between courses.  Our waiter has been there 20+ years and he was very polite and knowledgeable.  I can't wait to go back!

CZODemugeidpiTezU1z_0w.text: After reading good reviews on yelp, we decided to give it a try.  The food was pretty good, but the price was hefty so maybe even on that count.  The staff was friendly enough, but they need more training to pull off a high quality experience.  They were Denny's quality servers. Took a lot of the romance and fun out of it.  Also we were quoted "policy" that we order appetizer and meal at the same time.  A clear effort to turn over tables quickly.  Similarly priced places would never do this.

GqFAP2WIihtx599gA4rTRA.text: At our taxi driver's suggestion, we gave Hugo's a try.  This was a fabulous place to experience an old school Vegas meal.  We got lucky and got in since another reservation no showed.  I was given a long stem rose and we were led to our table.  Our team of waiters (Rashad and Victor) we're friendly and professional.  We started with a half bottle of wine delivered by the sommelier.  Very classy!  Then after ordering the show began, Victor brought the salad cart and expertly made our salads to order with some laughs and stories.  He is a riot and makes damn fine salads.  Next Rashad delivered raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palette before our dinner arrived.  I had the Hugo's Chicken and he had the Beef Wellington.  Both were perfectly executed.  We couldn't have been more pleased.  I got a pic of every course except the complimentary dessert tray.  It was exquisite with chocolate covered apricots, strawberries and figs with whipped cream.  We had a wonderful dining experience and were so glad for our taxi driver's recommendation.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hugo&#39;s Chicken
Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My salad and the bread basket.

j0z1bi_zylU9mcrc66ACxg.text: Hugo's Cellar and I got off on the wrong foot right away.  We didn't have reservations and were told that there would be a 30 minute wait.  No problem on the wait, but we just wanted some appetizer or something to munch on because my friend is diabetic and he needed to eat something small right away to balance his blood sugar.  I waited patiently as the bartender tended to one waiter after another.  I finally asked him for some cheese and crackers and he totally ignored me.  The hostess knew that I was getting hot and she sat us right away.  Now I don't know the intricacies of the food industry.  But apparently, this place does everything the old school way and they do it top notch.  I had to listen to my friend describe how a butter rose was made, how time consuming it was to make a good bordelaise sauce, and how the napkin under the creme brulee was a difficult fold to make.  I was still pissed about the bartender ignoring me.  Plus, I question whether or not they got my order correct.  I ordered the rib eye steak medium rare.  There wasn't much marbling on the steak and it looked and tasted more like the NY strip.  Value-wise, this place is fantastic.  Most other nice restaurants would have all the dishes a-la-cart.

uaY36Rmk_KmIUB4r7qGv0g.text: Simply the best. Best quality of food. We always order out steak rare at most medium rare and it's hard to get somewhere that can make it right. Well Hugo's Cellars is the best place for steak, service, and a must for a trip to Vegas. From the moment we walked in my wife received a rose and staff was more than helpful friendly staff at a restaurant they set the standards on what service should be. Honestly they raise the bar a few notches. Appetizers were great bread with rose butter so good. Main entrees were beyond delicious. Out steak was not over or under cooked which is easily done when ordering a rare steak they do not make any mistakes on food. This review still cannot serve this place justice they are incredible hands down. Oh and VICTOR, he just made it for us he was not our waiter or the manager he was the salad guy he will make your night and the experience very conversational never misses a beat his personality made our entire Vegas trip the best. If you make a reservation and have never been there before request Victor just going to Hugo's cellar is awe inspiring and an experience to remember but having Victor is truly what makes it the best. Must go there is a reason they have great reviews. The price yes it is higher priced so if your looking for a low priced meal it's not here. We spent $160 for 2 steak dinners and drinks. It was our anniversary so they brought a a special desert at no charge. I in no way regret spending the amount we did on dinner the food quality shows why and the service is unlike anywhere else we have EVER BEEN.

photos.caption: Photo of Hugo's Cellar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OPTRfSIcKy-n88CDgVwCIQ.text: Hugo's Cellar is still one of my all time favorites.  The food is amazing, I almost always have the prime rib as it is the best I have ever had.  However they make a great beef wellington as well.  The service is always great, just as you would expect from an upscale restaurant, and I would venture to say that everything about Hugo's Cellar is every bit as good as you would get at any other higher priced upscale restaurant on the Strip.

oYyK3fEhg1XHk8ovtGR85A.text: Very good food. Very good service. Very high prices to the point of the cost being higher than what you get. Only go here if you have been a winner gambling and your looking for a way to blow your winnings.

-BbBmyNsao5iFCeg-VsFMQ.text: Perfection with every little touch.  I've lived in Vegas for a very long time and thought IDE been everywhere.  My husband and I consider ourselves foodies having eaten in some of the best places in the world and I am a difficult critic.    That's why I was so surprised at our experience last night at this old downtown classic.   We Were greeted at the door with a rose. An empty bud vase was waiting on the table for it and before we left the restaurant the waiter had wrapped it to go for me.  The vodka cocktail my husband ordered came with its own chilling bin in a carafe. Elegant old style to the max.  The menu also is elegant old style classics that I don't know why they ever went out of style Reasonable prices and everything is included including the sorbet between courses and a finish with chocolate covered strawberries, figs, and dates with cream to dip. The beef Wellington was perfect as were the mash potatoes and al dente veggies.  Service was impeccable.   Definately a redo and let's keep it a secret so it doesn't get too busy

sYDtJoK-zCYfhyC83HWmEA.text: Service at Hugo's was the best we've ever had (hence the 5 stars). My husband and I are foodies and love to try new places - high and low-end - and Hugo's takes the cake for the best service anywhere. We dined in on a short trip to Vegas after reading great reviews. The menu is pricy but so much is included. A $53 filet also comes with mashed potatoes, vegetables, bread, salad, and sorbet in between. This is a steal in an expensive town like Las Vegas. The salad is prepared table-side, which is a very cool experience! I'd recommend their house orange vinaigrette. We were served by Carlos and Victor - great guys with lovely personalities and an unparalleled dedication to Hugo's patrons.   The food I'd rank a 4.5, just because we've had slightly better steak in our hometown of Houston. The lobster bisque is to die for.   Overall, fabulous fabulous place with an excellent atmosphere, interesting history, exceptional service, and delicious food. Enjoy!

FoPk5IBkymjFy7jm4l0B2A.text: Another wonderful throwback dinner. I actually prefer these places more than trendy places imported from other parts of the country. It's class all the way from the ladies receiving roses at the door to the table side salads, you will enjoy every moment. My steak arrived at the perfect delicious temperature and the complimentary dessert is a great surprise. Go there now!

kMWbv9BX1WuF4dw6JOSYQA.text: In a city known for overpriced mediocre food, Hugo's Cellar is most definitely a refreshing notch above the rest. Where do I start? Think close booths with pretty light fixtures, dim lighting, people's heads huddled together, soft whispers. It's that kind of place. You want to come with a significant other and have long three hour dinners.   First, it's away from the Strip and somewhat hidden as a basement restaurant (converted from a wine cellar from back in the days) so you automatically feel a little special. The service is impeccable - old school charm meets modern dining, like free salad (!) and a complementary light sorbet afterwards to cleanse your palette.   Most memorable attribute? Guys - they give a long stem red rose to EVERY female patron, saving you the need to buy her flowers yet giving you all the perks of a romantic evening! How much better does it get??

JvojoSzoe_jmrnMFHsaOoA.text: This is the restaurant I HIGHLY encourage everyone to try while in Vegas! One of Vegas' best kept secrets... Located in the basement of the 4Queens on Freemont Street-- it is one of the most romatic restaurant settings around!  This old-scool vegas decorated restaurant is dim and romantic--every lady receives a long stem red rose when escorted to their table. The service is unbeatable! The waiters are all very professional and highly educated when it comes to their menu and wine selections!   The food is out of this world! Steak, seafood, and poultry options are all fantastic--I have never had a bad meal at Hugo's! With the purchase of an entree you will receive the table side salad and dessert tray! if you ask for it! :) Be expecting to pay out some $$$--but hey, it's a night in Vegas & you can't find this just anywhere!!!

c-wx7rvdbcXV_8Nf6q6dHA.text: Love this place.  Its so intimate and romantic.  Great date spot. The wine guy is amazing with pairing.  Every entree I have every tried there is spot on. I love the table side salad the dressing is something I crave.

379u8n8PJUDYicTrussPlA.text: We really enjoyed the food we had at Hugo's Cellar, unfortunately it was overshadowed by the lackluster service.  They greet each of the women with a rose (nice touch).  It's quiet even though it's right next to the casino - the only complaint I had about this is that due to the smell of the smoke from the casino, it seemed like they were overcompensating with some sort of air freshener to get rid of the smoke smell.  This just resulted in a mixture of perfumed smoke smell in the entryway/bar of the restaurant.  The dinner we had was very good - we mostly opted for steaks, but the fish I had was done perfectly.  However, our waiter was just running through the motioned and you could definitely tell he was bored and did not want to be there.  That definitely put a downer on our experience there.  Not sure we would visit again.

vE_V25PFPva-QF4pgVn5Xg.text: Absolutely exceptional experience. A taste of the good ol' days of Vegas. From being seated with a rose for my wife to the martinis to the table side salads (which are actually remarkable) to the amazing appetizers to the steaks and fish to the sides and desert - it misses nothing and excels at everything you'd love in a rat-pack era steakhouse. Recommend without reservation.
